Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rit itta wrote a review Yesterday
Review_Text: Words aint enough to describe the lovely stay i had . The room (3113) was superb food amazing the activities in the animated pool keeps you entertained all day  the staff were incredible super helpful especially Ayou  Salah  Mustapha  loubna Abdulah from reception  they were so lovely and approachable. Not forgetting the 2 fabulous ladies of public relations as they made sure our stay was faultless  thank you marwa and iman for all the smiles and the best tips  you have made us feel welcomed at home . Value of money is amazing. The hotel is 25 minutes away from the city center however I loved the shuttle service . Thank you be live for making my first stay in Africa unforgettable xxxx‚Äù
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: H P of Mayfair wrote a review Mar 23
Review_Text: Writing this review as I am still in the hotel !!!  First class hotel. Definitely Very friendly helpful & polite staff which made all the difference and specially the pool staff !! Fantastic array of food at breakfast and each meal. Excellent swimming pools with plenty of sun loungers and umbrellas. Activities if you want them or peace and quiet if you don't. Free bus for trips into Marrakech. Definitely come again.  Once again a very big thank you to the guest relation lady who helped rebook our British Airways flight because one of the members of our group had emergency and had to go back earlier than expected and let us use her phone with no questions asked  A big thanks üôè to her from MR Patel London.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Simran O wrote a review Mar 18
Review_Text: Excellent service and friendly staff that accommodate you accordingly my husband broke his ankle and the staff helped him in any way they could.. they provided excellent activities like archery and darts Emma was lovely friendly and approachable and had so much fun doing aqua aerobics with her!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lesley M wrote a review Mar 18
Review_Text: I have just returned from this hotel. Having spent 10 nights there. The room was fantastic very clean. The hotel was lovely and very clean. The restaurant food was amazing. Had a very large choice but some of it was cold. Breakfast time was very busy as a lot of golfers go there so those to take all the rolls and the bread with Chuck don‚Äôt understand why the hotel as it‚Äôs all-inclusive should provide a packed lunch for them. Also they should have a couple of coffee and tea stations which would take a bit of pressure off of the staff even though they were all fantastic. Keep having to go back and forward. Get in the teas and coffee is in the cups Would make life a bit easier and also I found some evenings they would let people still in their swimwear which is clearly states you cannot go in there in shorts and bikinis. Obviously lunchtime it‚Äôs a bit different but obviously you put a T-shirt or no shorts. We used to sit round the large games pool every day which there was plenty of activities. All the staff there were amazing Emma Sami Titif Oussami who was especially brilliant got a sunbeds every day brought round water to us all when it was really hot which was every day. I will definitely be returning to this hotel next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sue M wrote a review Mar 18
Review_Text: Just returned after a fantastic 10 nights at this lovely hotel. We had a large room overlooking the pool on the ground floor which was lovely and cleaned every day with fresh towels and the beds were so comfortable.  The restaurant and food were good with a great choice to suit everyone but could do with being hotter we ended up going to the fresh pasta station at the evening to make sure we had hit food. The desserts are delicious and the best I‚Äôve eaten in an all inclusive hotel. Breakfast is frustrating and chaotic as the hotel is a base for the golfers who take over the restaurant first thing and take all the rolls and bread to make sandwiches to take with them the staff are run off their feet and you have to wait for the table to be cleaned then they bring the coffee tea but run out of cups so you have to wait again for them to fetch these. A suggestion would be to take the pressure of the staff to install a couple of self service tea and coffee machines.    What makes this hotel one of the best holidays I‚Äôve had is the staff around the pool Titus Emma Sami and especially Oussami who went out of his way every day to get fresh towels for us and put umbrellas by our sun beds even bringing us bottles of water in the 32 degrees heat. All the team were great fun to be around and we had a great time doing all the activities and met some lovely people.    I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to return next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rachel C wrote a review Mar 17
Review_Title: Good for price but not a 5*
Review_Text: I always try to start these reviews with some info about me as a traveller to help others decide if my preferences and tastes align with theirs to enable easier decision making. I am in my late 30‚Äôs and holiday a minimum of twice a year. I am fortunate that I can splash out and stay in some beautiful places in exotic parts of the world but am equally happy to seek out a bargain if it means I can see different parts of the world.    This holiday was a girls week away with the intention of catching some winter sun food and cocktails. We paid under ¬£500 a person for all inclusive inc flights    THE HOTEL    The hotel itself is kept very clean you are welcomed with beautiful incense smells as you arrive. The layout is easy to navigate and small. There are two pools one with a swim up bar and one which is ‚Äòheated‚Äô and where the animation team are based during the day. There are a few sunloungers that need to be replaced as they bow in the middle but on a whole all furnishings and fittings are clean and tidy. The gardens are well kept and aesthetically pleasing.    Plenty of Sun loungers hotel quiet and I was often the only person by the pool until 10-10.30 am.    Location is around 20 minutes away from Marrakesh and there is a free shuttle provided.    THE ROOM    We paid for a basic room with two beds. Room again was clean and pleasant enough beds were very comfortable but pillows not. Mini fridge contained only of water and was not cold. There was a kettle and 2 coffee capsules.  Plenty of hanging space and hangers.    Very strange window from bathroom into the bedroom we found this funny and you could draw a blind for privacy. Bath could not be used as no plug. Shower weak needed a descale but cubicle big and clean. Shower did drip all the time. Two sinks and some tolietries provided which we didn‚Äôt use. Only provided with one big towel and a hand towel which was not great for long thick hair. Hair dryer was not great for a supposed 5* but normal standard for price paid    We were on ground floor and there was a small area to sit outside. It overlooked a wall and little bit of garden.    The room was cleaned every day to a good standard. The cleaners are an asset to this hotel as are the other housekeeping team such as maintenance and gardeners. Clean towels provided each day.    FOOD    The hotel is greatly let down by its food. I am a real foodie and love spending money on food and drink. I am reviewing this based on the price we paid but I was very disappointed.    Food is served in a buffet style. It is very small and the layout is not easy to navigate. I could always find something to eat but noticed the food was very bland with lots of salt used if it was left over from lunch.    There were items of food that were not warm when they should have been and this made them inedible. I normally do not have a sweet tooth however the pastry chef was very talented here and deserts were fantastic.    Once a week you could book to eat in the other sit down restaurant. You have to be spending 4 nights plus to access this. The food was much better but very small menu. I wished there had been an option to pay to eat in this restaurant as I would have used it over the restaurant.    For lunch you could order food at the pool bar which was hot as it was cooked to order.    Waiting staff were ok some friendly others not so.    DRINKS    My friend said she liked the beer as she thought it tasted like corona. The cocktails were very poor as made with cordials and not juices very sweet and syrupy. I can be a lightweight in the heat and feel tipsy quickly if I am not careful‚Ä¶.I did not experience this at all as alcohol very watered down. Again for the price paid this was ok but not 5* standard. There is no option to buy better wines unless you were in the sit down restaurant and these did not look great for the price.    The bar staff in the lobby bar were fab very efficient kind and good service provided bring drinks to you.    Pool bar we only used once so can not comment we did not use the sports bar but the snack bar had poorer quality of staff service. Very rare to get a smile.    ENTERTAINMENT    Evening entertainment was ok for price paid. Some singers a disco dancers etc. they had karaoke which is not my personal favourite but was very popular.    The animation team by the ‚Äòheated‚Äô pool were an asset to the hotel. Emma and Sami spent the most time with us but all the team provided 10/10 service.    SUSTAINABILITY    Whilst I am not an eco warrior I have started to consider the environmental sustainability of hotels I stay in. This was not great for sustainable models. Very small plastic cups bottles straws used. Plastic cutlery at snack bar.    SPA    The spa was ok pleasing on the eye and clean. Treatments were mediocre but only cost 700 mad for a full massage and additional head massage so reasonably priced    OVERALL    We paid for what we got. I would rate this as a high end 3* to low end 4*. I was surprised we had wrist bands had towel cards had to pay room and towel deposits of 1000 mad as this is not expected in a five star hotel. The food and drinks are what would move this down to a 3* I‚Äôm my opinion.    The ages of guests ranged but there was a high percentage of young influencers around the hotel which may be why some of the reviews lean towards a false impression of five star standards.    Would I come back? Unlikely. Would I have been happy if I had paid a five star price for this holiday ‚Ä¶.NO. If you are paying over 500 GBP at this hotel at this time of year for a week then you are paying way too much in my opinion.    The staff (most) are what makes this hotel    My expectations of 5* differ greatly from the hotel and this would make me cautious booking an expensive holiday with this hotel chain worldwide.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Shirley-Rose wrote a review Mar 16
Review_Text: We had such an amazing holiday here. The hotel was gorgeous immaculate and so relaxing. The staff were amazing and so friendly. We spent a lot of our time around the quiet pool and honestly so thankful we did. Omar and Osama were absolutely amazing so friendly and welcoming and made us feel at home. The food was lovely for each meal and the chef were so helpful and friendly. Honestly will go back again and again. My only tiny issue was we booked a spa package still to this day I'm not sure if we ended up missing part of our massage the staff were lovely and the session we did have were amazing but I felt that you were left to figure out if you needed to wait or not for you next part of the sessions. I believe we were due to have a clay massage but never had it because we were just pointed to the end of the corridor. However everything else was absolutely fantastic and I can't thank the staff enough so a wonderful week.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Linda H wrote a review Mar 15
Review_Text: The hotel was lovely the rooms are big & clean. The food & drink was fresh hot and varied. The grounds are beautiful and well looked after. The staff are attentive friendly and good fun the activities around the pool are there if you want to take part. The evening singers & dancers were really good and aimed at an adult audience. We went as a group of 8 girls we had an amazing time and will definitely return one day.  Thank you to all the staff for accommodating our group with seating in the restaurant and sitting outside in the evening we never went without and they always had a friendly smile üòÉ
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Molly M wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Text: I can quite honestly say this is one of the best resorts I‚Äôve stayed at with the nicest atmosphere. The hotel is constantly being cleaned smelling amazing and all the cleaning/housekeeping staff were so happy and friendly. The staff in the pool bar were always very friendly and kept our drinks refilled frequently as well as providing some great food including late breakfasts. Tariq especially was very hard working and friendly. The restaurant buffet was possibly the best I‚Äôve experienced and yes whilst any buffet gets a bit same over seven days the chefs do a fantastic job of catering and overall it caters very well to all different tastes even two in our group who usually are very picky had no problem finding things to eat every time. The restaurant had a great atmosphere and again all the staff were amazing Mounad the Manager made sure everything was ok whilst Hassan Yanssef and Houda provided great service with many smiles and always keen to help if they could. The lobby bar staff were also amazing with special shout out for Azdeen as he really did well remembering our orders and being very attentive.  We were there as a group of seven for seven nights and we all had the most amazing experience thanks to all the amazing staff but we must admit the animation team especially Samy and Emma really went the extra mile to make the activities extra fun and we‚Äôre always so happy.  I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a great break a nice chilled hotel that can offer activities to suit your mood and the food and drink are excellent. This was such a great first experience of Morocco & Marrakesh even though souks were a bit hectic shuttle bus was great from hotel and the tours arranged from hotel were all great value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jenny K wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Text: This was our second holiday of this year and we booked 5 nignts here via an easyJet package deal for ¬£1300 all inclusive. The hotel itself is about 15 minutes drive outside of the city centre and runs daily shuttle busses into the city.    Firstly the rooms are massive. We booked a suite and it was actually bigger than our apartment ha! The suite came with a lovely balcony for sunbathing a bath & separate shower 2 bathrooms living room and 2 televisions which were large.    All inclusive includes 4 bars (including a sports bar!) a pool bar a snack bar which has pizzas sandwiches & salads made to order & a lounge bar which has acoustic music on evening. The lounge bar also does olives & peanuts.    Pool always has music playing which was great! And there‚Äôs a quiet pool too.    Restaurant food was great buffet seemed to always have 2 types of vegetarian tagine made to order pasta as well as usual salads ect as well as many options for meat eaters. The al a carte restaurant also was very nice- the soup was delicious!    We‚Äôd come here again! Staff were friendly and very welcoming and enjoyed entire visit
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Richie M wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Title: Great hotel but first impressions not so..................
Review_Text: The hotel was lovely and the first few days were very quiet as most guests appear to be golfers and were out for most of the day leaving the pool virtually to ourselves. We would swim in the morning and then in the afternoon move to the swim up pool where it was quieter - although not as warm as the large pool - or to our room which was a swim up room - and the water even colder!!!!!  Our first impressions however were not so good. On arrival at the hotel we were asked to pay approximately ¬£47. When asking what it was for we were told "tax". This was not stipulated in any of our paperwork so came as a shock.  Then we were shown to our room and were disappointed that the "busboy" or whatever they are called stood in the room I presume waiting for a tip. We had no local currency so I put a pound coin in the palm of his hand. He stood looking at it and I wished I'd taken it back from him! The hotel should inform their staff that this is neither polite nor to be expected from visitors - it was quite uncomfortable having him stand there waiting.  All other staff we encountered are just lovely and you want to tip them as they really do give good service and are very friendly and a credit to the running of the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: JenTerr wrote a review Mar 13
Review_Text: This hotel was the best! The food was full of variety and had loads of options the bedrooms were cleaned everyday and spotless. But above all the staff were amazing. Especially the animation team - Sami and Emma. And waiting staff. I would go back in a heart beat!!

The restaurant had a great atmosphere and again all the staff were amazing Mounad the Manager made sure everything was ok whilst Hassan Yanssef and Houda provided great service with many smiles and always keen to help if they could. The lobby bar staff were also amazing with special shout out for Azdeen as he really did well remembering our orders and being very attentive.  We were there as a group of seven for seven nights and we all had the most amazing experience thanks to all the amazing staff but we must admit the animation team especially Samy and Emma really went the extra mile to make the activities extra fun and we‚Äôre always so happy.  I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a great break a nice chilled hotel that can offer activities to suit your mood and the food and drink are excellent. This was such a great first experience of Morocco & Marrakesh even though souks were a bit hectic shuttle bus was great from hotel and the tours arranged from hotel were all great value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jenny K wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Text: This was our second holiday of this year and we booked 5 nignts here via an easyJet package deal for ¬£1300 all inclusive. The hotel itself is about 15 minutes drive outside of the city centre and runs daily shuttle busses into the city.    Firstly the rooms are massive. We booked a suite and it was actually bigger than our apartment ha! The suite came with a lovely balcony for sunbathing a bath & separate shower 2 bathrooms living room and 2 televisions which were large.    All inclusive includes 4 bars (including a sports bar!) a pool bar a snack bar which has pizzas sandwiches & salads made to order & a lounge bar which has acoustic music on evening. The lounge bar also does olives & peanuts.    Pool always has music playing which was great! And there‚Äôs a quiet pool too.    Restaurant food was great buffet seemed to always have 2 types of vegetarian tagine made to order pasta as well as usual salads ect as well as many options for meat eaters. The al a carte restaurant also was very nice- the soup was delicious!    We‚Äôd come here again! Staff were friendly and very welcoming and enjoyed entire visit
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Richie M wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Title: Great hotel but first impressions not so..................
Review_Text: The hotel was lovely and the first few days were very quiet as most guests appear to be golfers and were out for most of the day leaving the pool virtually to ourselves. We would swim in the morning and then in the afternoon move to the swim up pool where it was quieter - although not as warm as the large pool - or to our room which was a swim up room - and the water even colder!!!!!  Our first impressions however were not so good. On arrival at the hotel we were asked to pay approximately ¬£47. When asking what it was for we were told "tax". This was not stipulated in any of our paperwork so came as a shock.  Then we were shown to our room and were disappointed that the "busboy" or whatever they are called stood in the room I presume waiting for a tip. We had no local currency so I put a pound coin in the palm of his hand. He stood looking at it and I wished I'd taken it back from him! The hotel should inform their staff that this is neither polite nor to be expected from visitors - it was quite uncomfortable having him stand there waiting.  All other staff we encountered are just lovely and you want to tip them as they really do give good service and are very friendly and a credit to the running of the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: This hotel was the best! The food was full of variety and had loads of options the bedrooms were cleaned everyday and spotless. But above all the staff were amazing. Especially the animation team - Sami and Emma. And waiting staff. I would go back in a heart beat!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Simran O wrote a review Mar 18

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lesley M wrote a review Mar 18
Review_Text: I have just returned from this hotel. Having spent 10 nights there. The room was fantastic very clean. The hotel was lovely and very clean. The restaurant food was amazing. Had a very large choice but some of it was cold. Breakfast time was very busy as a lot of golfers go there so those to take all the rolls and the bread with Chuck don‚Äôt understand why the hotel as it‚Äôs all-inclusive should provide a packed lunch for them. Also they should have a couple of coffee and tea stations which would take a bit of pressure off of the staff even though they were all fantastic. Keep having to go back and forward. Get in the teas and coffee is in the cups Would make life a bit easier and also I found some evenings they would let people still in their swimwear which is clearly states you cannot go in there in shorts and bikinis. Obviously lunchtime it‚Äôs a bit different but obviously you put a T-shirt or no shorts. We used to sit round the large games pool every day which there was plenty of activities. All the staff there were amazing Emma Sami Titif Oussami who was especially brilliant got a sunbeds every day brought round water to us all when it was really hot which was every day. I will definitely be returning to this hotel next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sue M wrote a review Mar 18
Review_Text: Just returned after a fantastic 10 nights at this lovely hotel. We had a large room overlooking the pool on the ground floor which was lovely and cleaned every day with fresh towels and the beds were so comfortable.  The restaurant and food were good with a great choice to suit everyone but could do with being hotter we ended up going to the fresh pasta station at the evening to make sure we had hit food. The desserts are delicious and the best I‚Äôve eaten in an all inclusive hotel. Breakfast is frustrating and chaotic as the hotel is a base for the golfers who take over the restaurant first thing and take all the rolls and bread to make sandwiches to take with them the staff are run off their feet and you have to wait for the table to be cleaned then they bring the coffee tea but run out of cups so you have to wait again for them to fetch these. A suggestion would be to take the pressure of the staff to install a couple of self service tea and coffee machines.    What makes this hotel one of the best holidays I‚Äôve had is the staff around the pool Titus Emma Sami and especially Oussami who went out of his way every day to get fresh towels for us and put umbrellas by our sun beds even bringing us bottles of water in the 32 degrees heat. All the team were great fun to be around and we had a great time doing all the activities and met some lovely people.    I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to return next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rachel C wrote a review Mar 17
Review_Title: Good for price but not a 5*
Review_Text: I always try to start these reviews with some info about me as a traveller to help others decide if my preferences and tastes align with theirs to enable easier decision making. I am in my late 30‚Äôs and holiday a minimum of twice a year. I am fortunate that I can splash out and stay in some beautiful places in exotic parts of the world but am equally happy to seek out a bargain if it means I can see different parts of the world.    This holiday was a girls week away with the intention of catching some winter sun food and cocktails. We paid under ¬£500 a person for all inclusive inc flights    THE HOTEL    The hotel itself is kept very clean you are welcomed with beautiful incense smells as you arrive. The layout is easy to navigate and small. There are two pools one with a swim up bar and one which is ‚Äòheated‚Äô and where the animation team are based during the day. There are a few sunloungers that need to be replaced as they bow in the middle but on a whole all furnishings and fittings are clean and tidy. The gardens are well kept and aesthetically pleasing.    Plenty of Sun loungers hotel quiet and I was often the only person by the pool until 10-10.30 am.    Location is around 20 minutes away from Marrakesh and there is a free shuttle provided.    THE ROOM    We paid for a basic room with two beds. Room again was clean and pleasant enough beds were very comfortable but pillows not. Mini fridge contained only of water and was not cold. There was a kettle and 2 coffee capsules.  Plenty of hanging space and hangers.    Very strange window from bathroom into the bedroom we found this funny and you could draw a blind for privacy. Bath could not be used as no plug. Shower weak needed a descale but cubicle big and clean. Shower did drip all the time. Two sinks and some tolietries provided which we didn‚Äôt use. Only provided with one big towel and a hand towel which was not great for long thick hair. Hair dryer was not great for a supposed 5* but normal standard for price paid    We were on ground floor and there was a small area to sit outside. It overlooked a wall and little bit of garden.    The room was cleaned every day to a good standard. The cleaners are an asset to this hotel as are the other housekeeping team such as maintenance and gardeners. Clean towels provided each day.    FOOD    The hotel is greatly let down by its food. I am a real foodie and love spending money on food and drink. I am reviewing this based on the price we paid but I was very disappointed.    Food is served in a buffet style. It is very small and the layout is not easy to navigate. I could always find something to eat but noticed the food was very bland with lots of salt used if it was left over from lunch.    There were items of food that were not warm when they should have been and this made them inedible. I normally do not have a sweet tooth however the pastry chef was very talented here and deserts were fantastic.    Once a week you could book to eat in the other sit down restaurant. You have to be spending 4 nights plus to access this. The food was much better but very small menu. I wished there had been an option to pay to eat in this restaurant as I would have used it over the restaurant.    For lunch you could order food at the pool bar which was hot as it was cooked to order.    Waiting staff were ok some friendly others not so.    DRINKS    My friend said she liked the beer as she thought it tasted like corona. The cocktails were very poor as made with cordials and not juices very sweet and syrupy. I can be a lightweight in the heat and feel tipsy quickly if I am not careful‚Ä¶.I did not experience this at all as alcohol very watered down. Again for the price paid this was ok but not 5* standard. There is no option to buy better wines unless you were in the sit down restaurant and these did not look great for the price.    The bar staff in the lobby bar were fab very efficient kind and good service provided bring drinks to you.    Pool bar we only used once so can not comment we did not use the sports bar but the snack bar had poorer quality of staff service. Very rare to get a smile.    ENTERTAINMENT    Evening entertainment was ok for price paid. Some singers a disco dancers etc. they had karaoke which is not my personal favourite but was very popular.    The animation team by the ‚Äòheated‚Äô pool were an asset to the hotel. Emma and Sami spent the most time with us but all the team provided 10/10 service.    SUSTAINABILITY    Whilst I am not an eco warrior I have started to consider the environmental sustainability of hotels I stay in. This was not great for sustainable models. Very small plastic cups bottles straws used. Plastic cutlery at snack bar.    SPA    The spa was ok pleasing on the eye and clean. Treatments were mediocre but only cost 700 mad for a full massage and additional head massage so reasonably priced    OVERALL    We paid for what we got. I would rate this as a high end 3* to low end 4*. I was surprised we had wrist bands had towel cards had to pay room and towel deposits of 1000 mad as this is not expected in a five star hotel. The food and drinks are what would move this down to a 3* I‚Äôm my opinion.    The ages of guests ranged but there was a high percentage of young influencers around the hotel which may be why some of the reviews lean towards a false impression of five star standards.    Would I come back? Unlikely. Would I have been happy if I had paid a five star price for this holiday ‚Ä¶.NO. If you are paying over 500 GBP at this hotel at this time of year for a week then you are paying way too much in my opinion.    The staff (most) are what makes this hotel    My expectations of 5* differ greatly from the hotel and this would make me cautious booking an expensive holiday with this hotel chain worldwide.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Shirley-Rose wrote a review Mar 16
Review_Text: We had such an amazing holiday here. The hotel was gorgeous immaculate and so relaxing. The staff were amazing and so friendly. We spent a lot of our time around the quiet pool and honestly so thankful we did. Omar and Osama were absolutely amazing so friendly and welcoming and made us feel at home. The food was lovely for each meal and the chef were so helpful and friendly. Honestly will go back again and again. My only tiny issue was we booked a spa package still to this day I'm not sure if we ended up missing part of our massage the staff were lovely and the session we did have were amazing but I felt that you were left to figure out if you needed to wait or not for you next part of the sessions. I believe we were due to have a clay massage but never had it because we were just pointed to the end of the corridor. However everything else was absolutely fantastic and I can't thank the staff enough so a wonderful week.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jenny K wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Text: This was our second holiday of this year and we booked 5 nignts here via an easyJet package deal for ¬£1300 all inclusive. The hotel itself is about 15 minutes drive outside of the city centre and runs daily shuttle busses into the city.    Firstly the rooms are massive. We booked a suite and it was actually bigger than our apartment ha! The suite came with a lovely balcony for sunbathing a bath & separate shower 2 bathrooms living room and 2 televisions which were large.    All inclusive includes 4 bars (including a sports bar!) a pool bar a snack bar which has pizzas sandwiches & salads made to order & a lounge bar which has acoustic music on evening. The lounge bar also does olives & peanuts.    Pool always has music playing which was great! And there‚Äôs a quiet pool too. The al a carte restaurant also was very nice- the soup was delicious!    We‚Äôd come here again! Staff were friendly and very welcoming and enjoyed entire visit
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Richie M wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Title: Great hotel but first impressions not so..................
Review_Text: The hotel was lovely and the first few days were very quiet as most guests appear to be golfers and were out for most of the day leaving the pool virtually to ourselves. We would swim in the morning and then in the afternoon move to the swim up pool where it was quieter - although not as warm as the large pool - or to our room which was a swim up room - and the water even colder!!!!!  Our first impressions however were not so good. On arrival at the hotel we were asked to pay approximately ¬£47. When asking what it was for we were told "tax". This was not stipulated in any of our paperwork so came as a shock.  Then we were shown to our room and were disappointed that the "busboy" or whatever they are called stood in the room I presume waiting for a tip. We had no local currency so I put a pound coin in the palm of his hand. He stood looking at it and I wished I'd taken it back from him! The hotel should inform their staff that this is neither polite nor to be expected from visitors - it was quite uncomfortable having him stand there waiting.  All other staff we encountered are just lovely and you want to tip them as they really do give good service and are very friendly and a credit to the running of the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: JenTerr wrote a review Mar 13
Review_Text: This hotel was the best! The food was full of variety and had loads of options the bedrooms were cleaned everyday and spotless. But above all the staff were amazing. Especially the animation team - Sami and Emma. And waiting staff. I would go back in a heart beat!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Simran O wrote a review Mar 18
Review_Text: Excellent service and friendly staff that accommodate you accordingly my husband broke his ankle and the staff helped him in any way they could.. they provided excellent activities like archery and darts Emma was lovely friendly and approachable and had so much fun doing aqua aerobics with her!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lesley M wrote a review Mar 18
Review_Text: I have just returned from this hotel. Having spent 10 nights there. The room was fantastic very clean. The hotel was lovely and very clean. The restaurant food was amazing. Had a very large choice but some of it was cold. Breakfast time was very busy as a lot of golfers go there so those to take all the rolls and the bread with Chuck don‚Äôt understand why the hotel as it‚Äôs all-inclusive should provide a packed lunch for them. Also they should have a couple of coffee and tea stations which would take a bit of pressure off of the staff even though they were all fantastic. Keep having to go back and forward. Get in the teas and coffee is in the cups Would make life a bit easier and also I found some evenings they would let people still in their swimwear which is clearly states you cannot go in there in shorts and bikinis. Obviously lunchtime it‚Äôs a bit different but obviously you put a T-shirt or no shorts. We used to sit round the large games pool every day which there was plenty of activities. All the staff there were amazing Emma Sami Titif Oussami who was especially brilliant got a sunbeds every day brought round water to us all when it was really hot which was every day. I will definitely be returning to this hotel next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sue M wrote a review Mar 18
Review_Text: Just returned after a fantastic 10 nights at this lovely hotel. We had a large room overlooking the pool on the ground floor which was lovely and cleaned every day with fresh towels and the beds were so comfortable.  The restaurant and food were good with a great choice to suit everyone but could do with being hotter we ended up going to the fresh pasta station at the evening to make sure we had hit food. The desserts are delicious and the best I‚Äôve eaten in an all inclusive hotel. Breakfast is frustrating and chaotic as the hotel is a base for the golfers who take over the restaurant first thing and take all the rolls and bread to make sandwiches to take with them the staff are run off their feet and you have to wait for the table to be cleaned then they bring the coffee tea but run out of cups so you have to wait again for them to fetch these. A suggestion would be to take the pressure of the staff to install a couple of self service tea and coffee machines.    What makes this hotel one of the best holidays I‚Äôve had is the staff around the pool Titus Emma Sami and especially Oussami who went out of his way every day to get fresh towels for us and put umbrellas by our sun beds even bringing us bottles of water in the 32 degrees heat. All the team were great fun to be around and we had a great time doing all the activities and met some lovely people.    I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to return next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rachel C wrote a review Mar 17
Review_Title: Good for price but not a 5*
Review_Text: I always try to start these reviews with some info about me as a traveller to help others decide if my preferences and tastes align with theirs to enable easier decision making. I am in my late 30‚Äôs and holiday a minimum of twice a year. I am fortunate that I can splash out and stay in some beautiful places in exotic parts of the world but am equally happy to seek out a bargain if it means I can see different parts of the world.    This holiday was a girls week away with the intention of catching some winter sun food and cocktails. We paid under ¬£500 a person for all inclusive inc flights    THE HOTEL    The hotel itself is kept very clean you are welcomed with beautiful incense smells as you arrive. The layout is easy to navigate and small. There are two pools one with a swim up bar and one which is ‚Äòheated‚Äô and where the animation team are based during the day. There are a few sunloungers that need to be replaced as they bow in the middle but on a whole all furnishings and fittings are clean and tidy. The gardens are well kept and aesthetically pleasing.    Plenty of Sun loungers hotel quiet and I was often the only person by the pool until 10-10.30 am.    Location is around 20 minutes away from Marrakesh and there is a free shuttle provided.    THE ROOM    We paid for a basic room with two beds. Room again was clean and pleasant enough beds were very comfortable but pillows not. Mini fridge contained only of water and was not cold. There was a kettle and 2 coffee capsules.  Plenty of hanging space and hangers.    Very strange window from bathroom into the bedroom we found this funny and you could draw a blind for privacy. Bath could not be used as no plug. Shower weak needed a descale but cubicle big and clean. Shower did drip all the time. Two sinks and some tolietries provided which we didn‚Äôt use. Only provided with one big towel and a hand towel which was not great for long thick hair. Hair dryer was not great for a supposed 5* but normal standard for price paid    We were on ground floor and there was a small area to sit outside. It overlooked a wall and little bit of garden.    The room was cleaned every day to a good standard. The cleaners are an asset to this hotel as are the other housekeeping team such as maintenance and gardeners. Clean towels provided each day.    FOOD    The hotel is greatly let down by its food. I am a real foodie and love spending money on food and drink. I am reviewing this based on the price we paid but I was very disappointed.    Food is served in a buffet style. It is very small and the layout is not easy to navigate. I could always find something to eat but noticed the food was very bland with lots of salt used if it was left over from lunch.    There were items of food that were not warm when they should have been and this made them inedible. I normally do not have a sweet tooth however the pastry chef was very talented here and deserts were fantastic.    Once a week you could book to eat in the other sit down restaurant. You have to be spending 4 nights plus to access this. The food was much better but very small menu. I wished there had been an option to pay to eat in this restaurant as I would have used it over the restaurant.    For lunch you could order food at the pool bar which was hot as it was cooked to order.    Waiting staff were ok some friendly others not so.    DRINKS    My friend said she liked the beer as she thought it tasted like corona. The cocktails were very poor as made with cordials and not juices very sweet and syrupy. I can be a lightweight in the heat and feel tipsy quickly if I am not careful‚Ä¶.I did not experience this at all as alcohol very watered down. Again for the price paid this was ok but not 5* standard. There is no option to buy better wines unless you were in the sit down restaurant and these did not look great for the price.    The bar staff in the lobby bar were fab very efficient kind and good service provided bring drinks to you.    Pool bar we only used once so can not comment we did not use the sports bar but the snack bar had poorer quality of staff service. Very rare to get a smile.    ENTERTAINMENT    Evening entertainment was ok for price paid. Some singers a disco dancers etc. they had karaoke which is not my personal favourite but was very popular.    The animation team by the ‚Äòheated‚Äô pool were an asset to the hotel. Emma and Sami spent the most time with us but all the team provided 10/10 service.    SUSTAINABILITY    Whilst I am not an eco warrior I have started to consider the environmental sustainability of hotels I stay in. This was not great for sustainable models. Very small plastic cups bottles straws used. Plastic cutlery at snack bar.    SPA    The spa was ok pleasing on the eye and clean. Treatments were mediocre but only cost 700 mad for a full massage and additional head massage so reasonably priced    OVERALL    We paid for what we got. I would rate this as a high end 3* to low end 4*. I was surprised we had wrist bands had towel cards had to pay room and towel deposits of 1000 mad as this is not expected in a five star hotel. The food and drinks are what would move this down to a 3* I‚Äôm my opinion.    The ages of guests ranged but there was a high percentage of young influencers around the hotel which may be why some of the reviews lean towards a false impression of five star standards.    Would I come back? Unlikely. Would I have been happy if I had paid a five star price for this holiday ‚Ä¶.NO. If you are paying over 500 GBP at this hotel at this time of year for a week then you are paying way too much in my opinion.    The staff (most) are what makes this hotel    My expectations of 5* differ greatly from the hotel and this would make me cautious booking an expensive holiday with this hotel chain worldwide.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Shirley-Rose wrote a review Mar 16
Review_Text: We had such an amazing holiday here. The hotel was gorgeous immaculate and so relaxing. The staff were amazing and so friendly. We spent a lot of our time around the quiet pool and honestly so thankful we did. Omar and Osama were absolutely amazing so friendly and welcoming and made us feel at home. The food was lovely for each meal and the chef were so helpful and friendly. Honestly will go back again and again. My only tiny issue was we booked a spa package still to this day I'm not sure if we ended up missing part of our massage the staff were lovely and the session we did have were amazing but I felt that you were left to figure out if you needed to wait or not for you next part of the sessions. I believe we were due to have a clay massage but never had it because we were just pointed to the end of the corridor. However everything else was absolutely fantastic and I can't thank the staff enough so a wonderful week.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Linda H wrote a review Mar 15
Review_Text: The hotel was lovely the rooms are big & clean. The food & drink was fresh hot and varied. The grounds are beautiful and well looked after. The staff are attentive friendly and good fun the activities around the pool are there if you want to take part. The evening singers & dancers were really good and aimed at an adult audience. We went as a group of 8 girls we had an amazing time and will definitely return one day.  Thank you to all the staff for accommodating our group with seating in the restaurant and sitting outside in the evening we never went without and they always had a friendly smile üòÉ
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Molly M wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Text: I can quite honestly say this is one of the best resorts I‚Äôve stayed at with the nicest atmosphere. The hotel is constantly being cleaned smelling amazing and all the cleaning/housekeeping staff were so happy and friendly. The staff in the pool bar were always very friendly and kept our drinks refilled frequently as well as providing some great food including late breakfasts. Tariq especially was very hard working and friendly. The restaurant buffet was possibly the best I‚Äôve experienced and yes whilst any buffet gets a bit same over seven days the chefs do a fantastic job of catering and overall it caters very well to all different tastes even two in our group who usually are very picky had no problem finding things to eat every time. The restaurant had a great atmosphere and again all the staff were amazing Mounad the Manager made sure everything was ok whilst Hassan Yanssef and Houda provided great service with many smiles and always keen to help if they could. The lobby bar staff were also amazing with special shout out for Azdeen as he really did well remembering our orders and being very attentive.  We were there as a group of seven for seven nights and we all had the most amazing experience thanks to all the amazing staff but we must admit the animation team especially Samy and Emma really went the extra mile to make the activities extra fun and we‚Äôre always so happy.  I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a great break a nice chilled hotel that can offer activities to suit your mood and the food and drink are excellent. This was such a great first experience of Morocco & Marrakesh even though souks were a bit hectic shuttle bus was great from hotel and the tours arranged from hotel were all great value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: t e wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We were booked to stay from 7th to 17th February but stayed one extra night due to illness (more later).  I want to be balanced in this review and give the positive and the negative:    The positive:  1. the pool areas and gardens are beautiful and well looked after.  2. The bedrooms are a good size with comfortable beds  3. The bathroom is a good size with good shower and bath  4. The waiting and room cleaning staff are really helpful and friendly  5. The a la carte restaurant is ok but nothing special (one visit per week permitted )    The negative:  1. Hygiene in the buffet restaurant and hotel corridors is appallingly bad - it is all self service with all the guests handling the same serving spoons and tongs (some using hands) - it would be much better if you could point to what you want and the hotel staff serve it onto your plate.  2. Most of the food that is supposed to be hot in the buffet restaurant is just warm at best  3. after a couple of days the food seemed rather bland and tasteless  4. It seems that food left from yesterday is reprocessed and represented the next day  5. the free alcohol is poor quality and feels very weak  6. the tiled corridor from our room to reception was nearly always dirty with drink and food stains on the floor - I only ever saw it cleaned once per day  7. My wife contracted food poisoning on day 4 and suffered sickness and diarreah (see note below)  8. The cleaning maid told us not to worry about the mess as 2 rooms near us also had sickness and diarrhea  9. 2 nights later we heard 2 people above us throwing up all night  10. The hotel had a serious outbreak of sickness and diarrhea  11. The attitude of the senior management of the hotel is disgusting and we were very badly treated - the Public relations manager seated at a desk in reception area denied there was ever a problem (privately the food and beverage manager admitted to us and to another couple separately that there was a problem) - mysteriously we never saw him again.    Why do I feel the hotel has a problem with food hygiene and preparation? Please read the following and be very careful if you go to this hotel....    On day 4 of our 10 day holiday my wife had sickness and diarreah after 2 days of continuation the TUI rep called a doctor to our room - he diagnosed gastroenteritis and gave injections and tablets to follow. He said it would be fine in 24 hours. After 36 hours my wife was more poorly than ever. My travel insurance insisted I take my wife to hospital. the ambulance arrived in 30 minutes (the hotel nurse was very helpful at this stage). In hospital my wife was diagnosed with a rare form of gastroenteritis and dysentery caused by an amoeba (small larvae). This type of amoeba is tropical and caused by passing the infection on through contaminated water and food. My wife never left the hotel other than in an ambulance to go to hospital. There is no doubt this infection was caught at the hotel - but the public relations manager denied there was a problem and stated it was not their responsibility. She then quizzed me why I had not reported this to the hotel - I did after 24 hours. She then asked my why I did not call the hotel nurse - because I didn't know there was a hotel nurse. To cut a long story short my wife spent 3 days in hospital very ill indeed and could have died. She is now in a UK hospital still very unwell. On 3 occasions I asked to meet with the general manager - once to the front of house public relations manager once to reception and once (via the TUI rep) to the Head of public relations who sat in an office near the reception. On all 3 occasions I was refused access to the general manager    Conclusion  Without the problems we have experienced I would say the hotel is probably an average 3 stars. The hygiene situation particularly in the buffet restaurant is dire and needs addressing urgently by the hotel. The attitude of senior management is disgusting.  I cannot recommend this hotel on any level. if you do use it my advice is be very careful in the buffet restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sharon L wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We really enjoyed spending time around the pool - the animation team were all great. The aqua archery salsa  darts and football were all brilliant and delivered with such enthusiasm from the staff. Emma was particularly friendly and very knowledgeable. Ousamaa was excellent too but the whole team 10/10  The evening Lobby Bar staff were fabulous and very hard working making sure everyone was looked after.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ellie-Jayne Ryder wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Have just returned from a weeks stay at Be Live Collection.    Pro‚Äôs  - The hotel grounds are lovely and well looked after the lobby area is lovely and always spotless.  - We just had a standard room which was plenty big enough pleasant and had a good standard of house keeping everyday.  - The staff are really friendly & attentive. Mustapha in the Sports Bar takes extra care with his cocktails & they are definitely the best! Adezine in the Lobby Bar also makes sure you never have an empty glass. The Entertainment team around the pool are also very friendly & chatty.  - The shuttle bus into town (although the times could be slightly more accommodating ie there‚Äôs a massive gap in the afternoon) is free and pick up and drop off in the centre of town is easy.    Con‚Äôs  - There is really only one option for dinner daily which is the buffet restaurant. For us the food really could be improved. The buffet was very same same. Felt it was lacking options could have done with utilising the live cooking stations better or having a different themes for part of the buffet each night ie Asian Indian etc in order to break it up slightly. The food on the whole just tasted a bit bland (except the puddings - these were really nice).  - Breakfast wise queues by the toaster and the egg station made it feel a bit canteen-y as people often ended up queuing for food.  - The Ksar restaurant was nice however please be aware you can only use this ONCE per week so we could only visit this once. When told this on arrival we were quite disappointed.  - Drinks were not premium alcohol you had to pay extra if you wanted branded ie Gordon‚Äôs gin. The cocktails on the whole were not the best as they were weak and often made with mixers from concentrate. They were also inconsistent and no 2 seemed to taste the same.  - Obviously the hotel cannot control the weather however we felt more could have been done by way of entertainment on days when it wasn‚Äôt sunny in order to keep people‚Äôs morale.    Haven‚Äôt visited a 5* in Morocco previously so may be that we are being harsh in our expectation however this hotel didn‚Äôt compare to 5* hotels of Europe & the Caribbean but nonetheless we had a pleasant stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sani wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Hotel very nice Helpful polite staff poolside activies really good i enjoyed my friends birthday for the 3 days your allowed to play your play list if you ask I would highly recommend oussama pool men
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Kay4s wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: This hotel is Not 5 star 3.5/4 star at best.Rooms tired already towels grey and frayed. Azdine in lobby bar was exceptional resulting in hotel being more of a party hotel not 5 star luxury. Food on first impressions looks good.nicely presented with a talented pastry chef. Food and hygiene protocols Not in place not all serving chefs wear gloves prep counters chicken and fish alongside. No consideration people suffering from nut allergies nuts permanently displayed. Early breakfast service atrocious staff along with duty manager more interested in chatting than setting tables providing tea and coffee. Omelette station extremely slow. Lunch and dinner food is tasteless served cold buffet style which is a breeding ground for bacteria food is recycled. Heat lamps are not hot plates are cold. Numerous guests suffered gastric complaints with one guest being hospitalised for days. Management admitted there was a problem but were not interested. Am still suffering even though home after 10 days awaiting results. Serious food and hygiene problem here serving cold food is Not acceptable. Would not recommend hotel worst hotel I have ever stayed. Was delighted to leave. Tip: take plenty of Imodium with you if you wish to chance your luck residing at this party hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Food and hygiene protocols Not in place not all serving chefs wear gloves prep counters chicken and fish alongside. No consideration people suffering from nut allergies nuts permanently displayed. Early breakfast service atrocious staff along with duty manager more interested in chatting than setting tables providing tea and coffee. Omelette station extremely slow. Lunch and dinner food is tasteless served cold buffet style which is a breeding ground for bacteria food is recycled. Heat lamps are not hot plates are cold. Numerous guests suffered gastric complaints with one guest being hospitalised for days. Management admitted there was a problem but were not interested. Am still suffering even though home after 10 days awaiting results. Serious food and hygiene problem here serving cold food is Not acceptable. Would not recommend hotel worst hotel I have ever stayed. Was delighted to leave. Tip: take plenty of Imodium with you if you wish to chance your luck residing at this party hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Croakie wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Nothing 5-star there!    You have to leave a deposit (very 5-star!) for a room (and pool towel) in which the hand shower heads are either not working (shower) or leaking half the pressure (tub).    You get a very early idea of what 'all inclusive' means there when you discover you only have 2 Nespresso capsules for the whole stay and that additional capsules must be bought (cash of course) at reception at 15 dirhams (150 euros) a piece. Also the mini-bar only contains water and not only do you need to pay for anything else but it's not even in the mini-bar!    The food is just above average and everything is cold (those lamps are either off or not strong enough) The wine is terrible!  The waiters can easily reallocate your table to someone else if you're too long getting more food at the buffet.  Oh and if you came to Morocco to enjoy fresh and ripe vegetables and fruits you're in for a disappointment: tomatoes bananas and avocados are as unripe and hard as in Paris. With the exception of orange all juices are factory-made as is very likely most of what's presented on the buffet.    The bars offer a nice variety of beverages and cocktails which all share the same characteristics: cheap alcohol and too much sugar. I've heard someone say that they overdose the alcohol because they want you to get drunk faster so they don't have to serve you again. Don't know if it's true.....    Nobody gets the same price at the Spa where you are encouraged to pash cash again and once the money pocketed (litterally as far as I could tell) you get treatments that are too soft and ineffective anyway.  I don't know where those masseuses got their training (probably a crash online course) but their gestures are mechanical and uncaring.  Like most of the hotel staff they don't want to be there and they don't care.  A special mention for the music at the spa which must be managed by a child because tracks keep skipping at random (next previous same sometimes 4 times in a row sometimes the volume doubles....) making it impossible to fully relax in the booth.    What affected me the most was the lack of care and professionalism. If you are a little observant you see very quickly that the smiles are as fake as the goods they sell in town that they don't care about quality or customer satisfaction or anything else that makes up good service.    So really nothing 5- star there!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jacqueline H wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: From the moment your taxi glides through the security gates you experience quality service. Every staff member has your interest at heart. Mustapha and Ayoub at the reception desk made check in pleasurable and were attentive and as helpful as possible throughout my 8 day stay. Bedrooms were impeccably styled and always clean the buffet was an Aladdin's cave of delicious fare and drinks were varied and plentiful. Ayoub in the restaurant kept a keen eye on operations and service. Facilities were created and suit the adult market. Just disappointed with the onslaught of guests at the weekend when the restaurant was like a cattle market with younger guests on a conference pushing shoving and the loud disrespect for other people. The Moroccan restaurant was disappointing.  Yusin at the Tour Guide desk was marvellous helpful honest but always courteous and professional - he was the Man in the know to go to as well as the Public Relations rep. A big thank you to all the employees for a MOST MEMORABLRE AND WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE. On my next visit I will be choosing your hotel again and bringing my friends too for the Be Live Experience

Review_Date: Rae A wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Best trip for the start of the year
Review_Text: My partner and I really enjoyed our time at the hotel. We just wished we had more time. Everything was perfect. From the food the drinks and the event planners that helped with the activities and selection of music by the pool not to mention the night life. Also if you're in need of some great holiday pics in the hotel ask for a guy called Halim. He's really good with the camera. We got around 200+ photos for a good deal. Getting around is fairly easy as there is a free shuttle that has its own timetable that takes you into town (the Medina) from the hotel and back. You must book in adv like a day before at reception and a ticket will be handed to you. If you miss the shuttle coming back you have to make your own way back I assume. Reception were helpful from the day we arrived till the last day we left. I hope to see everyone again when we come back. It was great to be around many people and the beautiful faces of Morocco. It was an amazing experience we would love the re-live again.    Souifian Abdulatif Emaal Ennel Halim so many names to add a big thankyou to you all!! Xx

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lee P wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Thanks Azdine in the main bar, Nour El Houda <3 in the conservatory
Review_Text: We spent Christmas as the Be Live Adults' Only hotel and was there for 13 nights. We cut our trip short by 3 days (still haven't had a refund) as 16 nights would have been far too long to stay in the same routine every day. We really loved the staff at the hotel particularly Azdine in the main bar Nour El Houda <3 in the conservatory part of the main restaurant Tarek and Aaron in the snack bar they were all absolutely amazing. They really know how to look after you we tend to like a bottle of wine and they were all so kind with the service. (Thank you guys you all deserve pay rises) Now the place was faultless it's very clean and spotless service impeccable apart from the tour guide desk (will come back to that later) but it is very samey (even the music around the crazy - warm pool is the same tape playing every day) so you do start to feel a bit Groundhog. which is the only reason we left early. So my only advice would be perhaps to do a twin center holiday perhaps 5 nights here and 5 at an alternative place but in all the managers really know what they are doing as everything else is impeccable. including the lovely chamber/cleaning staff. Just don't go Groundhog like we did :) We met some lovely people and made some solid friendships. It's a very social and friendly environment and easy to chill and relax on comfy sunbeds around the cold pool. Perfect for that The rooms are sparse but big and very clean. If you book a tour with the tour guide and want to have a guide around the Souks make sure you tell the guy at the hotel you don't want to be taken to all the tourist traps where they do the hard sell and are mates and give the guide commission we ended up leaving after 30 minutes So be warned. But overall we would go back for the staff the location the sunshine and the nice people that we met there. So don't let the bad reviews put you off the swim up rooms are probably nice when it's 40 degrees but no way in winter. Thanks Adzine and Nour for making our holiday!!! Ps. Please feed Bown Bear the cat in the picture and let me know if you see him.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: T. M. Smith wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Solid 4 stars. Could use a little Lagniappe but otherwise perfect.
Review_Text: This is a late review but my girlfriend and I are planning another trip to Marrakech and I remembered this hotel. Honestly we booked a day long excursion for each of our three days there so we did not get to teally use the amenities or need anything from the staff. But I will review the good and bad that I do remember. With the nuamce that this review is based on the price we paid. The resort itself is a solid 4 stars. The furniture is not the best quality but the decor was nice. The grounds are lush and really beautiful at night. The grounds were safe as the security was very attentive. We rented the bikes the resort had and did a self tour of the area and while it seems like the property is far from everything we still found a lot of picturesque scenery and had fun. The food selection was decent again for the price and the fact that it was an all-inclusive. The beer wine and mixed drink selection was limited but strong. The staff was attentive and efficient as I do not remember check in taking a long time and after requesting additional towels the first day housekeeping supplied extra towels every day of our stay. For a first timer visiting this city this resort is perfect. But something about it was missing. It was a solid 4 star resort.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Adele P wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Spent a week here with friends.  On arrival staff welcomed us warmly.  The hotelrooms and grounds are beautiful.  This is the coldest time of year to visitso no sunbathing or swimming but thete are plenty of fun activities to do in the day.  A big thankyou to the animation team for keeping us entertained. Many thanks
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: muncey3 wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: the best place we‚Äôve ever stayed staff are the friendliest food and drink amazing weather was lovely too! Hotel room was spotless every day we even got a chance to chat to the housekeeping lady! We will be back!

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Tee wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Overall the stay was pleasant and we would return again in warmer months.  Myself and my friend (2 girls early twenties) stayed here for 2 nights which we got through a wowcher deal.  The hotel is very modern clean and aesthetic.  Staff were polite and helpful.  I liked that room came with 2 double beds 2 sinks and both a bath and shower. Plenty of space to store luggage & clothes. The bed provided was probably one of the comfiest I have ever experienced at hotel! The only thing I felt the room lacked was having an iron and iron board for convenience.  In terms of food the buffet had an adequate selection but as a vegetarian I felt there could‚Äôve been more options though all I did eat was very tasty. The way service ran seemed a bit odd though upon entering you would seat yourself which was fine but could sometimes be awkward as you wouldn‚Äôt know which tables were already taken and which weren‚Äôt if belongings hadn‚Äôt been left. It also meant you had to flag down a waiter to request drinks. I don‚Äôt know if it was more to do with the fact we were 2 young girls on our own but we were never first asked what we wanted to drink first at breakfast or dinner though we would see other couples/groups being brought over cups and saucers without request in the morning. The on-site Moroccan restaurant was 5/5.  The facilities of this hotel are good 2 lovely outside pools however too cold to use at this time of year so we just sunbathed in the afternoon. We did buy a spa package which allowed us to use the indoor heated pool - although this still wasn‚Äôt very warm! The packaged we bought cost about ¬£90 for use of the pool all day hammam treatment and 1 hour massage which we felt very good value for money - greatly enjoyed! Nice gym and small shop onsite for toiletries and snacks.  What felt was lacking a bit was entertainment day entertainment we guessed was due to the colder weather and the hotel not being full. However rather than trying to engage guests with some sort of activity it seemed like the entertainment guys just stood around chatting instead. We visited the sports bar on the first night which was pleasant with a foosball and snooker table but it was rather small. On the second night we joined the karaoke in the lobby bar which was fun though it shut down at midnight and general drinks/alcohol also purchase stopped then. Good selection of cocktails on offer.  We were one of a few younger groups but most of the clientele seemed to be middle aged couples/groups.  We quad biked in the desert which we‚Äôd definitely recommend! Be sure to do research on tour operators we felt ours (Rak adventures) was very good value for money getting 2 hours out in the dessert with snacks morrocan tea and photo opps.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Heidi S wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Just got back yesterday from a week here heres my thoughts:    Hotel/reception:  All super clean and tidy the reception staff were okay we booked everything through easyjet and they couldn‚Äôt find our booking which was stressful is a ¬£110 charge on arrival (¬£80 you get back when you check out)    Room:  The room was absolutely beautiful! Huge bathroom with bath and shower there is a window directly into bedroom fyi incase that bothers you (glad we didnt pay for a ‚Äúswim up room‚Äù as they are the rip off!)    Pools:  When we arrived the main pool was out of service.. brilliant.. luckily it opened a few days later this pool is nice (nice music mostly English songs) the other smaller pool is ICE cold but still okay for sunbathing no fighting over sunbeds at all here as theres so many we used the spa pool the most as it was the warmest of the three.    Spa:  The spa is stunning but not included we paid ¬£250 for a package to use the pool ultimates times which also came with treatments which were interesting.. the spa staff were a little pushy to make you buy treatments    Food:  The food was okay not great if you‚Äôre fussy like me my partner enjoyed it more the pancakes and puddings were great. Once we used the snack bar we went there every day for lunch as it was much better (burgers sandwiches chips pizzas paninis etc) the cocktails were really nice too    Entertainment/Drinks:  The lobby bar where the evening entertainment is is very small you have to get there early if you want a seat the staff in the main restaurant were great my wine was topped up before id even finished my glass.    Overall it was nice however I wouldn‚Äôt return or recommend it to a friend/family partly because of journey (not the hotels fault but worth knowing) the airports a nightmare and the private transfers are INSANE?! Both of them using there phone while driving both nearly crashed (multiple times) and even apologised to us the roads are indescribably dangerous here.    Most of the staff were lovely and friendly and the weather was mostly sunny enough to sunbathe and relax which is what we wanted but I wasn‚Äôt blown away the way we normally are with inclusive adult only resorts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Pioneer512219 wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Stayed for 15 nights. Left 19/01/23  The hotel immediately feels very smart/ very swish. This feeling never dipped in over 2 weeks.  The night life is very good with nightly live music 8-10 then a DJ or twice weekly the Sunset üåá band who are awesome. A 5 piece group who could play the O2 arena. Such cool entertainers. 20 or 50 people they would make it a party. Wow!  A once small tip 20Dh ensured nightly table service.    The separate sports bar is a nice touch to watch a live game on Bein sports. Lots of board games f√ºssball table & pool table. Mustafa the barman is nice and will find the football game if you ask him.    Coming from a customer - care background I was very impressed with the Fantastic staff from reception bar staff cafe staff to the cleaners/gardener's .  The 3 diligent managers who are always wandering round should be proud of themselves.    Outstanding staff members of our trip was Sara from the Lobby bar who has a lovely friendly can-do manner.  Also Omar and Esmee from the French style outside cafe who were excellent.  Amy & Abdullah of the animation team we're Great and taught us Arabic. Which proved really helpful in the Medina's.    We found the food superb French Moroccan Italian.  Dining in the conservatory at night is a must do experience.    The Separate Moroccan restaurant was nice with morrocan live music. Though you pay for drinks here bottle of wine around ¬£25    One swimming pool was heated which was fine.  The quiet pool was not heated though the surrounding fauna is beautiful. It's so peaceful with the sound of birds.  The loungers were plentiful & we really liked the free cabanas.    We found the bedrooms super swish beds so big you need a Walkie talkie. Ask for first floor room to avoid noise from upstairs. )    Our only gripe was the deafening music on the bus to and fro the Medina. Sometimes putting my hands over my ears as the driver scrolled blaring radio station after radio station.    All in all a great experience. From 2 worldly travellers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Chris S wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Location - around 25/30 mins from the airport in middle of nowhere which is good if you want to cocoon yourself into your holiday.  Hotel offers a superb free shuttle down to town pick up and drop off easy.    The hotel - the hotel is kept clean and pristine constantly someones always mopping sweeping or buffing something.  Two pools - one heated and one fresh water (fresh water has swim up bar) and they have nice selection of chairs and beds to use around the pool (beds are popular so add in English people and their towels you‚Äôll struggle to get one)    Food - we have all done the AI holiday and feeding time is usually like school dinners.  This place you felt as though you were in a restaurant and the service is attentive and personal.  The food itself was varied and at an incredibly high level probably the best AI food I‚Äôve ever had.    Staff - this is where it matters. Staff are incredible. They are professional but also let their personality show at times they seem to enjoy their work and that makes it easier for the guest (me) to relax.    Overall - I looked at it as a Butlins on cocaine when I arrived. My perception was wrong. The hotel is indeed 5 stars the service is up there with British 5 stars.  The entertainment was fantastic and varied.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

The sports bar is fun there's a pool table a football table and lots of little games to play like dominoes checkers scrabble. The lobby bar is great at night there was plenty of entertainment with a different theme every night.
