Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Danny Hall wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay... Staff our exceptional and rooms cleaned everyday with new bedding and towels etc. Walid and Mustafa at the swim ip pool bar were brilliant and made us feel so welcome.    Food was very good with large selection. You also have the option to have bespoke pasta dishes made to you specification likewise with omelettes in the morning. Every evening there is a bespoke special. .. So keep your eyes peeled for that also.    X2 pool options one is more communal close to the snack bar serving drinks and food. .. Burgers etc... This pool area has contemary music playing all day. With some activities games etc.    The other pool is very quiet and we gravitated to this most days for even more peace and chill time using the swim up pool bar. However this pool is not heated and cold but that's Jan for you. But you can use the poolside to get served by the brilliant Walid and Mustafa. üëç    Sports bar... The local on site for all big sports action playing all Premier league games.    Rooms & Swim up - great spacious rooms cleaned daily we had a massive bath and separate large shower room that we were really happy with. The TV channels were not very good for UK guests but we were not there to watch TV.    The swim up was OK... I would go for this if holidaying in summer but as it was Jan it was really cold so consider this if you are on a budget paying more ¬£ in Jan or Feb as you won't use it. That said the swim up gives you a South facing garden view whereas some other rooms on site don't. So food for though here when booking.    Loby bar- really enjoyed this bar... One of the guys was exceptional but his name alludes me... But all the team were great and entertainment is on every evening. Also if your choice of cocktail is not on the menu just ask... We ordered espresso martinis and they happily made these for us. üëç    This is a gated complex manned 24/7 and we felt extreamly safe.    Top tip... Use Viatour to book trips out with a guide... These fast track you into all key attractions avoiding the ques. üëç

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: jesssssb24 wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Fab couples retreat for a much needed break from reality!
Review_Text: We stayed here from 6th-13th January.  On arrival our bags were taken into the hotel for us we were offered a drink and biscuit which were lovely. A little bit of paperwork to fill in and we then got our room key. We were taken to our room which was one of the nicest rooms i have ever stayed in. plenty of room big shower bath option and an enormous bed. Not to mention how immaculately clean it was. Bedding appeared to be changed most days and cleaners were very efficient. Bottle of water refrigerated for our arrival.  In my opinion the food was good plenty to chose from if you take into account the size of the hotel. My partner is a very fussy eater and even he managed to fill and clear his plate!  The evening entertainment was a little hit and miss but that was expected at this time of year.  The pools were very clean plenty of sun-beds and quick service at the pool bar and snack bar. It was also very peaceful.  The staff here were amazing couldn‚Äôt do enough for you! always remembered our drinks keen to refill them too! sometimes i was triple parked!  Free transport into and back from marrakesh which is a brilliant bonus! we didn‚Äôt use this as we had a few other day trips booked through trip advisor - would recommend looking at these especially as they picked us up and dropped off directly at the hotel!    The only negative I have and this is nothing to do with the hotel really is that there were several large groups of extremely rowdy guests (better suited to an 18-30 holiday) shouting across the dining room intimidating other guests and being totally loud and obnoxious. We upped and moved to another table on the other side of the restaurant mid way through our meal on several occasions but this wasn‚Äôt enough to escape the noise. It would have been appreciated if staff had acknowledged this and at least asked them to quieten down. Like i said this is no reflection on the hotel i guess we were just unlucky.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Grant M wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived and started to check-in we were greeted warmly and offered traditional mint tea and pastries while filling out our locator forms ( very nice biscuits not so keen on the mint tea personally .    Once checked in we were escorted to our double room with a pool view. Room was excellent. Plenty of storage safe in the wardrobe air con extremely comfortable bed and a small patio leading to a stream like pool with sun beds.    Large shower two sinks bath and obviously a w/c. Rooms cleaned everyday.    The food was excellent. So many choices at breakfast lunch and dinner it would be impossible to type it all. All the waiters and waitresses couldn‚Äôt be more helpful if they tried  constantly topping up your tea and coffee at breakfast then wine/beer at lunch and dinner.    The bar staff in the main bar are amazing with photographic memories. They knew what everyone was drinking and always made sure your glass was topped up or your favourite tipple was bought straight to your table. Plus point of this was no queue at the bar.    There‚Äôs also a sports bar by the top pool which is quieter with a pool table football table board games and live sport. Then there‚Äôs the snack bar by the heated pool and a swim up bar in the other pool which isn‚Äôt heated there‚Äôs also a Moroccan restaurant on site which is included in your stay a must try.    The grounds of the hotel are immaculate and we‚Äôre always being cleaned/tidied up.    The activity crew round the main pool were brilliant always encouraging participation in archery crazy darts mini golf table tennis aqua aerobics football and a few other activities throughout the day.    As evening entertainment goes it was excellent. Most nights you have a band provided and a DJ which created a fantastic atmospherewhich leads to lots of dancing if you like a boogie. We also had Latin dancers one night and they were very good.    The chaps out the front of the hotel would order taxis to wherever you wanted if you didn‚Äôt want to use the free shuttle bus. We only used the free bus twice to the medina market and couldn‚Äôt fault the service. You can book lots of different trips at the hotel as well. We didn‚Äôt do any trips as we only had five days to relax and unwind in the sunshine.    On a final note. Whoever has or is thinking about going to this fabulous hotel have a fantastic time me and my wife did and are seriously thinking about going again this year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

The activity crew round the main pool were brilliant encouraging participation in various things with humour and sincerity.  The beds were made twice a day( which was brilliant after a quick siesta)!!!!  A different band every night provided a fantastic atmosphereand there was a lot of dancing if you wanted to!!  The guys out front could order taxis to wherever you wanted if the free bus didn't go where you needed.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: SPPH wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: Read if you are checking in late! Maybe we just got unlucky!?!
Review_Text: Overall a pleasant relaxing hotel. Just be mindful - if you are checking in late don't expect a 'normal service' at check-in.    Cons:  1) I emailed the hotel a few days prior to arriving and informed them of our late check-in I did not receive a reply!!  2) There is NO food available after 10pm we were so hungry when we arrived and all that was offered was a sandwich from the sports bar - see photo! After asking the reception staff several times for help (they offered us some of their food from the restaurant which was kind but it did feel like a struggle) very much "computer says no" at first. We just feel that the hotel needs to be more accommodating/flexible with guests in these circumstances.  3) When we arrived after 10pm after our flight and travels we were not offered a drink we had to join a queue at check-in just didn't feel welcoming especially after being so tired after our flight etc. Maybe our experience would have been different if we checked in within 'normal hours' but for a hotel like this we would have expected more especially since I emailed the hotel too!  4) Staff didn't seem empowered or too knowledgable e.g we got booked in to the a-la-carte restaurant on a Tuesday eve but later we realised that the restaurant was closed on Tuesdays so it caused a bit of frustration in rebooking. The reception staff should have known that the restaurant was closed on a Tuesday and should have told us! They rearranged it last minute on the Monday night for us (luckily we hadn't had dinner yet!) but when we got to the restaurant they turned us away saying that we hadn't booked. The restaurant staff then walked with us to reception realised that they had changed our booking and finally allowed us back into the restaurant... so not the best service experience.  5) Not enough staff at breakfast and meal times as we were waiting for our drinks orders to be taken or served our drinks took ages! Staff looked rushed off their feet.    Pro's:  1) Nice relaxing hotel and vibe  2) Gym and Spa are lovely! - the Hammam was gorgeous!  3) Food is decent - although the hotel could cater for the non-alcoholic drinkers a bit more in the restaurants. Would have been nice to have a 'cafe' area for those who wanted a chilled environment and coffee's instead of alcohol.  4) Rooms are cosy and a very good size  5) Free shuttle service into Marrakech Medina - this was our highlight!    Maybe we just got unlucky! but not sure I would rebook here especially for the ¬£¬£ paid vs service received.

Review_Date: rebecca s wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: We've had a lovely week at the be live collection adult only hotel it's very peaceful and everything goes at a slow pace. The food is very nice but quite repetitive. We went in December and the weather was lovely. The staff are all lovely and the activities team do a good job getting people involved in the little activities done through out the day. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: ian_waring wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Above Expectations was unsure about this holiday due religion However there were no concerns if you paid respect and observed their faith then we found it was more relaxed. The Hotel like all hotels they are located in let's say baron areas but inside are great.  The hotel is clean and well presented and the staff can't do enough for you    The sauna area is well run and has what you would expect and the price is about eight go for one of the deals then you have access to the indoor pool area all the time.    The outside area has 2 pools a quiet one and the activities Pool for Animations team use for water aerobics but just usable for all and the team are not pushy with any of the activities they put on    The Bars there are 4 bars that were open at different times to suit the day  All were well run and the Snack bar served food after 10am to 6pm    The Sports Bar was open from 5pm for drinks and pool table football and board games plus TV for Football coverage    The lobby bar has an area for acts and an indoor sitting area and a out outside area with heaters for the cold nights Must mention 2 of the staff here were excellent throughout our week was Sara and Azdine    The pool bar was well stocked so you could just swim up for a drink.    The Room was spacious and in good order with a safe and was cleaned every day.    The weather while we were there over the Xmas week was 23 to 25 degrees clear sky's    The restaurant was a very good size and staff were friendly and ready to assist with water or alcohol and the food was excellent throughout our stay whether it was breakfast lunch or dinner    Marrakesh Town is like Marmite so all I would say is they like to barter but if you try and be greedy they can get over excited so my tip if it's what you would pay in your market and you get a better price here then go ahead its how they make their living.    There are lots on offer outside your hotel like visits to different activities such as quad's camel rides safari jeeps Golf lots of courses all at different prices you can book with hotel or through you rep if you have one or just use the internet and search and seek out the best prices your self.    Some photos attached and would I go back oh Yes
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

If you have any issues for whatever reason or need anything reception staff were available 24/7. They were really helpful.    The hotel have a cash machine if you need to take out extra money when you are there on holiday they also have a currency exchange option there if you need exchange your money.    We also booked our excursion with the hotel staff whose name was Mehdi and we went to Atlas Mountain organised by him which was planned properly and we had a fabulous time.    My highlight was the spa at the hotel (you have to lay for the services) however it was totally worth it!    I definitely recommend this fantastic place it was such a lovely time for us.    Thank you so much to all the hotel staff for all their hardwork.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Elaine F wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: I went here with my partner at the end of November for one week. We went with easyJet holidays and everything ran smoothly. Transfer from airport to hotel was only 20 minutes. Check in was quick. You do have to leave a deposit and pay hotel tax for the government but this is fairly inexpensive and they accept debit or credit card if like me you have no Dirhams. The porter showed us to our room and took our bags. The room was lovely with large bathroom with large walk in shower and bath tub with another shower over. Bed was huge. It was ultra clean. I tipped the porter a couple of English Pounds. They take pounds cos they can change them but nothing less. As it was dark when we arrived it was about 9pm we couldn't see much. We ate at the buffet restaurant which is open until 10pm. The food there is really good especially the Moroccan section. And the service by all the waiting on staff impeccable. The Hotel during the day is spotlessly clean. The livelier pool is heated to a perfect temperature and the animation team are doing a great job. On check in you are given towel vouchers and so you get a huge towel from the animation desk. The hotel offers a regular shuttle bus to Marrakech with several pick up and drop off times. Reception are really friendly and very informative about best ways to get to tourist spots. The hotel management is very hands on. You often found the manager helping out in areas when it was busy. The staff at the snack bar are great. Even knocking up special cocktails not on the menu. Food at snack bar is excellent too and they are happy to do things that aren't on the menu. The chef there is hilarious - chat with him if you get a chance. I took part in several things around the pool - piquant archery aqua aerobics beer pong table tennis poker mini golf. All great fun and fab atmosphere. Lobby bar gets busy at night. But the staff work very hard in there. And the sports bar was great. They have board games and a pool table and table football. As World Cup was on then it got busy in there and atmosphere when Morocco played was unbelievable. The barman despite being busy noticed when anyone's drinks were finished and straightaway you had a fresh drink. He even knew after a couple of days what I drank and as soon as I sat down brought it over! Such service üòä. You must book the a la carte restaurant. Absolute fine dining Moroccan style. You can choose from 3 menus which you order before hand. My partner and I ordered different menus but it was all divine. Especially recommend the small Chicken with saffron. Gorgeous. Our waiter was Mourad and he was absolutely spot on with his table service. He explained the dishes and how they were made. There is a lute player on the stage to set the atmosphere which made it very romantic. Our wine glasses were constantly topped up. Great night. I was going to do a massage at the spa but didn't have enough time. I did go into see the spa it looked amazing and treatment was reasonably priced. And guests I spoke to who had used it only had positive things to say. Housekeeping in the hotel is meticulous. And our housekeeper surprised us everyday by making beautiful patterns using the runner and even fanning out my nightdress. Would I go back? Definitely. The atmosphere in the hotel is just good vibes. I never heard anyone complaining.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel and staff are fabulous. We are staying for 3 weeks and allocated a room overlooking a car park which isn‚Äôt ideal for a long stay. We paid extra to ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù. We were then asked to pay local taxes for the hotel even though our booking said already included. What a shame
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Tarazilla wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: If you‚Äôre a seasoned luxury traveller looking for a 5* holiday don‚Äôt stay here. It is not a real luxury hotel depending on what you‚Äôre used to.    This is a 3* hotel with 4* aesthetics overall 3.5* at best. Customer service can be completely non-existent at times and directly rude and aggressive at others (special shout out to the sports bar manager who was particularly awful). Food is hit or miss in terms of quality and variety.    As an all inclusive there is ZERO food between 12-1pm and after 10pm. Yes that‚Äôs right: you cannot find ANYTHING to eat after 10pm. If you complain Reception will tell you to waste your time looking for online delivery options and then laugh at you when you say you can‚Äôt find anything after 20 mins of searching because no one delivers to the hotel. It‚Äôs in the middle of nowhere. We found others stalking the halls in distress looking for food later in the evenings. I‚Äôve never seen anything like it: especially at an all inclusive! No crisps no nuts nothing. Drinks are watered down heavily as other reviewers have commented.    Saleh in reception could do with some customer service training and probably shouldn‚Äôt be client-facing. We were upgraded as we were treated so poorly on arrival.    The hotel is very clean and the rooms are nice. Note the pool view rooms don‚Äôt come with views if you sit on the terrace as the terrace wall is too high. Garden view rooms are actually car park views with a hedge blocking the cars. It‚Äôs worth staying upstairs for privacy. The bed mattresses were very comfortable but the pillows and duvets were cheap. Bring toiletries: the hotel shampoo and shower gel are poor quality and conditioner isn‚Äôt offered.    The spa is very good (but needs repair) and the hot stone massage was excellent. You‚Äôll be offered a ‚Äúspecial discounted price‚Äù which is in fact just the correct price as hotel guests get 10% discount on spa prices! They should leave bottles of water out.    Special shout out to the team around the heated pool though. Those guys were so friendly and nice. They were the only staff in the hotel who seemed to like having guests around!    If you‚Äôre looking for an actual 5* all inclusive holiday Egypt has actual 5* options by the sea for the same price or less. If you understand this is a 3.5* hotel and adjust your expectations accordingly you‚Äôll be fine and enjoy it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Paul C wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: Don't believe the negative reviews !! Great hotel and lovely staff
Review_Text: Spent 5 nights here early Deecember. Booked a swim-up room and was allocated 3004 at the far end which was lovely and quiet and got plenty of sun during the day. very spacious with a comfy bed and large bathroom. Room was also spotless and cleaned daily.  Food - excellent - plenty of choice. if you are expecting chips and chicken nuggets then this isn't the place for you. Wide choice of pasta freshly cooked pizza salads meats fish vegetables and a fantastic selection of Moroccan dishes.  Wine - red white and rose was very drinkable. My wife is vegetarian and she had plenty to choose from and never went hungry !!  Shout out for Leila for fantastic service in the restaurant - always quick to bring us our wine !!  Two pools - one heated with things going on during the day. The other was quieter - this is where we tended to stay most days. Both had plenty of sun beds and bali beds available when we were there.  Spa - no hard sell from the staff but very friendly and knowledgeable about the treatments available. We had 4 between us and had no complaints.  Reception - all staff were friendly and very helpful at all times.    Excursions - we booked our own prior to arriving via Trip Advisor - no issues.  Didn't use the free shuttle bus but appeared to be well used and those that did use it told us it was great.    Overall an excellent 5 night break and we would return    Thanks very much - merci !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: This hotel is classed as 5*. All inclusive. It is a bit tired in decorating and needs updating. The food is varied and caters to everyone‚Äôs taste. It‚Äôs excellent. We had a lovely lady called Fatima who cleaned our room. Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Odyssey47630774364 wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Stayed here for 10 nights as a group of 6 adults just returned home from this amazing place.    Hotel is beautiful spotlessly clean - cleaners clean constantly. From the minute we got off the bus to getting back on to return to return to the airport home we were made to feel so welcome by all the staff at the hotel.    Food - gorgeous and lots of choices we enjoyed all our meals in the main restaurant and the snack bar. The waiting staff in the main restaurant and the snack bar are all really friendly and hard working.    Drinks - the drinks are great cocktails are lovely spirits are fine - not like the local spirits in some places we have stayed and the lads enjoyed the local Stork lager.    Mustafa (sorry if spelt wrong) - is so friendly and kept us in lovely drinks and special cocktails each night while we were in the sports bar.    Bar waiter in the main bar ( sorry cant remember his name) - was so fun and kept our drinks flowing while we watched the nightly entertainment    Entertainment staff around the pool are amazing - made our holiday. Dont know all of their names ( or how to spell them correctly) - Tetif ( sorry if spelt wrong) Sam and Emma never stop and are so friendly and fun to spend the time around the pool with - they really did make our holiday.    We will definately be back    Thank you to everyone who made our holiday so enjoyable

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: William P wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Good value holiday in the sun
Review_Text: This is an all inclusive resort with two swimming pools and lots of activities. It is excellent for a golf tour with at least 10 courses within a 40 minute car ride. The rooms and bathrooms are large and the staff are very friendly.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Stuart P wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Fantastic stay, lovely resort and excellent food and service.
Review_Text: Have stayed in many All inclusive resorts and invariably end up being underwhelmed however I can say that our 7 days at the Be Live Collection were excellent. We had a Swim up Room that was big roomy and of a high standard bath and shower and big bed. The pool area is really nice and the Pool bar serves whatever you desire all day long. The food in the buffet was varied and really good pasta bar fish meats and different Tagine's every day alongside an abundance of salads rice couscous etc etc.. Regular shuttle bus from the hotel to the City and the Madina and plenty of choice of trips straight from the Hotel. I Wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel..

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: sal32mollie wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: We visited here for 4 nights with friends through easyJet .  Rooms were large and very clean and maid service was daily . The food was good and always something for everyone .  All the staff were so friendly and always greeted with a smile . The waiter in the bay was fab and worked so hard . Entertainment team were also great and not pushy .  We booked the hot air balloon ride at the desk in the hotel . This was very well organised and was a great experience .  We used the shuttle bus into Marrakesh and couldn‚Äôt fault this either . Would definitely return üòä
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Linzi_Ram83 wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: The hotel is immaculately clean staff are extremely hard working and extremely friendly. The all inclusive drinks are lovely especially the expresso martinis. The staff will make any cocktail or something similar if you ask. The food in the buffet restaurant is great quality and they cater for all nationalities. The Moroccan section is a must if you are adventurous with food. Overall we'd give this hotel and staff 11 out of 10 and we will definitely be coming back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nomad13382233506 wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Fantastic guy.... Azdine. So friendly service with a smile. Excellent. Ashraf is also as friendly great bunch of guys. Name a few Hamza and Ahmed fareed. Makes fantastic cocktail. Recommend this hotel and bar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Josh P wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Staff were friendly and drinks were free flowing.  We had a swim up room and would highly recommend. Staff to shout out - Azdine.  Areas for development - there is SO MUCH plastic waste at the hotel its really really sad to see. Please can you look into reducing this. from plastic cups straws single use condiment sachets. All the toiletries etc. In addition the instant coffee is vile! but that might just be my taste preference.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jake wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Came here with my wife at the end of October and this was the best break we've had. The hotel is extremely clean with extremely helpful and friendly staff from cleaners entertainment team to management. They all go out lf their way to make you feel welcome and relaxed.    The food selection is good for an all inclusive and the alcohol selection is superb.    At the night entertainment if you were seen looking for a table as it was always full a member of staff will instantly bring you table and chairs.    We had the swim up lane room and it did not disappoint. We wanted a night away from the entertainment so we sat in the swim up pool watching the stars above listening to the extremely calm and relaxing soft music which is played until about 10pm and then the main entertainment will start.    A holiday made so special thanks to the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Daniel C wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Starting from the hotel which was really nice and clean the diversity of food and beverages which can please everyone.  I had a great time playing all kind of games by the pool and made friends thanks to the entertainment team they did a great job!  The staff was always pleasant and helpful but I have to mention my friend Azzdine who was there for us every night working hard to keep everyone happy but with a big smile and a great attitude surprising us with special cocktails. Definitely he made our holiday even more enjoyable. Danny
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Alina C wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: One of the best holiday I‚Äôve ever had was here and that‚Äôs thanks to everyone who works here their work was really appreciated by us.  Everything was perfect it‚Äôs a very clean location especially the room great choice of food everyday very tasty entertaining team was lovely ‚ù§Ô∏è they are doing a great job and a big thank you to someone who‚Äôs very special to us and made our nights even more enjoyable always looking after us with a great smile and a positive attitude: AZZDINE ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è he is a great asset to your business!  Would come back anytime! Alina
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Janice012 wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: NIce Hotel but deposit not refunded
Review_Text: This is a great hotel with helpful staff excellent food good entertainment and many amenities. The gym is well appointed and the free shuttle bus to Marrakesh is very useful.  However when I arrived on 1 October I was charged 800.80 MAD (approximately ¬£86.80) as a deposit and was assured that this would be refunded when I checked out on 15 October. I presented my card on checkout and was told that my deposit had been refunded. When I got my statement from my bank a few days later I noted that I had not received a refund.  I contacted the hotel through my travel agent Broadway Travel and sent documentary evidence to show that no refund had been received. They contacted the hotel on my behalf and the hotel said that the refund had been made and to check my bank. My bank confirmed that no refund had been received. Broadway Travel contacted the hotel again but to date I have not received a reply nor a refund.  It is now 4 weeks since I returned from this hotel and I am still waiting for my deposit to be refunded. If I had received a refund and a proper response from the hotel I would have awarded 5 stars but this incident has marred an excellent holiday.  Looking at previous reviews this is the not first time this has happened.  Derek Keen  Date of stay 1 October - 15 October 2022

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nichola W wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: This hotel is a hidden gem
Review_Text: This hotel is great for an all inclusive resort the food is really good. The drinks are forever flowing. The staff are so welcoming from the moment you arrive. The entire place is very clean. Public area toilets are exceptionally clean too.  Totally recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: d l wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: I wasn‚Äôt going to make this review.    The First night I was violently sick to the point I started over heating shaking and sweating. I was on the toilet having diarrhoea till I randomly projectile vomited which landed on my PJs and was sick on the toilet. over a few hours coming back n forth from my bed to the toilet having my body push every last thing out my body. This happened on 3 rounds from around 1am-4am. On the 2nd round it was the worst as that‚Äôs when the over heating kicked in and I didn‚Äôt know what was going on with me or where I was so I kind of blanked out and panicked until I understood my surroundings. I didn‚Äôt wake my partner up because I didn‚Äôt want her to panic. I stayed in my room until around 2-3pm the next day. My partner was worried but I told her to carry on with her day and that I‚Äôll be fine. Later that day around 6pm I told the reception desk about my food poisoning and asked if I could get my PJs washed and they tried to charge me to wash them I didn‚Äôt want to pay so I now have a pair of sick designed Pjs.    The 2nd night I tried to avoid most things for dinner and only ate a piece of bread n a bit of pizza. My partner was fine with what she ate but was also cautious from me being violently sick.    I am here for 3 nights. Today the 3rd night wasn‚Äôt so bad I could Bear it But I SHOULDN‚ÄôT have eaten the MEAT! I was stuck to the toilet at 2am n 8:30am for over 30 minutes as I had severe diarrhoea (was on the phone watching tiktok while letting it all out) and straight after me my partner was sick in the toilet from food poisoning (9am). Around 11am at the toilet she told me to call the reception desk and ask for more toilet roll and to offer to pay for a late checkout or even an extra night here as she feels too sick to fly back home today 10/11/2022. The stuff said we can‚Äôt do a late check out as they‚Äôre fully booked and can‚Äôt so an extra night which I understand but telling me ‚Äúyou can continue to use our facilities‚Äú like it‚Äôs something extra you‚Äôre giving us?    Don‚Äôt get me WRONG! The Hotel is LOVELY and the staff are nice to you until you TELL THEM ABOUT FOOOD POISONING. if you‚Äôre lucky to not get food poisoning you‚Äôll have a LOVELY TIME!    From an alleged 5* hotel you would think they would be more attentive to our needs and if a customer is sick but NO. WE‚ÄôVE FELT PUSHED TO THE SIDE.    BACKSTORY  I‚Äôve spent over ¬£1k for a quick random 3 night stay because we‚Äôve recently found out we‚Äôve miscarried our first child (25/10/2022 - 01/11/2022). Work gave us 2 weeks off and I couldn‚Äôt watch her looking lost and empty inside as it really made me feel useless so I booked us a quick holiday to try and ease the pain a bit better. This is why when I was first sick from food poisoning on Monday (07/11/2022) I didn‚Äôt want to wake her up and worry her about me being sick. This experience hasn‚Äôt been good. I don‚Äôt know this holiday worked but it definitely took her mind off the miscarriage just a really odd way of doing it.    REASONS WHY I WROTE THIS REVIEW:  At first I wasn‚Äôt going to write this until the response or lack of response we received and none care given.  1. First night I was sick and told staff at reception about my food poisoning and needing my PJs washed. Staff was shocked and then tried to charge me to have my PJs watched.  2. 9:20am 10/11/2022 i approached the reception desk and brought them to the side and stated that my partner has food poisoning and that if they have anything to help her out. The reception told me to go to the gift shop and ask them as they didn‚Äôt have anything to help us with.  3. I called on the day of checkout (11:25 10/11/2022) to either pay a late checkout fee or an extra night due to my partner being severely sick from food poisoning. Staff was none understanding - and requested that we leave the room at 12 because they‚Äôre fully booked and didn‚Äôt offer to help.  4. 12:18 pm 10/11/2022 my partner is still toilet bound and reception calls our room asking us to leave. I explain that we can‚Äôt leave because my partner is toilet bound and she could vomit or diarrhoea at any moment - they‚Äôve transferred our call and we explain to someone else. 12:30 we had a nurse attend our room to give us medicine to help with the sickness. I‚Äôm just upset with how this was dealt with and treated.    This is why I have given it a 2 star rating - even though the food poisoning ruined my whole time. The hotel looked lovely and clean (in places that were public/visible) and they carried out maintenance work and the staff was lovely if you were well. Rooms were good and spacious. If I hadn‚Äôt had the food issue I would given it a high 4 and been satisfied.    The first night was the worst sickness I‚Äôve ever experienced having food poisoning. MINUS THE FOOD - ITS A LOVLY PLACE AND THE STAFF ARE WONDERFUL if you don‚Äôt get sick.    Pictures show sickness nurse and evidence.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Loved it! Friendly staff.. Great food. What more could you want?!
Review_Text: Arrived just before 3pm and offered food.. we declined and went to our room. Staff so friendly from the outset. Room huge and everything you could want. Yes you can see the bathroom from the bedroom but the toilet is separate (phew!!)    Food..  Amazing!! So much choice.. buffet you get lamb turkey lots of fish with cous cous rice salads potatoes and the best AI desserts we've had! If you just want chips you can get these at the snack bar but the other food was literally the best I've had since a sandals holiday which says a lot bearing in mind the price difference! Hussan in the restaurant was so so good! He preempted our needs so fast efficient and we noticed when he wasn't around. Breakfast was good. Service there was really hit and miss.. one girl ignored my requests for coffee and served elsewhere but when my husband asked for his second time! But i wasn't fussed re coffee or tea so decided best not to ask at breakfast. That said she was the only member of the staff that wasn't 100% on the ball. Azdine on the lobby bar must run through trainers like nobody's business. He does not stop. Friendly and fab!!! That man deserves a medal    Entertainment team.. FABULOUS! We did aqua aerobics and crazy darts and a ping pong game.. they're all so good  The staff make this hotel. Cannot fault the work ethics!    Pools and pool bar lovely.    Fab holiday fab hotel

Consider paying for a guide to take you into the Marrakesh rather than the group trip. It‚Äôs not much and you‚Äôll get a lot more from it. Overall fantastic value. Have a great holiday

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: I am one who usually makes the best of things!!  All I can say is something happened here and they  have forgotten about service. The room is clean the main pool is clean. Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sazbee1974 wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Can‚Äôt rate this hotel high enough love it
Review_Text: This was my second stay at this hotel i previously visited with my daughter on 2019 and this time I went with 3 friends and It didn‚Äôt disappoint the second time.    I absolutely love this hotel. The staff are all so friendly  there‚Äôs plenty going on in the day if you want to get involved but you are certainly not harassed by the entertainment team. We made use of the spa this time and booked a 2 day treatment and it was amazing and such good value.    The evening entertainment is good some nights quite chilled other there‚Äôs a dj and dancing for those who fancy it.    The food is lovely you can tell the chef and his team really care about what they serve up and there are always plenty of seats in the restaurant the pool bar serves lovely snacks to order too.    We spent most out time round the square pool  As they play music which we preferred. There are loads of beds and certainly no rush to get up and reserve them: the other pool is just as nice with its pool bar but we just preferred the other.    Rooms are lovely roomy and great air con and the WiFi is brill never struggled with signal once.    I went out to the souks markets on my first visits so gave it a miss this time. If you venture there the hotel run a free bus but beware of the men waiting as you get off claiming to be guides from the hotel they are not and will demand money for helping you. We also went to the YSL museum and gardens both were good if not a little pricy but if you are into instagramable photos this is the place for you

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: TashaHibbert wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: A (long) honest but fair review of Be Live Collection from a Northern couple in their late-20s.
Review_Text: I feel a little conflicted writing this one as we can both say we throughly enjoyed our holiday but just not for 10 whole nights. The resort is beautiful in so many ways but also does have some little flaws. If I could headline this review it would be to book for 5-7 nights and no more.    The swim up rooms are beautiful I can‚Äôt fault these and the plus side we made some great friends around our room. I would really recommend paying the extra for this.    The thing that really makes this resort great is the staff and they really do go that extra mile for you. We would really like to thank Azdine as he does a fantastic job your drinks are on the table before you‚Äôve finished your first ordered remembered every time. Please tip this man as he deserves a medal purely for the amount of steps he must do in one evening. Be Live management please pass on our thank yous to Azdine.    The grounds and resort are very well maintained by hard working grounds staff/maintenance/cleaners who clearly take a lot of pride in their work.    The biggest (and only) gripe for us was the food we did really struggle with finding an efficient meal very fish heavy and similar offerings each day. You can book into the A la carte restaurant - something we didn‚Äôt try as the menu wasn‚Äôt to our taste. Also do plan to eat else where perhaps out of the resort on a Tuesday & Sunday as this is when the A La carte restaurant is shut which I believe takes the stress of the main buffet. We couldn‚Äôt get seated in the main restaurant on these days from 7-9:45pm and there really wasn‚Äôt any food left when we did even the pizza and pasta. The restaurant does need more staff to deal with the amount of guests the staff are working tirelessly to serve collect drink orders and clear down tables ready for the following guests. Unfortunately just not enough of them to do so. We resorted to cleaning and setting our own tables on occasion.    The snack bar you think would be a nice break away from the restaurant with a more simple offering off food. Sadly a chicken ceaser salad consisted off 2 chicken nuggets on lettuce and a chicken burger again 2 chicken nuggets in some sweet bread - add this to very very slow service is frustrating but can‚Äôt be blamed on the staff just the lack of. Honestly friendly staff just over run with that being the only bar that side of the resort.    You‚Äôre a little out of the way in this resort something we did enjoy being out of the hustle and bustle. Which makes the shuttle bus very handy. The times are a little irrational but clearly advertised so we did have to book a taxi on a couple of occasions. Booking through the hotel was very easy and efficient but returning home relying on Marrakesh taxis not so much so please do bare this in mind and try to plan your day around the shuttle bus times.    The pool side day time entertainment team on these reviews seem to be quite positive something I would personally disagree with. They are very clearly drawn to a certain kind of person unfortunately I‚Äôm not blessed with long legs and a toned stomach which meant I wasn‚Äôt really asked to get involved. On one occasion I did sign myself up-to beer pong I physically had a drink taken off me and passed to a more attractive lady. Overall I‚Äôm not too fussed about this experience with the entertainment team as it‚Äôs not what I was there for but something to be mindful off and verging on slightly offensive at times. It would be nice if the team could be inclusive of all people of all shapes and sizes. On the contrary the evening entertainment staff are very inclusive and can‚Äôt be faulted we had some great evenings with this team.    The evening entertainment we throughly enjoyed the first week a nice mix of everything. The live band was fantastic DJ night a great lively evening and you can‚Äôt beat karaoke night. But by week 2 you‚Äôre furiously resisting the whole playlist for the evening. The set list needs mixing up at the risk of hearing Sweet Caroline one more time. I think this needs to be on a 2-weekly cycle rather than what seems a 5-day cycle.    The only frustration with the evening entertainment would be that for an adults only hotel the bar shutting and (literally) lights off for 12pm is too early they do such a great job at getting everyone up and active to have a great time and then by 12pm you‚Äôre expected to be in bed and lights off and not a peep of noise made. Every evening the team are fighting with huge groups of people chanting ‚Äúone more song‚Äù - take the hint here Be Live and extend those hours slightly. 10pm - 12pm for evening entertainment just doesn‚Äôt cut it. Possibly extend even just 1/2 days out of the week to please all guests?    The last thing that needs mentioning and the most frustrating one of all the flies are absolutely relentless around this resort and there seems to be no measures in place to manage this. I understand the country we was in but a few measures wouldn‚Äôt go a miss.    Over-all I would really recommend this resort which we have done to friends and family only in our opinion for no longer than a week (and if your taste buds are a little more mature/adventurous than what ours seems to be). We did throughly enjoy our holiday up-to night 6/7 to stay longer you would really need to fill your days with excursions.    I would certainly stay at a Be Live resort again possibly somewhere a little more European purely for the food reasons. The staff do go above and beyond for you a little difficult with reception not understanding much English but you can muddle your way through fine.    A very beautiful and accommodating resort if you‚Äôre not their for the food or day-time entertainment and for a relaxing short break away.    Thanks for a great stay Be Live and you have some amazing staff working for you who really do need some recognition just a few things that need a little work but nothing that ruined the holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Leanne2394 wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We returned from Marrakesh yesterday morning it was a lovely stay and 7 days were just enough. Firstly a big shoutout to Emma Titif and Oussama they were so friendly and they were a breath of fresh air when we saw them every day. All the staff were helpful. We didn‚Äôt go to the Moroccan restaurant on-site we felt like there was enough variety in the buffet. However the buffet was good but there were sometimes names of dishes missing. Although the staff could not do enough for you there just wasn‚Äôt enough of them the pool bar for instance had one very hard working individual working there every day and sometimes you could wait for a long period of time if it was busy to get a drink. There was a fantastic drinks runner in the lounge bar he was definitely the hardest working individual at that hotel. All week he provided us with fabulous service (sorry I didn‚Äôt remember his name) I also felt like he could have done with someone helping him collect glasses and run the drinks. Breakfast in the buffet was the worst service out of the three meal times. I had no tea or coffee offered for half of the mornings I were there. I asked one morning and I didn‚Äôt get any teabags that service did not seem to be as structured as the others. The entertainment was good throughout the day and night although Thursday night DJ‚Äôn was not me. However other than the staffing the holiday was good. Just a piece of advice the people at the hotel who sell you the excursions I would recommend going elsewhere there was very little information provided and I actually paid for an excursion and didn't know everything that I had paid for because we were not told. I would definitely return to see the lovely faces of those we spoken to in the hotel. There is so much more I could say but I recommend a visit I‚Äôve left thinking about the hard working staff and how they would make you smile each day not that I had to wait a some time to order a drink. It‚Äôs luxury the rooms are gorgeous we was luckily in the Sahara block so we would hear no noise from the entertainment if we went to bed early. The spa and the staff in the spa were a fabulous 10/10. The treatments are fairly priced and they were very accommodating. It says that the pool was heated but it was not when I went in.

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: angelikaSolihull wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: I had to really think about this review as not everything was perfect but overall we were happy.  We didn‚Äôt get off to a good start as our flight was delayed and when we finally got to the hotel after a long journey there weren‚Äôt any refreshments at all on offer and another long wait as there was only one member of staff on duty for the check in. There were only six couples we were last in line and had to wait nearly an hour. The best they could offer was a taxi into town to get some food at our own cost.Then no help was offered to find the room or with our luggage. We also had to put a credit card as a deposit for towels and possible damage which Tui had not informed us about.  Our room was good spacious very comfortable large twin beds a modern bathroom with a bath and a good shower. The maid service was great she cleaned the room to a high standard.The view was awful though a building site and the sports bar. We were offered a swap  but as I had unpacked at that point and the hotel was quite outstretched it seemed to much trouble.  The pools were good all be it a little neglected. Some tiles were missing and the handrail was unstable. There are two pools a quiet pool with a swim up bar and a pool with music and activities. Plenty of sun beds  again some needed upgrading. Generally all round the hotel there was evidence of a lack of investment.  The buffet was good some labelling missing but the food was nice plenty of choices for every taste. Some hygiene questions mainly over the behaviour of some guests.  Service was ok the staff worked tirelessly but not enough of them. Sometimes there was a lengthy wait for tea and coffee.  The Moroccan specialty restaurant wasn‚Äôt great nice ambiance but the food was not so good.  The evening entertainment was good a band with quieter music till ten then another singer or DJ till midnight. The service here was hit and miss as there was only one waiter working and he worked incredibly hard. The drinks were definitely watered down and there was quite a wait at the bar.  The shuttle service is good and reliable.  The use of plastic was shocking!  All in all we had a good holiday the hotel is definitely not 5 star probably more a 3 star and we‚Äôve been to quite a few similar hotels for a similar price.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Oualid at the swim up pool bar is also amazing great banter and even when there‚Äôs a queue he‚Äôs always smiling again absolutely amazing guy and makes amazing drinks  And last but definitely not least my bro Azdine the machine who literally doesn‚Äôt stop makes you feel special in a busy evening bar and always brings over drinks (Marrakesh flowers which are mega ) to us when we‚Äôre running low and always with a smile.  You can‚Äôt imagine anything being too big of an ask from these 3 and they‚Äôre a credit to the hotel and have made our honeymoon so special!

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Orange1992 wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Rooms: we booked a suite and were impressed with the size of the room along with the facilities and comfort. Towels & sheets changed every other day (personally think this is good no need for changing everyday) room unfortunately not serviced every day I presume due to the hotel being busy so potentially the need more room staff wasn‚Äôt an issue for us as we‚Äôre clean and tidy. On days where the room was serviced it was lovely however often there was a knock at the door bringing something later on: pillow cases hand towels. No iron in the room. Need to call for one they must only keep a few across the hotel as we waited an hour and a half (and called more than once) for it to arrive we ironed all our clothes then so we didn‚Äôt need to ask for it again. Water not left in the room on our second day so we ensured we took plenty back with us from the pool / restaurant.  Pools: you have the choice of two pools; one has music and activities throughout the day the other has no music and has a swim up bar. Both pools have plenty of sun beds. Neither pool is heating they are like plunge pools but lovely when you‚Äôve been in the sun.  Gym: well fitted out nicely cool with towels & water available.  Sports bar: played any football games requested across one large screen and a smaller one too includes a pool table and games. Comfortable seating. No alcoholic beverages served before 5pm but can take drinks from the other bars in with you.  Pool bar: for drinks and snacks we didn‚Äôt utilise as we sat at the pool with the swim up bar.  Al a carte restaurant: the menu is set and limited to chicken beef or vegetarian both my husband and I were not impressed with the meal served (ordered beef & vegetarian) we were allowed a second visit during our stay but opted not to do so.  Buffet restaurant: the food overall is average the dishes are badly labelled or not labelled at all no markers for meat / veggie / diary / gluten etc. the chefs were helpful and helped identify what was / wasn‚Äôt vegetarian but it would definitely be better use of their time if the dishes were clearly labelled. Rather than waiting to be seated you seat yourselves (no issues with that) but the staff don‚Äôt seem to be able to keep up with the table turnaround we had our drinks order taken at 1 out of 8 breakfasts. This is nothing against the staff they definitely were not slacking they simply couldn‚Äôt keep up with the number of guests.  Drinks: spirits & cocktails are watered down massively wine beer & mocktails were lovely.  Evening entertainment: this was done really well it gets busy but the staff are happy to bring tables & chairs down from the pool bar table service was slow and orders missed / forgotten but again it was simply one member of staff running round taking orders collecting glasses and bringing drinks out! Music is loud and if you have you a pool facing room (back of hotel) and sleep lightly remember your earplugs or stay up and get involved until it‚Äôs over. There were two different singers on throughout our stay both of which had lovely voices.  Staff: overall good it does generally feel understaffed. The staff (when they have the time) are accommodating and provided a service with a smile on their face throughout our stay. I‚Äôm not sure what staff get for their names being mentioned in Trip Advisor reviews (did ask but staff just said it was good) but there are a group who are insistent you leave one and mention their name staff offering for you to hotspot from their phone just to post a review there and then this was a nuisance and is something they should be trained in differently or discouraged in doing.  Wi-Fi: dips in and out quite a lot but when it works was sufficient for phone not so good on laptop.    We did not use the spa so no comments to leave.    Single use of plastic is really shocking bar wine & beer every drink is served with a plastic straw. During the day all drinks are served in small plastic cups with no encouragement to refill the cup you‚Äôve just used.    Non hotel related comments:  Coming through customs was like a game of 21 questions glad they‚Äôre doing the job thoroughly.  There are an obscene amount of flies if you are coming bring a fly swat with you.  Please women dress for the culture of the country you are visiting not where you are from. In the hotel you‚Äôre fine but remember this when venturing out.  Plenty of activities and excursions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rob wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: The check in process was easy. The room was nice and clean very spacious with a nice area to sit outside and catch some morning sun. The ladies who clean the rooms do an excellent job.    The food is great. I had read some negative reviews so I was pleasantly surprised. The buffet offers a wide variety of foods each day. The food is well presented and the bread is freshly baked. If you miss the breakfast buffet then you can go to the snack bar and get an omelette or something else. There was nice coffee at the lobby bar.    We spent most of our time at the quiet pool as we were both reading books. It has a swim up bar and that was a nice way to cool down and grab a drink. The drinks are very small and don't contain much alcohol which is a little frustrating but understandable as people would definitely be very drunk if they were normal measures. That being said if you ask for a double they'll give you one. A small tip goes a long way.    The Moroccan restaurant was okay. It would be better if there was more choice than just the three set menus given. The atmosphere is lovely the staff very polite and attentive and the musician was terrific the food was good but just a little underwhelming we preferred the buffet.    The beds are incredibly comfortable and it was so lovely to be able to fall asleep so easily.    Overall it was a very enjoyable and relaxing stay. The staff are very friendly especially the room cleaning staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jess R wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Short solo 5 day break    I was traumatised arriving at the airport you exit the airport into what I can only describe as a boxing ring with about 300 men standing around with names on bits of paper just my luck i couldn't find my driver but I did approach a gentleman who kindly rang my taxi man    Short journey to the hotel which was brilliant very quick check in you won't be allowed into your room till 3 even if the rooms are ready so make sure you have swim wear at hand in your hand luggage but full use of facility's from arrival until your taxi picks up on departure    I had a swim up room these rooms don't get the sun till 12ish. Room was cleaned daily and they were spacious unfortunately i had to move on the second night because of the noise of the elephant above when reception called them they decided to ramp the noise up even more they clearly needed to get 50000 steps in until 2am im not sire rhwy even left there room i had head phones on and white noise and still heard it  Reception staff were brilliant and moved me  I had a couple of cocktails very watered down couldn't taste a thing the resturant is small there is a small variety of food which is to be expected as its a small hotel but the food was lovely and you'll always find something  Snacks at pool bar as well you won't go hungry  Bottles of water at all bars  You have 2 pools one with music and entertainment which everyone enjoyed or a quiet pool where you can lay in peace  Now the spa I paid for a pedicure ¬£40 absolutely awful  ¬£60 massage this wasn't a massage it was a rub very disappointing experience  This holiday is what you make it my experience won't be yours  I didn't rate this a 5 star because its not ve only rated 3 because I cant give 3.5 I didn't get the wow factor on arrival didn't get a welcome drink and biscuit on arrival there wasn't a laundry service like in 5 star hotels wasn't allowed late check out for 2 hours even though there were empty rooms I could of used i was also missed at breakfast a couple of times to be offered a coffee don't get me wrong every member of staff here always had a smile and they all work very hard but for the money I paid I could of gone to another 5 star with better facility's  You will have a nice time here I came here for peace and to relax and that's what I left with  You will have a lovely time and the weather is beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Beth9332 wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We visited as a group of 3. Mother daughter and good friend.  The hotel itself is only around 20 mins from the airport which makes it very appealing. We came out on a early morning flight and was on our sun loungers by 11am.  I would recommend keeping some swimwear in your hand luggage tho as you can‚Äôt have your room till 3pm but can use all other facilities.  Oussama and Titi were a credit to the hotel with there positive vibes. Friendly and encouraging with activities. Making sure everyone is invited to participate but not been pushy if you don‚Äôt want to.  There was more then enough sun loungers the week we were there probably a good 1/3 empty on even the busiest days. No rush to get a towel to reserve early either.  The reason I wouldn‚Äôt give this hotel 5* is because of the drinks. The selection is good however they are all served in small plastic cups once you get a few ice cubes in you only get half a dozen mouth fulls of drink- if your lucky. The amount of plastic each person must use on a holiday is crazy as they are all single use cups. I always found Tariq at the outside bar a helpful friendly man.  My only gripe I had with staff was the supervisor looking man that would over see the bars- outside and inside. While we were there there was a large group of golfers. He pandered to them and was handed tips in return. Serving them drinks before everyone else. On more then a few occasions there was large queues at the bar and he would go behind the bar with a large order. Take one of the staff to make the 10 drinks and then he would pocket the tip! You could tell the bar staff were embarrassed doing this.  Food was good. Always plenty of choice.  The rooms were spotless and all areas of the hotel were too to be fair.  Also a shout out to the two guest relations ladies one of which gave us a tour on our first day the others helped us to organise a  Taxi many thanks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Peter W wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Not 5 Star !! Don‚Äôt be fooled . Very disappointing.
Review_Text: One week break in October ! Chose this hotel because of rating and all inclusive nature .  Good points :  Staff on the whole pleasant  attentive and friendly .  Housekeeping to a high standard and cleanliness to a high standard .  Buffet offered wide choice and dining room well serviced by staff to accommodate needs    Not so good :    There is no concept whatsoever of a no smoking policy . Smoking in corridors to rooms and at pool side and in all outside sitting areas means that we were exposed constantly to smoking . The room we occupied smelled of smoke and the two adjoining swimming rooms were occupied by smokers and smokers sat around pool . Don‚Äôt visit if you are a non smoker . Would be better if the management designated some areas of hotel as non smoking and some areas of pool and pool bar etc    There is no food available for Late flight arrivals . We arrived at 23.30 and were not welcomed merely checked in and left to sort out ourselves . Out of hours welcome could be better and hospitable  no welcome drink etc    The hotel environment is tired and the fabric of the building is in need of updates in many places  veneers coming off furniture etc NOT 5 star    Whilst wide variety of food the restaurant was a times chaotic  restaurant opened without all food choices available. Neither the restaurant not bars enforced the dress code policy meaning evening dining with intoxicated loud guests    Wasn‚Äôt expecting to be relaxing in a hotel which had its gardens / landscape being revamped . The photos say it all  trying to relax for two days running ! Yesterday was Bulldozers  today constant squeaking wheelbarrows and soul was not what we expected and the hotel management were not helpful when this was raised with them    Tried to raise with Reception but didn‚Äôt seem bothered or interested .    Such a shame as this hotel and holiday promised a lot but failed to deliver !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Michelle B wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We are on our last day of a weeks holiday at Be Live and we have had a lovely week here.  Checkin was easy we got here early and couldn't go to our rooms till 3pm but we were given our all inclusive wrist bands and had some food drink and used the pool until we could get to our room.  The rooms are lovely and clean very spacious and the cleaners make sure this is done daily. We have had regular mini toilettries and tea and coffee (other than first day we have had to request milk if we wanted in our room)  The food here is fine you won't go hungry Breakfast is eggs sausage toast fruit cakes etc (not English breakfast but we are in Morocco) snack bar we have had burgers pizza paninis and chips and at night the restaurant serves meats potatoes vegetables etc.  The drinks were lovely for me depends on who you get as to whether there watered down much but I never had no problem and my husband was drinking San Miguel from bottles and always enjoyed it but also the local beer Stork he said was good too.  The hotel does a daily shuttle into town which is a must after reading reviews I was very nervous to go into Marrakesh but I loved it you got to see it when your here.  The one thing for me at this hotel that makes it is certain members of staff they are so happy and helpful all the time Oualid at the pool bar is a credit to this hotel he is such a happy guy and works long hours but from the moment he starts to finishing always has a smile on his face. Youness Omar and Tarik at the snack bar again are such nice members of staff. There are a lot of others as well that work extremely hard which makes this hotel such a nice place to be.  The only reason I have said 4 not 5 stars is small things like the phone not working in the room the milk not been replenished daily small parts of the hotel needing refurbishment but that said we have had a lovely week and would definitely re ommend coming here to see Morocco and the people :)

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Anesu K wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: An experience I will cherish forever and probably repeat once or twice over
Review_Text: I was skeptical when I read other reviews but I‚Äôm glad the hotel proved otherwise to reviews.    Staff were very attentive and hardworking. Never had to wait for a drink or food at the snack bar bar or restaurant. The staff were pretty much on point with clearing tables for the next diners. They were helpful and a cheerful bunch. Cleaners receptionist servers and the rest of them. What a wonderful bunch.    Food was a hit and miss but still above average. There was a snack bar buffet and ala carte. Unfortunately did not have the ala carte as it needed to be booked in advance and our stay was not long enough to allow us that. The snack bar had the fast foods type of food which were great and tasty. Loved the Moroccan food at the buffet. There was certainly something for everyone. Loved all the new foods I tried compared to foods I was used to such as pasta.    Was worried the drinks would be watered down but I did not experience this myself. There isn‚Äôt an extensive selection but there is enough drinks on the menu to rotate if you are like me and like variety. Enjoyed the cocktails- mainly the fun on the beach and sunrise‚Ä¶yum.    The hotel itself is gorgeous. The pics do not do it justice. It is beautiful. There are 2 different pools a quiet and another one which plays music and has activities which is the one we preferred.    I really could not fault anything from my trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jonboy8421 wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Lovely hotel with very few floors
Review_Text: 4 night trip 5th to 9th oct    Great stuff:  Few transfers to the markets at various times thru the day - free return.  Great wifi - we were in room 3115 near the very end of the hotel and worked great.  Staff are great and very helpful. If you have a problem then just ask someone as they will sort it. we had a problem with the shower drainage - rang reception and they came and fixed if straight away.  Pool staff are great always trying to get u involved in daily activities (aqua aerobics aqua zumba stretch water polo football poker (for fun) mini golf (with a sand wedge and tennis ball :-) and various other fun games).There is always music being played at this pool. You don't have to get involved and if u want then just go to the quiet pool where there is also a swim up bar.  nice food and fairly good service at the snack bar by the main pool.  good selection of food at the main buffet restaurant all meals.  Food at the a la carte restaurant is beautiful but you only get a limited choice (The beef is stunning - WOW).  Rooms well cleaned and the grounds all beautiful.  Evening entertainment was good on some nights.    Not so great:  Cocktails very syrupy (personal taste - wife wasn't keen but I was - I loved my 100 or so Pina Colada's consumed :-) )  3 of the 4 days it took a while to get coffee at breakfast time - we didn't get until we had finished breakfast. Hot drinks are sent to each table when u sat down but something obviously wrong with the current system as staff were struggling to keep up. On one occasion we asked for coffee 3 times till we finally got. Maybe make this self service.  Service at the pool bar was generally ok but recommend maybe leaving bottles of water in an ice bucket for people to help themselves. This would save loads of queing time for those just wanting water rather than having to wait for people getting served cocktails.  Drinks service was slow at the main bar at night. There was only 1 member of staff serving drinks to the terrace. He was amazing but needed help every night. found ourselves having to order 2 drinks each at a time to keep it flowing.    Would we return? -- 100%    Thank you for a lovely stay    xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
