Review_Title: Best first holiday out of lock down anyone could wish for!!!
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I have come on an all inclusive holiday to the Be live adults resort in Marrakech.    The whole time we have been here the Staff have been wonderful efficient and friendly! In particular we would love to mention the warmth of Tariq the f and b Manager who is a credit to the hotel.    Upon arrival we were early for check in so taken straight to the lovely pool bar for cocktails and lunch we knew immediately that we were going to be looked after.    The food quality in both the main buffet restaurant pool bar and alacarte restaurant has been of a particularly high standard as-well as a wide selection of wines cocktails and soft drinks to choose from throughout the day.    There are a number of activities to choose from if you want ranging from yoga to archery spin classes and Pilates. We enjoy sunbathing around the pool and enjoying a good book but it‚Äôs nice to try something new.    The rooms are all brand new with flat screen TVs drench showers and are really comfortable. We just opted for a standard room and loved it but you can opt to stay in a suite or in a room that has a swim up moat to your own private sun beds on your terrace.    There is entertainment every night we have seen belly dancers singers and salsa classes when we have been in but we have also enjoyed making use of the free shuttle that takes you into Marrakesh and picks you up again. This has allowed use to explore and enjoy the city in the mornings and at night.    Thank you to Be live Marrakesh and Tariq we have had an amazing holiday and will definitely be using the Be live collection again as we have seen you have them all over the world!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The whole experience was absolutely amazing great food and lots of water activities. The whole stuff very friendly and helpful. Hotel has got evening events which are brilliant. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: mcuk23 wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: We stayed for 10 days in May our first proper holiday for 2 years after covid. We had a really relaxing and enjoyable break and Overall this hotel is great but it needs some work to get to a 5-star level. Here's my breakdown.    Cleanliness - 5/5 - This is a very clean hotel there's always someone buzzing around sweeping clipping the hedges mopping the floors etc. The rooms were cleaned bedding changed and floors mopped daily. The main reception is very clean and has a lovely diffuser smell to it too. The food areas are always being cleaned by the staff.    Food - 4/5 - Plenty of choices good selection of hot and cold food egg station in the mornings pasta station at night. They changed the menu slightly every day but sometimes dinner felt like you were just eating a reheated rehashed version of whatever was out at lunchtime. They don't serve fast food here other than pizza so no fries nuggets burgers etc The restaurant seemed a little small too and can imagine at full capacity it would be really cramped.    The snack bar is a real letdown the food is really not well presented or thought through. I had a pizza with literally 3 strands of cheese on it. Dry panini with wilted brown salad Cesar salad consists of some lettuce anchovies and 2 chicken nuggets drizzled with mayo. You get a basket of fries with around 10 fries in It's really not 5-star quality at all.    The 1 A la carte restaurant is Moroccan we are both not fans of sweet food which typically Moroccan food is but this was nice. only a choice of Menu A or B but we tried both and they were OK nothing to shout about. The Hotel really could do with another food offering.    Pool areas - 4/5 There are 2 pools one is near the snack bar which we didn't stay at as it was constantly pumping music and loud people everywhere. Felt like a club 18-30 vibe with people drinking way too much and being generally loud. The other pool is much nicer quiet and relaxing however we found people bagging sunbeds early ( which is not uncommon anywhere ) but the annoying thing was people reserving the day beds and then taking 2 sun loungers too. This made a few days a little tricky to get a sun lounger after 9.30 am but we managed all the same. The chap Kamal in the pool bar is great. Run off his feet all day no breaks and always a friendly hello. We tipped him a few dirhams here and there and found that we were never really waiting long for a beer.    Drinks 3/5 - Stork beer ( which is nice ) but tiny little glass bottles gone in 3/4 swigs. The cocktails are literally made up as they go along it seems. We heard several people complain about the lack of alcohol in the drinks but we never experienced this ourselves. The wine is nice and cold dry like pinot grigio style but again you would expect a 5-star resort to have a little choice however there is literally red/white/rose wine and that's it.    Room - 4/5 - Clean and bright our first room was overlooking the car park/road area to the rear of the hotel and we only stayed 1 night. We went to reception to enquire about a swim-up room ( i had emailed ahead and asked and was quoted 700 euro for 10 nights ). At the reception we asked and got a swim-up for 9 nights for around 400 euro. so much less than originally quoted. HOWEVER - I wouldn't bother doing this it really is literally a small cold slither of pool right outside your doors no privacy and ours was next to the walkway so had people constantly walking by. I wouldn't choose this option again but would have changed to a pool facing upper floor room instead.    Overall it's a decent place to stay to get away from the UK for a while. It's Hot and only 3.5 hrs flight from home. The Moroccan people in general are very warm welcoming and friendly. The staff in this hotel are very friendly Azdine in the lobby bar was probably one of the best barmen I've ever come across his friendliness charm and hard-working attitude are great to see. Most of the other staff were great too. There was the occasional grumpy face in the main buffet restaurant but I guess we caught a few of them on an off day. We tipped 20/50 dirham every now and again for good service and we were never really without a table or a drink too.    Credit to Titif and Mustapha as they opened up the sports bar early one day so that we could watch a very important football match.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Matthew M wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: Currently here at this wonderful hotel.  The bar staff at the pool bar especially youness is superb he has no problem in filling up our bubba mugs.  The whole animation team including Titus are fantastic. The staff can‚Äôt do enough for us.  10:10 all round
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ben P wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Azdine made our experience amazing!! Loved every moment and service in particular was great! He made amazing cocktails and was a lovely man all in all. Food was great aswell! The pool bar was great aswell and the rooms were exceptional traik and oussama
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Tyler cooper wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: AZDINE!  He was the reason we had such a good time!  Best staff we could havelooked after us!  Thankyou for hmmmm traik and Oussama  Service for cocktails and drinks was amazing!  Snack bar was very good too great service!  Also the food was quality!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Isabel D wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Very good first hotel all inclusive experience with staff all being extremely friendly and attentive. Activities were offered throughout the day and food and drinks were served whenever you pleased. Bedroom was very comfy and cleaned regularly throughout the day and the hotel as a whole was spotless. However although the food offered was pleasing and extremely reasonable for the price we paid to stay myself and my brother suffered with upset stomachs from most of the trip and one of the nights i actually vomited. This may not have been linked to the food served but considering the milk often smelt like cheese i think it was extremely likely. Apart from that slight drawback the experience at belive was thrilling and has a high chance of being revisited.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jon H wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: We had two swim up rooms for 4 nights last week. From the minute we arrived the service was fantastic. During our whole stay the staff were efficient and always had a smile on their faces. The room was brilliant with a comfortable bed and a lovely bathroom. We really loved our outside area with our own terrace and pool. The hotel facilities were great and we loved the pool area and using the swim up bar. Drinks were available all day with good bottled beer and wine but the cocktails were very weak with hardly any alcohol in them. The buffet was excellent and we enjoyed the breakfast  lunch and dinner there. We also enjoyed our meal in the Moroccan Restaurant where again the service was excellent. Overall the food was great but the quality of the drinks could have been better. Whilst we were there we had a birthday and the staff came over with a cake and sang happy birthday. The only facility that was disappointing was the sports bar. We were hoping to watch the F1 and football on the Sunday but it didn't open until 5pm. It's not really a sports bar more of a games bar with pool table and table football. Overall we had a great break in a lovely hotel with very good service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

The buffet was excellent and we enjoyed the breakfast  lunch and dinner there. We also enjoyed our meal in the Moroccan Restaurant where again the service was excellent. Overall the food was great but the quality of the drinks could have been better. Whilst we were there we had a birthday and the staff came over with a cake and sang happy birthday. The only facility that was disappointing was the sports bar. We were hoping to watch the F1 and football on the Sunday but it didn't open until 5pm. It's not really a sports bar more of a games bar with pool table and table football. Overall we had a great break in a lovely hotel with very good service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Angel0ftheN0rth wrote a review May 2022
Review_Title: Best first holiday out of lock down anyone could wish for!!!
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I have come on an all inclusive holiday to the Be live adults resort in Marrakech.    The whole time we have been here the Staff have been wonderful efficient and friendly! In particular we would love to mention the warmth of Tariq the f and b Manager who is a credit to the hotel.    Upon arrival we were early for check in so taken straight to the lovely pool bar for cocktails and lunch we knew immediately that we were going to be looked after.    The food quality in both the main buffet restaurant pool bar and alacarte restaurant has been of a particularly high standard as-well as a wide selection of wines cocktails and soft drinks to choose from throughout the day.    There are a number of activities to choose from if you want ranging from yoga to archery spin classes and Pilates. We enjoy sunbathing around the pool and enjoying a good book but it‚Äôs nice to try something new.    The rooms are all brand new with flat screen TVs drench showers and are really comfortable. We just opted for a standard room and loved it but you can opt to stay in a suite or in a room that has a swim up moat to your own private sun beds on your terrace.    There is entertainment every night we have seen belly dancers singers and salsa classes when we have been in but we have also enjoyed making use of the free shuttle that takes you into Marrakesh and picks you up again. This has allowed use to explore and enjoy the city in the mornings and at night.    Thank you to Be live Marrakesh and Tariq we have had an amazing holiday and will definitely be using the Be live collection again as we have seen you have them all over the world!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: mcuk23 wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: We stayed for 10 days in May our first proper holiday for 2 years after covid. We had a really relaxing and enjoyable break and Overall this hotel is great but it needs some work to get to a 5-star level. Here's my breakdown.    Cleanliness - 5/5 - This is a very clean hotel there's always someone buzzing around sweeping clipping the hedges mopping the floors etc. The rooms were cleaned bedding changed and floors mopped daily. The main reception is very clean and has a lovely diffuser smell to it too. The food areas are always being cleaned by the staff.    Food - 4/5 - Plenty of choices good selection of hot and cold food egg station in the mornings pasta station at night. They changed the menu slightly every day but sometimes dinner felt like you were just eating a reheated rehashed version of whatever was out at lunchtime. They don't serve fast food here other than pizza so no fries nuggets burgers etc The restaurant seemed a little small too and can imagine at full capacity it would be really cramped.    The snack bar is a real letdown the food is really not well presented or thought through. I had a pizza with literally 3 strands of cheese on it. Dry panini with wilted brown salad Cesar salad consists of some lettuce anchovies and 2 chicken nuggets drizzled with mayo. You get a basket of fries with around 10 fries in It's really not 5-star quality at all.    The 1 A la carte restaurant is Moroccan we are both not fans of sweet food which typically Moroccan food is but this was nice. only a choice of Menu A or B but we tried both and they were OK nothing to shout about. The Hotel really could do with another food offering.    Pool areas - 4/5 There are 2 pools one is near the snack bar which we didn't stay at as it was constantly pumping music and loud people everywhere. Felt like a club 18-30 vibe with people drinking way too much and being generally loud. The other pool is much nicer quiet and relaxing however we found people bagging sunbeds early ( which is not uncommon anywhere ) but the annoying thing was people reserving the day beds and then taking 2 sun loungers too. This made a few days a little tricky to get a sun lounger after 9.30 am but we managed all the same. The chap Kamal in the pool bar is great. Run off his feet all day no breaks and always a friendly hello. We tipped him a few dirhams here and there and found that we were never really waiting long for a beer.    Drinks 3/5 - Stork beer ( which is nice ) but tiny little glass bottles gone in 3/4 swigs. The cocktails are literally made up as they go along it seems. We heard several people complain about the lack of alcohol in the drinks but we never experienced this ourselves. The wine is nice and cold dry like pinot grigio style but again you would expect a 5-star resort to have a little choice however there is literally red/white/rose wine and that's it.    Room - 4/5 - Clean and bright our first room was overlooking the car park/road area to the rear of the hotel and we only stayed 1 night. We went to reception to enquire about a swim-up room ( i had emailed ahead and asked and was quoted 700 euro for 10 nights ). At the reception we asked and got a swim-up for 9 nights for around 400 euro. so much less than originally quoted. HOWEVER - I wouldn't bother doing this it really is literally a small cold slither of pool right outside your doors no privacy and ours was next to the walkway so had people constantly walking by. I wouldn't choose this option again but would have changed to a pool facing upper floor room instead.    Overall it's a decent place to stay to get away from the UK for a while. It's Hot and only 3.5 hrs flight from home. The Moroccan people in general are very warm welcoming and friendly. The staff in this hotel are very friendly Azdine in the lobby bar was probably one of the best barmen I've ever come across his friendliness charm and hard-working attitude are great to see. Most of the other staff were great too. There was the occasional grumpy face in the main buffet restaurant but I guess we caught a few of them on an off day. We tipped 20/50 dirham every now and again for good service and we were never really without a table or a drink too.    Credit to Titif and Mustapha as they opened up the sports bar early one day so that we could watch a very important football match.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Matthew M wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: Currently here at this wonderful hotel.  The bar staff at the pool bar especially youness is superb he has no problem in filling up our bubba mugs.  The whole animation team including Titus are fantastic. The staff can‚Äôt do enough for us.  10:10 all round
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ben P wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Azdine made our experience amazing!! Loved every moment and service in particular was great! He made amazing cocktails and was a lovely man all in all. Food was great aswell! The pool bar was great aswell and the rooms were exceptional traik and oussama
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Tyler cooper wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: AZDINE!  He was the reason we had such a good time!  Best staff we could havelooked after us!  Thankyou for hmmmm traik and Oussama  Service for cocktails and drinks was amazing!  Snack bar was very good too great service!  Also the food was quality!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Isabel D wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Very good first hotel all inclusive experience with staff all being extremely friendly and attentive. Activities were offered throughout the day and food and drinks were served whenever you pleased. Bedroom was very comfy and cleaned regularly throughout the day and the hotel as a whole was spotless. However although the food offered was pleasing and extremely reasonable for the price we paid to stay myself and my brother suffered with upset stomachs from most of the trip and one of the nights i actually vomited. This may not have been linked to the food served but considering the milk often smelt like cheese i think it was extremely likely. Apart from that slight drawback the experience at belive was thrilling and has a high chance of being revisited.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

This may not have been linked to the food served but considering the milk often smelt like cheese i think it was extremely likely. Apart from that slight drawback the experience at belive was thrilling and has a high chance of being revisited.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jon H wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: We had two swim up rooms for 4 nights last week. From the minute we arrived the service was fantastic. During our whole stay the staff were efficient and always had a smile on their faces. The room was brilliant with a comfortable bed and a lovely bathroom. We really loved our outside area with our own terrace and pool. The hotel facilities were great and we loved the pool area and using the swim up bar. Drinks were available all day with good bottled beer and wine but the cocktails were very weak with hardly any alcohol in them. The buffet was excellent and we enjoyed the breakfast  lunch and dinner there. We also enjoyed our meal in the Moroccan Restaurant where again the service was excellent. Overall the food was great but the quality of the drinks could have been better. Whilst we were there we had a birthday and the staff came over with a cake and sang happy birthday. The only facility that was disappointing was the sports bar. We were hoping to watch the F1 and football on the Sunday but it didn't open until 5pm. It's not really a sports bar more of a games bar with pool table and table football. Overall we had a great break in a lovely hotel with very good service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Angel0ftheN0rth wrote a review May 2022
Review_Title: Best first holiday out of lock down anyone could wish for!!!
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I have come on an all inclusive holiday to the Be live adults resort in Marrakech.    The whole time we have been here the Staff have been wonderful efficient and friendly! In particular we would love to mention the warmth of Tariq the f and b Manager who is a credit to the hotel.    Upon arrival we were early for check in so taken straight to the lovely pool bar for cocktails and lunch we knew immediately that we were going to be looked after.    The food quality in both the main buffet restaurant pool bar and alacarte restaurant has been of a particularly high standard as-well as a wide selection of wines cocktails and soft drinks to choose from throughout the day.    There are a number of activities to choose from if you want ranging from yoga to archery spin classes and Pilates. We enjoy sunbathing around the pool and enjoying a good book but it‚Äôs nice to try something new.    The rooms are all brand new with flat screen TVs drench showers and are really comfortable. We just opted for a standard room and loved it but you can opt to stay in a suite or in a room that has a swim up moat to your own private sun beds on your terrace.    There is entertainment every night we have seen belly dancers singers and salsa classes when we have been in but we have also enjoyed making use of the free shuttle that takes you into Marrakesh and picks you up again. This has allowed use to explore and enjoy the city in the mornings and at night.    Thank you to Be live Marrakesh and Tariq we have had an amazing holiday and will definitely be using the Be live collection again as we have seen you have them all over the world!

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: mcuk23 wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: We stayed for 10 days in May our first proper holiday for 2 years after covid. We had a really relaxing and enjoyable break and Overall this hotel is great but it needs some work to get to a 5-star level. Here's my breakdown.    Cleanliness - 5/5 - This is a very clean hotel there's always someone buzzing around sweeping clipping the hedges mopping the floors etc. The rooms were cleaned bedding changed and floors mopped daily. The main reception is very clean and has a lovely diffuser smell to it too. The food areas are always being cleaned by the staff.    Food - 4/5 - Plenty of choices good selection of hot and cold food egg station in the mornings pasta station at night. They changed the menu slightly every day but sometimes dinner felt like you were just eating a reheated rehashed version of whatever was out at lunchtime. They don't serve fast food here other than pizza so no fries nuggets burgers etc The restaurant seemed a little small too and can imagine at full capacity it would be really cramped.    The snack bar is a real letdown the food is really not well presented or thought through. I had a pizza with literally 3 strands of cheese on it. Dry panini with wilted brown salad Cesar salad consists of some lettuce anchovies and 2 chicken nuggets drizzled with mayo. You get a basket of fries with around 10 fries in It's really not 5-star quality at all.    The 1 A la carte restaurant is Moroccan we are both not fans of sweet food which typically Moroccan food is but this was nice. only a choice of Menu A or B but we tried both and they were OK nothing to shout about. The Hotel really could do with another food offering.    Pool areas - 4/5 There are 2 pools one is near the snack bar which we didn't stay at as it was constantly pumping music and loud people everywhere. Felt like a club 18-30 vibe with people drinking way too much and being generally loud. The other pool is much nicer quiet and relaxing however we found people bagging sunbeds early ( which is not uncommon anywhere ) but the annoying thing was people reserving the day beds and then taking 2 sun loungers too. This made a few days a little tricky to get a sun lounger after 9.30 am but we managed all the same. The chap Kamal in the pool bar is great. Run off his feet all day no breaks and always a friendly hello. We tipped him a few dirhams here and there and found that we were never really waiting long for a beer.    Drinks 3/5 - Stork beer ( which is nice ) but tiny little glass bottles gone in 3/4 swigs. The cocktails are literally made up as they go along it seems. We heard several people complain about the lack of alcohol in the drinks but we never experienced this ourselves. The wine is nice and cold dry like pinot grigio style but again you would expect a 5-star resort to have a little choice however there is literally red/white/rose wine and that's it.    Room - 4/5 - Clean and bright our first room was overlooking the car park/road area to the rear of the hotel and we only stayed 1 night. We went to reception to enquire about a swim-up room ( i had emailed ahead and asked and was quoted 700 euro for 10 nights ). At the reception we asked and got a swim-up for 9 nights for around 400 euro. so much less than originally quoted. HOWEVER - I wouldn't bother doing this it really is literally a small cold slither of pool right outside your doors no privacy and ours was next to the walkway so had people constantly walking by. I wouldn't choose this option again but would have changed to a pool facing upper floor room instead.    Overall it's a decent place to stay to get away from the UK for a while. It's Hot and only 3.5 hrs flight from home. The Moroccan people in general are very warm welcoming and friendly. The staff in this hotel are very friendly Azdine in the lobby bar was probably one of the best barmen I've ever come across his friendliness charm and hard-working attitude are great to see. Most of the other staff were great too. There was the occasional grumpy face in the main buffet restaurant but I guess we caught a few of them on an off day. We tipped 20/50 dirham every now and again for good service and we were never really without a table or a drink too.    Credit to Titif and Mustapha as they opened up the sports bar early one day so that we could watch a very important football match.

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: ericab wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: A couple of positives but one massive negative.  Starting with the positives our junior suite was lovely very spacious with a very comfortable bed and a great shower various toiletries provided which we didn‚Äôt actually use.  The service in the buffet restaurant was good and the guy who took and delivered drinks orders on the patio area during the evening worked his socks off he could really do with some help.  The quiet pool area was just that; no rush for sun loungers or cabanas nice bar area from 10am.  We did find the food got very repetitive and the buffet area felt cramped when it was busy.  The score of two is for the above comments.  Now the massive negative: On our last afternoon just one bath towel was brought to our room. We discovered this at 5pm when we started to get ready for the evening. We decided not to bring it to anyone‚Äôs attention as we had 2 bathrobes as well as the one towel (also the phone in our room didn‚Äôt work).  When we checked out at 6.15am the following morning we were informed that a towel was missing from our room. We explained that just the one was brought the day before but we were accused of stealing a towel. We invited the receptionist 3 times to look in our suitcases to prove that we hadn‚Äôt taken a towel but he declined and insisted we put a ‚Äòpending charge‚Äô on our credit card which we would receive back once the housekeeper admitted to putting just the one towel in our room. I was very against doing this as I was furious at this accusation which was in front of other guests checking out. My husband eventually agreed to this charge as we knew our airport transfer would be arriving at 6.30am.  I have since emailed and tweeted the hotel regarding this but they have not done me the courtesy of a response.  Due to this we wouldn‚Äôt recommend unless you take photos of exactly what towels are in your room just before you check out.  This was an awful experience for us and we feel we have been treated appallingly. Never again would we visit this hotel or any others in this chain.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: My stay at Be Live Collection was the highlight of my trip to Morocco! In addition everyone here is very warm they teach me to speak Arabic help me warmly when I am in trouble help me print materials provide car rental service on time! Special thanks to Marwa for helping me when I was alone in a foreign country Muniya (I don't know if that's spelled correctly) also helps me a lot and Younes from the car rental company Mahdi Sharlaf Loubna Muhammad Yassine from the reception .... And many many people forgive me for having trouble remembering people's names (pronouncing yours is too hard for me)!    If I ever get the chance to go back to Morocco I will come back to be Live Collection. It's really ‚Äú Be Live‚Äù! I will miss you my friends! Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Craig N wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: The hotel itself is always immaculate. The swim up room we had was lovely. Very big although I wouldn't spend extra on a swim up room again. The water is not heated so it's freezing.    The two outdoor pools offer variety as one is quite active with activities and music with the other being much quieter. I do think it's very disappointing that they don't have poolside waiters for drinks.    The inside bar is just far too small. Frankly ridiculous for a hotel of this size. It can only comfortably seat about 40 people so if you don't get a seat early you're stuck in the lobby or forced to go back to your room. This is something that needs to be urgently looked at as it's the only area of the hotel to spend the evening comfortably. The entertainment start at 10pm which means you're often sitting for a couple of hours waiting for it to start because if you arrive any later you've got no chance of getting a seat.    The food- Sadly the food is pretty dreadful all round. Breakfast is fine with lots of pastries pancakes and fresh omelettes on offer. But the buffet for lunch and dinner is awful and really spoiled our trip. The food is often cold and bland with nothing looking or tasting good. I remember being particularly thrilled at finding some warm turkey breast and lentils which on reflection is pretty pathetic for staying in a 5 star hotel. Comfortably the worst food I've ever had on holiday. The A La Carte restaurant was sadly not much better. The snack bar by the pool is okay and the food is cooked fresh but objectively is only enjoyable because the buffet food is so bad. You're certainly only eating for fuel and not enjoyment which you don't expect from a five star hotel.    Drink- the alcohol is okay. What you expect from an all inclusive resort like this. Watered down spirits and the cocktails are hit and miss depending on who makes them. The only 'safe' drink every time was the draught beer which was actually alright. It was also very difficult to get hold of bottled water in the morning which was frankly ridiculous. They also don't provide much in the way of tea coffee or milk in the room and guests were always asking for extras.    Staff- The staff were generally nice and helpful but I didn't find the staff in the buffet restaurant to be that friendly.    Location- the hotel is a good 20-30mins outside the city and sadly there is literally nothing in the immediate area which is a real shame if you want a break from the awful food. The shuttle bus is good and drops you straight outside the main square in Marakech.    Sadly I really wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you get a stupidly cheap deal and great weather. It's far too expensive for what it is and that is mainly down to the awful food.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: pbeach2018 wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Booked as a last minute weekend break. Turned into one of the best holidays we have had. Hotel if fantastic. Food is restaurant standard. Staff are friendly and helpful. All the services provided on site are first class. Would definitely recommend to friends and family and will certainly be returning this year

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Cinderz L wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: This may just be a long review so please prepare yourself for a read but most importantly will be very honest!!    We arrived at the hotel very late since there was a delay with our flight (easyjet of course) anyway arrived at the hotel which is in the middle of no where not even a shop about at least 15 to 20mins cab ride which is 300dhms. Once at the hotel you go past security gates no one can get in the hotel unless they're staying at the hotel which is great and the hotel also is guarded 24hours by security you will see them everywhere around the grounds at night. At the reception at check in they will obviously ask for your passport as usual but also a room deposit which I was confused about as this was not written anywhere on the booking. It says at reception it is 600dhms roughly 50 sterling but depending on the receptionist the charge will differ as we got charged 1000dhms which is just over 80 sterling. They take this either by debit/credit card or even cash also you can change up money at the hotel which I highly suggest as the exchange rate is amazing it was 12dhms to the pound.  The room we had was lovely it was right at the back with 2 double beds which were so comfy best sleep I've had in a long time. The bathroom was lovely too and our room was cleaned daily I have no complaints there at all!! In fact the hotel itself was exceptionally clean it was cleaned every day by the staff. The reception floor was buffed every day so be careful so slippery sometimes.  The pools were absolutely lovely clean too was just a dream to just lay there with no kids running about. The animation team were lovely too always trying to get people involved with activities. So there was water aerobics archery belly dancing yoga football basketball and general pool games oh and gym stuff.  The spa wow what can I say AMAZINGwe got the hammam which was 500 dhms so just over 40 sterling and was incredible skin was so soft. I highly recommend the spa the whole team were lovely.  The drinks well they all tasted like water to me tye alcohol is very weak but I fond this on all inclusive holidays that the alcohol is weak. I always say add more but made no difference. The lobby bar their bartenders were fab knew your drinks before you even walked over!!    Right the food what can I say NOT 5*it was very bad some days freezing cold as if it came straight from the fridge. The breakfast you have Your usual pancakesomelette stations which was lovely the moroccon pancakes were amazing. Lunch time is when the disaster started their was plenty choice but the food was not good very bland and same goes for dinner. In fact you will see the same meal several times over the week repeated day after day after day. The desserts were also a repeat of the day before loads of choice but just on repeat.  The pool bar was okay but nothing to award 5* at all!!    We used the shuttle bus into the market which was great good tip turn your hotel braclet inside out as the people at the market will pretend they're from the hotel!!    There is a photographer at the hotel too each photo is 50dhms his really good at his job so take a look.    The evening entertainment I think was touch and go as its covid there is not a lot of seats so if you want to see the entertainment have dinner early and grab a seat.  The a la carte we never even went the menu was not great at all so we took the best of the bad bunch and stuck at the buffet.    Is this hotel 5* hell no it is not the grounds and the spa could be considered as 4*+ but with 5* you would expect everything to be of a higher standard which the food and drinks is not. I would say 3*+ if including the food.    Oh wait I forgot there is no food after 10pm or drinks after midnight i think it was so if you're flight is delayed like ours and you would like some snacks just to fill you there won't be none. I have been to 3* hotels who have provided a snack bar for me and my family if we have arrived later than expected. Again this would be a nice touch of you're arriving at 5* hotel especially when there is not a single shop in the area.    There is a mini shop/souvenir shop in the hotel but that shuts at 10.30pm they sell crispchocolate and little souvenirs but no drinks!!!    I think I've covered everything would I go back to this hotel unfortunately not its not worth the money.    Hope you enjoyed reading my essay üòä
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: dudeonwheels wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Beautiful very modern 1st class relaxing hotel is exceptionally clean and gardens are a complete joy. As we came for the sun relaxing all day around the pool was the very best you could ever hope for. The animation staff during the day were brilliant and incredibly friendly not disturbing anyone but always there with great advice a big smile friendship and assistance. Big thumbs up to all the team who all really made our holiday special. Mehdi and Kamal are the best dispensing drinks and making us feel special 5 stars!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Thislifeis4living wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: Amazing Experience for 2 friends from the UK - UA
Review_Text: The experience was great. Lovely polite attentive staff especially when dining remembering your drinks order and trying to see if you are enjoying your time with them. Rooms cleaned every day fresh breakfast every morning. The lunch felt sometimes like a rotation of the night before's dinner and could do with more variations as my only improvement. The excursions manager wasn't clear on his price which I felt was a bit disappointing so perhaps book elsewhere for this part. Lubna was very polite and lovely at the front desk and Ayoub at the snack bar was always friendly and serving with a smile. I will definitely stay again this year or next. Another feedback is please try to put on a shuttle to the city between 12 - 2 most people want to go into town for lunch if they do not enjoy the lunch options available or after breakfast and this was not available as only 10am and 4pm was available. It is about 20mins into the main centre but worth staying as it is so peaceful and clean.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Adeline12345221 wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Food is amazing rooms are luxurious and staff are very friendly and helpful.  Everything is clean including the toilets are the pool. The hotel does not look as a five star at the reception but it makes up for it with everything else

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sarah W wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: We‚Äôve just come back from a weeks stay and we had a wonderful time!    The hotel is lovely and maintained to a high standard. The grounds are well kept with gardeners each day. There are two pools one more quiet and the other larger and busier. We stayed by the quiet one as it has a swim up bar. There were plenty of sun beds but the hotel wasn‚Äôt full so I can imagine in peak season you would need to get one earlier on.    There are two bars outside. One where you can order food by the larger pool and the swim up bar. The main one usually had two staff members serving and it could‚Äôve done with 3. The pool bar was manned by Kamal and he looked after us superbly and was interesting to talk to. Sometimes there needed to be two of him as he was rushed off his feet!    The buffet restaurant was well organised food was varied and delicious. Sometimes things could‚Äôve been a bit hotter but everything was fresh and tasty.    The a la carte wasn‚Äôt worth it. Things were over cooked and desert was bland. We were done in 45 mins.    Food was ok at the pool bar outside burgers panini etc.    There needs to be another bar for evenings. There was only capacity for 35 inside of an evening and when it was chilly we were sat in the reception area which had no atmosphere.    We had a twin room with really comfortable beds although pillows were a bit too soft. We had a terrace which caught the sun in the evenings. There‚Äôs a fridge in the room with a large bottle of water each day. The aircon helped on warmer nights. The shower was fabulous. Great pressure and always hot water. We made use of the complimentary toiletries too.    We used the shuttle bus into the medina a few times and it was always on time.    Now to the staff‚Ä¶. They work so hard in the heat and particularly as we visited during Ramadan. Special thanks to Kamal at the pool bar Rajaa who took great care of us at breakfast and lunch Hicham who looked after us at dinner and Azdine who always remembered our evening drink order.    We had a great week in the sunshine at a decent price via TUI. It made visiting Marrakech so easy. If I could give 4.5 I would.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jessica W wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Azdine at Lobby bar was amazing and made our evening experience memorable. Always remembered what we were drinking and we didn't have to prompt him. Thanks Azdine.  Overall I've enjoyed.my experience and will be returning to Marakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: We are on our last day at Be Live & we are very sad to be leaving. The hotel is beautifully clean & our room was cleaned every day. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: Second visit and there will be a third to this lovely hotel. the staff are so friendly it is spotlessly clean. Choice of 2 pools plenty of loungers no need for early towel run! A big thank you to Rajja at breakfast and lunch who spoiled me with my early morning English tea.  And now onto the big guns the Animation Team. Titif Samil. Zizzi. Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights. The location was great only 20 minutes from the medina and they provide free shuttles to the market and back. Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: The hotel is very well kept and all the staff are friendly and helpful. Special mention to azdine who works in the lobby bar. With the choice of entering the hustle and bustle of merrakech without being in it.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Shane z wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: 5 night stay lovely tranquil grounds and landscaping great food the staff are all amazing - especially AZDINE and OUSAMMA who were super friendly and speedy... keeping up with our drink requests isn't easy! Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: BackPacker785472 wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: We arrived about 1 o'clock and had to wait for our room until 3 (check in time although we had checked in not a problem althoughhotel was only 25% full ) Went for a drink and lunch then sat outside in the sun .Taken to our room (3113) a long way from reception .The room was lovely outlook not up to much but we had not paid for a view - get what you pay for ! Room beautifully clean and spacious only fault with it  screen over bath is so long you can't reach the taps. The few people I spoke to about it were getting in it to run it .You have a shower cubicle as well so I just used that to much hassle although I do love baths .Only other complaint a big lack of coffee so if you are a coffee lover take a small jar and coffee mate or similar( they will give you milk at the bar but struggle to find coffee sachets )  We had a hammam in the spa which was wonderful little bit pricey compared to outside but very tranquil the spa is very well kept and worth a visit.  Restaurant food is pretty good lots of choice quite often seafood which my partner loves (King prawns Octopus Squid etc.) hard to get hot food ( the hotel was not very busy which might be the reason - not enough turnaround )  A la carte restaurant a bit disappointing book early to avoid ensure you get in and be prepared to pick your menus (2 set choices ) when you book your table at reception The restaurant was only open Wednesday and Sunday when we were there ( mid March)  The grounds are beautiful and well kept  not massive but bigger than the sister hotel .Plenty of sunbeds with space between them .Pool bar food and staff good plenty of seating Food freshly cooked so hot !  Entertainment varies so some nights better than others lovely staff and the waiter is amazing and more so if you tip him .  All told a good hotel and the staff are lovelyI've only given it 4 stars because the room was badly cleaned on the regular cleaners day off the lack of coffee and regular tea bags but mainly because of the atrocious motion lighting in the hall ways and steps that is so delayed it caused me to spend my last day in the room with no food ( not allowed to take it out of the restaurant) ) With a very swollen ankle caused by missing footing going down the steps in the dark .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lee Mc wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at the be live collection for 7 days in March 22.    This is the first time we have been to Marrakesh and in all honesty was not my choice of destination. With all inclusive holidays I am very nervous when it come to cheap places. I‚Äôm a believer of you get what you pay for! Well I was wrong with this hotel! It was brilliant!    I when we checked in the room wasn‚Äôt ready and check in was 3pm. They checked you in so you could use the all inclusive and I asked if there was a room to change in so we could sunbathe. They gave us a room and we was able to get changed and enjoy our first day.    Hotel staff:  The hotel staff from the gardeners cleaners maintenance men to the guest relations staff and beyond where amazing! Always smiling and alway a hello or Bonjour! The restaurant staff where brilliant we where always greeted in the morning and at lunch by Medhi he always kept the wine and water topped up he was brilliant! The lobby bar is where we spent every evening and there is live music dance shows & Karaoke. It was a good laugh. The bar staff in this place where amazing joining in with the entertainment team to get the guests dancing etc was great. Oussama was brilliant and on the odd time you went to the bar greeted you like you where his family was so pleasant I do have to say though Azdine who is the server in the lobby bar most nights was excellent! The man never stops I‚Äôm a pretty big drinker and my glass was never empty. Thank you!    The food:  We where pleasantly surprised with the food. Our overall opinion was it was lovely! There was only one issue I had (the Mrs didn‚Äôt have this) was they use a oil dressing on somethings that‚Äôs a little annoying but edible! Nothing‚Äôs perfect but thought I would point that out. We ate2/3 times a day always full and happy with the choices! The desserts where amazing so much choice and we did enjoy it a lot!    General:  The hotel is very clean and tidy. Our room was cleaned everyday and could not fault anything. I‚Äôm pretty much glass half full so if you want to go looking for things I‚Äôm sure you will find them! But nothing that is going to spoil your stay unless you want it to!    I think the trip was huge value for money and the hotel is great. It is situated a little out of the way but the hotel put a free bus that takes you into Marrakesh. We didn‚Äôt use this as we decided last minute to go into Marrakesh and a taxi was only 150 DN (around ¬£12.5).    We enjoyed it hope you do if you decide to go!

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: ClauGeany wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: It was a bank holiday trip ( 3 nights and 4 days ) but this place is awesome!  I‚Äôm very picky when comes to food or drinks but everything was 5*. The staff is so fast going you literally have no time to leave the fork down and the dishes are gone well done team! The bed was amazing slept like a baby every night. The rooms are clean and spacious the pool view are probably the best option. The bartenders the waiters( from the restaurant bar or snack bar) the chefs the receptionist are all great!  We tried ( and it‚Äôs a must ) the 2 h treatment in their SPA - hamam + full body scrub + 30/30 relaxing & head massage. It‚Äôs amazing I‚Äôll take the massage everyday next time as it will defo be a next time!  Thank you for having us!    P.S: if you‚Äôre planning any trip to the Souk I‚Äôll highly recommend you to get a guid from the hotel! Don‚Äôt look at the ‚Ç¨30 charge - it‚Äôs a well spent ‚Ç¨30 !!!

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nicola Oliver wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: I arrived on 1st March 2022 stayed for 10 days had absolutely fantastic time best hotel for me I've ever been to. All the staff are very friendly and helpful and made my stay so much better. We had a rainy day the pool staff entertained us in the pool bar. The snack bar and Restaurant staff were always there with everything we needed. I certainly can not forget the clearing of our hotel room every day they do a fantastic job and the general cleanliness of the hotel throughout the day and every day is not something you see every where.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: shudhiecjvf wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: The nicest hotel I have ever stayed in staff entertainment food cleanliness location all 5 star. Staff very helpful and attentive. Tittif especially was very friendly and always kept us entertained with archery aerobics bowls African dancing and Arabic lessons by the pool. Gorgeous hotel very clean amazing food for every meal. Would 100% recommend. Amazing value for money
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Elin wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Title: Amazing hotel, amazing staff, amazing trip
Review_Text: We had the best stay at Be Live collection Marrakesh we could have ever hoped for! We were so well looked after at all times by the wonderful hotel staff who saw to our every need! The food was incredible lots of choice including traditional Moroccan dishes every meal. The entertainment was so much fun! We tried archery aqua aerobics Arabic classes with Tittif - definitely a must! Can't fault anything would 100% come back again!

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: If I could give this place more than 5 stars I would! Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Melissa S wrote a review Feb 2022
Review_Title: Would of been 5 star if they didn't cancel less than 24 hours before.
Review_Text: Hotel cancelled the original booking less than 24 hours before. This was frustrating as it was a surprise holiday for my husband and we had to find another hotel via our agent. We spent 3 days instead of 6 at Be Live. The hotel upgraded our swim up room to a suite free of charge for the inconvenience.Of the 3 days spent the experience was really enjoyable. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The food was very nice and drinks were in abundance. Shout out to Ayoub on the snack bar who really took care of us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Tammy17 wrote a review Jan 2022
Review_Text: We travelled out in October for a surprise birthday. Quick check in and straight to the bar as we did not want to eat late at night. Bar staff lovely and polite. Drinks quite rubbish to be fair. Had been warned by friends already there!    Anyway our room lovely and large working aircon ( always a bonus). Large bed and nice towels. Food in main restaurant good. Loved the fresh bread and the soups! Breakfast great great waiters very attentive.    Pool bar served by the friendly Kamal. Didnt watch the shows after the first couple of days went up to the pool / games room.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nattan M wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Text: Wonderful guy so kind and looking for your well-being at every time. This guy is very nice and so proud of his job! It is clear that he love his job  his hotel and to s√®ve customer as best as he can with smile . Thank you Azdine !!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: CMCP1993 wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Text: Wow. Where to begin. The hotel itself is fabulous so clean modern and beautiful decor. Two pools a swim up bar loads of activities. But the main thing that stands out is the entertainment and the staff.    Firstly the entertainment. The night we arrived we went to the lobby bar as there was still music on. What a buzz. The DJ was amazing and had the whole crowd on the dance floor. There was such a good atmosphere we were so surprised and so happy we chose this hotel. Every night there is a theme and different entertainment we seen belly dancers a live band etc. Honestly the best entertainment I have Experienced in a hotel.    Secondly the staff. There is too many to mention by name but all of the staff are amazing. The bar staff are so friendly get everyone dancing remember your favourite drink etc. The pool guys are so fun and not pushy if you don‚Äôt want to participate in games. The reception / public relations are amazing. They were so helpful arranging for our antigen test and had someone to come to the hotel to do this. Also so helpful organising taxis and providing us with maps and tips of where to go. The staff will really go out of their way to help you and it never felt like too much.    Finally RastaMan Zanjii. He is the hotel photographer and is fantastic. He is so professional and took amazing photos for such a reasonable price. We were late back to hotel after an excursion and had arranged to meet Zanjii there to collect our photos. He waited for us which we were so grateful for. Im so happy we have these memories so really recommend getting photos taken by him.    I cannot fault this hotel. The room was so spacious and modern and we were met with a platter of fresh fruit and treats when we arrived.    Thank you so much Be Live. We are so sad to be travelling home but I hope to come back soon and will recommend this hotel to everyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Peace wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Text: Loved this hotel.  Fantastic on all fronts.  Rooms amazing food great entertainment great people fantastic  Absolutely nothing bad to say  Would definitely return    Actually travelled before the date supplied

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: bazboytoy wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Text: We stayed early October  for 2 weeks  should have been going to Jamaica but as we were not allowed to travel there  we booked this  weather was mid 30c and wall to wall sunshine . Stayed by the swim up pool most days  was looked after well by kamel . Pool was a bit chilly 1st thing but soon warmed up in the afternoon .  Food was ok but I did struggle some days  soup was good. The bread was amazing . Didn‚Äôt try the Morocco restaurant But looked nice .lunch at the pool bar was good . Staff were very nice and the whole place was spotless .  The only complaint was the lack of measures for alcohol  beer was good though .  Overall a very good holiday and it was only 2 3/4 hours flight .  Would return one day .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Becky W wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Title: The staff made us feel like family
Review_Text: We had planned to stay at the hotel for a month but had to leave early due to new COVID restrictions in place stopping UK flights in and out of the country. We stayed for 3 weeks in the end.  We absolutely loved our time at the Be Live. From the moment we arrived to our sad goodbyes the staff were just wonderful. They always went the extra mile and truly made us feel welcome. After the last few years we needed a break and the Be Live Collection delivered.    The staff  First I was to shout out to Azzdine on the bar. He had our drinks memorised by the second day. Even on nights when it was crazy busy he worked so hard and it never went unnoticed. We never had to go to the bar to order he would always find us and keep our drinks topped up.  Mahdi on the travel desk was an angel. He made sure we could do all the things we wanted to to make the most out of our stay. The 3day excursion through the Atlas Mountains to the Sahara Desert was our favourite- cannot recommended enough! And incredibly good value for money!! Mahdi was a real sweetie and booking through him was so easy.  Marwa on the front desk was very sweet looking after us. Always greeted with a smile and was genuinely keen to know how we were enjoying our stay in Morocco. She gave us some great tips about the city and when we told her we had to leave early she was crushed. She was planning to give us a special meal on one of our last nights in the Moroccan restaurant.  Smilie and Mamadou and the entertainment staff were fantastic. So much energy and a great sense of humour. They kept the vibes at the ‚Äúloud pool‚Äù going and the water aerobics were never dull!  Youness and the young lads on the snack bar were always so so kind and greeted us with smiles every day. It could get busy but they worked so hard and quickly it was never a long wait.  And the waiting staff at the canteen- there was a young girl in the evenings with bling hair (never caught her name) who worked so hard and always had a smile on her face. And Raja in the breakfast team was always a welcome sight in the mornings. The food was fresh delicious and had so much variety. It was always a good meal ever night! The Moroccan restaurant is absolutely worth checking out!  And the cleaners were amazing! They made fun towel animals for when we came back from our excursions. Little touches like that made such a difference.    Pools:  The pools were brilliant- a quiet chill out vibe pool. And a more energetic pool with music and games. Both were a decent size and well maintained.    The grounds:  The grounds weren‚Äôt too big so nothing was too far away. The gardens are beautifully maintained.    Bar:  The drinks are all delicious! Some familiar drinks and some interesting new ones to try. Loved the Marrakesh Flower!    Location:  It‚Äôs not far from town and the free shuttle is easy to book.    Excursions:  We did Essaouira quad biking hot air Balloon ride Marrakesh the Atlas Mountains and Sahara desert. All amazing!! We wanted to do the waterfalls too but as we had to leave early we missed out.    The rooms:  Comfy bed and great pillows. Clean. Bright. Good water pressure in the showers and a nice deep bath to sit in too. Lots of storage and the safe for our valuables. Sometimes our cards didn‚Äôt work getting in but the reception fixed that in 2 seconds.    In short- if you‚Äôre going to Marrakesh stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: D D wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Title: One of the best stays ever!
Review_Text: A really nice hotel with very friendly staff.  You need anything they will always help you out.  The rooms are beautiful modern style with a arabic touch in the bedroom.  To us hygi√´nisch is important so we were not disappointed because everything and everywhere was very clean.  On friday they have delicious Moroccan food from all different types of tagines you can imagine and so much more! Everyday they have a theme at the restaurant so you are able to eat different nice and fresh food.  At the evening you can dance and laugh the night away with live music (band dj) and even bellydancers who show up by surprise!    Thank you all of you for the very nice time we had at the hotel we will defenitely come back.  Worth it!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: slaymshen wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: I can't believe it's a 5-star hotel it doesn't reach a 4-star    There are some reasons why dont choose be live adults:    Cold water  Not tasty food  Reheated food  Bad Coffee  Mandatory deposit to get pool towels  Aggressive behavior by some employees  many parts of the hotel are being restructured
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Anna S wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Fabulous time here food was lovely and staff amazing. Special mention to Hassan who made every evening fabulous!    Very clean and good Covid measures in place. Helpful staff all through resort and lots of fun to be had at the noisy pool or a quiet pool with a lovely swim up bar depending on how you feel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Hayz wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: This hotel claims to be a 5* ?! I was yet to see this during my 9 night stay at this hotel.  When arriving at this venue the staff were rude and uninterested. We had to wait hours for our room to be ready so made our way to the buffet. The food was so basic and remained the same for the 9 days we stayed there. It was luke warm and never hot however the worst part was the flies on everything including the food/tables. I couldn‚Äôt remember a day where there wasn‚Äôt a fly either on me or trying to get on my food. There was nothing being done about this problem either it just appeared the ‚Äò‚Äônorm‚Äô‚Äô. Then surprise surprise 2 days later I was ill and so was my partner with really bad food poisoning. Multiple staff were told about this but didn‚Äôt care. Whilst bed bound in the room the smell of sewers from outside drains was so strong and the noise from surrounding rooms made it unbearable.    I am shocked that this hotel can call itself a 5* after reading all the positive reviews before going... whilst sitting outside one evening at the hotel I saw staff stand over someone whilst making a trip advisor review ... explains a lot now.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: bmatthews2015 wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: This hotel is simply not a 5 star hotel we have just returned from 8 nights at Be live Marrakesh. The rooms are quiet nice but that‚Äôs it. From the moment we arrived we never felt welcome at all and the welcome we received was cold as ice most staff at this hotel weren‚Äôt very helpful and some even rude. Apart from the lovely lady we had for housekeeping who does a fantastic job and is very polite.The buffet which is the only option for breakfast/lunch/dinner other than a snack bar and the Moroccan restaurant which your allowed to book once during your stay. During our stay the buffet/restaurant had flies everywhere including on the food itself on a daily basis which I had noticed on other reviews but assumed this may have been an exaggeration. Unfortunately not. On our 2nd night my partner fell sick with food poisoning (no surprise). This completely ruined the holiday for her and to make matters worse the 3 hotel staff that I informed offered ABSOLUTELY NO HELP OR ADVISE! despite being told a guest in their hotel is sick. Shocking. I ended up purchasing Imodium and paracetamol from the small hotel shop. The flies were also consistently all over the snack bar where again drinks are prepared. All in all not only would we never dream of returning to this hotel we would never consider any of the other 30+ Be Live hotels full stop.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: russ41burg wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: We had a nice time in this hotel. The positives were that is is exceptionally clean and well maintained with a good sized room that was quiet and away from the main entertainment. The food was generally good quality if a bit repetitive and there were some occasions when some of the hot food wasn‚Äôt as hot as it could have been. The staff were outstanding however and we were very well looked after by bar and waiting staff at all times. Regular shuttle bus into Marrakesh is good but could do with more slots. Pools were first class although a bit chilly and the sun loungers didn‚Äôt have very good padding. All in all it‚Äôs a nice place though and provides a decent base for exploring the area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nikki wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Fantastic immaculate professional delicious exceptional can I go on ....yes I can. Fantastic service from all staff and a swim up room just was the best. Would suggest though that a choice is given about changing towels every day in your room because if eco and also don't always use them . All staff are professional in every way. Restaurant food was delicious and so nice to see no fast food like chips. 5 star all the way and I never eat dessert but here omg delicious. Entertainment was funny and was mostly in French due to clientele but in these type of countries it was above the standard . Great pool bar with hamal and busy pool was energetic without going on. The rooms are exceptional offering additional items such as toothbrush showering goodsslippers and Bath robes. Fridge in room with fresh water And tea n coffee facilities too. Only negative thing was on checkout that was charged for a stain on beach towel which within 5day holiday only changed once as limited use and therefore very annoyed at 6am to be challenged on damage to a towel without evidence and a cost of ‚Ç¨25for a stain...very disappointed as clearly if we saw Stain would have asked fir clean towel. Other than that amazing beautiful peaceful and can't wait to return. Xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Meriem K wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel : the food was very good the staff was amazing (Thanks to Ilyas & Mamadou for the efforts to keep us busy) we had a blast.  If you want to have fun with as much food & drink then this hotel is for you!    Negative things : they give only small bottle of water and there is no drink in the minibar

Apart from the lovely lady we had for housekeeping who does a fantastic job and is very polite.The buffet which is the only option for breakfast/lunch/dinner other than a snack bar and the Moroccan restaurant which your allowed to book once during your stay. During our stay the buffet/restaurant had flies everywhere including on the food itself on a daily basis which I had noticed on other reviews but assumed this may have been an exaggeration. Unfortunately not. On our 2nd night my partner fell sick with food poisoning (no surprise). This completely ruined the holiday for her and to make matters worse the 3 hotel staff that I informed offered ABSOLUTELY NO HELP OR ADVISE! despite being told a guest in their hotel is sick. Shocking. I ended up purchasing Imodium and paracetamol from the small hotel shop. The flies were also consistently all over the snack bar where again drinks are prepared. All in all not only would we never dream of returning to this hotel we would never consider any of the other 30+ Be Live hotels full stop.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: russ41burg wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: We had a nice time in this hotel. The positives were that is is exceptionally clean and well maintained with a good sized room that was quiet and away from the main entertainment. The food was generally good quality if a bit repetitive and there were some occasions when some of the hot food wasn‚Äôt as hot as it could have been. The staff were outstanding however and we were very well looked after by bar and waiting staff at all times. Regular shuttle bus into Marrakesh is good but could do with more slots. Pools were first class although a bit chilly and the sun loungers didn‚Äôt have very good padding. All in all it‚Äôs a nice place though and provides a decent base for exploring the area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nikki wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Fantastic immaculate professional delicious exceptional can I go on ....yes I can. Fantastic service from all staff and a swim up room just was the best. Would suggest though that a choice is given about changing towels every day in your room because if eco and also don't always use them . All staff are professional in every way. Restaurant food was delicious and so nice to see no fast food like chips. 5 star all the way and I never eat dessert but here omg delicious. Entertainment was funny and was mostly in French due to clientele but in these type of countries it was above the standard . Great pool bar with hamal and busy pool was energetic without going on. The rooms are exceptional offering additional items such as toothbrush showering goodsslippers and Bath robes. Fridge in room with fresh water And tea n coffee facilities too. Only negative thing was on checkout that was charged for a stain on beach towel which within 5day holiday only changed once as limited use and therefore very annoyed at 6am to be challenged on damage to a towel without evidence and a cost of ‚Ç¨25for a stain...very disappointed as clearly if we saw Stain would have asked fir clean towel. Other than that amazing beautiful peaceful and can't wait to return. Xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Meriem K wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel : the food was very good the staff was amazing (Thanks to Ilyas & Mamadou for the efforts to keep us busy) we had a blast.  If you want to have fun with as much food & drink then this hotel is for you!    Negative things : they give only small bottle of water and there is no drink in the minibar

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Gazzor wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Title: Not as advertised, very noisy most of the day
Review_Text: it is not `The tranquility of a residential area¬¥ as it states on its website it is totally opposite loud thumping annoying sounds the rest of the staff are great lovely rooms but very random regulations on the using of masks glove and mask for food but you can hold hands use the same mike for karaoke and where the screen is at the snack bar with a big sign saying masks mandatory virtually nobody wore one and nobody asked them to?

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Becky W wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Title: The staff made us feel like family
Review_Text: We had planned to stay at the hotel for a month but had to leave early due to new COVID restrictions in place stopping UK flights in and out of the country. We stayed for 3 weeks in the end.  We absolutely loved our time at the Be Live. From the moment we arrived to our sad goodbyes the staff were just wonderful. They always went the extra mile and truly made us feel welcome. After the last few years we needed a break and the Be Live Collection delivered.    The staff  First I was to shout out to Azzdine on the bar. He had our drinks memorised by the second day. Even on nights when it was crazy busy he worked so hard and it never went unnoticed. We never had to go to the bar to order he would always find us and keep our drinks topped up.  Mahdi on the travel desk was an angel. He made sure we could do all the things we wanted to to make the most out of our stay. The 3day excursion through the Atlas Mountains to the Sahara Desert was our favourite- cannot recommended enough! And incredibly good value for money!! Mahdi was a real sweetie and booking through him was so easy.  Marwa on the front desk was very sweet looking after us. Always greeted with a smile and was genuinely keen to know how we were enjoying our stay in Morocco. She gave us some great tips about the city and when we told her we had to leave early she was crushed. She was planning to give us a special meal on one of our last nights in the Moroccan restaurant.  Smilie and Mamadou and the entertainment staff were fantastic. So much energy and a great sense of humour. They kept the vibes at the ‚Äúloud pool‚Äù going and the water aerobics were never dull!  Youness and the young lads on the snack bar were always so so kind and greeted us with smiles every day. It could get busy but they worked so hard and quickly it was never a long wait.  And the waiting staff at the canteen- there was a young girl in the evenings with bling hair (never caught her name) who worked so hard and always had a smile on her face. And Raja in the breakfast team was always a welcome sight in the mornings. The food was fresh delicious and had so much variety. It was always a good meal ever night! The Moroccan restaurant is absolutely worth checking out!  And the cleaners were amazing! They made fun towel animals for when we came back from our excursions. Little touches like that made such a difference.    Pools:  The pools were brilliant- a quiet chill out vibe pool. And a more energetic pool with music and games. Both were a decent size and well maintained.    The grounds:  The grounds weren‚Äôt too big so nothing was too far away. The gardens are beautifully maintained.    Bar:  The drinks are all delicious! Some familiar drinks and some interesting new ones to try. Loved the Marrakesh Flower!    Location:  It‚Äôs not far from town and the free shuttle is easy to book.    Excursions:  We did Essaouira quad biking hot air Balloon ride Marrakesh the Atlas Mountains and Sahara desert. All amazing!! We wanted to do the waterfalls too but as we had to leave early we missed out.    The rooms:  Comfy bed and great pillows. Clean. Bright. Good water pressure in the showers and a nice deep bath to sit in too. Lots of storage and the safe for our valuables. Sometimes our cards didn‚Äôt work getting in but the reception fixed that in 2 seconds.    In short- if you‚Äôre going to Marrakesh stay here.
