Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: LordRupert wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Hotel - It is situated on the outskirts of Marrakech (approximately 15 mins drive) in an area that is clearly marked for further development. You can see the mountains in the distance but effectively it is surrounded by scrub land. I ran regularly in this scrub land without issue but I did see stray dogs often. There are security guards at key points and the rear of the hotel is surrounded by fencing and landscaping. The grounds are immaculate and very clean - they are a nice place to be in. The hotel design is functional and it is on two levels with a central reception area. The key thing for me is how clean it was. The rooms are immaculate and the bathroom and bedroom are pleasant places to be. The beds and bed linen are excellent. Think hard about the swim up rooms - they're not especially private and I don't think they provide the bangs per buck you'd hope. I'm very pleased we didn't get one.  Staff - French is the business language here and it is true to say that staff respond best to it. That said I found the staff to be pleasant and friendly. I don't have anything negative to say. I enjoyed using my basic French skills. Cleaning staff were excellent. Waiting staff were always willing to help but I felt that there weren't enough of them.  Food - serving area is not big enough but food is very well presented. This is not for you if you like beige food or struggle with foreign food. I loved the tagines salads octopus and squid. Moroccan wine and beer was a pleasant surprise.  Pool - there are 2 pools: quiet (with a swim up bar) and the one near the activities. Both are in good condition and I regularly saw them tested / sampled. They're both cleaned in the evening. The swim up bar is only really good for cooling down. The nosiy pool accommodates the water polo and water aerobics.  Misc - the gym is good but is not air conditioned. I was impressed with the spa facilities - had a really good massage. Use the coach to go into Marrakech - I've fallen in love with the place. Take the 1535 bus - you see it in the day and night and the sunset is stunning. You'll need to pay a visitor tax on arrival at the hotel and a deposit for the pool towels (they're good quality). Sports bar is a good place to watch football - it isn't conducive to a group social though and the atmosphere is a bit odd. There are plenty of sun beds and I wasn't conscious of the usual problems.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jia17 wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: One of the best in Marrakech
Review_Text: We just came back after a wonderful time at Marrakech Be Live Collection. The best thing about the hotel is the staff and their hospitality. We were looked after very well by Abdes Samad at Breakfast and lunch. He made sure we were comfortable and served well. A Wonderful host! Raja and Hassan at the buffet hotel were also amazing servers. Younnes at the bar was very nice. Made sure all drinks were to perfection especially my sugar free morroccon tea.  The food was amazing wih good blend of moroccon and continental varieties. It wasnt repetitive at all. The evening entertainment was great especially the belly dance show although it was very short and would be nice to have it slightly longer.  The room was very comfortable we had the double superior with garden view. Rooms were cleaned daily. The thing missing from our room was the lack of bath robes. Also the towels were a bit worn out and need replacing.  The free shuttle bus to town was very handy and the driver was very friendly.  The pool was great but they would benefit from having a jacuzzi aswell.  Overall it is a great all inclusive hotel and we throughly enjoyed our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: @matthewwood wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Positives:  * Lovely Hotel And Buildings  * Lovely Setting  * Staff Helpful (When Available)  * Rooms Are Modern And Comfortable  * Spa Massage Treatment Was Very Relaxing And Worth The Money    Negatives:  * Demand A ¬£100.00 Deposit Before You Check In (This Still Has Not Been Refunded Back To Me And I've Had No Response From The Hotel Now Been Over a Month)  * Barely Any Staff Available At The Bars For 200+ Plus Rooms To Have 2 Staff At The Bar Is Not Good Enough Waiting Around 15 Minutes For A Drink  * Both Myself And My Partner Plus Numerous Other People Got Food Poisoning From The Buffet - Mostly Was The Same Food Every Night With Slight Variations  * Numerous Flies Around The Buffet Food Didn't Seem Like The Staff Were Bothered About That    This is a lovely hotel but its a shame that certain things make it not enjoyable. We stayed for 7 nights and after 3 we were ready to come home. I am very disappointed that we were demanded to pay the deposit (which I found in the small print on my TUI booking) and have not had it back? Best option pay the deposit in cash and ask them to give it back to you when you check out.    3 star at best unfortunately not the 5 star it claims to be.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sophie M wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful and very clean.  The food is good but a lot of it isn't labelled so anyone with dietary requirements/restrictions/allergies be careful. Staff also can't answer what the food is if you ask them if it has meat etc in it.  The entertainment is good and reception staff are very friendly.  The other staff barely smile or look enthusiastic but this is no issue for us we just accept it and remain polite ourselves but wouldn't be likely to tip the service. I remember 3 members of bar/restaurant staff that were happy and smiling throughout the stay.  Unfortunately the staff do have a hard job though there isn't enough staff so they're probably fed up and overworked.    There is city tax to pay to stay but it isn't a lot at all travel/tour operators don't warn you of this and they do put a holding charge/refundable deposit on your card for the towels etc but apparently this gets removed and un-blocked from your card which is unfortunately still showing on mine as ¬£84 ... So be warned incase this is not given back.  The food was good there was a selection of Moroccan food to try and was tasty fish seafood sushi and a little English food the rooms are immaculately clean the showers work great overall it's a good stay and worth the money spent!  We would return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: RC28 wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Great night at the Sports Bar after a fantastic meal at the a la carte restaurant. Fabulous cocktails and service with a smile from Mohcinelots of entertainment from sports on TV to board games and table football !! Would highly recommend a visit here !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Toni C wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: Good hotel, lacks in a few areas
Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful in terms of presentation. Immaculately clean. Good facilities.  We had a swim up room and although its shallow it was a nice extra and definitely helped you cool down in the heat.  The entertainment is good.  The sports bar is a nice and they take sports requests.  The all inclusive buffet is what you would usually expect repetitive but adequate. The service in here is slow and it's difficult to get a drink.  The snack bar is better value its included and has a menu with different choices which are all cooked fresh.  Bedrooms although pretty lack basic items such as coffee and tea making facilities and an iron which you would expect in a 5 star hotel. We requested tea bags and milk from the maids daily.  The safe is free and easy to use.  Your room is only cleaned if you display a notice on your door.  Requests for fresh towels took too long as we were informed you needed to display a sign to get your room cleaned upon check in.  They take a ¬£100 deposit upon check in which you get back. They are very precious about their pool towels though and if you dont hand in either 2 towels or towel cards when you check out you will be charged.  The general service was slow throughout the hotel but I dont know if that's just in Marrakech itself as no one seems to be in a rush.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Joanne H wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Don‚Äôt get me wrong this IS a lovely place but it‚Äôs not a 5 star more like a high 3 or 4 star. We had a ‚Äòswim up‚Äô room which is deceiving as it‚Äôs not a swim up. What you do have is a small narrow and shallow section of pool that runs the length of the block of each 9 ground floor apartments with your sun loungers partially submerged in the edge off your patio area. It‚Äôs too small to swim in and even if you could there is nowhere to swim to! However it‚Äôs lovely to have this semi private space just outside your room and is great for cooling off when the temperatures soar. The rooms are beautiful spacious well appointed and clean. The all inclusive options are limited to the buffet for breakfast from 7-10am lunch 1-3pm then dinner from 7-9pm. There is a reasonable selection to choose from something to suit everyone but it‚Äôs typical all inclusive nothing spectacular. There is a snack bar at the larger pool but the snacks are very limited and pretty dire. The on-site supermarket can‚Äôt really be called so. It‚Äôs one little room selling gifts and very basic supplies. No drinks alcohol or even ice creams available. The staff are helpful enough but not many crack a smile or attempt to make any conversation. The lobby bar is open all day until late and serve a selection of cocktails beer and coffee. Olives and nuts are available on request but they don‚Äôt offer or advertise this. The sports bar is quite disappointing and has a rather ‚Äòyouth club‚Äô feel to it. There is a mini bar in your room which you can pay to have stocked from 190 DHS for 4 beers. My advice is pop to the pool bar and take drinks back to your room which most people seem to do. All in all a nice quiet place for a sunny relaxing holiday just don‚Äôt expect too much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Vandna Vadher wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: THE BEST HOTEL WE'VE STAYED AT EVER
Review_Text: The best Hotel we've stayed at PERIOD. From the receptionist to the concierge service staff to the restaurants every single staff were absolutely lovely so helpful and always with a smile of thier faces. They all went above and beyond for us.    The hotel was on point the rooms were spacious and so clean and comfy just like being at home. The beds were like a dream and the pillows seriously were better than ours at home.    The food was ridiculously delicious so much choice from breakfast lunch and dinner we literally ate ate & ATE! if you miss breakfast or lunch there's always the pool bar that also do some great snack foods and Drinks were insane!! Cocktails were the best things here!!    Both the pools were sooo much fun there's something for everyone if you want a nice chilled quiet pool or you wanna party it up with lots of fun activities. Archery Yoga or Aqua aerobics there were so many more fun games to get involved with. They also had some great entertainment every night so some of you don't even need to leave the resort.    We will definitely be visiting here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: natalies8191 wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel ... slightly let down by drinks service
Review_Text: The hotel is exactly as shown on the pictures beautifully decorated and all the areas and rooms are spotlessly clean staff are always seen round the clock keeping the hotel looking well! 2 great pools one quiet and one with entertainment. Sports bar is great showed English football games and a nice change to play pool and games if you don‚Äôt fancy the entertainment! Mochine in the sports bar very lovely and provides table service for drinks if he‚Äôs not too busy. Food was great a bit repetitive but very nice... maybe would be good in the future to have some themed food nights to change it up a bit?    All staff very friendly but also quite laidback which we loved... helpful if needed but were not in your face to join in games etc. Pool towels were nice and clean and get fresh ones everyday until you leave. Reception will change English sterling into dirhams if needed which is very easy & we paid 90 sterling for deposit and 38 sterling for tax for 7 nights 2 people.    Only downside would be the drinks service in the day time particularly at the snack bar ... at times the bar ran out of cups which caused a wait to be served which isn‚Äôt ideal in 40degree heat! Poor bar staff had to rush round to collect and wash them so would be good to get some more stock in to prevent this.    All in all a fabulous hotel and would highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: ma77hill wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: We have just spent a week at your resort and would like to share our experience.    Firstly the resort is beautiful with very modern rooms two big swimming pools sports bar with board games and a pool table and a cocktail bar. I have to say every aspect of the resort was perfectly clean and the maids were attentive.    The food for an all inclusive resort was of a good standard however very repetitive. The snack bar offered an al a carte menu offering late breakfast pizza burgers and salads all with table service. I don‚Äôt feel the food was to a 5 star standard however was perfectly fine for a week.    The service was extremely average the staff levels were severely lacking and there appeared to be no leadership across the resort. The manager spent his entire time stood at the door welcoming guests but didn‚Äôt manage his staff. The restaurant tables were rarely laid up with enough cutlery or glasses you had to chase waiters around to get a drink with your meal and on several occasions wait whilst they collected empty glasses/cutlery to be washed before you could have a drink or a spoon for your ice cream!!! Whilst everyone expects buffet style dinning I think it would be more appropriate to show guest to their table take their drink orders then direct them to the buffet.    The bars again lack staff on average you could wait between 5-20 minutes to be served at peak times and again on occasions would be told to wait whilst they waited for the glasses to washed.    You clearly do not have the staff to offer table service or drink demands so why not invest in self service areas around the pool and in the restaurant. This would take a lot of pressure off the staff and cut down waiting times for frustrated guests who expect a great service giving your claimed 5 star rating.    The quiet swimming pool was complete with a bar accessibly from the pool which was very well received. This however would only be restocked in the morning meaning all the drinks were often warm! Not again something you‚Äôd expect from a 5 star resort!!!    On the day of check out we were offered to pay to enjoy a late check out the night before. We spoke with different members of reception all of which told us different information and prices! When it came to paying we were quoted 600 MAD to check out of our room at 6pm. However at 3pm we were told the late check out was only until 2pm and we had to leave! Others experienced the same so it would appear a scam between the staff to make money on the side with no clear hotel policy of late check out times or prices.    All in all the resort has fantastic potential but requires a manager to complete some basic staff training and over sea the basics.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: lara b wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Food was great  Hotel was clean  Rooms were great  Beds were so comfortable I was sleeping for like 9 hrs every night!!  The hotel staff were absolutely amazing brilliant and hard working!!!  Once the bar staff served you they knew exactly what your choice of drink was    Thanks to all the entertainment staff  I love you all  My only gripe would be the entertainment on the whole  As great as the staff were I was bored out of my skull during the day!!  Please improve as I would like to come and visit again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: michelle m wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Highly recommend and will be back
Review_Text: This was our first time in Morocco as it was for many other guests we spoke to. The rooms and beds are immaculately clean stylish and well equipped.  Food good choice of traditional Moroccan international and a real French cuisine influence too. I‚Äôd say over half the guests are French here. Try and restrain yourself at the sweet trolley!!! Beautiful patisserie choices. Restaurant staff are very happy and attentive although I feel at times they were under staffed.  The house wine is Moroccan and very good.  Loved the girls at the snack bar always a smile and little chat everyday with them.  Snack bar food very good  Special thanks to Kareem in the animation team who gave me advice and support during aqua aerobics due to my shoulder injury. Lovely guy professional and helpful.  We preferred the activity pool lots going on and lots of fun.  Marrakech market an experience not to be missed but get a guide an endorsed one and tell them what you want to see and what you want to buy. The free hotel bus is brilliant  We will definitely be returning for the hospitality food and the incredible weather. Other guests said the same.  Highly recommend  Don‚Äôt forget to tip for good service too they‚Äôre all so sweet and work very hard.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: davidmyers06 wrote a review Sep 2019

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Dean R wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Firstly I would like to explain why this hotel is not a 5* hotel.  1) The service is generally poor and not attentive for example at breakfast you need to ask for a drink and if you are lucky you may get a smile. Bowls and glasses are at a shortage which for a self claimed 5* resort is shocking.  2) When you enter the Buffet restaurant as with all 5* hotels you would expect to be taken to a free table? Well not here you need to walk around the restaurant and find one yourself. Then wait and wait and wait to ask a waiter/ress for a drink.  3) No glasses at the snack bar usually in the afternoon. They can't cope with the washing up.  4) No mini bar in the room. You will also be informed it is forbidden to take drinks in your room?  5) The breakfast is OK pretty standard. Lunch is the best meal of the day in the Buffet restaurant. Dinner is poor very very poor. Unless you eat pasta and pizza your choice is limited. The morrocan selection is poor. The food is warm at best. The pasta is the best option but I didn't come to Morroco to eat pasta.  If you have food allergies or like me can't eat bread you will be struggling to eat. No food allergy advise on any food and cross contamination on many food types.  The snack bar is OK again if you want to eat pizza and burgers and fries. I don't travel to 5* resorts and want this I expect more. The salads are limited and don't expect to eat one past 16.00 as you be told they are not available?  The Ksar restaurant is not too bad. You can have one reservation per stay if you stop over 4 nights.  I am not just moaning on but the service and food is that of a 3* hotel at best.  The positives are:  The rooms are really nice and spotless beds are large and very comfy. We stopped in 4004 ground floor next to the snack bar. The swim up rooms are more of a selling gimic. You can't swim up you could however walk up to your room in water?  The bus to the city is useful and free. We used this twice. A little tip. Go in the morning if you want to shop. Hardly anyone bothers you. Go at night to experience the hustle and bustle.  The pools and pool staff are good staff are very friendly.  Grounds are kept nice and clean.  The coffee is good as is the Morrocan tea.  There is now where to have a nice afternoon coffee and cake or light snack.  I have travelled all over the world and have been lucky to stay in some top hotels. I stay away a lot with work so I am used to the hotel life.  My wife and I have had a relaxing time away from our children for a week. I wouldn't return back to this hotel or even Morroco. It was an experience but not one I will be having again.  One last thing the evening entertainment was at best average. After a week with most hotel entertainment you loose the will to live.  Go to Turkey for 5* service fresh food and culture.  Cheers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: olivia p wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: It would be good for a 4*
Review_Text: The good:  - the pool bar is absolutely spot on. Very nice touch.  - The hotel is very clean this cannot be faulted.  - Staff are nice enough  - The shuttle is handy but drops you in quite a random place    The bad:  - The sport bar. From reviews I was excited to see this. However it is nothing to what you would expect. When we first walked in we had to wait for 'Mohcine' to serve us because he was over seeing some other guests write a review on tripadvisor for him! ( now I realize why everyone only writes a review for the sports bar). Then when he made the drinks there were no hello or conversation made. We never went to the sports bar again after this.  - The buffet restaurant the food was never warm. I am not fussy with food so this wasn't much of problem for me.  - There isn't enough outside seating for everyone to watch the entertainment. But logistically the hotel wouldn't be able to fit anymore seats out there anyway.  - The cleaners sometimes didn't clean our room till around 4pm (but did a great job).  - If you have a room near the pool music is extremely loud from 9am-7pm and you can hear the entertainment on an evening until 12pm.    Even with its downfalls I still think its a great hotel and would recommend to people staying in Marrakesh.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: RBGINA wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: UP-SCALE ALL-INCLUSIVE Hotel with little things to be done better :)
Review_Text: Have been many times in Marrakech this time I stayed at Be Live Collection in a swimm-up room room was spacious clean and had a sunny Location even though the water was by far too cold. Many Bar Outlets to get Drinks and Snacks Restaurant to small if fully booked 2 Seatings for Diner recommended- large variety to choose from nice Lobby Bar thanks to Azedine :)  great Staff at FUNIMATION-POOL Fathi Tatif and Karim are great :! THKS. also to the entire other staff cleaning Housekeeping Front-Office (Sheila and M.Taha Bell-Boys Waiters and Waitresses impossible to Name them all but pls. foward the compliments- I ll check on that when I return :) ! BEST of all and most freindly and helpfull MAITRE TAREK from the Main Restaurant! Deposit-System for Towels should be revised/changed- not really suitable for a 5 Star Hotel ! (Lots of commission for reception-staff when changing back Deposit in Euro upon check-out :) !!! SPA STAFF very unpleasant upon Arrival they didn`t pay Attention were counting the daily income because it was short before closing even if i wanted to have only a Spa-Menue Leaflet with all the Treatments they offer but nothing I got no Information at all very bad attitude and no cusomer-service at all (only in SPA!) And it takes a Long time until you get an answer from Reservation for an Airport-Transfer upon Arrival and secon email of mine was not answered at all :( !!!!! Shall return in a few weeks/months when ist not so crowded!

Review_Text: Spending a week here at Be Live and I must say that it has been an excellent hotel from checking in to the pool bars and entertainment staff.    Special mention to Mochine in the sports bar who is a top guy and made our experience even better with great hospitality and great customer experience.    Will gladly return thanks to him and all the staff at Be Live Collection üëçüèº
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: antb1976 wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Very average and I definitely wouldn‚Äôt call it 5*
Review_Text: Upon arrival we were greeted nicely at the door after arriving from the centre of Marrakech where we had a great time and brilliant service from Riad Dar One (look them up as their Riad is amazing)    Unfortunately I had left my rucksack in the Riad and quickly realised I‚Äôd also left my passport in the bag. Now I know that it was my error but rather than checking us in and waiting for our passports to arrive they insisted that I needed pictures of the passport and the special number when arriving into Marrakech airport. This took about an hour after a really long day this could have been avoided by just letting us check-in however the hotel manager said that this wasn‚Äôt possible. The guys at Dar one kindly drove the bag up to the hotel the next day that‚Äôs real service.    So the hotel is really nice and the room was far from a disappointment we had a superior swim up room which was spacious very clean and the sunbathing area was spot on. I‚Äôm not sure about the swim up part as it was more of a relaxing area I jokingly tried to swim in it and the bruises i sustained will be with me for sometime üòÇ what I found odd was that the mini bar was only stocked with a bottle of water I later found out that to have drinks in there you had to pay extra......I decided that walking to the bar was the better option.....mmmmmmm    So amazing looking hotel and room was spot on we truly had been spoilt.    HOWEVER    the service was atrocious trying to get a drink at any of the bars took too long and if you were lucky you received a slightly cold drink in a not very clean plastic cup....I stuck to beer out of the bottle which on the first day they ran out at the pool bar. Dinner that same evening was ok the food is average for what is supposed to be 5* i was hoping for amazing local food and instead we got very average European food. During the evening meal I decided to have a glass of red it took and age to arrive and then when I asked for another I was told they had ran out and that I had to go and get one from another bar. I spoke to the restaurant manager who in return told me to sit down and he would sort it out....he did.    I have many scenarios where service was bad but I think you will get the idea. I did speak to customer relations about it and things seemed to improve I must say that the girls on the desk were VERY helpful and understanding. Also I must say that all their staff were very good the simple thing is that there wasn‚Äôt enough of them this resulted in a disappointing 1* service.    I won‚Äôt even start on the evening entertainment which was shocking and more like for a hotel smack bang in the centre of Benidorm 5* hotels are supposed to be a bit more classy than karaoke 80‚Äôs disco and a very poor pub singer on an electronic keyboard.    Overall I would give it a 3* which would have been higher if service levels were much higher.    Come on Be Live you have to realised that your customers work hard to pay to come to your resorts and these are holidays that they wait in anticipation for some time to receive service like this is nothing but disappointing. MUST DO BETTER
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ro W wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Don‚Äôt come or waste your money
Review_Text: We‚Äôve been here since Friday and I can honestly say it the worst holiday experience we‚Äôve had. May be it‚Äôs because we have been spoilt in the past but this place is just appalling in terms of service.    On the bright side the room is spacious and clean which is a positive and the housekeeping staff do a good job.    However the services available are very limited. In an all inclusive resort it is disappointing to see that there is not stocked mini bar even just soft drinks!    Four times we‚Äôve asked for our fridge to be looked at and it‚Äôs still not working properly. We‚Äôve been out and for our own soft drinks off site to stock it.They only came to look at the fridge today (day 4) after we asked to see the manager!    The pool bar is a disaster. Hardy anything is on top including soft drinks and it‚Äôs an effort to try and get some of the staff to serve you. Depends on how many French people are at the bar and how much the bar staff want to pull themselves away from engaging them in conversation.    Nothing is chilled the bar is in not in good working order and they ran out of beer at 12:30 this afternoon ( I don‚Äôt drink it but those that did did not look impressed!).    There aren‚Äôt enough glasses to go round which then has an impact on the available bar staff and at several points yesterday the bar was unmanned for 30+ minutes whilst the single member of staff had to Cole‚Äôs the glasses and do several stock runs! The cleanliness of glasses is a lot to be desired as I‚Äôve just taken a sip of wine (with ice which is just outrageously) and it tastes of Pernod as the glasses have not been clearly washed properly ü§¢. Who doesn‚Äôt like the take of wine and Pernod in one go!    In terms of food very hit and miss. Buffet food is luke warm to say the least and I would have some serious concerns in light of that around it‚Äôs hygiene status. Again staff seem so busy but that‚Äôs because they are unable to cope with the demand. This is impacting on the overall level of customer service.    We‚Äôve paid for swim up which is clearly over priced as it‚Äôs about the same width and depth as our neighbours pond. Now I know I‚Äôm a big girl but Jesus even a carp would struggle!    If the management team are reading this come and se me I‚Äôm in room 2001 and more than happy to have a the conversation now rather than later today (23/09/19) when we return to our room.    If I had any advice don‚Äôt come!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is really modern and clean so I couldn't fault how the place looks. However when it comes to the service improvements need to be made. Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: golfgoddess123 wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Staff were generally very helpful especially the maitre d' who went out of his way to ensure one of the ladies in our party had a very special big birthday celebration. Rooms were a good size and the beds were REALLY comfortable. Spotlessly clean. Buffet food was plentiful and with a good variety. House rose wine was lovely but spirits and the mixers were disappointing. Can recommend the virgin mojito without sugar though!  The hotel has 2 pools - one with music aerobics table tennis etc and one as a quiet area. During our stay there were 2 ladies by the "quiet" pool who were thoroughly obnoxious and an absolute disgrace. The management tried very hard to subdue them but a firmer stance would have been more appropriate including calling in the police. At the very least the hotel should review its clothing policy and introduce a ban on topless bathing.  The bar staff worked really hard but could have done with a few more pairs of hands.  There is an a la carte restaurant where you can eat once if you stay more than 4 nights. Limited choice of menu but very accommodating and nice traditional food.  Spa was excellent especially the reflexology massage.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: tanja646 wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Don‚Äôt trust them- awful end to our holiday!
Review_Text: I was looking forward to writing this review as we had a lovely holiday but on checkout it was completely ruined. We left being shouted at by terrible reception staff who were incompetent rude and unhelpful.    On arrival we were not talked through the information about the hotel instead they took a deposit on card and sent us to the room. We needed WiFi so later came down where a different member of staff spoke us through the hotel information and told us to collect towel cards the next morning. We came down the next morning where we were asked to pay a deposit for the towels 200MAD each which we paid in cash. On our final evening we paid a city tax and were told we would receive both the deposit and towel deposit back when we checkout the next day. Upon checkout we received the card deposit back but were refused the towel deposit being returned because they had not given us a receipt for paying cash.    At this point we were informed that the towel deposit was included in the initial deposit paid. This was not told to us and they proceeded to take cash for the towels even though we had paid the deposit by card. They claimed to check the CCTV and then claimed they could not see a pass over of cash- either they have not checked or they are just stealing our money. Both options are unacceptable.    The management have managed this very poorly most of all Abdellah who was most unhelpful and would not pass us any management contact. This is the second lot of poor management we observed- a racist drunk man was behaving inappropriately at the pool and it was other holiday makers who had to step in rather than their own staff.  I‚Äôm not going to mention any positives because our experience was ruined. We will be recommending everyone to not come here. We will be complaining to the hotel the Be Live Hotel group our booking provider and the financial authorities.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Beebubbaloo wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Having gone from a 5 star Riad to this there was a considerable difference in service. Don't get me wrong staff are lovely friendly helpful facilities clean but when you pay 5 star you should get exceptional service ( and we have stayed in a a few 5 stars). Tea bags were never replenished in our room they took our room towels one day and never replaced so only had robes to dry on. The glasses around the pool are only cleared at the end of the day 6pm i feel there is not enough staff around the pool to give the 5 star treatment. The pool towels REALLY smell of sweat where they probably need replacing. On a positive there are no kids (wahoo) the buffet is out of this world so fresh and really good options for vegetarians. But i really think it should be 4 star rating or even 3 star. The spa and indoor pool you have to pay on top of the all inclusive. For ¬£150 per night which we paid i would expected personal service and access to indoor pool.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Adam Q wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Nice Hotel but service was lacklustre
Review_Text: Hotel was lovely and couldn't knock the rooms (we had a swim up room) and the surrounding pool/restaurant areas but was let down severely by the service offered by the bar staff and restaurant staff in general. Numerous occasions the bar ran out of beer or ran out of specific drinks and we waited nearly 15 minutes every morning just to get someone to acknowledge we wanted coffee. There was a few exceptions the guys in the lobby bar were very efficient and for some reason the service at dinner was unbelievable but apart from this we were not best pleased and neither were most of the people we spoke to. If this hotel decided to invest in training their staff in being more efficient and friendly then we would really consider going back in the future.    On a positive note I enjoyed the games around the activity pool and also liked the two different settings of a pool bar which was quieter and had the bar attached and the activity pool with constant games and party atmosphere around.    Would like to suggest s toilet near the quiet pool though as we constantly had to go back to our room as there was only a toilet at the activity pool.    Overall we didnt really let issues with service bother us and we still had a nice time just was a bit of a dampener overall.    Service 2 out of 5  Hotel 4 out of 5  Pool 4 out of 5
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Chloe-Rose B wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: We went to this hotel in August and it was amazing! All the staff are lovely especially the young lady with glasses at the snack bar her name is Hayat she was always so nice and made sure that we always had everything we needed! The hotel is so clean and always have really good food on offer especially for someone as fussy as me I could always have a pizza if I didn‚Äôt like anything else! Would definitely come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: LisaC00k wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Am just about to leave this hotel after spending a week here with 2 of my friends. Bit of a mixed review on the whole but I would come back here again mainly because of the friendly staff (and great weather).  The rooms are large and spacious I had a double room with one bed and my friends had a double room with 2 double beds. They were very clean the cleaning staff do an excellent job. Randomly there is a window between the bathroom and bedroom so you can see you friend showering as the blind is quite see-through.  There are 2 pools at the hotel we spent out time round the ‚Äúfun pool‚Äù where they put on the usual activities such as aqua aerobics archery and boules. The ‚Äúanimation team‚Äù are great. Very friendly and helpful they even attempted to teach us Arabic.  Shout out to Kerim Titif Fahd and Fatima - thanks to all of you for making our holiday so much fun.  Meal times is the main down side. The food is ok it could be labelled better as someone with a good allergy this could be difficult at times but there is a reasonable choice. The management need to invest in more plates and cutlery and glasses throughout the hotel as often we were waiting for these things to be cleaned. The staff tried incredibly hard to serve us well but at one point I ordered 3 drinks and the girl behind the bar had to go collect glasses so she could compete my order.  On an evening there is entertainment on each night we however decided to go to the sports bar where there is a pool table table football and various other games such as poker and dominoes as well as showing live sports on the tv. Mohccine is the bar tender there and he is brilliant. He has his own special cocktail and will make you just about anything you like!  There is a shuttle bus from the hotel into Marrakech you just book it the day before just be aware of people trying to make you hold monkeys and stuff in the square because once you‚Äôve touched it you have to hold them!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Kelsey16 wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: The benefits of the hotel is that you didn‚Äôt have to fight for sun beds and the pool area is beautiful. The rooms are lovely and modern and the beds are amazing. However there are many many downsides to the hotel. Didn‚Äôt get checked in until after 3pm as we were still waiting for the room to be cleaned. Very limited choice of food in the restaurant and forever waiting for cutlery bowls etc. Drinks were watered down or full of sugar. Service was the worst I have ever known had better service in a 3*. We seemed like an inconvenience when asking for anything even when asking for a drink at the bar. The worst part was the airport shuttle. We booked this days in advance to be told the morning of our departure it had not been booked. After waiting for 40 minutes a taxi finally arrived. Told us the price had increased but we paid it to ensure we made our flight! Beautiful hotel but so so many areas for improvement.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: 530Amanda wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in! Pros : hotel itself is lovely and modern fab AC in rooms. No sun bed race on a morning. Cons : room wasn‚Äôt ready until 3pm queuing for a bottle of water in 40 degree heat which was NEVER cold always lukewarm. Restaurant was a joke very limited selection with cold food. Fried eggs burnt on the bottom raw on the top scrambled egg so cold I felt I could‚Äôve made an egg mayo sandwich. No brown bread only white which tasted sweet even when toasted. Had to ask for spoons bowls and milk for cereal. Full fat milk no skimmed or semi skimmed. Staff very rude making you feel like such an inconvenience. Had to hunt for salt and pepper which 9/10 were empty anyway. We got to the point of dreading meal times. Every single time in the sports bar we felt an inconvenience to the Batman as we kept interrupting his game of pool so we could get a drink (cheap copies of spirits or warm bottles of beer)! At one point he had ran out of glasses so we were being served cocktails in a plastic beaker you got round the pool. Pool area does not get cleaned I was cleaning my side table myself and couldn‚Äôt put my bag on the floor as it was filthy. Never once seen the pool get cleaned or water checked. Basically if your not French (French I‚Äôd their second language) you get ignored by animation and treat with total disrespect by staff everywhere! Cannot wait for this holiday to be over!

Review_Date: Thomas O wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Just recently came back from a week stay here and we had such a great relaxing time.    The hotel is spotless i couldn't fault the cleaners at all and the pool toilets where also immaculate. The room we had was just a standard room but it was a great size and the air con system worked a dream.The food choice was okay in the main restaurants with different types of meats and fish been put on every night and they had several Morocco dishes which was expected. if you like your salads they had a huge choice which was nice. The pool snack bar was a really nice touch also with burgers pizzas sandwiches and salads all on offer.    My only cons for this hotel was the amount of staff they had on at the bars at times with a waiting time to get served just over 5 minutes which the staff did there best to get to you as soon as they could.Also the amount of bees at the pool bars at times which was annoying at times.    The staff at this hotel where great and pleasant but would just like to say a huge thank you to Adbel and moschine which worked on the pool bar and sports bar and also would like to thank Abdess who worked in the restaurant. All 3 made the holiday extra special. Also a massive thank you to the cleaners who work very hard everyday to make it so clean defiantly the cleanest hotel i have ever stayed in.    All in all we had a great time and defiantly would recommend this hotel.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: miss P wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Honest review- nice hotel but definitely not 5*
Review_Text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Be Live and thought I would write a quick review as I find reviews very useful in making decisions about where to stay...    Pros-    The rooms are very nice and clean and as the other reviews state the bed is very comfy! The swim up room is definitely worth the extra money and gets sun in the afternoon which is perfect.  The swim up bar pool is lovely and always easy to find a lounger.  Spa- we had a massage which works out as a pound a minute- quite expensive to be honest but it was very good and relaxing. As other reviews stated we were prepared for the hard sell of numerous spa packages and just pushed back. The lady on the spa reception was very welcoming and friendly.    Cons-    Staff could be more helpful and also the transport arranged by staff is very over priced. We used a car arranged by reception to go into town the guy didn‚Äôt have change so we overpaid he gave us his number and said he would collect us in a few hours but didn‚Äôt answer any of our calls or texts until hours later. Also after checking in early we were given no info about suitcase storage toilets towels etc. which is ridiculous for a 5 star hotel- you just have to work things out for yourself.  Food is not labelled well at all as all of the reviews state so not too sure why they do not sort an easy fix. Very unclear what is vegetarian/vegan- just need clearer labels. Also food is often not hot but cold or warm and they need more waiters to serve drinks. There should be a self-serve drinks machine as standard for 5 star hotels as the staff are rushed off their feet and take forever to serve even a water. They also get the drinks orders wrong so you have to start again after waiting- again really poor for a 5 star hotel.    Drinks- service at the bars is slow and no smiles. The drinks are typically watered down/just full of sugar. Also endless plastic straws- please say no as they automatically put one in every drink.  Deposit- we read about this beforehand so brought cash which made it a lot easier to get the money back at the end- highly recommend doing this to avoid card complications and them not paying the money back. For 2 people and 2 towels it came to ¬£90.    Overall very beautiful hotel and swim up room is worth it but they desperately need more staff and the food drinks and service could be improved. Also just to note- If you go into the souks in town please do not go near the monkeys or snakes- tourists taking pics with chained up monkeys is vile.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: TravellerAbi93 wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Overall this is a lovely hotel. Most staff are very pleasant and helpful. The room is amazingly spotless and comes with all the extras even a mini sewing kit. The air-conditioning in the room was a life saver. Shower is very good and again bathroom is spotless. The housekeeping team work very hard. FYI the towels are kept on a shelf above the bath! We didn't realise when we checked in late at night but the housekeeping team were happy to bring us towels when requested. Water bottle replenished daily in the room. We had a room near the noisier pool which wasn't a problem during the day as we went to the quiet pool or out for the day time. It's a better location for the evening as the entertainment runs until midnight which is very very loud not our cup of tea but manageable and understandable.  The quiet pool is lovely and peaceful the swim up bar is an added bit of luxury although mind the step walking back through the pool or you'll end up with the drink in the pool lol. We didn't go to the noisier pool as not our thing but the people there looked to be enjoying themselves.  The food selection was great plenty to choose from and try on each day. The puddings were amazing. However the buffet bar is not staffed well enough. The waiters and waitresses are rushing around everywhere and you have to wait ages for your drink to arrive which nearly always arrived after we finished our meal. The hotel needs more staff here definitely as the experience each time was not 5 * service.  The spa is incredible! Me and my husband had a package 1 hour hamman treatment in a couple room which was an experience! Followed by 30 min massage of your choice and then a 30 min full body massage. Incredible... I even fell asleep and snored according to my husband lol.  Check in was relatively straight forward. When we arrived the buffet was closing in 20 mins so the staff invited us to enjoy before check in and guarded our luggage which was very lovely of them. There is a deposit you have to pay for the room and extra for a pool towel card. We opted to not pay for the towels as we had our own and it was around ¬£53. This was a little silly as on check out they didn't even check our room before processing the refund of the deposit.  The shuttle bus into Marrakech is reliable and we used it to travel in but got a taxi back as the travel times back are far apart.  Overall a really pleasant stay for our mini moon break away at an affordable price. I would recommend to anyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jordan wax wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine is the best Bartender in marrakech! Great service and the best cocktails at the hotel. Make sure you visit him at the sports bar! However I can‚Äôt say the same for his pool playing abilities because I was destroying him every time lol
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Amandajc75 wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: We have just returned from the Be Live hotel in Marrakech. In some aspects the hotel would get a 5/5 - cleanliness staff food - amazing!! However some basic fundamental that are missing - lack of spoons and glasses...seriously what is that all about? Surely you would think a 5* hotel would have enough spoons and glasses for its customers. The queues at the main bar in the evening... one person behind the bar working his socks off and just getting on with it - you just know that if it was not an "all inclusive" hotel and people were paying for drinks there would be at least 3 or 4 people there to serve in excess of 100 people (possibly more) who populate the area in the evening. We had a swim up room which was beautiful and we loved even with the stench coming out from the shower which is obviously some form of drainage fault this didn't overly bother us (you just need to shut the shower door to contain it) as the room was amazing! Finally the nightlife - or lack of it - I know this is an adult only hotel but not everyone is in couples and even if you were the continual old love songs "lady in red / Just the two of us" played on the keyboard are just too much and it just created an overall lack of atmosphere at the hotel which could have brought so much to it in terms of customer experience. As the week went on we just started to dread the evening entertainment and in the end avoided it - not ideal for a holiday experience.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: reviewer of luxury wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Second visit to marrakech within 1 month. This was more of a adult holiday for a short break so we chose the Be live collection adults only. Stayed in a pool view room which was clean and mainly facing the garden which did work out well because the live entertainment carried on till quite late by the pool and was quite loud. So we were a little distance away.    There are 2 pools one which offered entertainment and the other was more the quiet pool. We enjoyed our time at the quiet pool that is what we had come for!    We had 3 rooms booked for the stay and Mohammed on reception was very helpful in trying to move us around so all the rooms were near to each other -very accommodating.    The all inclusive option is mainly the buffet. There is also a morrocan restaurant onsite but it is an additional cost if you stay less than 4 days. There is also the option of a snack bar by the pool. I have done a few all inclusive adult resorts and I was a little surprised with the limited meal options. But for our short stay it was sufficient.    I had read a few reviews before leaving about the service by the pool being very good. We had none - no one came and asked us for any drinks by the pool. We had to go to the bar everytime. The service was not to expectation after all that I had read.    With the all inclusive drinks menu they mainly offer the local brands. Most cocktails come out of a machine so they are too sweet and you cant even taste the alcohol. Local liquor rather than branded spirits.    Overall a lovely short stay but quite a basic all inclusive option for an adults only 5* resort.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This was our fourth time to Morocco and the first in this hotel. We had a great week which was very relaxing and the hotel amenities were excellent. The gym was ok and they have a spinning class and yoga class daily if you're interested.    The Spa was excellent and my wife and I felt very relaxed after a couple of treatments. The rooms are spacious and very modern and the food was very good...especially the deserts    Now for the negatives the a' la carte restaurant only has two 3 course menu options and you can only book once during your stay. The other bug bear was if you want drinks in your room you have to pay even though it's an 'All Inclusive' hotel...go figure!    That said they have wifi throughout the hotel and their service was very good. We would definitely go back:-)

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: KateRussell1410 wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Just got back from 8 days at BeLive Collection Marrakech. Overall lovely and relaxing holiday some of the reviews on here make things sound quite bad - they're not but there are a couple of quirks at the hotel!    We stayed in a suite room was lovely - great bed shower was good nice to have a bit of extra space and a balcony. Room was kept very clean by the hotel staff (as were all the premises). It is a lovely looking hotel grounds and gardens are beautiful didn't use the spa in the end but had a tour and that looked great bars nicely decorated and well kept pools were great and there's lots going on around the hotel. Bus that goes into Marrakech is very useful you have to book it through reception and it only leaves at certain times but it's a really good facility to be able to experience Marrakech itself.    If you're in a bedroom in the centre of the hotel (overlooking the area outside the dining room) be aware it will be noisy at night. This is the area where the entertainment takes place of an evening and from the noise levels the band may as well have been in our bedroom! Tended to be finished by midnight but if early nights and peace and quiet is your thing then ask for a room at the end of the hotel and front facing. We overlooked the pool where activities took place so it was quite noisy during the day too - not a huge problem as we tended to be at the quieter pool so that was fine but again take it into consideration if you'd like a quieter holiday. In fairness when we spoke to reception they did offer us another room to move to but I couldn't be bothered with the hassle of repacking and moving so we stayed put and just adapted our days around the noise.    Food could do with being a bit hotter the buffet is lukewarm at nearly every meal. Everything has been properly cooked I think it's a struggle they have because of the ambient temperature being so hot. Hotel badly needs to invest in more glassware! There's never enough for you to have the drink you order in the glass it should be served in (not a huge problem obviously but quite strange when you're handed rum and coke in a wine glass). The service in the bars and buffet could be better - this is not the staffs fault they're running around all over the place just think there needs to be more staff in these areas. As long as you're quite chilled and don't mind waiting for things it's not a problem.    The a la carte restaurant isn't really a la carte there's only 2 set menu options both traditional Moroccan meals. We had a lovely evening there the food was absolutely beautiful and the service was great - if trying some local cuisine is your thing then definitely go here (if you're more a pizza and chips person then probably don't bother).    Having seen other reviews I was quite nervous before we went - on the whole absolutely no reason to be! The biggest things people seem to worry about in reviews is that the tea and coffee facilities in the rooms don't come with milk - if you ask at the Snack Bar they will give you a small cup of milk to take to your room and that you have to pay a deposit on arrival. This is for towels and the condition the room is left in - can't speak about how easily the money comes back as we only checked out yesterday so not sure yet.    Overall it was a lovely relaxing holiday and a great base to see some of Marrakech from.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: Be live hotel it‚Äôs amazing hotel all the staff they are good and very nice! Specially Titiif was amazing and he was the best of the animation group. The rooms were very clean and a different design on your bed when you get back from the pool. A bit silly that you need to put a deposit off ‚Ç¨100 down for pool towels for your stay. Got the money back when we left.Was a fantastic holiday all round will definitely be back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: JOMO1 wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Superb holiday destination and fabulous hotel
Review_Text: Lovely reception area and a nice welcome from a traditional Berber gentleman offering mint tea. All communal spaces are lovely and clean and nicely presented. Beautiful spacious well appointed rooms and bathrooms. Fabulous friendly hard working staff. Lovely food with a big selection including fish and seafood steak and every other type of meat local specialities pizza pasta salads and desserts. Great regular shuttle bus into town. There are two large pools one sporty and lively and the other lovely and quiet (rowdy people will be asked to use the other pool by the pool attendant). The gardens are gorgeous and very well kept. Drinks and cocktails are lovely (as someone has complained yes they‚Äôre diluted at the pool but probably for safety reasons and you can always have the wine (lovely rose!) bottled beer (San Miguel or local Stork) or perhaps go to Benidorm instead!!!!!). There is nightly entertainment which is great but it could be a bit quieter for those who aren‚Äôt interested in it or even moved a little further away from the rooms perhaps. The hotel offers great disabled access with lifts and ramps wherever necessary. Definitely recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rory M wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We enjoyed 7 days here; fully satisfied the whole time.    The room was really nice larger than we expected and great bathroom - balcony always a good extra for a cigar and a late night drink (and drying towels/trunks). A few nice touches like the maids making up the bed in various designs each day were a welcome surprise.    The pools were great plenty of beds so you‚Äôre not crammed in with everyone (even at busy times) pool bar a nice novelty. Theres activities if you fancy it the staff made you aware of them but were happy to take no for an answer which is perfect. There‚Äôs plenty of stuff to do if you fancy it. Some of the music was a bit of a weird choice but I‚Äôm confident they‚Äôd change it if you spoke to them and it really bothered you    The staff were great throughout the hotel everyone was happy & helpful from the guy who checked us out at 6am to the waiting staff in the restaurant (Mourad - top man had our drinks sussed out by day 2 and kept them coming before we even sat down every day). The gentleman in the Lobby bar in the evening is also great (never got his name).    Food did get a bit familiar in the buffet but I‚Äôm not the most adventurous eater so not the best to comment on that really. I was still full after every meal and the snack bar does pizzas/burgers etc if you don‚Äôt fancy buffet.    The entertainment I mean some of it wasn‚Äôt for me some of it I really enjoyed - if you‚Äôve been to these places you know what it‚Äôs like.. it‚Äôs the same with every all inclusive I‚Äôve ever been to. The important thing is the drinks were kept flowing throughout all of it üòÇ    We went down into Marrakesh on the shuttle no dramas just booked it and that was that (although you‚Äôre met with people desperate to show you around - they will leave you alone if you make it clear you want to do your own thing. Nothing to do with the hotel just a tip). Also the time we were down there was a bit long between shuttles back so we had to get a cab but none of the cab drivers knew where the hotel was üòÇ. Luckily (for us) our driver figured it out by asking around all the cab stands he wasn‚Äôt going to charge us for that but we gave him a ‚Ç¨5 tip for his extra work & he couldn‚Äôt believe it. Something we noticed about Moroccan culture is most people are very friendly and really keen to help if they can. Great people.    We did 2 excursions which can be found/arranged in the lobby both went really smooth and were well organised. Really fun and I‚Äôd say fairly reasonably priced considering transport is included.    All in all we had a fantastic week we had plenty of rest and relaxation but equally it felt like we took advantage of most things the hotel has on offer and weren‚Äôt disappointed by any of it. The ‚ÄúAdults Only‚Äù element really distinguishes the dynamic of the hotel from others we‚Äôve been to I‚Äôm not anti-kids but I can‚Äôt deny it is nice to not have any about (especially the time of year we went).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Florence B wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Lovely hotel! And fantastic spa very relaxing great massages would highly recommend the hammam. The rooms were spacious and comfy the beds were amazing and the rooms so clean! The buffet was always fully stocked and with so many choices and all the food so delicious. The waiters in the buffet brought our drinks very quickly and were very kind to us. We went to the quieter pool with the swim up bar as the other pool can get loud and there were lots of people smoking around us. There was always a guy near the quieter pool to help move or put up umbrellas and always plenty of seats even if you came at 1pm. Service was slightly slow at the snack bar but only if you were rude as long as you are polite and nice then you‚Äôll have great service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Kellyzxcvbnm wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: A beautiful resort stunning rooms and wonderful hospitality.  Having read some of the other reviews I can concur that service is very slow... if you‚Äôre referring to the fact that your drink is on the table within about 30 seconds of the waiter spotting you! Sometimes even less.    Azdine the bartender at the Lobby Bar who we considered to be the mascot of Be Live can not be faulted. The most charming smiley and helpful person. This gentleman most certainty deserves a raise. I have never seen someone run with glasses on a tray without dropping a single one; only at the lobby bar. The strawberry mojito is a must!    The rooms are very clean spacious and modern. I will be sad to leave our beloved bed... unbelievably comfortable...must find out where they get their pillows from.  Pools and outdoor spaces are kept very clean and you can get fresh pool towels everyday. We mainly used the relaxation pool which is the quieter of the two pools perfect for a leisurely dip and some reading not to mention with a swim up bar. The other pool has plenty of activities including water polo aqua aerobics and mojito parties. They even do archery no don‚Äôt be silly that‚Äôs not in the pool.    The restaurant is open most of the day and in the few hours they‚Äôre getting ready for change over there is the snack bar that serves food. Plenty of traditional Moroccan food to try; beef tajine couscous Moroccan soup and more. You‚Äôve also got your classics; pizza chips and chicken burgers. I also noticed that the chef catered for a couple with some more specific dietary needs.    Extras... must not forget the extras. Free shuttle from the hotel into the M√©dina and New Town. In the hotel there are DJ/Karaoke/Dancers/Professional singers on every night. And then there is the spa... a little pocket of heaven hidden in marrakech who knew. As soon as we walked in we felt relaxed and welcomed. We couldn‚Äôt help buy a few massage treatments a Hammam and Full body massage for both of us 1200MAD equivalent to ¬£100. (¬£100 for BOTH yes you heard right 4 treatments for ¬£100) this also included full use of the spa pool steam and sauna. There is also a gym in there somewhere but to be honest who is going to the gym on holiday!    This holiday was exactly what we didn‚Äôt know we wanted.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: casawillowbrooke wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Excellent Staff a quiet oasis in Marrakech
Review_Text: We had a lovely stay at this hotel the staff were wonderful Hassan Leila and Raja in the restaurant and Azdine in the bar who was always smiling only to name a few.  The room was comfortable and quiet and maid service was good.  Overall the food was good a little more choice would be better especially at lunchtime offering cold meets/ cheeses to go with salads. Pool areas were good one with activities and a quiet pool with a swim up bar plastic glasses need replacing. Plenty of sun beds parasols and cabanas.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Hellyb123red wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Shortly before the start of our holiday I became concerned that the majority of 5* reviews on TripAdvisor were from people who had only ever posted one review and were potentially fake or linked to the hotel in some way. (It later transpired that the fabulous entertainment team where great at asking for reviews and many of the guests agreed to create an account and leave a review there was no pressure but you could tell they were proud of the hotel and wanted potential guests to know)    I was very relieved when we arrived we were greeted at our taxi and at the reception desk by very welcoming staff.    The reception was clean and modern. Arrived at 11am and had to wait until 3pm to check in which was to be expected but we had full access to pool food and bar.    The rooms were great clean in good repair modern and large. My mum is disabled and though given a disabled room it didn‚Äôt meet her requirements - a quick remark to reception and her room was changed straight away with no quibble. The rooms had a fridge and tea making facilities. Bath and shower. Though if you are travelling as friends be warned you can see each other shower!    The rooms with their own pool looked lovely. Worth the extra cost for a treat. Though they aren‚Äôt private and you‚Äôll get to know your neighbour well.    It was Mum‚Äôs birthday when away. They noticed by date on passport and made her feel very special. I won‚Äôt say what they did as don‚Äôt want to ruin surprise for others!    The two pools were fantastic. One was tranquil and relaxing with the swim up bar. The other was fun noisy and full of life...you pick how you want to spend your day. The enclosed sun beds looked great but looking closer they are a little tired and the mattresses are stained. Not appealing. The tiled area around the pool is so slippery - go careful my dad took a tumble. Poolside toilets were immaculate.    Lots of fun activities - aqua aerobics archery Arabic lessons bowls volleyball darts golf etc again up to you if you want to join in. The entertainment team worked hard.    Husband and father both enjoyed using the gym though it wasn‚Äôt air conditioned.    The food was delicious so much choice mostly all healthy. I ate a lot but gained no weight as it was all fresh meats salads and vegetables though pasta and pizza available and lots of naughty pudding choices. Not much variety and no themed food nights but you won‚Äôt starve...waiting staff very attentive and Moroccan wine is actually very nice!    The Moroccan restaurant was a nice treat far too much food but lovely. Though most of the food can be eaten in main restaurant. Shame you can only go once.    Snack bar offered burgers chips and sandwiches which were also tasty.    They had themed nights some of which were odd. ‚ÄòWhite night‚Äô (where you were meant to wear white clothes no one did) ‚Äòkaraoke night‚Äô ‚Äòoriental night‚Äô - expected East Asian food (none served) so not sure what the theme was.    Lots of drinks on the menu they will make pretty much anything you ask for if they have the ingredients. Azdine was particularly fantastic great at remembering what we liked to drink and so smiley and warm.    The bar is lovely and evening entertainment is mainly classy and not intrusive or over the top. Live background music or lounge singers.    Sports bar was more like a youth club but good for a late drink and some pool.    Money exchange at the reception desk was a great rate.    The shuttle bus is a large air con coach it‚Äôs free and very handy! 20 mins to town.    I dropped my nail polish and the glass cracked and cut my hand badly the bright pink polish went on the two small hand towels. I confessed my accident and offered to pay for replacement towels. They were cheap white old towels that would cost no more than ¬£5 to replace but they tried to charge me ¬£20 a towel and comprised on ¬£10 a towel. It was an accident but it was a little disappointing they tried to make me pay ¬£40!    There is a hotel nurse who cleaned my wound at no cost.    ¬£100 cash given to reception on arrival as a deposit and the same money was returned - but make sure you have cash to avoid a card transaction fee.    A few extra staff to reduce wait at bar and maybe offer poolside drinks service...that would make it bliss!    Not a luxury 5* hotel but compared to its rivals it deserves 4.5-5*
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Very mixed reviews start with the positives  Rooms clean  Animation good  Rooms lovely as we upgraded sadly no milk for the coffee and not fresh water put in mini bar every day    Sadly arrived hear on the Sunday was violenty sick on the Monday so was in hotel room for 2 days food just didn‚Äôt agree with me  Not 5 Star u have to queue for a while for a drink as only one bar member on  The bar is swarming with bees  The staff in restaurant not very friendly they only want to help the French someone mornings waited ages for coffee  Not aloud no drinks in room no room service if you want to take a drink u need to use a paper cup like a 5 year old  Food not great always cold the best thing is prob breakfast the resultant shocking went there for 3 course meal don‚Äôt no what they tried to serve us but no way was it lamb  Think this hotel has a long way to go before it can be a 5 star sadly wouldn‚Äôt return
