Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: bethandboo wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Just came back from 5 nights away here.  First of all staff and hotel are lovely very friendly and the hotel is always being cleaned and grounds being looked after.  Rooms are amazing beds are massive and cleaners come in every day and seemed very friendly.  Entertainment in the day is good always fun stuff to do we loved archery aqua gym and water polo. Having yoga at 5pm when it‚Äôs 40 degrees outside is not ideal though should be in the morning.  Entertainment in the evening some evenings are good with shows on other evenings not so great just singers or a dj.  Drink - beer is San Miguel in bottles or stork (there own beer) other alcohol is definitely watered down but just ask for double measures and you‚Äôll get more drunk then.  Pools - lovely always sun loungers so no need to get up early. Having the quiet pool with a pool bar probably not the best idea though. (You get told to go to the loud pool if your making to much noise in the quiet pool by the way)  Food - Buffet is okay not that much variety however I always found something to eat and if not there is a pasta station. Snack bar for lunch is okay but not the best food. Al a carte is the worst I‚Äôve ever been too yes it‚Äôs Moroccan cuisine and I did eat most of it but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend bothering to go it‚Äôs not a proper al a carte.  Would we return probably not but great holiday all around.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Tom O'Sullivan wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I travelled to Marrakesh with my girlfriend for a week in the sun.    The hotel is nearly perfect a few things to work on but not the end of the world    The pool team were great especially Karim and titif they managed to keep the place smiling the whole time.    The bar pool is headed up by Mochine and he is brilliant he really made you feel special and was always on the ball with your drinks and with food.    The most important comment of mine is about someone I am sure Is forgotten a lot. The barman in the sports bar who works alone in there made the holiday even more special he would make you come back to the hotel just because of his service.    The rooms are very clean and the maids always leave a different shape on the sheets which is fab.    It is a 20 minute cab in to Marrakesh city centre and the hotel staff will  Help you get a cab    The few negatives    Service at bars can be slow as there is probably not enough staff at these bars but once again the staff do there best    There was sometimes not enough glasses at night but just keep hold of yours and take it back to the bar yourself    I have seen a lot of people moaning about staff being rude on trip advisors my advice is be nice to the staff and say thank you as that can help and they are just people trying to do there job!    Fab hotel and will recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Get_away_fr0m_it_all wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Firstly this is a very nice hotel with lovely well kept gardens very nice bedrooms and amenities and some excellent service staff. However it is hugely let down in a few key areas.  Unnecessary Amministrative processes  Check is in a long drawn out process. The towel deposit system is crazy as is the system for getting and returning the towels. We went to the spa and asked for the charge to be put on our room but they wouldn't do it as they said the spa was separate (and made me walk back to the room to get money before they would start the treatment) this also happened in the shops which means having to carry cash or cards- not ideal for a pool holiday.  Bars  This has been stated in many reviews but the hotel seem to be doing nothing about the fact that the bars are understaffed. There is only ever one person on the pool bar and he frequently runs out of glasses which makes the wait times even longer. One afternoon I went to the swim up bar I counted 11 people ahead of me to be served so decided to walk up to the snack bar same thing here a huge queue waiting for food and drinks. On the way back I noticed that the lounge bar was empty so nipped in there to ask for a bottle of water and despite there being nobody in the lounge other than the waiter and myself he refused to serve me because I had a bikini on and the lounge policy is you must be wearing a top- crazy!  In another bizarre incident we had finished dinner and were going to walk across to the lounge to listen to the music. When we tried to leave the restaurant carrying our drinks (rather than leaving them and reordering in the lounge) A member of staff refused to let me out of the restaurant carrying my glass as it belonged to the restaurant and not the lounge bar because they were slightly different shapes. When I said I thought that was crazy and was a waste of a drink and of the waiters time in the lounge he got very angry and shouted ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt disrespect our restaurant!‚Äô I hardly think that taking a different shaped glass 5 ft across the corridor into the hotels own lounge bar is disrespecting anyone!  This hotel could be 5 star with better management and processes. They really should consider that most 5 star customers aren‚Äôt bothered about stealing towels or wine glasses or running off without paying for their massages so perhaps instead of having unnecessary administrative hoops for clients to jump through they should concentrate more on customer service and encouraging guests to enjoy their time spent at the hotel with more staff on areas that matter
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: emilligan5 wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights and that was about right length of stay the hotel grounds are well looked after and clean it was a nice short break within a short distance of visiting the city    Positives:  Free shuttle bus into the centre was really good with 2 stops one near the gardens and one near the M√©dina. Guest relations were very helpful at helping us plan a route to see what we wanted to see  The sports bar - really liked this place and was good fun with good drinks  There is a split of a ‚Äòquiet pool‚Äô and a fun pool which was nice but I think with the pool bar in the ‚Äòquiet pool‚Äô they‚Äôve got it the wrong way round  The lobby bar staff were lovely and made great drinks  Plenty of sun loungers and comfortable sun beds    Improvements:  They need to label their food for allergens (being gluten free this would have been very helpful and more options would have been nice too!) and have a better selection especially for vegetarians  The pool bar - needs more staff service was really slow and they need more cups constantly running out. They also need to sort the wasp problem at one point there were wasps trapped inside a syrup bottle. üò©    Would recommend for a short stay at the right price
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: jamie s wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Me and my wife stayed here for a week. We have stayed in many 5 star hotels and always been impressed with food and drink on offer.    Bad points  The food in buffet area was awfulnot a great choice cold and undercooked meats I.e pink chicken.  The a la carte is the worst a la carte with have been In only about 10 people eating and we noticed that nearly everyone was sending full plates back. The fish soup was disgusting the mains tasted like they had been cooked in diesel. We left before desert was served and we were not the only ones.  The snack bar is an absolute hygiene nightmare. When I ordered a beer the waiter picked a glass off the bar were all dirty plastic glasses were left supposedly ready to clean. Oh no he just poured my beer straight into a dirty glass which some one had obviously already had drank from. Then when I said I wasn't drinking out of that because it was dirty he took it off Me swilled a cocktail plastic cup in water underneath bar and put my beer in cocktail glass( like a martini glass shape) not what you want your beer in. I then decided to give that a miss. My Mrs got her cocktail in a paper coffee cup 1 day as they had run out of plastic ones. This happened everyday and not just with us. The hotel was quiet as well as not full to capacity.  I used the gym to be fair it wasn't bad but I wanted a water which was availbe but just placed in a basket and no fridge so red hot water for all gym users and to be honest which ever bar you wanted bottled water from it was always warm as they did not put enough in fridge.  The bar staff were ignorant and rude except for Mochine and whatever the man's name was who work at lobby bar in night and would bring drinks to table( always smiling)  The drinks were not named but we knew this and unfortunately horrible in taste I.e gin vodka.  Good points  The weather  The room  The beer( from lobby bar out of a proper glass)  3 entertainment staff  Leaving to come Home!!!    Sorry but trust me  this is not 5 star nor 4 nor 3 . It may look good on the eye( I fell for the looks) but regards to food drink and service I can only give 2 star at a massive push. Actually 1.5...    Oh and swim up bar... What a waste of time that is. So depressing no atmosphere over there and staff don't want to be there .  My biggest advice to English tourists is stay away at all costs even if this hotel is cheap. It's cheap for a reason !!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Aliiise wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: A place to relax and be in calm.
Review_Text: Great place to relax and do nothing! Spend your days beside the pool and drink light cocktails - run away from busy life and just do nothing. Service and staff very nice and friendly always smiley and welcoming. Food was amazing good mix of Moroccan and Italian I would say... or just European but we did have some sushi as well... so very good mix of everything!!! Loved it! Great to experience the Moroccan restaurant that was available for bookings. If you spent at least 4 days in the hotel you could book 1 evening. They had 2 menus of 3 course meals and both of them where lovely and rich of flavour. Good thing - they had a lot of simile food in the main dining room as well... so 1 evening is restaurant is completely enough. The only lacking point I felt was the beverages in the bar area. Of course alcohol. I‚Äôm fine it's the local alcohol and I never wanted to buy any extra or a better brand. But For a 5 star hotel I was imagining the cocktails to be more creative and more exciting. There where 4 bars (lobby bar snack bar pool bar and sports bar) - all was almost the same and felt a little lacking.  Our room was fantastic and lovely room was cleaned every day I loved how the lady every day made a different ornament on the bed - a bow or wrapped it differently. Lovely.  We spent there 7 days. It was nice and relaxing but sometimes i found it a little boring. Entertainment in the evenings where relaxing and calm as for me I some nights needed some disco or party as I was away with my husband with no kids üòÇ

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: British Reviewer wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: The Worst Holiday I‚Äôve Ever Been On
Review_Text: I‚Äôm going to try and keep this review short and give you what I think you need to know if your looking to stay here as I could most probably write a book about it.    Quick not before starting we booked to stay here for a lovely relaxing break for 11 nights and we left 6 days early !    First this is classed as a 5 star hotel. On first glance the lobby yes looks very flash and fancy. But looking 5 star doesn‚Äôt mean it is.    If you arrive before 3pm like we did you will not get a key to your room only a wristband and told to go get lunch. To which we personally weren‚Äôt shown where anything was yet when being on holiday we saw multiple times couples been shown around after check in. On arrival there is a ¬£85 deposit you can give in cash that goes into a envelope and is given back on checkout but please note any notes with writing on they won‚Äôt accept for some reason.    I‚Äôve broken down the rest of the reviews into sections.    ROOM  Rooms are probably the best part of this hotel cleaned everyday comfy beds nice bathroom and if your the right side of the resort by pool bar pool it‚Äôs nice a quiet but you can hear every step someone takes below and beside you so if you want a early night good luck. If your room is the other side by the loud pool you will have very loud rap music all day. Tea and coffee in room with fresh water in fridge everyday but no milk.    STAFF  Ermmm. Where do I start ! I think we can say out of this army of staff 2 of them where ok ! We was either ignored spoken to like trash or rudely served. I like to add this only happen to us because we are a same sex couple. Everyone else we saw had a very very warm welcome and offered drinks and chair pulled out.    SERVICE  Horrendous by far the worst I‚Äôve ever experienced. We had multiple days of having no drinks offered to us at the Resturant again everyone did just not us. Blanked and when we had to go and ask our drinks where nearly on the floor after the way they chucked them on the table. Every time we walked in the Resturant or bar no hello welcome nothing but yet a couple behind get a hello. Snack bar by bother 6 people working there no service for 25 minutes by then that was just us others served straight away.    CLEANLINESS  Great clean room and gardens are kept well. Pool was the dirtiest pool I‚Äôve been it. We was there for 6 days and by day 6 it was clear it still hadn‚Äôt been cleaned. Black dirty floating around.    FOOD  If you don‚Äôt eat fish or beef with bones in it good luck. I eat neither and I really struggled all (hot) food was luck warm or cold. Same every day just recycled meat and vegetables. Food not labelled so you think your eating rice with mix veg until you find the whole of the ocean mixed in it.    ACTIVITIES/ENTERTAINMENT  Boring nothing to do. Entertainment doesn‚Äôt start until 10pm and even then bored and dull.    SPA/GYM  Gym was good clean all worked a lot smaller than the picture and not cold in there. Spa no free so if you think you get that included you won‚Äôt.    We honestly felt ignored here treated like s**t and had the worst service because we are a Same sex couple. If your a same sex couple please don‚Äôt go here and waste your money. Even if all the service side of things didn‚Äôt happen. I still wouldn‚Äôt call this a 5 star more like a 3 star.    We spent over ¬£2000 worked our asss off to pay for this dream holiday to leave 6 days early because we felt uneasy. And not welcomed. Also to turn up to 5 star hotel with strict rules and food times and with nothing going for it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Toohonest wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Great Hotel!!!    Hospitality:-  Initially greeted us with mint tea and cake/biscuit upon our arrival.  Accommodating to all our request...e.g iron drinks etc.    Very modern and clean hotel  Hotel room and balcony are a generous size and the gardens well manicured.  Resturants and snack bar serve a good variety of choices and are open at good hours and cheif is present to make certain dishes at your request.  Staff also arefriendly.    Entertainment- there is an activities pool and a relaxing pool and they do not effect each other at all. Good range of activities e.g archery mini golf aqua aerobics and mojito parties.    Sports bar open until 1pm with board games snooker and TV and sandwiches.    There is night entertainment daily at 10pm prompt e.g belly dancing and sax player    Minor con:-  query some of the staff always understood our request because at times got an order of drinks that we didn't request for or was forgotten. They would benefit from knowing exactly what is requested instead of trying to guess sometimes or just saying 'yes'.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ftb wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Everything with the hotel is amazing we upgraded ourselfs with a swim-up room for 400dh per day and it was well worth the money. The service is amazing and the food is very fresh and there‚Äôs a good balance between moroccan and international dishes.    The most important thing to mention...THE ANIMATION TEAM! Our stay would not be this good without them. Titif Fatima-Zahra Mostapha and karim you are the best!!!    We will be back next summer!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Simo wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Love this hotel! Amazing service and really wonderful people working here especially the entertainment team: Tittif Fati Mustafa and Karim. They were kind and helpful whenever u needed something. They actually made this trip so enjoyable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Reeki wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We have just returned from a fabulous stay at this lovely hotel. The staff were all friendly and helpful. A special mention to Tariq in the a la carte restaurant the food was authentic Morrocan and delicious and he was very attentive and helpful on both of our visits there.  The food on offer each day in the main restaurant was plentiful each day different dishes with lots of variety always well cooked and tasty.  There are two pool areas both with plenty of sun loungers umbrellas and cabanas. The only problem was the shortage of plastic glasses.  Our room was very comfortable and the whole hotel was spotlessly clean.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Daisyflower93 wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Hotel was rated 5 star. I am very well traveled and have stayed in many 5 star hotels across the world and at best I would give this hotel 3. Don‚Äôt get me wrong the building rooms and pool themselves are lovely and very clean but this is where the good points end. The food is average at best and the ‚ÄúA la carte‚Äù restaurant was honestly the worst food I have ever consumed in my life. As for alcohol at the pool bars it is watered down/rationed and the service behind the bar is unfriendly. That is me being kind. I think we saw the bar tender smile once in the whole weeks stay. Some staff were fairly pleasant but most were miserable and inattentive. We felt pressured to have photos taken by the poolside by a ‚Äúphotographer‚Äù which we would have had to have payed for and although we politely declined we where still continually harassed about it. The animation team appeared to just sit around and gossip all day and were about as exciting as watching paint dry. Which brings me to my final point. The awful night life. Absolutely no atmosphere what so ever and again average at best. Would never return to this hotel and have been put off from ever returning to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Matt C wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Spent a week here in May 2018.    Food and drinks are excellent you can get food all day in one form or another. Drinks are good.    The whole hotel is calm and peaceful and getting a sunbed is not a problem. The place is spotlessly clean throughout.    There are free return coaches to the markets in Marrakesh. We got lost and missed our coach and had to get a cab back! It only cost ¬£20 and added to the whole chaotic experience of visiting the markets.    Staff are friendly and helpful when asked for anything.    Would definitely return

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Michael P wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Ok it is definately not 5 star 3 star at best. our first morning the room flooded after next door room took a shower this happened frequently on first floor. Wifi is very poor. limited connectivity in rooms on first floor and around pool. Pool bar service slow and confused more staff required. Food at snack bar good but again rather confused service you dont allways get what you ordered. Food in main resurant OK but food gets cold quickly once on show. Main bar service very good but only local non brand drinks free so this is not good for a so called 5 star all inclusive experience. Rooms clean and maid service excellent. Golf coursed here are fantastic and not busy (July). Our driver to golf was excellent and allways on time. Marrakech is a fun place to visit rather dirty in places Medina busy and intersting. Would visit again for Golf but maybe try a different Hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: Mohcine is the best barman in Marrakech he made us feel like we re home but its not. Mohcine best cocktail maker. When ur in this hotel ask for him. Im really impressed he speaks 3 langages ans Always smiling we spent the best Moment ever in his pr√©sence

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Thank you to the animation team (Karim fati and Salim )üòçüòçüòç
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: 1Barann wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Firstly I cannot believe some of the negative comments I have read about this hotel. My experience was so positive. The staff were amazing so friendly. I thought I would have issues as I don't speak French but no. From check in to check out the staff were super. My special thanks go to Abdessamad and Raaga in the Restaurant who looked after me for the 10 days I was there. I was always greeted with friendly smiles and didn't have to ask for drinks as they were there in an instant. Around the pool were Mustafa the pool boy and Titif who I did stretch with most mornings. Special thank you to Karim who very patiently helped me with my archery skills until I could hit the bulls eye!    I asked for a quiet room and it was perfect. Okay there was no view but the room was spacious clean and quiet. Bed was really comfy and the shower was powerful and hot. Everything I needed. As for food I can't say too much as I am happy with fruit and salad and there was plenty of that. As for tea making facilities although no milk was provided this was not a problem. I just went to the bar and asked for tea bags and milk to take to the room and they were more than happy to do this.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Magolizen34 wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine - Very good employee nice person! Absolutely Great 5 stars service.  Amrad - Very good employee 5 stars service.  Hotel in geral was very cool Nice weather very organized very good food nothing bad to tell.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Steph B wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Had a great stay at this beautiful hotel. We did have an issue with our first room 1011 as after retuning for the afternoon it smelt of sewage which got worse when my daughter had a shower. This was promptly resolved by reception who moved is to the first floor 5206. Rooms are modern and spacious and beds are comfy.    Plenty of sun beds around the pool and we managed to get a cabana most days. There were also lots of parasols for shade. As others have mentioned the lack of plastic glasses at the pool bar was an issue and I felt sorry for the young lad serving.    Food was delicious ..... best I have had on an all inclusive hotel. Cocktails were divine and they made my daughter expresso martinis which are her favourite. We got some smaller notes from reception and tipped our favourite staff which was well appreciated.    Evening entertainment was a little disappointing. It was sometimes difficult to get a seat and 2 nights there was just a DJ playing. WiFi was ok in reception but patchy in other parts of the hotel.    Despite the few small issues we had a fabulous time and would love to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: sareenab22 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Booked this hotel for a week. First of all our flight was awful - do not book with Royal Air Morocco. Our baggage was left in Casablanca and we had to collect it the next day. Apparently this has been happening a lot recently so book with a reliable airline.    The hotel was lovely the room was clean and the facilities were great. With regards to the food I found it to be cold most days perhaps keeping it constantly warm would be better - no one likes a hot omelette with cold beans and sausages! The staff weren't very friendly either and they were nicer to those who either spoke French or Arabic. They never came over to ask if we would like any drinks with our food and when we did ask it would take them 15 minutes to bring a coke! The waiters were quite forgetful. There was one guy in particular who was very rude I went to approach him for a drinks before I said anything he started saying "Coke? Coke? Coke?" When all I wanted was a glass of wine he had no manners so I did my best to avoid him any time I went for food. The Moroccan restaurant was also very basic and the food didn't taste very good. I think the hotel would benefit from either more restaurants or more variety in the buffet. The evening entertainment was also very good! With live music and belly dancers.    Our rooms were lovely and very clean although the housekeepers weren't consistent and the last couple of days they didn't clean our room. They provide teas and coffee in the room but when I called and asked for milk the receptionist was quite rude and said I had to go to the kitchen and get some. It would also be better if they provided water instead of ask having to ask for it perhaps putting a few bottles in the mini fridge.    The hotel was nice overall. There's a shuttle bus which takes you to the city which was nice. The cost of a taxi to the airport was 250 dirham which I thought was a lot for a 20 minute journey. It is a great place to relax for a few days. I think the hotel needs to consider the small things manners included.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: travelsingh wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We went away last minute for an escape and celebration and had emailed the hotel before hand to see if there was anything special they could do for us to celebrate and was very pleased that although they could not promise me anything they did reply back to me.    We had booked a standard double room but was very pleased upon arrival to be told that we had been upgraded to a pool view double room. The room was very clean and fresh looking and there was an amazing cake that was there for us when we got there. This was a lovely touch.    The hotel is great and there is plenty to keep most people happy. The entertainment team work hard to kepp everyone smiling and there was never a rush for us to scramble for sun beds there were plenty available and always managed to find somewhere to sit.    The drinks and the waiting staff were all pleasant and the Mojito's are some of the best i've ever had. We really enjoyed the food every evening in the buffet restaurant and was happy not to see chips but a range of other foods available.    The entertainment was good and managed to watch all the football I wanted to in the sports bar even when it was not open I asked the entertainment team who were more than happy to open up and put it on.    The free shuttle bus available to get into the Marrakech centre it was great to visit the markets and see the Mosque.    There is a steep charge for late check out but we were very lucky to avoid this as I had cheekily emailed to ask if we could have longer for free and the lovely reception team allowed me to have an extra few hours for free this really meant we were able to enjoy our last day. And for the final few hours we had pre booked ourselves into the lovely spa for a Rhassoul Hammam and massage treatment.    Thank you Be live for a wonderful stay and will hopefully be back to see you again soon :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Mark J wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Excellent hotel food is great buffet but plenty of different options each meal time including a cooking station (changes as per meal omelettes for breakfast etc)  Staff can't do enough for you. Travelling as a solo traveller but never feel alone. 5* and highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Alexander R wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: I would recommend the Be Live Collection providing the food was improved and more staff in the bar areas. The hotel itself was clean and staff very pleasant which made up for the hotels shortfalls. I would recommend if food was improved
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: mariemurray wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We had a wonderful experience at this resort. All the staff were always so cheerful and friendly!!! Every time we came for a meal the waiting staff recognised us and spoke to us by name which added a wonderful personal touch. The staff at reception pool and the cleaning staff were equally friendly and helpful! On our last night Omar and Amine in particular were fantastic and did their best to tend to our every need! Our waiter also took a personal interest when one of our party became ill and had to leave the table which we appreciated a lot! Everyone made us feel so welcome and we can't wait to come back! We would recommend staying here 100 per cent! We have been to Marrakech a number of times now and this is one of our favourite places to stay! Best wishes and our heartfelt thanks to all the staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ko1995 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine is great! I would definitely recommend the sports bar. The hotel staff are all very attentive as well as the animation team. The hotel grounds are excellent and the pool is nice üëçüèº. I would recommend the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Cruiser55215698137 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine is excellent best service in Marrakech. Make sure you check out the sports bar if you stay at Belive. The hotel is very nice and the service is excellent. The food is great and the staff are all very attentive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lisa-Marie M wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We arrived home Saturday after a weeks stay in this beautiful resort. We were greeted by the staff on reception where we were given our bands and keys etc. We paid the deposit of 1000 dirham which was held on our card for the towel cards (this was returned as soon as we handed these back and handed back our bands at the end of the holiday).    The food in the main buffet was lovely definitely something for everyone lots of meat fish veg potatoes etc good for someone who is quite fussy. I didn‚Äôt find a problem at all with any of the food and both my partner and I found the desserts absolutely fabulous! The √° la cart√® was pretty nice but I found the staff took ages to come to our table and they only offered 2 set menus which wasn‚Äôt amazing and we overall much preferred the buffet restaurant.    Every evening we went into the lobby bar the bar staff were amazing shout out to Azedione the happy waiter who continuously kept our drinks topped up! The loveliest guy in the world and always smiling.    The sports bar Mohcine made the greatest cocktails ever and was ever so friendly. Always willing to do make you cocktail after cocktail and open until 1am. There are also sandwiches available if you are hungry later on in the evening and lots of games on offer at the bar!    We stayed by the relaxing pool until 2pm when the sun hit out swim up pool and stayed up until 8/8.30pm. The pool bar was also lovely and it was nice to have a drink whilst also in the pool.    We took the free shuttle bus into the market however where it drops you off is around a 15 minute walk to the Medina where the market is. Be careful for fake tour guides offering you a trip everywhere for ¬£1. We were suggested by another family in the hotel an app called Maps.me which downloads the map on WiFi in the hotel and you can pin where you get off the bus and use it to direct you back without using mobile data. It was a great suggestion and really helped us otherwise we could not have got back to the bus.    Every member of staff was lovely and said hello etc always happy to help even the maid who cleaned our room. It was very friendly there.    Overall we had such an amazing holiday and really really enjoyed ourselves. We loved Marrakech and we would love to return. Thank you Be Live for an amazing week we had such a great time and feel like you deserve all the recognition.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: manhatten15 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Just returned from a 5 day break here with my fianc√©e all we wanted was to relax for a few days somewhere hot.  The hotel is not a 5 star I'd give it 3.5 to 4 max. I found the grounds and pool area nice enough but the 2 bars had only 1 or sometime 2 servers and it didn't look very clean the plastic cups were dirty most of the time. I found the staff to be a little stand offish they worshipped the French guests but I didn't find them friendly or approachable at all. The rooms were ok and the bed was very comfortable. There is nothing in the mini bar which most 5 start hotels have and there is no room service. The cleaning was inconsistent one day they only made the bed and didn't empty the bins the next they didn't leave ANY towels when I called for some it took 40 mins for someone to bring us some. I found the entertainment boring and the hotel is literally in the middle of nowhere so you have to get a taxi everywhere.  We checked out at 12:00 but were not leaving for the airport until 19:00. I was told that I had to remove my wrist band and if I wanted to use the facilities and have anything to eat or drink before leaving for the airport then I'd have to pay! Never have I experienced this at a 5 start hotel. I wanted to have a shower before going to the airport and they wouldn't even let me use a towel. So the saying is true; you get what you pay for and as it was such a bargain trip it was ok to just sit and relax in the sun in a very quiet and laid back hotel. If I ever return to Marrakesh I'd book somewhere else to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jamie saitch wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine works at the sports bar which is open 6pm-1am best bar tender always keeping everyone happy and entertained such a lovely lad recommend coming here as the entertainment after dinner is not that good. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: ZoeVBC wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We stayed at the Be Live Marrakech in June 2019. It is a lovely hotel but there are a few teaks that would really give it the 5*'s that it rates itself as.    The rooms were spacious beds comfy and the bathrooms well fitted. Balcony facing the car park wasn't ideal but the road was practically silent so no problems there.    Food was great all buffet but huge choice and fresh and tagine pizza bread fish veggies salads and meats on offer every day so its a good variety.    Table service with drinks was a bit hit and miss. Some waiters are excellent... some not so much.    Pools are lovely if a little cold but perfect for a hot day. Loungers are comfy and there are lots of cabanas too.    there is a free coach to the Medina running several times a day which is fab.    The pool towel guest wrist band and check in and out process were all bizarre and purely administrative - seemingly pointless. Elevating the service and streamlining these processes would make it a far nicer customer experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Georgia P wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We visited here just last week and were very happy with the holiday. Most of the staff were friendly the cleaners were great they changed the whole bedding every day and refilled the little free shower things. The resort was in pristine condition. The only things I would knock from this hotel was the deposit and the snack bar. When you arrive you are told you must pay a deposit of ¬£50GBP for the room and an extra ¬£20 if you would like use of the hotel towels for the pool. The money isn't held incase anything happens it does get taken and as it stands we still haven't had it refunded yet. When the receptionist refunded it they dont even check the room incase anything is damaged I see this as being pointless. The snack bar... with the resort being spotless you are very restricted as to what food/glasses you can take into certain area. The snack bar is located near the 'loud pool' and I would call it a restaurant. You have to take a seat and they come and bring you a menu and you order (this takes about 15 minutes each time though) then they make your food which again takes about 20 minutes. Every other all inclusive I've stayed at you usually get a panini which is grilled in front of you and takes max 10 mins. This isn't the best when you literally want to grab something quickly. Everything else was great the food drinks rooms the two different pools. Would definitely stay again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Beth Q wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Brilliant animation team made our stay loads better had an amazing time. The activities they provide are great such as pool parties water polo etc. The food and drink are good and the restaurant/bar staff are lovely. Titif made us feel very welcome and provided us with a good laugh and entertainment!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: LoveTravel579497 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Not worth the money as not 5 star. Other guests agreed and 1 described as a 4 star with a spa.    The hotel staff for the most part were helpful and friendly but the service lacked at the snack bar and pool bar. It was slow and they got your order wrong every time. They didn't greet you or talk with you  The evening staff at the lobby bar however were very friendly and the service was great. The standard of drink was better too however still more choice required.    Yes the hotel is modern and very clean but it lacked any sense of tradition or culture or splashes of colour. Everything was neutral and plain.    There was no room service or poolside service.    The hotel is in the middle of nowhere so traveling is via taxi or the free shuttle. You cannot walk anywhere.  It's a 15 minutes bus ride to city centre.    I would recommend to stay here but lower expectations to a high quality 3 star.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Dani wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine amazing bartender. Makes you feel very welcome. Highly recommend visiting this bar. Life and soul of the bar. Mohcine always makes sure we are taken care of. Lots of games football table and pool so always entertained.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: thommo34 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Looks can be deceiving, definitely not 5 star!!
Review_Text: We visited Be Live Collection in April 2019 for a long weekend. Having already visited Marrakech we opted not to stay in a Riad in the old city this time and went for the '5 Star' out of town hotel instead.    Located about half an hour from the airport on the other side of the city the location is ok as we wanted to relax by the pool and venture into the city occasionally. There is a courtesy bus from the hotel to La Mamounia Hotel near the main square and it takes about 20-25 minutes several times a day but you need to book in advance as it gets busy at certain times.    First impressions of the hotel were good the lobby was large and impressive check-in was pretty quick. We where shown to our room the hotel is only 2 stories so its more spread out with rooms built around little courtyards. Our room was a little walk from the reception it was clean and a good size with everything you would need.    There are two swimming pools (both unheated and absolutely ice cold in April!) a quiet one with swim up bar and a bigger activity pool with music and events. There is also a sports bar with pool table etc and big screen a pool snack bar between the two pools a lobby bar that in the evening has load music and entertainment. The main buffet restaurant and a smaller a la carte restaurant I'll come back to these.    Our room lock stopped working while we were there and twice I had to walk back to the reception for them to re validate my room key and then explain that it still didn't work and wait for maintenance to come and fix it while it was a nuisance in the heat maintenance we pretty quick and fixed the issue. In the main restaurant there was a waiter who was very attentive and good at his job called Abdessamad!    These though were the only occasions that the service was good in this hotel. They do not have enough staff to start with. The quiet pool has a swim up bar and only one member of staff working it understandably come lunchtime and the afternoon heat the bar got busy and long queues formed then he would inevitably run out of something and disappear for 5-10 mins to get more. I felt sorry for him as he was doing his best but there should have been at least 2 people working that bar. By contrast the pool bar between the two pools had three or four people on it but service was worse we sat down a at table the first day we arrived and then went to get a menu to be told they would bring one over they did a couple of minutes later. So the following day we sat down and waited for a menu for 15 minutes they weren't even busy loads of empty tables and they walked past us several times it was only when we got up to get one that one was given to us.    In the buffet restaurant the food was the same pretty much everyday whether lunch or dinner and they never seemed to cater for everyone so things would run out all the time and people would be standing around waiting for more to come out. At the pizza station they had a choice of three but only made one of each at a time and wouldn't start to make a new one until that was gone so people standing around waiting. When we spoke to management they said there's some there one slice of one of the pizza's no apology about the display being empty.    The plates are dotted around the dining room under the counter but frequently ran out and people would have to ask for more plates. At breakfast the glasses for juice were always running out they just didn't have enough when they did bring some out it would be about 20 and so many people were waiting they would go straight away and people would be waiting again! 5 star? They haven't even got enough crockery should have plenty of these that they are always full!    The A la carte restaurant you qualify to eat here once for stays of 4 nights or more you need to book in advance at reception. A la carte is a bit misleading there's a choice of two set menu's but the food quality was good and made for a lovely change to the awful buffet.    This hotel at best is 4 star but the service was something else and drags it down to 3 star the staff I think are trying but the management don't seem interested we complained a couple of times and got some sort of excuse and that was it!    Shame because it has potential relatively new hotel but we would definitely not stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: harold g wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We are staying in the be life collection for 22 days and we are enjoying ourselves.  The staff is so nice that you feel at home GM be proud of the staff !  The food in the buffet restaurant is good and taken care off everyday.  There are some little points in the restaurant the good have some better materials longer spoons that do not fall in to the sauce .  And maybe the can fill up the refrigerator with a few cans of soda.  The music by the swimming pool good be better and the volume is to much.Afther all we had a great time .  The hotel is just not the 5 stars that we are just to but it‚Äôs new and the can improve.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: pensonfamilyof7 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We recently stayed at the Be Live Collection in Marrakech for one week in June and I have to say from checking in to checking out we were most certainly looked after to a five star standard.  ALL the hotel staff were very friendly and welcoming from the entertainment team Simo Salim Fati Titif Karim and Mustafa who kept us occupied when we wanted around the pool and into the evenings. Amine the maitre d‚Äô went above and beyond to find my husband Stilton on our last night in the restaurant and he also was the best singer on the karaoke too üé§ to all the house staff who always said ‚Äúgood morning‚Äù to us every day.  The hotel was impeccably kept from the rooms to the gardens and pool areas. The food in the restaurant was varied and cooked to a high standard with so much variety it was hard to choose from omelettes T bone steak to sushi fresh fruit and so many deserts you just had to try them all üòã  We took advantage of the spa and have to say the massages we had not only were relaxing but such good value for money and again we were treated impeccably in the spa too  Would definitely recommend this hotel and would go back in a heart beat  Thanks for the best holiday ü•∞‚òÄÔ∏è

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jessica N wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Arrival: 20-30 minutes' drive outside of Marrakech the hotel almost appears out of nowhere. It is one story and unassuming but beautiful from the outside. Reception area very clean and bright with plenty of seating options a well-stocked and variable gift shop and a small boutique. We arrived at 2.45 checked in and were surprised to find that there was a city tax (17 euro) a room deposit (100 euro) and a towel depot (can't remember price). we were given information about dining and bus shuttles by the quite frankly very rude reception staff and promptly told to go eat lunch before we saw our room. when we asked about our luggage they said it would be fine where it is (in the middle of the reception floor).    Departure: Our flight was late and we didn't need to leave the hotel until 5pm so we asked for a late check out on arrival and were rudely told we had to ask the day of departure. so we did and thankfully there was availability and we managed to get late checkout until 3pm (for a 60 euro fee) and keep our all-inclusive wrist bands until we left at 5pm.    The room: We chose a swim-up room which wasn't actually swim up because if you veered outside of the part directly in front of your own room you would be in other guest's space. Aside from that small detail the room was very comfortable bright and clean. The bed was among the most comfortable I have ever slept in and slept soundly every night. the pillows were out of the world! There is a mini-fridge but is not stocked within the all-inclusive package but the hotel does provide a large bottle of water daily to the room. There is a kettle and tea and coffee in the room. The bathroom was strange; there is a window from the bathroom into the bedroom. there is a blind that when pulled you cannot see into the bathroom from the bedroom during the day but at night when the bedroom is dark if you turn the light on in the bathroom there may as well not be any blind there! Can see everything! The shower was nice pressure and adjustable temperature but the bathroom completely flooded every time you even had a quick shower. This is clearly an on-going issue as the bottom of the bathroom door was warped when we arrived. Bathroom amenities included a hairdryer shower cap shampoo body wash body lotion a comb soap and a couple of glasses. Directly outside the room was a patio with two chairs and a table and two sun loungers at the swim-up pool. The pool was cold in the mornings but very refreshing and comfortable in the afternoons and evenings and was very enjoyable.    Food and drink: what can I say? food and drinks were bottomless. the buffet had a wide range and catered to majority of palates. Breakfast was varied with an omelette station and continental if desired. Lunch always included a pizza pasta red meat chicken fish salad and an array of salad and vegetable options. Dinner was the same. House wine and beer is available in the buffet restaurant at meal times. The Lobby Bar was exceptional. staff were friendly (majority speak French but good English also). Fabulous outdoor seating area at the bar. The staff are on the ball I think they thought our names were Gin and Tonic by the end!    Pools: there are two pools; one is an activity pool with aqua aerobics and other activities throughout the day. there are also ping-pong tables and you can play archery. The second pool is more chilled scattered with couples sipping their drinks from the pool bar. plenty of loungers and cabanas it was very enjoyable.    Overall: We were there to decompress for a few days both leading very busy lives at home so it was perfect for us. We didn't venture into Marrakech instead opting to make full use of the all-inclusive package and our swim-up room! We enjoyed our stay very much and will definitely be back. if you can get past the rudeness of the reception staff then the rest is very much enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sarahlg1980 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here for a week and that was plenty. Cosmetically the hotel was beautiful room was lush pool and surroundings where just stunning. Unfortunately how this got a 5* for service is beyond us as its most certainly not that yet. Short staffed wrong things given 3 days to get room service (namely an ironing board!) and having to wait AGES for drinks and service in the restaurants. I would not return to this hotel unfortunately its not worth the money paid for it in my opinion. Also if your a couple who are going ensure your not of the shy type and the rooms have an adjoining window into the bedroom/living room which is completely see-through so you will see all being done in the bathroom! (toilet is separate) but shower etc is all open for all to see 2 way into the room lol so being shy is not an option! ;-) Also we had a balcony door which did not lock - DIY also was not a strong point for this hotel. There where dangerous areas leading up to roof areas which where not safe but still accessible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: Wye Valley of Monmouthshire, United Kingdom

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Soozywong wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: All that glitters is not gold
Review_Text: I booked this ‚Äòbudget‚Äô alleged 5 star hotel as a surprise for my husbands birthday through Voyage Priv√©.  The reviews mainly read well and for a 5* all inclusive hotel for 4 nights how bad could it be? We have previously stayed at The Four Seasons the Mandarin Oriental and Marmounia so feel quite well placed to make a comparison.  Clearly other reviewers are not as well travelled - the Belive Collection in Marrakech is a 3/4 star hotel at best. If anyone thinks it is a 5 star hotel they are delusional! But for the price it is ok at best.  We took an early morning flight to maximise our time - big mistake. Check out time is 11.00am and Check in time is 3.00pm. Why it takes 4 hours to do a turn around is beyond me? Maybe the fact that they take a room deposit in addition to full payment may explain the calibre of guests they are used to - which is why they need 4 hours to clean up?! We arrived at 10.30am and got into our room at 3.00pm Bad form. When I enquired how much longer it would be I was told I should have taken a later flight! That kind of summed up the ethos of the hotel.  There is also a towel deposit taken upon arrival for use of towels by the pool. This is restricted to ONE towel per person. It‚Äôs not as though the towels are thick and fluffy - but you only get one!  Use it wisely! All inclusive clearly doesn‚Äôt extend to towels!  Upon arrival we were given wrist bands which shows the staff you are guests of the hotel. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere and a 30 minute taxi ride into Marrakech - who are they expecting to infiltrate - especially to steal their towels! There is Nothing in the surrounding area and by nothing I mean absolutely squat diddly.  The rooms are reasonably well appointed. Large and comfortable. There is a fridge which is stocked with nothing but a bottle of water. Clearly All inclusive doesn‚Äôt extend to the fridge either!  There is a kettle a couple of tea bags coffee and sugar but milk isn‚Äôt included either.  The bathrooms are of a good size with double sinks but the amenities are poor. The tiniest piece of  soap imaginable small shampoo shower gel body lotion sponge shower cap and comb. Oh I forgot a razor! No cotton buds conditioner cotton wool nail files or anything actually useful. Again only one towel per person is allowed. There is clearly a towel issue here!  We booked a room with a swim up pool but being on the edge doesn‚Äôt the afford the luxury of swimming anywhere - it reached my knees!  There are two large swimming pools with plenty of sun loungers however there are no cushions on the chairs and bearing in mind you are only allowed one towel this doesn‚Äôt help on the comfort level.  There are two restaurants - one only available every 4 nights and the main buffet restaurant.  There is also a snack bar which is limited depending on what time you want to eat - however the food is good. Hamburgers and Pizza are worth ordering.  The main buffet restaurant at breakfast is average at best. Breakfast has a reasonably good assortment of choices however completely spoilt by the chef who makes the eggs. Instead of using spatulas to serve up the food - he uses one spatula and his bare hands! Call me fussy but if anyone is going to physically touch my food - it‚Äôs going to be me!  Lunch however was very nice and dinner was pretty much the same as lunch with a couple of additions. Nothing too exciting!  The A la Carte restaurant has two set menus and waiter service which is a rare treat as it is clearly lacking from the rest of the hotel. The two waiters Tarim and Mourac should definitely be promoted.  Both speak English are friendly and want to be of service - more than I can say for the rest of the hotel (and lack of distinguishable management)  We chose to eat out on three of our four nights - our choice as there are some fantastic restaurants in Marrakech.  There is a good selection of drinks which is All inclusive so no complaints there.  Would I come again - No. Would I recommend it - No. Is it good value for money........if you have no expectations of receiving 5 star service from an alleged 5 star hotel - it ticks the box but a 5 star hotel it certainly isn‚Äôt. Management is nowhere to be seen - it runs itself....somewhat unprofessionally.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: jess966 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Spend 7 days at this hotel with a friend for a girls break. We were looking for a quiet hotel geared for adults with a nice atmosphere and this was it.    I made some requested before arriving directly with the hotel and they fulfilled all of them. I wanted two separate double beds in our room as we weren't a couple and a surprise for my friend on her 30th birthday. Be-live really came through and delivered. Had a birthday cake at the exact time/day requested and put up surprise balloons in the evening. Very pleased with this and commend the hotel for their efforts. Room wasn't massive but was clean very quiet comfy beds great shower couldn't ask for much more accommodation wise. Felt it was worth every penny.    Food was great I have recently been travelling to Mexico and Jamaica in hotels that offer a massive array of food 24hrs a day and was pleasantly surprised on standard and choice here at what I would class as a small hotel. Good wine and alcohol brands which was great for all inclusive. Table service in evening brilliant however at breakfast was always trying to catch the waiters eye for a cup of tea/coffee which was annoying and often went without. Diner included freshly prepared food and the dining room and other areas were always super clean.    Two swimming pools one quiet and another with some form of music and entertainment so probably suits most... tranquil feel all round water was lovely temperature and bar service at pool was quick. Only complaint would be the gardeners mowing strimming cutting all day long some days which was annoying noise levels if you really want super chilled environment as the loud sounds seemed to go on and on. But i must say the clientele at the hotel was great making a positive and relaxing atmosphere.    Spa booking was easy to book not over priced did some great packages over all experience was good. I'm a gym goer and was disappointed to find no air-conditioning! it was boiling and uncomfortable to workout in their. Decent equipment usable to get by on a couple weeks holiday.    Location was fantastic if you want to venture out- 10 mins into town we took a couple trips out and was handy being so close to the city centre. They offer a good shuttle service that's regular. Hotel also has good security for anyone conscious of this aspect.    Evening entertainment started at 10pm... every night was something different apart from the warm up singer was the same each night which got a little boring and could have been a little more upbeat.    Overall this was a suburb holiday and I would come back to this hotel and felt it was worth every penny!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Aeroguy757 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: My wife and I were here for two weeks from 27th May and had a swim up room which was lovely. When checking in we paid our room deposit in cash (Sterling) and this was put into a sealed envelope and handed back to us when leaving. Swim up rooms are in the three blocks to the right of reception and face west so the sun hits the room in the afternoon. There is no real shade then so use a high factor sun screen. The other three blocks to the left do not have swim up rooms. In all there are six accommodation blocks and each have different names are arranged around a themed courtyard relating to that name. Guests are provided with bathrobe and comfortable soft slippers. If you are staying in an upper level room then please use the slippers as a courtesy to the guests below who will hear your footsteps and furniture rearranging. An interesting point I found out is that the hotel kitchen is underground and apparently connects to the pool bar by tunnel.  As with other reviewers we found the staff to be super friendly and helpful and the hotel spotlessly clean throughout.  The food quality was consistent and very tasty with something for everyone. Be aware that the norm is to serve wine chilled and asking for red wine at room temperature may result in a small delay as the waiter may have to go and get some specially for you. The hand sanitizer by the main door has to be hit fairly hard to work so people probably though it was empty and were not bothering to use it. We took our own. We did not book the al la carte due to the negative feed back and experiences of other guests.  We also experienced the one bar person serving at a time scenario. The bar staff are great the serving policy not so good. Some bars had two or more staff behind the counter but only one actually getting you a drink. It's funny to see an orderly line start to form at busy times at the lobby bar. The management really need to sort this out.  However whilst you are waiting in line you can try to figure out what song you are listening to. You'll know the song but not the style in which it being performed. Ever heard "The Show Must Go On" by Queen done in a bossa - nova style? Actually it's quite fun and passes the time as you are queuing.  We took our own plastic glasses and coffee cups so we didn't have the fun of drinking beer from a cocktail glass unfortunately but we did see it happening. The staff were quite happy to fill them for us and take them back to our room for the afternoon laze in the sun. Take metal or reusable straws with you and do your bit for the environment too.  The Sports bar is advertised as opening at 10 PM however it is open (but not staffed or serving drinks) earlier in the day and allows the sports fans to try and catch an event. There is one giant t.v. and another smaller one in a side section which allows for a different event to be followed. The commentary is foreign so no clash of sounds to worry about.  Just beyond the sports bar was a great surprise new addition and is not listed on websites (or even the daily activities board). The hotel has built a brand new boules court with games taking place at 11 a.m and 5 p.m.  It's a great way to meet people and is so quick and easy to learn so give it a go! I would hope that they invest in a tape measure and rake at some point oh and a scoreboard would be good too. Early days for this activity but well done for it!  We also used the gym a few times. It's well equipped with fresh towels and sanitizer sprays but could do with a bit more air con perhaps. Be aware that you can access it by the outside steps in the early morning before the spa opens.  The hotel has a mix of age groups and nationalities with many people just coming for a few days. We felt like long term residents after ten days let alone two weeks however small things apart it was a very enjoyable holiday and would recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Liiamm1995 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Superb hotel all the staff make you feel so welcome and cannot do enough for you if you need anything they are there for you. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Michelle S wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Just returned from 10 nights at this beautiful hotel with my partner  Quick and easy check in and shown to our room and how to work the AC.  Room was simple luxury. Ours was facing away from the pool not the greatest view but fantastic sunrise over the Atlas Mountains! The beds are incredibly comfortable. Room cleaned everyday fresh towels provided and gorgeous displays left for you to find when you return to your room.    Can‚Äôt comment on the animation pool as we didn‚Äôt use it but the relaxed pool was brilliant not very deep but lots of steps and ledges to sit and cool off with a cocktail from the pool bar or swim if you want to. And plenty of loungers and cabanas.    Plenty of choice when it comes to food..if you miss breakfast at the buffet you can get a late breakfast at the snack bar. Snack bar burgers were lovely! Loved the food in the buffet restaurant and never had any issues here.    Drinks were great BUT..a few little points to be made..there were times when our drinks had little or no alcohol so maybe a little training in measures needed? We used the lobby bar pool bar and snack bar all three bars could use an extra staff member or 2 at peak times..this said we never waited too long to be served and always with a smile. Glasses are an issue. The plastic glasses used around the pool are quite old and look quite worn so need replacing and maybe doubling in quantity. Maybe stick to bottled beers as beer from a cocktail glass is just odd.    All the staff here are amazing. We were always greeted with a smile. Even just walking through the hotel or grounds every staff member we came across said hello. After about the fourth day everyone knew our drinks order before we asked including the waiters.    Entertainment was good. Belly dancers and Latino night were great even the karaoke was good!    Already looking forward to our next visit!    Thanks to all the staff at Be Live Collection Marrakech for making our holiday fantastic ‚ù§Ô∏è
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Eve C wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: My husband and I just spent a long weekend at this hotel as a birthday treat to ourselves and we couldn't have chosen a better hotel. The rooms were so luxurious and spotless with clean towels and fluffy robes every day. Being an adults only hotel the atmosphere was calm and relaxing with daily activities like archery yoga and aqua aerobics to keep you going. The pool area was amazing with free books available to read table tennis and a swim up pool bar. The food was delicious however it was a tad cold at times. However that could be forgiven for the luxurious surroundings of the hotel the wonderful staff and the entertainment at night time. Even the sports bar had games in it to keep you amused. Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: London Ferret wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Lovely Hotel and staff, bar needs sorting
Review_Text: Absolutely lovely hotel beautiful grounds. Not massive but really well kept and feels spacious. Plenty of sunbeds. There is an animations pool with music not too loud and a much quieter pool for relaxing. You can also pay to use the indoor pool in the health centre.  The staff are almost all absolutely lovely and really care about making sure you have a nice holiday. They don't hassle you and are very helpful. Not a big fan of animations but the team were really nice and very enthusiastic and always had something going on ‚Äì aquarobics archery spin class etc  Food is plentiful and very varied. The cous-cous was great I ended up having it almost every day. Wine is somewhat dodgy but it is Morocco.  Beer is ok. Cocktails are interesting and are completely different depending on who makes them but that's part of the fun in an all-inclusive.  Room was lovely nice beds & linen. Floors are stone and reverberate dreadfully ‚Äì first couple of nights kept awake by people upstairs who continually moved furniture around all night in high heels!!??? Quieter after that though. Don't think they turn the AC on until May?  There are two bars a sports bar which is oddly quite relaxing and opens I think about 10:30 and the main bar.  Only 2 real complaints for the whole holiday the first would be that they should sort out the service at the main bar. This is a big problem and they know about it so I assume it is deliberate. There's frequently only one person serving drinks sometimes two. Very often I would have to wait 20 minutes to get served. There are a couple of waiters but they are rushed off their feet and you can still wait a long time for them.  2nd complaint is that 2 days before we left they built a small stage outside the main bar facing the hotel with speakers facing the rooms. They then had live music at deafening volume which was so loud we could hear it in the room aver the tv! This went on until midnight on the last 2 days we were there which was a real shame. I hope it was only temporary as it was really awful.  The courtesy bus into town is a coach so usually plenty of seats but you do need to book in advance though staff are very obliging about this.  Other than that a great holiday and really pleasant staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

However the pool bar and the snack bar need more staff during the day and both are in desperate need of more plastic glasses.. staff did come around and clear glasses by sunbeds but every time we went to bar the beer in bottles were never cold and when we we're offered a glass Drinking beer from a cocktail glass is weird ..  the maitre de in the main buffet restaurant never smiled or took the effort to speak to us once in 5days we was there.. and when I asked him for a bottle of water for the table .. eventually I got it .. but with attitude .. walked past him most days just outside the restaurant on his phone .... Review_Text: Myself and a friend spent 7 nights at the Be Live Collection Hotel.  We had a lovely clean and comfortable room with good facilities.    All the staff were extremely friendly! We had a great time with Simu (Entertainment) doing all the activities by the pool especially the Aqua Aerobics. He always made us smile and was great to chat and laugh with!  Adnane (Reception) was the first to greet us at the hotel and check us in. He was so helpful and friendly and when we an issue with our room (only one bed) he was quick to get us transferred and get our luggage moved etc. Any queries we had about the hotel and Marrakesh is general Adnane was there to help! Great service all round would definitely recommend this hotel.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Debbi V wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Live Right Now at Be Live Collection - Lovely Holiday
Review_Text: We are currently at the end of our first week here with one week to go. We are in room 1004 swim up room which catches the sun from around 12pm every day until the sun goes down. We are facing the pool with the swim-up bar.    When we arrived (late because our flight had been delayed) we were quickly checked in and then told that we could go to the Sports Bar for something to eat and drink. It was almost but not quite closing time. We got two very welcome cold beers (called Stork perfectly decent - they also do San Miguel but in smaller bottles) and a sandwich which was really tasty.    When we got to our room we noticed a sewage smell which was still there the next day. We mentioned it and they tried to sort it out but we had to change rooms. This was done very efficiently and with a small token of the hotel's apology (bottle of wine and a large plate of fruit and nuts). The new room was lovely and we are still there now. Unfortunately this second night I got no sleep at all as the pump for the water channel (pool) outside our room makes an awful droning noise which becomes very loud when the hotel quietens down after midnight. I had to go to reception at 3.30 as my head was ready to explode!!! Thankfully they turned off the pump and I was able to sleep. The next night I had to remind them to turn it off but subsequent nights they seemed to remember and get into a routine. But last night sadly they forgot so I had to remind them again. PLEASE PLEASE make this a daily routine for your maintenance staff. The noise is horrendous and right outside people's rooms. The pump is not needed overnight and the man comes to turn in back on in the morning. Such a small thing but important for your guests to get good sleep. Thanks.    The gym here is great with lovely staff who greet you with a towel and water if you want it. Equipment is fab but it needs to be connected to the wi-fi because it has features like Netflix and Spotify that can't be used because it just tells you that it is not connected. There is bluetooth for you to connect your headphones but this is useless without the connectivity. Otherwise a great gym.    There are plenty of activities like yoga pilates aqua gym and archery etc. They have just built a new boules pit but they don't have it in the programme yet which is a great shame. My husband is a great lover of boules and would play every day but no one is encouraged to play. Come on Animation Team... maybe you can do this before we leave next Monday! :)    The food is superb! We love it. We love the salads and the wide variety of cooked veggies. Some different meat too every night. Decent red white and rose wine but sparkling is not available on the All Inclusive.    Bar staff - in fact all staff - are lovely and helpful. Range of cocktails is decent although the bar service can be slow because there is usually only one person on and a large queue builds up.    In the sport bar we had an evening watching the Champions League final and although this was obviously known about in advance there were no cold beers!! It is a myth that us British like warm beers. I understand that it gets busy in there... but beers should be stocked up for special evenings and maybe consider draft??    Wide mix of nationalities here which is nice and people seem to come for odd number of days like 4! Long weekends from the UK to Morocco. Can't fault them! :)    All in all a lovely hotel. Very clean nice gardens lots of places to sit in the sun or in shade. Can't really comment about the pools or the availability of sunbeds as we luckily have our own but when I am having my coffee outside first thing in the morning I see people laying down their towels especially on the covered "cabanas".    What's that hubby? Cocktail time? Ok have to go. Another week of paradise calls!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: sonal d wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Great hotel friendly and helpful. Do brush up on your french and arabic language skills as English is basic.    If you do have any general questions Marwa at the PR desk is very helpful.    Check in is at 3pm so if you arrive early you will be waiting. You will get a wristband so you can have food and drinks    Check out is at 12pm. You can ask on the day for a late check out but they will charge. We were asked to pay 600 dirhams to extend our room till 3pm.Thats ¬£20 an hour.    Wristbands are taken when you check out. If you arrived early and used the bar and food facilities then on check out you are not entitled to these anymore. If you do want to eat and drink then it is 400 dirham per person.    Do book to go to the restaurant on site called Ksar. The service is great and the food is scrumptious. Tariq looked after us very well.    The Spa on site is independent to the hotel so you cannot charge treatments to your room. Do fill in the health form before your first treatment. The treatments were excellent and very relaxing. A good deal can be had if you pay by cash. Mounir Ben Salem looked after us very well.    If you do not eat fish or beef you will struggle. Do be careful as labelling of foods is not the best. We did mention it on day 1 and by day 5 it was better. There are not enough serving utensils so guests use meat ones with veg so do ask for clean ones if not sure. Thank you to Amine & Adil the restaurant managers and Abdessamad & Omar the waiters who looked after us every day.

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jessie wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Ok.. This place could be good but there are some major flaws that need sorting. In its defence the food is good the rooms are good and the housekeeping is fine.. The bad bits:  1. The owners need to take note. One server per bar is not enough! Everyone has said it but nothing seems to be changing. I watched a Barman taking 7-8 minutes to complete each order. When you have a new customer arriving every 2-3 minutes it's clear to see the problem.. its causing disconcernation. It's not the Bartenders fault he's just not well organised and overworked.  2. The nightly entertainment is not very imaginative the real problem is that because its outside every single room gets affected with noise pollution every single night. Fine if you want to watch the countless renditions of 80s songs but if you dont you cannot sleep until after midnight at the earliest.  3. The pool music playlist is questionable. On a few days part of the playlist had songs that made frequent use of the N word as well as frequent explicit sexual phrases. This is not acceptable. I do not want to hear the N word uttered by ANYBODY and although I'm no prude I'm not impressed by the poor music choices. This needs to be addressed as a matter of urgency. Play music to the crowd you have. It caused me a lot of annoyance. Auto tuned rap is just not what you want in your ears all day.    The conclusion for me is If you want a generic resort holiday where you like the club 18-30 feel this will be fine for you. If you want a more ethnic morrocan experience and you dont like rap/house music all day look elsewhere. I wanted to like it but came away disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family
