Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: SofiaH wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Lovely hotel let down by understaffing :-(
Review_Text: My husband & I chose a 3 night stay for our 1st anniversary. The hotel has MANY plus points;  - lovely big modern rooms  - lots of food available all day long  - free shuttle to town daily  - 2 big pools 1 has music the other is lovely and quiet  - we liked the variety of food yes it‚Äôs a buffet but they have tagines meats fish pasta salads and gorgeous desserts    However there are a couple of things that could be improved but that really made our holiday a lot less enjoyable  -1 staff member per bar is not enough I am pregnant and all I wanted 90% of the time was a bottle of water but I had to queue for 30 minutes in some cases for the pleasure.  My suggestion would be to have a fridge with soft drinks/beers and the people only need to queue for cocktails and coffees etc  - loungers- there was enough but apart from the cabanas they were pretty uncomfortable I would suggest to purchase some padded covers for the rest    Overall the hotel is good but for usservice is THE most important factor and unfortunately lack of staffing let‚Äôs this hotel down :-(

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: JordanOBrien wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Do not stay at this hotel!!! The service is the worst service I have ever experienced anywhere in the world. Two nights in a row there was no cutlery with a queue of people waiting for them to bring some out. On lunch on our fourth day there was no plates- again there was a queue waiting for them to bring plates out. Dinner on our third night we had to ask 4 different waiters if we could order drinks- all of which told us they would come back and none of them did. In the end we had to leave the restaurant and go to the bar to get drinks and bring those into the restaurant. In The snack bar you can be waiting for 20-30 minutes just to order your food or even just to get a menu. There is one server for around 40 people. All of the drinks bars are extremely slow service. The food itself is extremely limited. Almost half of the buffet food is cold where it‚Äôs not kept heated properly. The snack bar is horrendous - if you order sausage and cheese from the breakfast menu- you literally received a plate of tiny triangles of cheese and tiny triangles of ham. Every person is the hotel was complaining about the food and service the entire time we were there.    The entertainment at night is very lacking- most nights it is just background music. When there is entertainment on it doesn‚Äôt start until 10pm and at this point most people have gone to bed.    On our 5th day our keys were not working so we went to reception to ask for new ones and they told me I had to speak with the manager. When I went to speak to him I was told I have to pay 1300 dirhams (around ¬£120) because there were stains on the bedsheets. When I told him I would not be paying this because it does not cost this much to replace them (and also because I‚Äôve never heard of hotels charging for stains on bedsheets) he compared it to me arriving at the hotel and not receiving the swim up room I had paid for- and instead receiving a basic room- I am still not sure on the relevance of this? He then said if I want to stay at a 5* hotel I should expect to pay this much for sheets! I only ever stay at 5* hotels anywhere I go in the world and I have never heard anything like this.    The only good thing about the hotel is the pool entertainment staff- especially Simo. Apart from this I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Kingsmeister wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: After a flight delay and arriving at @3am I was pleased to have a swift and efficient check in and go to my room. The room is modern very clean and spacious. 2 queen size beds firm and comfortable - excellent rain shower and bathroom with twin sinks. he room had a patio leading onto the rear gardens. Summary - great room!  I am an early riser so when I arrived at the pool there was myself the gardener and pool cleaner tranquillity at its best. To be fair even after breakfast there were beds and cabanas available around both pools. Breakfast was great too - typical buffet arrangement of local Moroccan specialities. Possible improvement in service of tea and coffee and removal of used crockery but overall breakfast was good.  The pool areas are great clean and well presented. Quiet pool with swim up bar is great. Shout out for Omar who ran the swim up bar (bottled San Miguel!). The other pool has background music and is where the animation team hang out. Simo is the man to see here ! Kept us busy with table tennis archery and aqua aerobics to name a few. well done Simo and team.  Evening meals were varied and the Moroccan specialities were great very hot and tasty. The lobby bar is where the cocktail should be taken. Hand made and served in jam jars for as special touch - mojito is the one to go for.  We used the shuttle service into town too very prompt and efficient.  So overall a brilliant weekend at the Be Live - I will not hesitate to return.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lynn C wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Before Going was a little apprehensive what with Spicy Foods (I Don't Like) Dress to Cover Up (I go on Holiday To GET A Tan)  Food Was Brilliant put on at least 8 lbs  Dress So long as you either cover shoulders or knees There is No Problem (This is Only outside of the Hotel )  Must Go to THE SOUKS an Experience You Will Never Forget But Don''t Forget to Haggle IT'S Expected  ENJOYED THIS HOLIDAY IMMENSELY

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: simonjordanw wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel and grounds. Choice of quiet or ‚Äòactive‚Äô pool. Loads of good quality sun loungers day beds and parasols. Choice of bars with hand crafted coffee too which was a pleasant surprise (although not all staff knew how to make a macchiato - if it‚Äôs on the menu train the staff!) Food was very good; a great selection of local dishes at every meal. Pastries were excellent. My main criticism if the restaurant is that the food wasn‚Äôt always hot enough (and no constant supply of hot or cold plates). Bedroom clean bright very comfortable bed and great pillows. Cleaned well every day and always bottled water in the fridge. Most staff pleasant and helpful but the odd occasion we felt ignored in favour of obvious favourite guests which was a shame. Overall though would I go back? In a heartbeat.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Carmen G wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Lovely Hotel - Though requires more staff and some smiles to give it that 5 *
Review_Text: Arrived home this week after a Fantastic Holiday in Marrakesh. The hotel was lovely - well laid out and beautiful gardens and 2 lovely pools.  We had a superior room which was very spacious  modern and great Air con. Huge bath separate toilet and huge shower. Room cleaned daily  Despite the food being roughly the same everyday lunch and dinner - i did thoroughly enjoy the food. Plenty of meats and seafood and tasty  Entertainment was every night and not the greatest for a 5* hotel and there were only  enough seats outside to sit around 40 people. ( there are 212 rooms at the hotel )  Ways where management could improve and make this the 5* it deserves is recruit more staff on the bars and in the dining hall and rethink the outdoor seating plan  One member of staff per bar is not sufficient and with other nations that Don't Queue caused many unnecessary altercations with other guests. This affected the snack bar pool bar Lobby bar and Dining Hall. No wonder the staff couldn't smile in these areas.  Sports Bar I enjoyed for a great cocktail by Mochine. Great guy thank you .  The hotel runs a shuttle bus which is handy as its about 20 mins in a bus from the Centre. Run fairly regularly.  Tip for Marrakesh - a map doesn't work. If you want to sight see there is a stop and start open top bus that stops right where you are dropped off. Or find someone in a decent restaurant or policeman for directions.  Take plenty of sun cream hat and mosquito spray  We went with Tui ( though we never saw a rep so all trips were booked on the app) I recommend the trip to Essaouira and Atlas Mountains  Overall great holiday and great Hotel though need to recuit more staff  One thing i will say if you have an early flight you can not check in until 3pm and you will also need to pay 600 dir deposit and 200 dir each for a towel. Pay in cash as you will get this back on check out .  Enjoy !! I loved Morocco and will be returning one day
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: delight m wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine best bartender in Marrakech  Would definitely advise to visit this place  All the staff are on point  Mohcine  Advise to visit sports bar which also has the best music  The best cocktails in town !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Deepers84 wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Some great bits, some not so great
Review_Text: This is a beautiful hotel the rooms are so lovely and the gardens and pools are really nice. The staff on the reception are very friendly and helpful. Beds are comfortable we slept really well. Wifi can be accessed almost everywhere in the hotel which is great.    The food is okay not great. And there are lots of flies in the dining room. Unfortunately the restaurant  and bars seem to be quite understaffed and so it can be a bit manic in the dining room trying to get cutlery or drinks.    It's difficult to get drinks at the pool bar as there is only 1 person there all day - he is doing his best but there are lots of people to serve.    Cocktails are hit and miss - mostly they are from a bottle. Very occasionally in the lounge bar they might be made and these are delicious. But these are the exception not the rule. Rose wine very nice.    Sports bar really fun and staff are fab but there is no air conditioning and so you can expect to be bitten by insects if you are in there longer than 5 minutes.    Every night between 10pm and 1am is live music and this can be heard from all rooms in the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: Mohcine is a legend make sure you go and see him if you stay here. He made our holiday. Our holiday was already great but he made out experience he goes out his way to make sure you have the best stay!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sarah wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Don‚Äôt be fooled by the positive reviews
Review_Text: Although this hotel appears to be rated 5 star it really isn‚Äôt it‚Äôs more of a 2 star. Other than the rooms being nice there is not much else that is. Firstly we arrived and the reception took on average 25 minutes to help one guest with a line of at least 5 people it took ages. We arrived early so thought we‚Äôd get a drink by the pool. Shock- there was no alcohol in the pool bar no matter what drink we ordered. The bar that has a little bit of alcohol is the lobby bar don‚Äôt even bother with any of the others.    We then thought it would be good to go to the pool until our room was ready but towels are only available at certain times that are not convenient. You would think they would be during the day so we had to swim towel-less. On top of this you have to pay for it (and many other add ons).    When we finally went to check in (again after waiting awfully long in the queue) we were taken to our room to only have maintenance paint cans tools and workers in there so we couldn‚Äôt go in. We then had to walk back to reception in the heat go back to the long line (shock) and wait to be reallocated a room. There was little to no sympathy or effort to make the already terrible experience better.    In trying to keep a positive mind frame I thought I‚Äôd give the spa ago which was basically an extended moisturising session with a huge chunk of the time with no massage therapist in the room. Apparently this is part of the experience so that ‚Äúyou can rest‚Äù on your own. So you‚Äôre basically paying to have an empty room-complete waste of money.    The food is average at best and has given quite a few people the terrible stomachs and diarrhoea.    Despite the good deal- save your money folks. There are plenty of decent places that actually have good service and have decent food elsewhere.    You‚Äôll thank me in the long run.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Safari52798663427 wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Just returned from a week at be live marrakach with my daughter and we had a superb time. Food roomscleanliness and entertainments team were all excellent and great value for money. The hotel is outside Marrakech but the hotel provide transport into the city if you want to have a look around- recommend the half day tour.Evening music does go on until midnight so if you want to go to bed earlier take some earplugs.Plenty of shampoo and shower gel but no conditioner but you also get body lotion.Would definitely recommend this hotel even for a short 4/5 day break and the hammam in the spa is a must! even the spa does discount for cash well worth a visit .

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rico Brown wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine has the best customer service & best cocktails in the Hotel :) üëç I would highly recommend coming to this Hotel and staying for the week & make sure you get yourself a Special cocktail from the man himself! üçπüî•
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: elainexjx wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: So I have just returned from a girly week away with friends but my second time in Morrocco    I can honestly say this hotel surpassed my expectations.    The entertainment team are excellent especially Titif and Simo.The guys are full of energy and try and get everyone involved! You can see they really love what they do.    I didn‚Äôt expect there to be so much variety and activities all day for a Adults Only hotel and there is Defo something for everyone. The activities ranged from pool aerobics archery Zumba yoga and Arabic lessons just to name a few.    I had a an Arabic lesson with Titif he was so patient and wrote everything down he had taught me. Such a great teacher and very intelligent hubun kthyr.    The evening entertainment is equally as good and some nights I didn‚Äôt want to leave they had a cocktail hour karaoke night live bands Brazilian dancers üíÉ etc    For those who want some quiet time there is a quiet pool with a swim up bar and an equally great size pool! I tried it but it wasn‚Äôt my thing far too quiet.    The hotel is spotless and well looked after the gardens and grounds are so pretty so if your all about the insta photo you‚Äôll Defo love it here.    The rooms are a great size and again well looked after we didn‚Äôt have a kettle iron or ironing board but all we needed to do was ask and they were there in seconds. I would have expected them to be there as standard but there was no hassle so it was fine.    Younis the hotel tour operator is excellent and again nothing is too much to ask he will sort absolutely anything out for you. I had quite a bad cold and he went to the pharmacy to get me some cold relief such a star‚≠êÔ∏è.    The spa is amazing and not normally my thing I had a traditional sauna and scrub defo worth it if your a sun worshipper like me. I‚Äôve never felt so relaxed in my life.    The food is good plenty of choice and it didn‚Äôt seem as though food was being recycled like it normally is in all inclusive. I was with a vegetarian and if she‚Äôs happy then it must be ok! I tended to stick to the freshly cooked meat and fish only because I like my food piping hot. There are omelettes fried and poached eggs available for breakfast again a lot of choices in fruit yogurts crepes etc they also do morrocan meals so if your feeling adventurous then give it a try. Again the staff in the restaurant kitchen and bar are great.    The pool bar serves food also so you can pick up a quick snack between 10 - 6 obviously the menu doesn‚Äôt change but there is plenty of choice and the food is nice.    Yes it‚Äôs a 5 star but they could do with some help as somethings need to be changed and improved slightly. Nothing that would massively effect your stay.    I don‚Äôt believe the issues are down to the staff but the the owners and management.The bar service is quite slow and they don‚Äôt offer pool service or a stocked fridge in the room. They really need a new supply of glassware as they would often glass collect wash them then serve your drink. Give me a week there in charge and I‚Äôd make them the 5 Star they deserve and say they are.    I would highly recommend this hotel and would even go as far to say I‚Äôd go back for some winter sun.    shukraan lak laqad qadayt waqtaan rayieaan.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: GrishGrish wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: First the reception staff are really kind and friendly.  However the lines to reception were ALWAYS long and there was ALWAYS an issue.  Our tub didn‚Äôt work and staff were called out. Wait wait wait...  The keys were constantly de-magnetising. Four times in 24 hours - wait wait wait...  They took our towels! Just as my friend was getting in the shower. Replacing them? Wait wait wait...  Want a drink? The bar was understaffed. Wait wait wait.  And it was a LONG trip to town. The website says 10 minutes. It was at least 30 - every time. Shuttles run but not hourly. I think there were about 5/6 a day.  Seriously. Stay in town. Not out here for this kind of service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Inspire03184230217 wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: -Very clean hotel!  -Good entertainment.  -But it‚Äôs understaffed and that‚Äôs why the service is very bad food is cold little variation long waiting for drinks and a clean table.  -Location is quiet and there‚Äôs a shuttle service to the centre.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Darren B wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Fabulous stay in this all inclusive hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel away from hustle and noise of Marrakech. Our swim up room is +++ and recommend these rooms overlooking stunning gardens and a quite pool. Well worth the extra. The free shuttle bus into town is a great added feature and is seamless. The quality of food is excellent at the pool bar. There were some issues with the buffet style food during our stay however these were addressed and solutions are in place to fix this. Most staff are fantastic kind and friendly and very hospitable special mention is for Hassan in the buffet resturant and Yassine at the pool bar. Also Ms Mounia Ouarhzif she was amazing at dealing with any issues that arose during our stay. I can‚Äôt thank her enough for her professionalism understanding and kindness. Perfect break away for anyone looking to recharge in beautiful surroundings. We will be back again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: boroforus wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: This Adult Only Hotel is so nice. We stayed in a basic room for 10 nights. The room itself was spacious with a super king bed and the deepest mattress I have ever seen. Flat screen TV on the wall with other amenities such as tea/coffee/water/fridge/safe. There was a big window between the bedroom and bathroom reduced privacy but the bathroom was lovely with a big walk in shower and a bath. Hairdryer and sachet gels left every day and the body lotion was lush! Drinks in glasses with lots of choice were delivered by the lovely waiters nuts olives placed on your table after 5pm. Food I was a let down we didn‚Äôt find much to our taste and the al a cart was dreadful. The pools were lovely and the pool staff were exceptional. Snacks were always made fresh to order and served to you. Loads of sun beds with towels on a deposit. All inclusive was a good deal here as you are 30mins away from the medina. Do not hesitate to book this place. We will defo go back very soon. Many thanks to the management and all staff for providing this great hotel and making our stay memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Y437 wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Friendly helpful staff - loads of sun beds available - great winter sun Fly & Flop break
Review_Text: The good stuff :- Staff are happy and very helpful nothing is too much trouble - a very positive and welcome holiday hotel experience therefore would recommend this new hotel on this element alone    Buffet Dining and poolside cafe is perfectly good with freshly prepared foods  plenty of choice and a civilised dining experience - I am vegetarian .    Loads of sun beds round 2 large and nice pools (1 heated) - no early morning dash to reserve as there‚Äôs more than enough sun beds for everyone    Well equipped nice bedrooms. large airy spacious and clean - tea and coffee and array of toiletries inc but sadly no hair conditioner - junior suite with double balcony on 1st floor    No hesitation in recommending for a short winter break    The bad :- The typical TUI ALa Carte restaurant was disappointing (you are restricted to 1 visit per stay) ...don‚Äôt bother as the experience was not great the food limited and very average at best - this concept needs a complete rethink by management and Tui as it‚Äôs a reoccurring issue across their hotels - Tui customers are not all beer and burgers .  Strangely the aircon is controlled from a central point eg it only pumped out warm air as apparently they hadn‚Äôt yet switched to the summer season cooling setting ..most odd !    The ugly:- sand coloured low rise concrete hotel set almost in middle of nowhere...in scrub land on outskirts of city but the hotel itself is new and modern with relaxed welcome vibe with delightful gardens . It‚Äôs perfectly safe and acceptable particularly if this is a short fly and flop break
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Laura B wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We spent one week in this resort: it has been wonderful ... the staff has been always very nice and helpful with any questions or requests the food at the restaurants is really good you have plenty of choice in terms of vegetablesfruits meatfish...every day...the desserts are particularly tasteful good wine as well...as all inclusive we could test a wide range of cocktails along the week at the multiple bars love the mojito..room is big and cleaned every day ...the area is quiet and close to the medina of Marrakech that you can reach by free shuttle offered by the hotel...you can book excursions...We did the one to visit Ourzazate and Ait Benaddo really worth even if it is a bit expensive...you can also book treatment at the spa for a real hammam (a bit expensive tough) very good...swimming pools are big and cleaned....overall great place to spend your holidays very relaxing

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: LJPentecost wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Let me start with a few negatives but please continue to read as the overall experience was still fairly positive.    Firstly this hotel may tick the required boxes to be a 5 Star resort but that is where the similarities end. It is a high quality hotel when considering room decor and an overall high standard aesthetically but there are flaws.    Some of the staff have been seriously let down by the management when it comes to training the snack bar at the pool is the worst service I have ever experienced the area is generally clean and tidy and the food is of good standard but the staff are either untrained or inexperienced. It can take up to half an hour to get food during quiet periods and it‚Äôs hit or miss whether drinks will arrive before the the food after the food or even at all. We ate here 3 out of 7 days and experienced the same headless chicken approach every time whilst hoping the previous experience was a one off seeing others suffer the same frustration gave us some peace of mind that there was some consistency and we we not the only victims.    The main restaurant offers nice fresh food for lunch and dinner although it‚Äôs a bit samey salad veg rice pasta pizza and fresh meats or fish. It‚Äôs a bun fight so get there early if you want a relaxing meal. Breakfast is the best meal of the day so don‚Äôt lie in the poached eggs are to die for.    There is defiantly a lack of staff or lack of interested staff within the resort getting served in the lobby bar can be a nightmare the staff plod along and have no idea who is next in line so frustration will get to you. Try and get a seat and order to your table the waiting staff in the lobby bar are by far the best employees they have and should be promoted to train the less capable.    Evening entertainment was relaxing in the lobby bar with live singing.    The animation team around the main pool are eager to please and if you want to take part in the activities they will make you very welcome.    If you like sports they have a sports bar at your disposal unfortunately or not it was closed for 3 days during our visit due to some sewage problems watching the footy in an establishment that smells somewhere between a wet dog and human sick was an unpleasant experience but hopefully this has now been resolved.    It‚Äôs my third trip to Marrakech for a sunny relaxing break and if I do decide to return it won‚Äôt be to this hotel if your not necessarily looking for adults only try the Tikida Palmeraie along the road. Far less stressful in my experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Tourist64674448038 wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Hotel reception very helpful when we arrived and addressed the lack of bath robes and iron and ironing board immediately-although they did remove the latter 2 items as not standard for our room.  Food was buffet style and not very hot. Pool snack bar cooked lovely fresh pizza which was hot! Pool amazing and beautifully kept.Beds super comfy and rooms cleaned daily.All in all a beautiful hotel but could do with more eating options.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: CLAIRESD2018 wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Really rather impressed with this hotel!
Review_Text: I have returned today after a 4 night stay at this hotel. I was very impressed! The hotel has a very chilled vibe with beautiful gardens and hardworking staff. We stayed in a standard double room with a garden view. The rooms are modern spotlessly clean and huge. My only one criticism of the room would be no drink making facilities but that‚Äôs absolutely my only criticism! Check-in process was smooth we arrived by 11:30am so waited until early afternoon for our room which wasn‚Äôt a problem as we could use all facilities and the sun was shining! Food was great lots of choice and many traditional Moroccan dishes to try. You also get one opportunity during your stay to dine at the √† la carte Restaurant which we did on the last night which I would also recommend that you do. The gardens are beautiful and the hotel grounds are kept spotlessly clean by an army of hardworking staff. All in all I would not hesitate in returning to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

I don't think we could have just sat in the hotel for a week as wasn't alot going on during the day and night to keep you from getting bored. overall would deffo recommend for a relaxing get away with chance to really experience Marrakech

Review_Date: Gil D wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We are staying here now. This hotel is so clean the staff are lovely and so friendly. We have a swim up room which is excellent the bed is comfy room is clean and modern. This bar my husband thinks is wonderful extra large tv screens with good quality picture. 1st time he has been anywhere and been able to watch his team without a problem.  The bars are constantly running out of glasses.  My small recommemdations to improve this lovely hotel. A few soft drinks in the fridge in the bedroom.  Yesterday it rained. The lobby bar is very small. So not many people can fit in. And sitting outside under the small covered area was cold and damp. And is also cold in the evening. The restaurant has patio heaters why doesnt the bar? Also why dont you keep the snack bar open till 9 just for drinks and with patio heaters.. This is a lovely area to sit  will add more seating area.  Maybe offer waiter sevice around the pool.    We do love this hotel. Lovely laid back atmoshere chilled out feel to it. We would recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Danny B wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Great Hotel For A Couples Week Away!
Review_Text: We have just spent an great week at the Be Live Collection in Marrakech. From the moment we got to the hotel and were greeted with mint tea and biscuits we have found the whole experience brilliant. The whole hotel is always immaculate and the staff are generally great. They are all very friendly and happy to help you but then also leave you alone enough to enjoy the beautiful spaces.    The free shuttle bus stops very close to the main souks and centre of the the city. It‚Äôs perfect for spending the day in town then coming back at night.    I would like to advise you that there is a deposit of around 600 dirham per room and 200 dirham per pool towel that is asked for when you arrive. I may have missed this however I didn‚Äôt see this anywhere on the website of booking documents. This works about at around ¬£80 (which obviously you get back when you leave). However I would also advise that the international transfer bank into your account takes up to 28 days therefore try and use cash and then convert the money back at the airport otherwise you will be like me and have to wait for almost a month for the money back.    I do have a couple points that they could improve on in my opinion. The first would be the service at the snack bar. The food that they served was good however it takes a while to be served and a while to get the food. The portion sizes were also on the small size for a late breakfast that I had (half a slice of toast which was cold when I got it).    The second is regarding the leaving day. We were collected at 7am by Thomas Cook for our 11am flight which was fine however the buffet breakfast doesn't open until 7am. When I asked the reception team about this I was advised to ask the transfer bus to wait until I had breakfast... Clearly this wasn't an option therefore I asked the restaurant manager who advised there is no way we could have any food before we left. Therefore I had to take some fruit as an alternative. This was frustrating baring in mind I had booked all inclusive.    Overall its a really nice hotel that is close enough for you to get into the city when/if you wanted. Yet far enough away for it not to have the busy city hustle and bustle.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I really enjoyed my stay here. It is a very well maintained hotel and the staff go out of their way to make your stay. I stayed in a superior pool view room which was on the ground floor it was spacious and spotlessly clean my only gripe was that there were no towel hooks so we had to hang our towels over the doors. There were so many options to eat including so many vegan and veggie options. Considering that the wine is poured freely and constantly i didn‚Äôt expect it to be great but it was actually quite nice although sometimes served to you in a martini or brandy glass which was an experience. For me this was not the most Luxurious 5 star hotel but the things it lacked were unimportant as my priority was to relax and have a good time which is exactly what I was able to do. Review_Date: LesleyT wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Attended here for 4 night golf break with our local club. Hotel is very clean staff are helpful and food is quite good. Our hotel room although of a good standard did not have a bath and the shower did not drain hence every time used flooded into the main bedroom We did raise this with reception but the problem was ongoing. The buffet restaurant is of a good standard for a limited stay but could become repetitive if staying for any length of time. The Moroccan restaurant is overpriced and not worth a visit. All our party came out hungry after the set menu. The outside facilities and the gym are very good although the pool was cold but this was expected at the time of our visit. Hotel is set in the middle of no where so making it difficult to go offsite unless transport is booked. We would not visit Marrakech again but this is not down to the hotel.

Review_Date: R3991UNdennisd wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We had a Splendid time at Be Live Collection Hotel in Marrakech and would certainly stay there again. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: BillericayHammer wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here for my 50th birthday celebration and had a wonderful week.  The hotel is new and is kept absolutely spotlessly clean. The rooms gardens and communal spaces are always being tender to so you get that feeling of being in a very special place.  I see that some reviews have had bad experiences with the staff but I can only relate our experience which was that they were excellent. Especially the waiters in the restaurant who worked incredibly hard and were always friendly and helpful.  The food was excellent. Usual AI buffet style but a huge variety and everything tasted great. I particularly loved the lamb and my wife the fresh vegetables.  The drink was again standard AI local stuff but was fine. We tried the white and rose wines and they were perfectly OK and I had both the local and San Miguel beers.  One word on location : be aware that this hotel is set way out of town and essentially there is nothing around it. So if you are thinking you can walk anywhere then you will be disappointed. Having said that the hotel runs an excellent free shuttle bus into town around 5 times a day. We used that and it worked out great.  The entertainment : we did not get involved in the entertainment during the day as we just wanted to relax but people seemed to be enjoying it. The evening entertainment around the bar was actually pretty good. A coupe of the bands and singers they had to were excellent.  Regarding the 'swim up' rooms..... This is a bit of a misnomer. What you have is a narrow channel of a pool outside your room. The sunbeds are sat in an inch or so of water and you can plunge into the deeper part to cool off whenever you want. So whilst the name is perhaps a bit wrong we did really enjoy having that option.  Only criticism I could really have is that very occasionally there was a bit of a wait for a drink at the bar in the evening and this is an area I think the management could help the staff out with. One they can increase the number of staff and Two they could give them more glasses which they often seemed to run out of! But this is a very minor quibble. You're on holiday so chill out and wait for your drink you're not on the clock!  Overall a great experience and we would jump at the chance to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Scott Vincent wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: before i rant about the airconditioning its partly my own fault as its happened before to me in Marrakech and i must have just forgot. This was a last minute decision to book on the Sunday before we flew on Friday. Just wanted something hot and a short flight for seven days. This was tipped as a five star hotel in the Tui collection and after checking there own web site it looked pretty good and offered everywere airconditioned rooms which is a necessity for me as i sleep terrible in hot places. When we arrived our Junior suite was pretty nice amazing lounge area and sizable bedroom with extensive second floor balcony. really happy. Checked in got changed left the aircon on 18 and left to sunbath. You can imagine our horror when we got back and the room was 28 deg that was about 3 more than we had been sunbathing.  Long story short they dont switch the airconditioning on until the end of April irrelevant of how hot it is outside. FYI it was about 25-26.  When i challenged them at reception they said no one else had complained and as it was winter they couldent do anything. We thought it strange no one would say anything and it was only when we chatted with people around the pool did we realise everyone had been complaining.  If you are staying between October and April its worth checking about the aircon.  As it was all inclusive its worth mentioning the food offering is pretty limited with only one main restaurant for breakfast lunch and dinner and a secondary restaurant they use for a Moroccan experiance.  The main restuarant is a bit bland and badly designed with the staff having to push past you while they take plates back to the kitchen.  In order of service i would only give breakfast 2/5 with Lunch and dinner 3/5. most of the hot dishes on Lunch and dinner are mostly Tangine and for whatever reason were super dry nothing like we experianced in the medina restaurants. Lots of fishe dishes at night but again really dry no sauce. The Moroccan experiance which according to the hotel you can only book once was the most disapointing again super dry and bland. In fairness i did see people eating burger and chips at the pool every day and they looked satisfied.  The bar in the evening was great way to relax and the bar manager never stopped all night with his cocktails.  Finally the spa which was another reason to book a good hotel was perhaps the worst i have encountered. The very first day we arrived in the morning i tried to book a massage for the evening. The place was empty and i could not get any of the young staff to confirm if they could do it all they would say was can you come back another time. In the end i took a taxi up to the Medina and booked a Hammam. 250 dhms which was more than half price what it was at the hotel.  Summary not 5 star more like 3.5
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Michelle R wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Have just returned from a 10 day stay with my partner and daughter.    Hotel had a lovely atmosphere as it's small enough to get to interact with your fellow guests but big enough to chill too.    Special mention must be made to praise Simo and Abdessamad. Simo leads the entertainment team and strikes the right balance between encouraging people to participate and not being too intrusive. Abdessamad in the restaurant is the most attentive waiter and remembered our drinks preferences whether at breakfast or dinner.    Our first night was spent in room 5002 which appeared to be a disabled access room as it had a walk in shower and open plan WC with no bath. We had to be moved as the bathroom was poorly designed with the shower drain being at the highest point and therefore the bathroom was under 2" of water with no chance of it draining away. No debate over moving rooms as I suspect it was a known issue. Room 5003 was lovely this time with a huge bath and separate shower cubicle and enclosed WC. We had asked for a quiet room but the superior rooms are sited opposite the sports bar which is open to 1am. We like to sleep with the terrace door ajar so we had a little noise but it wasn't too bad as the hotel was only half full. At full capacity/high season I think this would be a different story.    We had wet weather during our stay which meant that the bar seating was full with long queues at the bar. There was only ever one bartender on duty which we felt was a way of managing consumption so we just doubled our order! If you were lucky you could catch the eye of the waiter who would take your order and return after quite a delay with your drinks often with nuts and olives. Evening entertainment was good with the usual singers dancers etc.    The spa is a great facility most useful during the wet weather. We each enjoyed a massage which was reasonably priced.    Being away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech is a bonus. The shuttle bus in and out was easy and we had no problem reserving seats although others weren't so lucky.    I would definitely stay at the Be Live chain again but probably wouldn't return to Marrakech as we generally like to visit new destinations each time.    All in all a lovely holiday made special by meeting interesting people and being looked after so well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Susan Cook wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: This was an awesome week meeting loads of new people and having a great time.  The room was very comfortable with large queen size bed large shower and very spacious. The place is very clean and constantly being maintained by staff.  Food was always available either from the buffet where there was a choice for everyone or the snack bar if people wanted the convenience type food such as pizza. The drinks were fast and flowing with a range of cocktails for you to try or the simple beer.  What can I say about the entertainment team (Simo Titfi Fati and Salim) as well as my husband and I staying up every night until 1am in the bar with the live music or the belly dancers I was then up at 10am for the yoga archery salsa dancing and twice daily aqua aerobics in the heated pool. We also under took an Arabic lesson and played mini golf. There was lots for us to do. So if you want to join in go for it. Thank you Team!  There are two pools one heated and one unfortunately not but it does have a swim up bar which is a nice feature. There is a spa which I did not visit this time but would do if we visit again.  Outside of the complex we visited the Souks (local markets) which was an experience not to be missed.  This hotel and complex is well worth a visit and there was nothing to complain about. Great job by all including the entertainment team the bar staff and caterers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sammy E wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Me and my Husband have just returned home from this hotel and we have not one bad word to say about this place.  Our stay was incrediable from start to finish.  I could pick out some faults but they are such small things that it‚Äôs not even worth going into.    Our room was brilliant on arrival we were greeted with rose petals in the shape of a heart on our bed. This was lovely as we weren‚Äôt expecting any kind of anything special for our Honeymoon. The bed is so so soft we struggled to get out of it in time for breakfast.  The ONLY thing I would suggest is tea and coffee making facilities in the room - that would be a huge bonus!    The food - it was never bad. But I did struggle as I am more of a plain and simple girl. There was a huge range of starters mains and desserts. It seems previous reviews saying the food was bland has hit a nerve with the chefs as that certainly is not the case now. There was also copious amounts of fruit and vegetables. Enough to suit all pallets.    The staff - where do I start?  Simo is awesome. Always smiling and says hello to everyone he passes. Very charming young man who is constantly on the move and full of energy. He joined us for lunch on our last day and we were facisnated listening to him telling us about his life.    Titif is also awesome he is also always smiling and greeting everyone. He set up the Archery course for us on Thursday (bad weather day) and joined the team I was on - we had an amazing time and thanks to him our team won! He also showed me and my husband a few card tricks which we will be showing to our children. We showed him some of the card games we played so he can pass on these games to other guests.    All in all we had a brilliant time. We met some amazing people who we will keep in contact with - something we don‚Äôt nornally do but this hotel brings everyone together and you end up forming friendships throughout your stay.    Hopefully in the future we will have the opportunity to stay here again and we would do so without any hesitation.    Thanks again to ALL the staff I wish I could mention you all but I would be here forever.    See you all soon.  Sam and Rich
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: keithliz wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: The hotel is very nice in a very quite location outside of town . The rooms were very comfortable . Nice bath and shower . A few English channels on TV . Only water in the fridge unless you upgrade to a package of fridge drinks  Two pools one heated with music and aqua aerobics . One quiet with a swim up bar but to cold when we went at the end of march .  The entertainment was low key .Not big shows . Small dance troop .Duos and small groups .  The drinks from the bars were of good quality and often bottled mixers . Bottled beers available in the sports bar and swim up bar . A pool table .TV and bar games were in the sports bar and late night snacks open until one .  The food was good and a fair amount of choice for a small hotel . The only problem as with most Buffet restaurants was the food being only warm or cold . The cakes fruit ice cream are great  Overall I would recommend and I would return for a weeks chill out .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: RyanD23 wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: If you look back on my past reviews it‚Äôs very rare that I‚Äôll write anything negative but I think this hotel has to brush up on a few things.    The Spa is by far the best thing about this hotel for the rest I‚Äôm going to try and break this hotel down there‚Äôs some good and some bad    Amazing -    - The Spa is unbelievable ¬£170pp for 5-6 hours of massages and treatments per person    Good -    - Most Staff  - Very Clean and nice Rooms (great shower)  - Service  - Value for money (¬£440pp for 4 nights including flights and transfers)  - The Hotel grounds (looks great & very clean)  - Food was good and had a fair bit of variety some bad bits    Being picky -    - Alcohol not sold at the sports bar during the day and most of the evening even when big football matches were being shown. You had to walk 40 yards to get a beer. So not ideal    - No tea or coffee facilities in the rooms (only water in a small fridge)    - You can‚Äôt buy any drinks at the shop to take to your room    Bad -    - Reception staff didn‚Äôt come across great everything appeared to be hard work.    - No Air-conditioning in the room as it‚Äôs classed as out of season despite being 26c  We were ready to leave the first night because it was so hot.  We didn‚Äôt eventually get moved to a room with a breeze but then introduced the bugs as we had to have the door open all the time - however I would put this down to TUI for not giving any indication that this is a seasonal thing.    - Lumps in the milk a few times not great for your morning coffee    - A few things undercooked where they were trying to rush to keep the food consistent on the trays    - Quite slow with the drinks at meal times    Onto TUI -    What a terrible company from the moment you make the payment.    Trying to book seats online after paying was a nightmare  We booked and paid for exit seats but then only had that option on the way back even then we were seated separately.  Then the issue with the air-con - I phoned them on the first day they said they will call me back straight away then I didn‚Äôt hear from them for the duration of the trip  Complete Joke    Overall Ok
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Kevin Y wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine and the Staff are excellent.  Their service is second to none very proffesional and extremely friendly.  They made our stay even better than we expected.  I would recommend anyone to come to Marrakech and stay at Be Live Collection Marrakech.tetif and fati and azdine and yassine  Thank you very much Mohcine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Maria W wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine a fantastic waiting service very attentive and friendly . Drinks at the ready as soon as you‚Äôre seated. Lovely lounge area to relax in either after a day at the pool or before or after your meal.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: GC62 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Winter Sun, Be Live Collection Marrakech March 2019
Review_Text: Just returned from a great weeks winter sun & would like to state that I spoke to guest relations during our stay & are aware of the following comments.  We arrived to a very warm welcome reception team who explained all amenities at the hotel & suggested that we took lunch or a drink at the Lobby or Pool bars as our rooms would be available at 2pm (we arrived at 12noon) this we did enjoying the surroundings of the pool along with a refreshing drink.  Staff:  All the staff at the hotel can't do enough for you & you are always greeted with warm smile.  Accommodation:  The rooms are fresh clean with a sumptuous bed  we had a ground floor room with terrace which was lovely. Large bathroom with separate shower  toilet twin basins & a huge bath.The rooms are cleaned daily to a very high standard.  Pool:  We stayed around the main pool out of the two pools where there are plenty of sun beds umbrellas & doubled covered loungers. Daily entertainment included water aerobics  darts stretching & archery to name just a few things to do if you want pool side.  Bars & Restaurant:  This is where the hotel requires some attention & as already mentioned I have spoken with the hotel about while staying so they are aware.  Food:  There is plenty of choice of food in the main restaurant the only issue we found was that the food was being prepared far to soon & was either warm or cold. Most days there was lack of dinner plates bowls side plates & dessert spoons. this can be simply resolved by ensuring that one of the many kitchen staff was responsible for checking these to ensure that nothing ran out during service.  Bars:  On three seperate occasions the Sports bar ran out of Beer Rum & Gin on another the pool bar ran out of clean plastic tumblers & at another time the Lobby bar ran out of high ball tumblers serving Mojitos in Whiskey tumblers.    Now these are really silly things that should never happen once is a mistake on multiple occasions its a habit!    We have stayed at A/I 5* hotels in the past with the restaurant & bar service being far superior than what we received at the Be Live Collection Marrakech but saying all this we had a great week & WOULD return hopefully seeing these silly issues resolved as I have been ensured by guest relations!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nikkzzz wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: 20th-24th Feb 19..    We arrived as group of 4 ladies for my friends hen do..  What can I say apart from amazing.. from the beginning to the end.... we came for an relaxing hen and certainly didn‚Äôt fail..the main pool was amazing although the swim up pool was freezing. All entertainment at the hotel was up to good standard.. the hotel was clean.. with the help of concierge. we originally had a room with a single double bed when we actually booked with 2 double beds.. however Maria promptly arranged for the room to be changed. The rooms were spotless spacious and always cleaned on time. As an all inclusive the food was very repetitive and a variety would have been better.. Visiting the souks was amazing seeing what people do for a living.. Would like to thank Maria and Marwa for there help especially for our night life.. you girls was great.. would recommend this hotel!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Mandy B wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The Hotel is kept very clean..... The staff are lovely........ The food in the restaurant was ok so I would suggest eating at the snack bar for lunch as the buffet is the same food for lunch and dinner.  The rooms were hot as the air con isn‚Äôt switched on till June so after complaining twice and asking for a fan I just gave up.  The pool temperature for the swim up bar was freezing so we didn‚Äôt use that bar unless it was for hot chocolate to warm us up after the swim üòÇ  We had a swim up room but was a waste of money as the water was painfully cold and should have been called ‚Äúpaddle up room‚Äù as the water comes up to my knees and I‚Äôm 5‚Äô8.  I will be going back to Morocco one day but won‚Äôt be staying here unfortunately.  Good luck with your stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Julie A wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: What an amazing hotel! Just returned after 5 great days here only wish we'd had longer! The hotel is spotlessly clean staff friendly and helpful nothing too much trouble especially for our waiter Hassan!    If you are going to Marrakesh stay here!! Whilst it may not be in the city centre it was a relief to come back here to superb food and wine relax on a sunbed or swim in one of their two beautiful pools after negotiating the frenzy of down town Marrakesh!    I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel nor to stay here again.    The hotel is all-inclusive and adults only although there is a sister hotel which caters for families - the choice is yours. I'd never heard of Be Live Hotels prior to our visit here but after this experience will be checking out their other hotels.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: C L M wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The hotel was very clean and staff worked hard to keep it so. The buffet was amazing; excellent selection and the wine was very nice too.    A wonderful place to stay for a relaxing break. Impressed from start to finish.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: If going to Marrakech make sure you stay at this Hotel Well placed just outside the city two great pools in lovely grounds so clean and tidy and Wonderful five star food to suit every taste. The staff are friendly and very helpful and our waiter in the restaurant Hassan was superb helpful and attentive and so very professional.The rooms are too a high standard and I will be looking at all the other hotels in this group thank you for a great vacation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Blairmaria wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: My husband and I have spent the last 4 nights here before we move on to Agadir tomorrow. We have had a lovely time we booked a suite which was just perfect we couldn‚Äôt get over how big it was very clean modern and comfortable too. The food was delicious we particularly liked having lunch at the pool bar so we could relax in the sun and enjoy table service. The staff are very kind and always happy to help. Special thank you to the pregnant lady (don‚Äôt know her name) who served us each day at the pool bar always rushing around to make sure everyone was watered and fed with a smile which couldn‚Äôt be easy in the heat! The mojitos were a huge hit with us the beer and rose was also very nice. If we return to Marrakesh for some winter sun we will definitely stay here again and have already recommended this hotel to friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nour wrote a review Mar 2019
