Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Happycamper79 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Nice elements and some lovely staff but completely let down by the basics :(  - Given incorrect room - can‚Äôt share a bed with my other half  - No coffee or mini bar in room  - Ask for iron 3 days in a row and finally provided on 3rd day ten minutes before we need to go out  - Not allowed to take coffee from breakfast to room  - Very rude spa manger and impossible to find out basics on booking and using steam room!  - Pumping music by pool at 10am  - Room smells badly of drains  - Pools are freezing cold  Despite all problems most staff are lovely and place is very clean.  Tried to cancel our last night after they refused to supply a kettle so I could have a 6am coffee... and that again refused :(  Hence my review!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: karen m wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel away from the noise and traffic of Marrakech itself. Exceptionally clean in all areas;swim-up room well worth the upgrade. All the entertainment staff during the day were truly wonderful and really made the holiday especially for my disabled adult son.Good entertainment at night although I can imagine the bar area would not be big enough to accommodate all guests when hotel full. The main restaurant food was varied and of a high standard...a special mention here to our waiter Mouhad whose service was excellent. I have to say that all staff were friendly courteous and helpful. We did hear some negative feedback about the a la carte restaurant and we decided not to try for ourselves...there is certainly enough choice in the main one anyway with different themed nights. Great snack bar by the man pool....lovely to sit out here for lunch! Would highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jeff A wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Best all inclusive we‚Äôve stayed at
Review_Text: First of all ... for then attention of management...  please recognise Azzedine from the lobby bar. This guy was by far the best member of staff I‚Äôve ever encountered in a hotel.... absolutely amazing and always smiling... great kid!    To keep it simple.... here‚Äôs the hotels pros and cons....    Good  Clean rooms  Lovely bathroom  All amenities are pretty close - nicely designed hotel  Decent pool very clean and good beds and free cabanas  Staff were incredible could never do enough  Selection of food was strong good mixture and some very healthy meals.  Entertainment team and night entertainment (on occasionally days were brilliant... the band with the short guy and black girl sorry can‚Äôt remember names... top quality they were!)  Wifi actually really good throughout all rooms and parts of hotel.    Bad.... or should I say suggestions...    Sports bar opening times only open from late... needs to be open more frequently so we can play pool and table football etc. Although staff did open at times for football so all was good.    No Coffee machine in room I would expect this as a minimum.... love a coffee in bed before going for breakfast. Have got drinks self service at breakfast too with an option for paper cups to take away.    Need to have self service soft drinks / water often waiting at the bar for ages just for water or a soft drink! Why not make these self service so the wait at the bar is much reduced.    Shop incredibly expensive ¬£20 for a small bottle of sun cream was reduce koi‚Äôs but of course nowhere else to go. Also was very little snacks or drinks you could buy... I know it‚Äôs all inclusive but sometimes nice to chill in room with snacks    Selected Singer - couple of the nights had a miserable singer on depressing everyone. Killed the mood and room emptied quickly.... people want upbeat and to have fun.    Overall though a brilliant hotel with fantastic staff. Would definitely come back to Marrakesh just for this hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: PB wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Pool is not heated we could not swim. False advertising. Ladies at reception are not friendly. They make it seem like they doing a service to you. The buffet gets to you after 2 days. Similar food everyday. Location is far out.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Cate D wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine who gave us incredible service from day 1 would highly recommend this resort having spent over 20 years within the hospitality industry both as an operations manager for a global luxury group and as Training Director for the HCITB every expectation was met and exceeded my sister and I had an amazing experience and look forward to many more..thank you to the entertainment tetif and fati for enhancing this visit
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rhi√°n James wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Ignore all the bad reviews, this hotel is amazing.
Review_Text: We stayed here for 10 nights. Initially we were told by Thomas Cook we‚Äôd get a room upgrade for my birthday when we arrived hotel didn‚Äôt have any knowledge of it. Not the hotels fault if was just our awful Thomas Cook holiday rep who was no where to be seen for 10 nights. All of the reception staff were friendly and always helpful when we needed something. They also helped my partner decorate our room on my birthday and bought us a cheesecake etc it was beautiful.    Our room was always spotless the cleaners kept it immaculate. As long as we remembered put our dirty towels in the bath we had fresh ones each day.    The food was fresh daily never had any problems with it. Breakfast is repetitive but lunch and dinner does change most days.    Lobby bar and sports bar staff were always super friendly and couldn‚Äôt do enough for us Azdine Yanis Youness ayoun and Mouhcine (we didn‚Äôt get everyone‚Äôs names sorry!) were always smiling and continued to refill our drinks throughout our time at the lobby bar day or night.    Entertainment was always different of an evening and a special mention to Simo and Salim who worked super hard to engage the guests into activities both day and night. Simo worked so hard and deserves massive credit. On another note; Fati wasn‚Äôt helpful I do feel that she leaves Simo to do everything whilst she just relaxes in the towel hut. A couple of times I went to change my towels and she was just relaxing on her phone leaving other entertainers to do all the work. Doesn‚Äôt seem fair on the other stagf.    The shuttle bus from hotel into town is frequent and the pick up/drop off point is easy to get to. If you get a taxi it‚Äôs 100 dirham before 8pm and 150dirham after 8pm. There is nothing close by to the hotel so you can‚Äôt walk anywhere outside of the resort. We booked all of our trips through the lovely man in the hotel lobby he is helpful and all our trips went smoothly with no issues!    Only one issue is that there was no air con in the rooms and if was 32 degrees on some days.    Thanks so much for an amazing holiday we will be back next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: yousaf wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We travelled as a group of 4 friends and booked via Tui to the Be Live Collection Adults Only in Marrakech and I must say it was awesome.    It is a big resort with plenty of outdoor space. Peaceful and relaxing.    The hotel is situated in a standalone plot about 20 minutes drive from central Marrakech. It runs a free shuttle bus back and forth five times a day but you are asked to pre-book your seat the day before.    The resort is beautifully done with landscaped gardens it is spotlessly clean throughout has huge rooms and is tastefully decorated. Rooms have a safe where you can keep your valuables and documents and you can change currency at the reception. Exchange rate is a little lower than you would get in town but saves a lot of hassle.    There are two pools one which is heated and in and around which many of the activities take place throughout the day and a second pool which is unheated.    There are many activities organised throughout the day all free and all very well run by the entertainment team run by Simo and his team Karim Salim Fati and Titif who were very good at their jobs and a pleasure to meet.    We were very pleasantly surprised by the variety range and quality of the food on offer at the main buffet.    There was a pleasant mix of nationalities and age groups at the resort and we feel it offered something for everyone.    There was also varied entertainment in the evenings at the lobby bar.    We used the lobby bar pool bar and snack bar and found the service was always friendly. We were very impressed with the staff as a whole but must give a mention to Ayoub at the pool bar and Mohcine and Yassin at the lobby bar.    There is also a sports bar open till 1am where you can get drinks and snacks.    The gardeners and the housekeeping team were always on the go and were doing a great job.    We must also mention Mounia the manager who was absolutely brilliant as we had some minor issues which she resolved quickly. She even arranged for breakfast to be sent to our rooms the evening before we went out on an early 7am excursion to the Atlas Mountains.    And lastly the TUI rep Sara Jane who met us at the airport when we landed and was always there and who helped us with all the information we needed and who booked our 4 days of excursions for us a great big thank you.    To summarise we felt this resort met all our needs perfectly after a stressful few months at work we needed a getaway and it was a perfect balance of relaxing at the resort and getting out there to see the culture meet the people see the architecture and learn some history. It met and exceeded all our hopes and expectations.    The staff definitely make all the difference at this resort to make it what it is as they clearly have worked so hard to achieve and maintain these standards. We would definitely return to this resort.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Debra G wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Considering this hotel had only been open 1 Year on March 15  there is a lot of work that needed to be attended to  like the floor in the lobby bar near the bar  the door to the ladies toilets near the snack bar and quite a lot of the walls leading to the rooms are a mess
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Marcialynnette wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We wanted luxury sun quality service and relaxation and that is exactly what we got. I treated my husband to a swim up room as it was his birthday and that really was a nice touch. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff they were friendly and helpful. The food was delicious the wine was suprisingly good and the entertainment and team (Simo) was superb. We really had fun. Would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Mel P wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We had a thoroughly enjoyable weeks stay in March.  Cleanliness is noticeable rooms cleaned daily. Like that there is a system that encourages you to be environmentally friendly ie placing towels in the bath that need changing.  Fresh water replenished daily.  Massive bed and very comfortable as were the pillows.  Not usually one for entertainment teams I did however find the team here to be more respectful if you choose not to participate but encouraging you to engage all the same in a very pleasant manner. A good range of activities.  Used the gym daily and really very adequate. The main pool was heated sufficiently to swim.  We also accessed the ‚Äòquiet pool‚Äô which we found very relaxing.  Service in all areas was good and certainly no complaints.  Food was above standard stayed in a number of all inclusives and this goes into the top ten list. Good choice and quality of foods. Can you believe no chips for a whole week less you ate from the snack bar. Lovely selection of fruits and range of options at breakfast was impressive. Alcohol drinks very pleasant.  We used the bus service Into Marrakesh which was faultless. As stated in reviews there is nothing local we went fri a relaxing week away and this was not an issue for us. Taxi‚Äôs are available and very reasonably priced  Money exchange and ATM in the hotel.  Really couldn‚Äôt find anything to fault highly recommend and would certainly consider again may also look at the be live options in other countries.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Daydream01341558707 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Great resort...but open the sports bar!!!
Review_Text: We enjoyed our stay here In March. It was clean and the food was great. Plenty of sunbeds! Lovely pool. Special thanks to Laila who greeted us with a big smile and coffee every morning and to Hassan who looked after us In the evenings keeping our glasses filled with delicious ros√© wine. Our main critisism is that the sports bar wasnt open for us to play pool or catch up on the football until 10pm which is just too late. When they did open earlier on occasions the bar wasnt open so we had to keeping going back to the snack bar everytime we needed a drink. We were unfortunate to have a full day of heavy rain and it was clear they werent set up for this. They eventually opened the sports bar so we had something to do but they had to close the snack bar instead. We would probably go back even though its quite a way out from the centre and there is nothing else around! The staff are fantastic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: T.H wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The entertainment staff are great at getting everyone involved! Specifically Simo Salim Fati and Titif have been great throughout our one week stay here doing archery beer pong mini golf aqua sports and all sorts.  Lovely food... the snack bar is great friendly staff and fresh food.  Beautiful pools and lots to do here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: SCRahman wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Think this is one of my best holidays so far the staff are so attentive caring and extremely hard working to make you holiday relaxing and an enjoyable experience. The hotel is of a very high standard the food is cooked to perfection and with so much choice the entertainment team are fantastic with so many activities to do during the daytime catering for all age groups would highly recommend this particular hotel for a perfect break away    Sarah
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Carlito jack wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Excellent customer service! I would recommend to everyone. Mohcine made us feel at home straight away. The scenery at the hotel is also amazing with great food and cocktails if you book with all inclusive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Meis72 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Great hotel. Nice rooms and they are very clean. Good food. Bus from hotel to centre. Staff is very helpfull. Nice programm of entertainment during the day. Nice Spa good to relax. You will have a very nice relaxing holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: VickieVee wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: I loved this hotel. As a frequent traveller for business and personal reasons I expect a lot from resorts which claim to be 5 star.    This hotel delivered. Comfortable beds spacious suite great entertainment by the pool in the day and fab food. What more could you expect for the price?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: SarahMonty80 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Just returned from 3 nights in this wonderful hotel ! All the staff were welcoming and lovely. The entertainment team went above and beyond and even had me joining in at aqua aerobics which is unusual for me! The pool area was lovely with delightful gardens. The whole hotel has a very relaxed and luxurious feel and is spotlessly clean and well laid out. We stopped in a suite with beautiful views of the sunset from the balcony. There is a wide selection of food choices from the restaurant which was a pleasant surprise for all inclusive plenty of fresh fruit and vegetables delicious deserts and good beer and wine. The entertainment in the bar area was ok. Youness behind the bar made the best Mojitos ! We had a spa treatment which was amazing you can get a cheaper deal if you pay cash and it was very reasonably priced compared to the UK. The cash machine in reception is quite temperamental - select the French option and ask one of the staff to help you as we tried 3 times to get cash before it finally worked! There is a shuttle bus to the main square and the Souks are well worth a visit. We had a fantastic stay and will definitely be back. Don‚Äôt believe all the bad reviews!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: JK wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We stayed here for four nights. We read some bad reviews about this place before we left. But from the moment we arrived at the hotel the staff were very nice helpful and friendly. Our room was spotless and the hotel itself was very well looked after. The staff would organise activates at one of the pools every day optional to take part but we thought it was good fun and a great way to mingle with the over guests. There was another pool which looked to be quieter for those looking for a bit more peace and quiet. As mentioned there is a free shuttle bus going into Marrakech several times a day from outside the hotel which was very handy (make sure to book in at reception as you need a ticket for the bus).  Overall we found this hotel to be a great place for a few days to relax.  ALL staff were very friendly wouldn‚Äôt like to mention any names but they were lovely to us from the moment we arrived.    The only negative for us was our room had an interconnecting door with the room next door. Most mornings we were woken up by the guests in the other room ‚Äì we could hear a hair dryer and zips opening and closing. The noise insulation was not great and would recommend asking for a room with no interconnecting door.Show less

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Bregje B wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Superb mohcine! Le service c‚Äôetait tres bien. It was a great holiday. Everything was nice. The people and the team were very gently and the food is delicious. We will come back next year. Thank you for everything mohcine and yassine and azdine and hassan tetif karim
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Bash wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Excellent hotel, great food, lots to do...
Review_Text: Really pleased with this Hotel it‚Äôs a fab place with so much to do you don‚Äôt really feel like leaving the place. Food is nice and plentiful so the Gym and aqua aerobics come handy to burn off the indulgence.  Particular mention to Karim and Simo the entertainment leads. Very helpful.    On a separate note I booked with Voyage Priv√© awful experience they just don‚Äôt care when they fail to deliver will never be using them again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Graydebbie wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Fantastic Hotel just returned from a weeks stay to celebrate my birthday. The room was fantastic (swim up room) On arrival at room Happy birthday banner birthday cake and lovely decoration on bed (Thank you). All staff were really friendly always greeted with a smile and very polite. The entertainment team SimoSalimKarimFati and Titif worked really hard getting to know you. Even got me to take part in the activities which is a achievement as I usually do not move from my sun lounger and book!!!    Food at the pool bar was great. Sara the waitress was lovely.    First visit to Morocco will defiantly be back and will stay again at this hotel again.    Highly recommend this hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Michelle A wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Still staying here until tomorrow our last day I am always very honest with my reviews  the hotel is very clean modern and new and yes most of the staff are great . However a few issues have disappointed us during our stay  firstly no air conditioning in rooms even though it‚Äôs 32 degrees asked reception why and told marrakech not hot enough yet to switch on  obviously centrally controlled asked for a fan  still waiting .  The food is nice  not a typical 5star choice  good salads  but quite a lot of meat griddled but not cooked properly and fish too raw in the middle .  Also checkout is 12 so later flight in the evening will cost you ¬£100 to keep your room til 6pm  think this is absolutely overpriced stayed in many 5 star resorts around the world never have I been asked to pay this much .  The pools are lovely not deep waist high the main one is heated with entertainment etc but the quiet chill pool with swim up bar is not and is freezing and empty this definitely needs a rethink .  The rooms are fabulous new modern clean  great bathrooms  separate shower  loo bath double sinks and comfortable beds  but the worst sleep all 4 nights as no air con far too hot  and leaving balcony door open you get attacked by mosquitoes.  The other issue we have met is when the hotel is full which it is now meal times are hectic  shortage of staff who are trying so hard to keep tables served  cleaned and waited on  managers stood around doing nothing  I asked a manager for a drink as we had been waiting 15 mins he then asked the waiter to bring it  how sad he couldn‚Äôt help out himself .  Some evenings we have had to wait in the bar for a table as so busy  with 8 couples in front of us .  It‚Äôs a mixed bag of ages here  a lot of golfers  and great to be adult only no children .  There is also no pool service at either pools  which is disappointing.  Personally I wouldn‚Äôt return to the hotel  have stayed in Morocco 26 times and have had much better experiences in other hotels  it was a pleasant 4 day break but could have been better .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: neil w wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: On our last day now  Had a great time  Room fantastic  Cleaner as a whistle here  Food not the greatest if your slightly fussy too much Moroccan veg and fish  Beer very tasty  Snack bar very good  Entertainment very good headed by Salim  The rest of the guys simo fatititif andkalim made our holiday
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Shaz wrote a review Mar 2019

Entertainment team were fantastic Simo KarimsalimtitifFati extremely fluent in many languages and a fabulous variety of activities.  Very enjoyable holiday the weather was very hot.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: idlewarrior wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: What a wonderful peaceful hotel 20 mins from marrakesh very clean rooms big food excellent selection snack bar options late breakfast or early lunch etc.The entertainment team all jolly and great to get along with always something going on if you want it thanks Kamir for my arabic lessons .and the guy on archery all great fun a great team without over pushing it .bar service and waiter sevice great might get very busy in summer.  only cocern small step from lobby bar and restuarant not marked caught peple out as theyre line of sight was looking for tables ..I know it is hot and it is Marrakesh but i missed tea/coffee in the room.  Would recommend this for adults 100%

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Vicky S wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We have loved staying at Be Live Collection! The resort is big enough that there is enough space and enough to do but feels peaceful and intimate.    The rooms are very clean and a great mix of modern and Moroccan the only issue with the room is there is sometimes a drain smell but other than that very pleasant and spacious. I would also advise asking for a room either not on the ground floor or with a garden view as we had a pool view room and did feel quite exposed.    The buffet restaurant is nice and the food is good with lots of variety to suit all tastes and the on site morrocan restaurant is very authentic!    All the staff are very friendly and always make you feel welcome even when they are rushed off their feet! We want to mention Mohcine and Hafid who were especially friendly and attentive!!    There is a free shuttle bus into Marrakech which takes about 20 mins.    Overall a lovely stay and we plan on coming back!! Thanks to everyone at Be Live Collection!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: weelynn wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: What a fabulous hotel! And I‚Äôm fussy lol. We are leaving tomorrow and can honestly say I could stay on for another two weeks. Hotel is beautiful and spacious and sparkles with cleanliness. The food is lovely and the drinks are fabulous. The red wine is very nice too. Our room was beautiful and the bathrooms are stunning. The grounds are beautiful with flowers and shrubs everywhere. Never a shortage of comfortable beds around the pools. But the very best thing about this place is the lovely people who look after your every need. From the room cleaners to the restaurant and bar staff. Every one is so polite and respectful and work very very hard to pander to your every need. Thank you all so much. It‚Äôs a pity the same can‚Äôt be said about some of the guests who on several evenings were just so rude to the staff. Especially the ones turning up in groups of about forty and expecting to be sat together!! How ridiculous!! The poor staff were getting shouted at terribly. It was if these people expected them to make the rest of the guests disappear just to accommodate them because they were in a group!! So sad to see the waiters being treat badly like that. The lovely Simo and the whole entertainment crew work tirelessly to keep you entertained. But if you just want to chill that‚Äôs okay too. The evening entertainment was fun and the cocktails were to die for. Would we come here again? In a heartbeat. Well done everyone at Be Live Collection you made our holiday wonderful xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Robert Stanley Hill wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Came with an open mind and we are half way through our weeks stay here. It is a very good place indeed. The welcome was fast and pain free. Reception staff are pretty good at their job. All the rest of the staff are very friendly and courteous from the snack bar which is the main bar during the day to the lobby bar and the restaurant. Never had to wait for a drink. Food is adequate. Shorts and mixers vary a bit from being tasteless to ok. Cocktails not up to much. Wine is pretty good. All in all it is a good place to visiit. There is nothing in the area to walk to the only drawback
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: rachelr wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Had a very pleasant week long stay. The hotel itself was spotless and the staff went above and beyond with their customer service. Especially Karim who works there he was so lovely and very attentive. Making the stay extra special  And NO CHILDREN makes for a lovely atmosphere  Would definitely go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rachel C wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Pure Indulgence.. and no kids! Perfect.
Review_Text: We are in to the second week of our stay and cannot find fault with anything. We haven't noted all the names of particular staff except the friendly beautiful polite and helpful Ra'ja in the restaurant for breakfast and lunch. The bartender on the swim up bar is absolutely lovely and always cheerful. In fact we haven't come across one single member of staff who is anything but cheerful and polite. They as most Moroccans we have encountered are happy cheerful people.  The hotel is absolutely beautiful. Very modern but still with a Moroccan vibe. The gardens are lush and exotic even before the roses have bloomed.  From the second you walk into reception and you smell the aromatic vapour wafting through the lovely open space you instantly feel lifted and enveloped in luxury.  If the hotel reads this comment could you tell be the name of the incense/perfume used in reception. It is intoxicating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Northwest Chinese Golf socitey wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: 27 of us just got back from a golfing holiday staying in be live collection hotel.. we stay for a week.. hotel was clean.. staff very helpful and friendly a tip a day go a long way so giving 20 dirham (¬£1.80). The only 2 complains I personally would give as I was sharing a double room is that the bathroom has a large window inserted between bathroom and the bedroom and the blinds does not even hide the fact that everything could be view. The reception staff were slow checking in. Food was very good with lots of choices on offer..As the hotel is adults only no kids running around etc...golf wise. the hotel is about 20 minutes from all golf courses. we played first day on' The Montgomerie' the course didn't have enough golf carts to go round our groups so walking from greens to tees were very long some holes being a par 5 walk to the next tee!!!!! The course nothing special if anything each hole look the same layout.so I wouldn't booked there again. The second course 'The Tony Jacklin' was right next door to Montgomerie again nothing special but you still need a golf cart to go round but not as bad as The Montgomerie from greens to tees..The third course 'Al maaden' I personally would play again as it was different set up with views toward the mountain.Last golf course to play was 'Noria ' was out of this world. A truly championship course each hole is difference the 9th and 18th hole with water bang in the middle next to the club house. After golf in Noria few of us gather up in the bar/restaurant area waiting for our group to finish seating next to us were a 4 ball of FRENCH persons whom took it to themselves to tell us to be quiet with one lady screaming at the top of her voice the other lady putting her fingers at her ears. This i may add was rude enough until one of the french lady wanted to take a photo of us this inflame us and a shouting match was had...Nearly came to blows!!! Speaking to bar staff and the pro afterwards the French group in question are known trouble makers.. Anyway beside this the golf holiday was superb. Going to the old town with a group is a no go as the traffic inside is very bad and flume from the cars and bikes were very strong.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Placitasgirl wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Our search for a relaxing week in some warm winter sunshine led us (via Tui) to the Be Live Collection Adults Only in Marrakech and we've just returned after a 1 week break.    The hotel opened almost a year ago and having read some of the early reviews the first thing that is clear is that the management have worked extremely hard to address some of the recurring issues such as drain smells in rooms poor food rude or disinterested staff and have achieved great things because we simply didn't encounter any of these problems.    The hotel is situated in a standalone plot about 20 minutes drive from central Marrakech. It runs a free shuttle bus back and forth five times a day but you are asked to prebook your seat the day before. The property is beautifully done; landscaped gardens spotlessly clean throughout huge rooms (we took a suite) and tastefully decorated.    There are two pools an "active" one which is heated and in and around which many of the activities take place through the day. I joined in the yoga stretch and dance classes as well as the archery sessions and my husband enjoyed refreshing his Arabic at daily sessions too. There are many other activities through the day all free and all very well run by Simo Karim and the team who were very good at their jobs and a pleasure to meet. This pool could get a bit noisy with music on for these sessions and activities going on so after the first day or so we chose to sit around the second pool which is simply beautiful with a swim up pool bar. The pool is unheated but fortunately the water was amazing (26-28c each day) and after a day or so a number of us ventured in to cool down or enjoy a refreshing drink.    This was our first ever AI holiday and we were a bit wary of all buffet food but we were very pleasantly surprised by the variety range and quality of the food on offer at the main buffet and snack bar. The only disappointment was the once per visit dinner at the specialty Moroccan Cuisine restaurant which offers a choice of 2 set menus and table service. The main course on the menu we had chosen was not available and was substituted with a Chicken Tagine which was disappointing as this was a dish always available in the buffet. Our starter (Harira soup) was watery tasteless and contained hard chickpeas. The second course (seven Moroccan salads) was just a plate of mush with the only thing that wasn't bland or over sweet being the spinach. Our main courses arrived and my tagine was terribly overcooked to the point of being almost inedible. The Beef Tanjia also disappointing; bland and tasting only of lemon juice. We've travelled to Morocco on many occasions and I enjoy cooking Moroccan food. We've never had such disappointing dishes and I left the restaurant when the main arrived and ate at the buffet. Such a shame and a real missed opportunity for the resort given how well they do food everywhere else. We weren't the only guests to leave and eat elsewhere or to comment on how disappointed we were.    There was a pleasant mix of nationalities and age groups at the resort and we feel it offered something for everyone. We didn't attend any of the shows in the evening but the feedback from guests who did was very good. We did use the lobby bar pool bar and snack bar and found the drinks good and the Moroccan Ros√© really lovely. Service again was always friendly if a little slow but always delivered with a smile. We were super impressed with the workmate of staff in the buffet who never stopped and the same is true of the gardeners and housekeeping team. Special mention to Sara at the pool bar who despite being 7 months pregnant didn't stop and never stopped smiling. Good luck with the little on Sara!    To summarise we felt this resort met all our needs perfectly; it was a "fly and flop: week after a stressful few months and the holiday for us wan't about the destination but the resort and it met and exceeded all our hopes and expectations.    If I were to offer any tips I'd say that the rooms at the unheated pool side of the resort are quieter and I wouldn't book a ground floor room; the upper rooms are quieter and more private in my opinion.    We were made aware of the deposit for towels/damages by Tui and also of the fact that the spa was independently run and incurred additional charges for their services and the indoor pool which is located there. The gym is free of charge. The hotel description on the Tui website indicated that it was outside the city but a quick google search would clearly show you it's in an undeveloped area with nothing nearby to walk to.    We would definitely return to the resort. We'd book a suite again and would ask if we could be located on the quieter side again.    I'm impressed by the way the resort has settled into it's skin since opening and that the reviews are now reflecting this which must be really pleasing for the whole team who have clearly worked so hard to achieve and maintain these standards.    Thank you Be Live Collection we had a great time and hope to see you all again in the not too distant future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: ikkesdb wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: This is one of the best hotels we visited.  Great accomodation and super service.  Especially mohcine in the lounge bar was impressive in customer service ;-)    The rooms where clean and well equiped 2 swimming pools one quite and one animation and a great buffet restaurant    We will be back !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: AverageMum2015 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We booked this hotel to enjoy a bit of winter sun. The hotel is bright modern and kept spotlessly clean. The rooms are light airy and spacious. We were all inclusive and the standard of food served was great. My only criticism is that I booked this hotel partly as it had an indoor pool  sauna steam room and spa. However on arriving at the hotel I was told it was run entire independently and all their facilities incurred a considerable extra charge - over ‚Ç¨20 each per visit. We were lucky with the weather so didn‚Äôt need to use it. I feel this should be made clear when booking. We booked through Tui and indoor pool etc was billed as a main plus with no mention of extra costs. I‚Äôve never been to a hotel where use of the indoor pool is extra! The hotel is in a small gardened area but around the hotel is totally undeveloped so there‚Äôs no where to stroll locally.Marrakech itself is 20 mins away and the hotel offers several shuttle buses per day. It costs @‚Ç¨15 by taxi.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: Totally enjoyed my stay at this hotel . In terms of being a All Inclusive resort the food exceeded my expectations. The hotel itself is visually pleasing and rooms are extremely comfortable & modern. With the added bonus of the free bus service to the square our stay was smooth and well catered for . Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: H√•rek S wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Stayed for 14 days-and we really enjoyed the stay!Everything was excellent-foodstaff and all the choices ...swimminggym and other activities.The room was extremely clean-also the rest of the hotel.Appreciated that the hotel had a free shuttle bus to the town.We will absolutely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: AVW94 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: I stayed here for 3 nights with my boyfriend as a birthday present and it was amazing!    We booked the suite which was huge with comfortable beds. It had a balcony overlooking the pool and hotel grounds. The room was extremely clean as was the entire hotel even the toilets at the reception were immaculate.    The hotel is all inclusive and the food was wonderful a wide selection to choose from for breakfast lunch and dinner. You can also have burger and chips by the pool just before lunch - be careful of the flies around that particular bar area.    The spa is definitely worth the price you pay- it is quite expensive in comparison to elsewhere but it is 100% worth it the atmosphere and the staff; amazing! I fell asleep during my massage and the hammam left my skin feeling brand new!    The hotel also had a free shuttle bus to the market which was great. There is also free gym access and a sports bar with a massive TV for football the bar also includes board and card games. There are 4 bars around the whole hotel so loads to drink!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Beanie31 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Just returned from a week at this lovely hotel. Room and facilities were very good. Buffet food excellent with plenty of choice. Good programme of entertainment during the day. All staff very friendly and helpful. On the negative side... pillows in bedroom extremely uncomfortable! Ate in A la Carte restaurant on one night very disappointing. 2 Set menu choices so not a la carte and food not as good as buffet selection. The hotel ran out of tonic water on 3 of the 7 nights that we were there which was very disappointing and not something you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Cocktails also very disappointing I saw one barman in the pool bar adding water to my pina colada. Local Moroccan wine on the other hand was very good!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Froggyx1 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Great staff, fresh food, a relaxing January break away
Review_Text: HoHssine Belhimer is the perfect host in the bar. The hotel has everything for a break away from the UK's January blues. The food is fresh and varied the all inclusive "local" wines spirits and beers are some of the best we have had. Whilst not a "spa" person the hammam was certainly an experience. All in all can't fault anything - all the staff were so friendly attentive and we thoroughly recommend the Be Live Marrakech.  We upgraded to the swim up pool room - too cold to use the pool but its location was in a quiet part of the hotel and the room and bed size were great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Resort62162 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine is a credit to the hotel. Attentive handsome and funny. What a great start to our holiday x x x hotel is so lovely. Mohcine gives such a great service to everyone x with a lovely smile and the cocktail he made us was soooooo amazing x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Kate N wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Had an excellent 4 night break with my 18 year old son. I tried the gym yoga aqua aerobics and archery and he tried all the cocktails on the bar menu.    Had a suite which was massive: bedroom with very comfortable king size bed fully separated from the sitting room by a sliding door. Only disappointment was the sofa bed wasn‚Äôt the usual type- pull out  type with a double mattress - it was the sofa with bedding added still comfortable enough though.    Excellent food with good range at each meal. Delicious desserts beautifully presented with exquisitely made pastry. Moroccan wine was good each of the cocktails was apparently great.    Spa was large and modern booked a 3 day package. Lovely staff including the 2 Hammam girls Illem and Lattifa and we had great range of massages.    Main pool was warm lovely to be swimming in February looking up at a bright blue cloudless sky.    The evening entertainment was surprisingly good excellent singers. Depending on the mix of guests in the bar people got up and danced some nights.    The clientele seem mixed many stylish French Dutch and Japanese. Some people were on golfing holidays but most here to relax.    Overall an excellent hotel we‚Äôd definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Gilly W wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: A stayed here for 7 nights with a friend. We agreed it was the best holiday we'd ever had and will definitely return.    I'd booked a twin room the room was huge and we had a double bed each! Gorgeous bathroom large shower separate bath twin wash basins. Our ground floor room had it's own terrace opposite one of the pools.    We were all inclusive the choice of food at each meal was good tagines plus other great choices every day; lovely selection of vegetables and salads. Loads of fresh fruit available too.    All staff were lovely and worked so hard! The waiters in the restaurant knew our preferences very quickly as did the barman; they all looked after us really well .    Activities going on at one pool every day including: football yoga archery aqua aerobics salsa and Arabic lessons.    There's a gorgeous spa offering many different treatment options I had two massages during my stay.    The hotel is designed in the traditional Morrocan style cleanliness could not been faulted.    My only concern was that they seem unable to cater for dietary intolerances; despite several emails from the travel agent and myself. Having said that I didn't starve. There was always something delicious I could have.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Georgnax1 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Mohcine the waiter at the lobby bar so friendly always has a smile and nothing is too much trouble we‚Äôll done mohcine it has been a pleasure to meet you thank you for making our holiday one to temember
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Liam M wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We have loved every minute of our trip from the 1st moment that we arrived. The Hotel is fantastic great scenery & gardens rooms are really nice and very modern but with that Morrocan twist. The food is great with a huge variety every single day for breakfast lunch and tea! Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Marjorie wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Gorgeous hotel romantic and cosy small corners where you can sit and relax. Furniture is extremely well chosen. The food is better compared to other hotels in Marrakech!  Mojito at the bar next the restaurant is great.    Only bad thing that I can say is that the rooms are noisy we paid for a nice swim up room which logically results in a groundfloor room... but the noise we have from our upper neighbours is really anoying it s like they are redecorating every morning and they don t use there complete feet to walk but just their heels. It can be bad luck but if you aren t paying for a swim up room i would suggest asking a room on the first floor.    We are even thinking about booking 2 extra days but are waiting to see if the noise pollution decreases.    Br  Marjorie&Nicolas
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Kazzaholibobs wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We arrived on Friday. By Saturday I was completely relaxed. Lots to do pool aqua aerobics and other fitness activities are great. Spa is amazing good value for money and leaves you floating. Spend as much as you can afford you‚Äôre worth it. Rooms are fab and I could stay in bed all day is so comfy. Mohcine at lobby bar has looked after us so well nothing is too much trouble and his smile is like the Moroccan sun. I‚Äôll update as I go but in essence the staff are amazing and nothing is too much trouble.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sarah K wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Fabulous hotel for complete relaxation peace and quiet. The Staff are all wonderful.  The spa is worth every penny and the Hammam and massage package were sublime. Mohcine at the bar was always helpful and polite. Great service fabulous food. Beyond amazing!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: PPLE593 wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: It honestly baffles me how anyone can rate this place any less that 5 star. From arrival we were given an absolutely outstanding service. The hotel itself is beautiful pristine and modern. The food was fantastic - I would pay for it in a resturant so to get it at a buffet is exceptional. The staff here are so helpful nothing is too much and our drinks order was always remembered. For the resort being very popular it never seemed overcrowded or busy. We could always find sunloungers at any time of the day. The shuttle bus to town was very handy and the reception is open 24 hours for things like money exchange but there is a cash point in reception to draw out dirham.  As it was our honeymoon on arrival our bed was covered in rose petals and we were given a lovely cheescake. We felt very special.  All in all I would not hesitate to recommend this outstanding hotel to anyone looking to visit morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Naimish wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Amazing Experience, Except One Minor Hiccup
Review_Text: It was an amazing experience place was beautiful and Great Staff  always smiling and very helpful. Very good cocktails.Spa was not that great wouldn't recommend that. Except one bad experience  non customer walked in and got drunk. Screaming and running here and there bashing on the walls. Seems like security staff knew him therefore they didn't kicked him out and entertained him for 3 hours till 3am. They should have taken him out and dealt with promptly instead.    Lifeguards Karim Simo and Fatima were so nice and helpful always smileing. Made whole trip unforgettable. Big thank you for all the entertainments...    Experience at the Main Square was a quite an adventure. You have to be very careful with people very dominative people at Main Square. 20 mins in and out lol    Over all I had a nice time...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: QQwertyu wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Perfect in every way! Spotlessly clean and modern spacious rooms. Staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Especially Simo Fati Karim Salim Tatif Sara and Ayoub. The attention to detail puts this hotel above all others. Fantastic entertainment all day. Live bands at night who were really talented traditional belly dancing archery games. Something for everyone and all for Adults. This actually is an adult only hotel. The food was delicious and catered for all tastes or diets. I doubt vegetarians would have any problems here. Wow you should have seen the Valentines Day spread! Plus we were all given roses. Take a kettle as there is not one in the room. It is slightly cool in the mornings or late at night. But a cardigan will be enough. They put heaters on outside at night if you like to sit out. I went in February and no mosquitoes. Sara the Tui rep was always on hand and very helpful. No problem exchanging currency at reception and our room had a free safe. I would go so far as to say this is the best hotel i have stayed in and I am well travelled. I will definitely be going back. Deserves 10 stars! I seriously cannot find fault and can‚Äôt understand any bad reviews
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Stacey wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Me & my boyfriend booked this hotel based on the previous reviews. The food was nice but I found the food a little samey throughout the week and reverted back to either pizza or pasta every night and I am adventurous in trying new foods so that was a little disappointing.    We upgraded to the swim up room the room was lovely and clean and really big! The bathroom was my favourite part as it had a rainfall shower. Many people have complained about the shower flooding but that‚Äôs because they weren‚Äôt careful with the door! If you close it really slowly so water will be pushed out.    As we travelled in December we weren‚Äôt actually able to use the swim up pool as it wasn‚Äôt heated so was Ice cold so wasted my money on that tbh! But if we‚Äôd have gone in the summer months I have no doubt we would have used it daily!    The pool was really clean but only one of them was open unfortunately the one with the swim up bar was closed. Again probably due to the time of year.    The drinks were ok the best cocktails were in the sports bar as they seem to take a little more time making them whereas in the bar inside the hotel they are busy so seem to just throw them together so taste completely different.    The night life on the first night was great they had the normal show on which was in the main bar which got rather cramped (not sure if they do the shows somewhere else when it‚Äôs mega busy?) then they had a DJ on till gone 1am which was ace but every night after that the bar shut at 12 and the sports bar at 1am but there wasn‚Äôt really a night light life tbh. They had singers etc on which were good but it was mostly a sit and chat kind of evening.    The spa ..... we paid for a couples spa experience over 2 days. The spa is simply beautiful and is soooo clean. We had AMAZING hot stone massage that I can‚Äôt recommend highly enough! HOWEVER beware of the Hammam!!! It started with us in a steam room all ok so far we were then taken into a Mable room with 2 marble slabs as I entered one of the women grabbed by bikini top off of me so I was naked on top and then asked if it was ok :/ we were then asked to lay on the slabs they then proceeded to hose us down and then vigorously rub creams and salts into our skin (even my breasts) we were asked to flip over several times which on a Mable slab when wet is rather difficult and VERY unflattering!!! They spoke in their language the whole way though which I found rude and not relaxing at all. We were then hosed for a final time given a robe and then ushered into the pool area (I was still topless) so had to stand in the corner to try and put my top back on. DAY 2 of the Hammam same drill HOWEVER I knew was was coming with the top being off so I opted for a swim suit which I would have to pull down myself. I‚Äôm not sure if this annoyed her that I was prepared as when I laid on the slab she pulled my bottoms right up so I had an awful wedgey she then proceeded to rub cream all over up and down my legs and even grazed somewhere she shouldn‚Äôt have!! I was just laid there mortified! They again told us to flip over sit up all of which again wasn‚Äôt flattering when your boyfriend is laid across from you. They even hosed us directly in our faces to get some cream off. Again robe on ushered back to the pool. The massages we had after the hammam were great but the whole traumatising experience ruined it for me! Didn‚Äôt feel like I could say anything as they all just spoke in different languages so just sucked it up.    They provide a shuttle bus into Marrakech which is handy TIP: when you get off the bus if a gentleman comes to speak to you and says he works with the hotel and says he can show you to the markets DECLINE! We didn‚Äôt and he ended up showing us around the entire market taking us to different trade stalls (he clearly had an agreement with them) even took us to a random shop where they put us in a room and tried to sell us stuff. He walked us around for hours and we tried several times to tell him we were ok from here but he continued to follow us around. I‚Äôd had enough at one point and said enough is enough and he demanded loads of money from us for his time we ended up giving around 200 (roughly ¬£13) as he had taught us loads of stuff we wouldn‚Äôt have known he took it and left. This only left us with about 40 mins to ourselves as we‚Äôd booked our shuttle back.    All in all I wouldn‚Äôt go back to this hotel or Marrakech based on my experience on this holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jags200 wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: I wouldn‚Äôt rate the hotel a 5* resort / 3*- 4* at best.
Review_Text: The experience was a sub 3* experience. The toilets in the room smell of sewage constantly throughout the day which was very disappointing and made the stay very unpleasant. The food on the buffet was lacking variety and was the same menu everyday for lunch and dinner. The Moroccan experience was however a tasteful experience.    The members on the snack bar were very disengaged de- motivated which showed when they presented themselves to members of the public. The snack bar service was very slow service this was mainly due to the numbers of staff required to serve the public demand. I believe the staffing number in this area needs to be increased.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Mareesa P wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is the perfect place for a relaxing getaway. 25 minutes from the airport 30 minutes from the M√©dina enough to escape the noise and totally relax. The hotel is VERY clean and the staff are some of the friendliest I have come across in this type of resort. Hafid the barman in the lobby bar was exceptional in fact the lobby bar and the restaurant staff were always smiling and welcoming. The service around the pools and snack bar however were not as good slow service and grumpy staff. The food in the hotel was ok a good choice but not always hot. The snack bar food was good so we ate lunch there most days.  My husband has a dairy allergy and it was very reassuring when we explained this to a manager in the restaurant he took my husband along the whole buffet line explaining what he could and couldn‚Äôt have for the first couple of days unfortunately this manager then had the rest of the week off and when we asked the chefs they tried to help us but we weren‚Äôt confident in what they said luckily the first couple of days with the manager gave us insight enough to choose safe options. It was great to holiday somewhere with even a little help when it comes to allergy information so I would say if you have any dietary restrictions this hotel is a good choice.  The whole place is so calm and relaxing in fact a lot of the time the staff were making more noise than the guests! February is a good time to go as the season hasn‚Äôt really started so you get the benefit of the space around the hotel.. not having to fight to get a sunbed (even the daybeds were available most of the time) and also the bar area wasn‚Äôt packed.  A couple of things worth knowing before you go....  1) the hotel takes a ¬£90 deposit on arrival we weren‚Äôt aware of this and unfortunately it cut our spending money in half but obviously when you check out they refund it.  2) there is a cash machine in the lobby we didn‚Äôt use it but had we known we could have saved time at the airport.  3) there is a local tour operator in the hotel lobby we booked through our rep when we were there which I would advise but the point is if you are unsure which trips to go on you can speak to someone when you are there.  Some observations for improvement  -It would have been nice to have drinks waiters around the pool I know this is a luxury but the staff were doing a great job in collecting empties it would have been nice if they asked if you wanted a refill before walking away.  - the staff do need to be taught how to lift furniture not drag it around it spoilt the ambience every time they decided to rearrange the sun loungers or the chairs for 10 minutes  - no room service here which is a shame we would have used it if it was on offer and there were a couple of people who we met who had been poorly and couldn‚Äôt leave their room so didn‚Äôt eat at all.  To be honest the above are very small issues which didn‚Äôt change the fact we had a fantastic time here. I would most certainly recommend this hotel to my friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Croydongal wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Myself and partner have just returned from a Tui 7 night all inclusive stay at this hotel. We both enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel. Tui should let guests know however regarding the ¬£90 deposit required on arrival (this is fully refundable however on check out). We paid this in sterling which was no problem however would have been nice to have a heads up from Tui. The overall service is not that of a 5* hotel and can be hit and miss. Staff slow bringing drinks or not bringing drinks order at all. The service in the buffet restaurant does not cope well during busy times. Room was nice however as others also reported there was a sewage smell in the room which wasn‚Äôt great. Cleaners do a great job everyday though as the entire place is spotless. The rooms can by noisy as we were woken up by drunken revellers outside our room. In addition could also hear TVs in other rooms so the room insulation could be better. Spa was extremely expensive so we didn‚Äôt use it. The equivalent of ¬£20 to use indoor pool for 30 mins!!! No way! However the heated outdoor pool was a lovely temperature. The guy who is in charge of the poolside entertainment and fitness is great. He works really hard and always had a smile. A real asset for this hotel. I really didn‚Äôt see the point in the hotel photographers. The photos they took were just cheesy to be honest and then they would hassle you to purchase them. Just leave guests in peace to enjoy their holiday. If I want photos I will ask or just take them myself. The photographers just got in the way and could be intrusive. All in all a great hotel with great facilities. Food was fine and plentiful. I would recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
