Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Journey473142 wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Disgusting behaviour of one of the staff.
Review_Text: My complaint today is that this guys is a theif he didn‚Äôt return our deposit based on information we did not receive on arrival. This has been the worst check out experience he is a disgrace and I will be taking this further.. He physically slapped my hand and laughed in my face whilst I recorded our conversation for evidence. He still did not return my deposit he lied that he will send a partial payment back to my account. To find that he withdraws another 300 Durham (total of 900 durham) -Misleading liar and bad customer service.    If something is not sorted out I will be uploading more videos of him and the way he treated myself and my sister.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Peachey wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Thank you very much to Tittif and Simo for their constant entertainment! All the staff work extremely long hours yet there isn‚Äôt a minute of the day where they are ‚Äòslacking‚Äô.    They know a tonne of languages all of which they seem excellent at (particularly English) and do everything they can to keep you entertained.    Fantastic holiday!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lorren P wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Myself and my now FIANC√â (he proposed on this holiday!) are currently at the be live collection hotel and having an absolutely amazing time.    After getting engaged and news spreading around the hotel we came back to our room one evening to petals candles and a cake! Thank you so much to Mohamed for organising this it was a lovely surprise.    All of the staff are fantastic and friendly particularly Tittif. Always making sure your ok getting you involved in activities but not forcing it on you. The hotel is spotless! Staff are constantly cleaning buffing the floors etc.    Not one bad word to say about this hotel. Beautiful perfect holiday. Thank you very much!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Joel M wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is very good but what made the holiday was the entertainment team. Simo Salim Fati ibrahim titif karim...all amazing and go out of their way to help you. They make the holiday very fun with loads of things to do including archery ping pong darts aqua aerobics Zumba salsa & yoga. They all speak many languages and their English is very good! Thank you so much for keeping us entertained every minute of the day and night! 100% will be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Georgia M wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I am a bit late with my review I stayed at the hotel one month into it's opening but had an amazing time. I travelled with my nan and I work in travel sales so was nervous to stay in a new hotel. I now always recommend this hotel to customers when I can and have had customers return happy from this hotel where I sent them. My customers came back to tell me that our pictures were up in the hotel haha! I emailed the hotel on a few occasions before travel and they were quick to respond.    The photographer Fikri was amazing. He took amazing pictures of me with my nan with the flowers and sunset and when her favorite song came on the karaoke night he could tell she wanted to dance so he danced with her and it was so lovely she was so happy that night.    Food was amazing. Buffet is small but worked for us at the time. I can imagine busier months can get crowded. But there was so much choice for food and it was all delicious I didn't even bother with the a la carte which we got to eat in for free once a week. Animation team were great leave you alone when you want to be. Pool snack bar great you can get great burgers and pizzas outside. Cabana beds free if you get there in time. Shower had a blind separating bathroom from bedroom which was see through so me and my nan had a deal to sit on the terrace during shower time which was fine but would have preferred more privacy. Hotel helped me print my boarding passes in reception. Gift shop SO cheap for nice handmade items. Booked the double superior which gave us two double beds in one room which was nice. Entertainment was karaoke live music in the lounge bar african dancers upstairs in the function room. I didn't try the sports bar.    The lounge bar was really social lots of people chatting and making friends. cocktails amazing. It was just stunning the gardeners were always out taking pride in the beautiful gardens...shuttle bus was fab too souks are a must see.. I can't think of anything else but I would recommend. we went in april for 5 days
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: loupey01 wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I just wanted to leave a positive review about this hotel. After booking a short break I read all the bad reviews and panicked we had made the wrong decision.  We couldn‚Äôt fault the holiday. The airport was fine a good tip to take pens to fill out the form so on arrival and leaving it didn‚Äôt take long at all getting through the airport. I can imagine in the height of season it maybe busier.  The hotel is modern and clean. Our room was lovely üòä No problem with staff they are all friendly. The guy that runs the spa is a bit pushy that you have a package. We only wanted massages so gave up in the end.  We were only here 4 days but would go back. The weather wasn‚Äôt great but there isn‚Äôt anything you can do about that.  The shuttle bus we used to go into the town centre again a great service and you felt safe walking around.  We got charged on arrival for the towels then refunded when we left.  Thank you for a lovely holiday üòä
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: invalcottage wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: We stayed at B Live Marrakech last week on a short 5 day holiday booked through Fleetway Travel. It was one of those bargain offers and to be honest we didn‚Äôt expect too much - so long as we had a break from work- we would be happy. Wow - what a surprise! The hotel was fantastic- modern ( only one year old) and spotlessly clean. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. Although a little way from the main town there was a free shuttle service- so no problems there. A big thank you to everyone for making our stay so enjoyable- especially our lovely housekeeper who made our room so beautiful each day. We can‚Äôt wait to return next year!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Allan S wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Overall appearance - Very clean and constantly being kept clean.  Not a very big hotel and couldn‚Äôt cope with the low numbers in November so no idea how it will cope in peak.  It‚Äôs already showing signs of age even though it‚Äôs not a year old.  Beds and cushions around the pool ripped. The beds are broken. Maintenance men are everywhere repainting.  You do have to pay a deposit of a 1000dhm on arrival. Not what you‚Äôd expect at a 5 star hotel. This is for room keys and pool towels cards.    Food - A small Buffett restaurant that isn‚Äôt big enough for the numbers.  Food was very repetitive and poorly signed.  My wife is a vegetarian and had little hot choice. Thank god for the fresh pasta choice every night.  A lot of the food was Luke warm.  There is an A la Carter choice but we chose to ignore it as the menu was not very appealing and no one who went recommended it. Some of them even went straight to the main restaurant after coming out.there is a snack bar which serves burgers / pizza / Pannonia and salads. This was good.    Drink - The mini bar is extra and quite expensive. I would‚Äôve expected that to have been stocked with local beer and soft drinks.  The beer is good but the cocktails were very weak unless you asked for extra.  The bar was busy and didn‚Äôt always have enough waiters on.  There was only one bar which is quite small and. Didn‚Äôt have enough seats so unless you got in early you either had to stand or go outside.    Entertainment- some good and some ok.  The problem was that it was in the same place as the bar. Small area loud noise. Couldn‚Äôt really talk to others. Might be ok in peak season but was a downside.    Rooms - we had a swim up room. Waters not heated so didn‚Äôt use it. The room was big and spacious. The beds are comfy.  Bathrooms are big as well. Even though the mirror fell of the wall in the first night it was a very good room.  The air con was on heat and we couldn‚Äôt change it. Had to turn it off when it got to 30 degrees.  The tv channel choices are limited but if the entertainment is on it‚Äôs not a problem.  Minibar only had a bottle of water in it. There is a price list for other stuff if you want it but it‚Äôs expensive.    Pools - main pool is heated but the swim up pool bar one isn‚Äôt. Too cold to go in it. Would be ok in middle of summer though.  Even though the staff were going around clearing glasses away from around the pools they never asked if anyone wanted a drink. You had to go to the bars yourself. Something else you‚Äôd expect at a 5 star hotel.    Staff - they were all friendly and helpful. Only issue was that sometimes they‚Äôd getting chatting to each other and forget about you. Not for long though.    Overall I‚Äôd say this hotel is a good 4 star but for Thomas Cook to class it as a signature hotel is a let down.  It could improve in high season when more outdoor stuff could be going on.    If you want a quiet holiday at a nice hotel but don‚Äôt expect the full 5 star pampering then go for it but if you want the full 5 star treatment I‚Äôd recommend going elsewhere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Chris T wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Friendly, helpful and hardworking staff make all the difference!
Review_Text: Having just returned from our holiday (with TUI) in the last week of November we can say that we were highly delighted. We booked through a travel agent in the high street and so didn't bother checking out reviews until it was too late! I will admit to slight trepidation in the light of some very damning ones but I am happy to report that we found next to nothing to complain about in fact the opposite - we had a great time.    The rooms are fantastic - the beds so so comfortable. We had no shower issues or any drain smells. Loved the bathroom.    We thought that the food was exceptionally good with a fantastic range of things to try. By and large it was all pretty tasty. If you pick something you aren't happy with just go up and get something else - no problem. All the dining room staff were without exception charming and as helpful as they could be. Yes we did encounter a couple of occasions where they were a bit slow with a replacement drink but that was at times when they were all struggling to keep up with clearing tables at times of peak demand. We could see that they were flat out and not standing about ignoring us. A little bit of a wait at times did us no harm we were on holiday after all.The red wine (didn't try the white or rose) was surprisingly good and the beer was perfectly acceptable. We didn't get all the names of the dining room staff but we would like to thank them all for their cheerful service with a smile. It makes such a difference!    Outside the gardens are beautiful and very well tended and the two pools are very nice. The quiet pool is as cold as people have already said! Too cold for me! It was a shame because the swim up bar was hardly used at all - pretty dull for the bar staff! No doubt it comes into its own in the height of summer when temperatures soar but I feel that not to have it heated at cooler times of the year is missing a trick.  The activities pool is a nice temperature and we spent nearly all our time around this one. Yes there is the constant music being played at various levels of volume. It tended to go up a notch when the Aqua aerobics was on. At first it was a bit intrusive but by the end of the week we were quite used to it. We were all encouraged by the team running the various activities available to have a go. The team of Simo Titif Karim and Fati were all brilliant. My wife took to the Aqua aerobics from day one whilst I decided that total slobbing out was more the preferred course of action. Simo with his disarming gentle cajoling and humorous micky taking eventually persuaded me to take to the water and join my wife after a couple of days. OMG! what a workout! Very enjoyable despite me having the most uncoordinated arms and legs in the pool. Several beers required immediately afterwards! Table tennis was also available and we got right into that! Thank you Simo and the rest you were awsome!    We took the free bus into town on one occasion which worked well.    I didn't sample the spa so cannot comment. I arrived at the hotel very tense and expecting to need a massage to help me unwind but everything about the place was so relaxing a massage was unnecessary!    To sum up: We thoroughly enjoyed our trip. We were generally lucky with the weather so lounging round the pool was very enjoyable. On the first couple of days it was rather cool so you had to wrap up in a towel! We had a swim up room but the water was freezing (unheated) and probably only worth having in the height of summer.  The front desk staff were polite and professional and far from the grumpy so and so's they have been described in some reviews.    The queues at the airport are truly dreadful!!! Apart from that - a great value holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: MSHunterAFC wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel with fabulous big comfy beds great bathroom with super sized shower and bath. Towels got changed every day and the room cleaned too.  Fabulous staff all round the hotel always polite and will do anything for you. Big shout out to the bar tender in the sports bar who kept my glass full all week and the girl in the entertainment team who gave the best greeting üòÅ ( sorry forgot names)  No major issues with food and choices all seemed nice to me and I'm a fussy eater .  Dont forget to book some trips when you are there. I went on the Marrakech at night the waterfalls and Atlas mountains. All worth it and you go deep into the country. Well worth it.    Overall really nice hotel and I would go back.    My only moan....... is the airport! 2.5 hours to get through passport control on way in to the country and 2 hours to get back through on way out. The queues were massive and that's in November so I couldn't imagine what it's like on July.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: BertieWertie wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: The staff are the greatest asset!
Review_Text: We‚Äôve just returned home from a wonderful 6 nights at the Be Live Adults Only Marrakech. We had an excellent overall experience and we didn‚Äôt need to worry about the negative reviews because they‚Äôre not accurate.    The Pros and cons:    1. The staff are by far the greatest asset to the hotel. We didn‚Äôt get all the names but we wanted to send thanks to Mourad for looking after us so well at lunch and dinner times. Thanks also to Yousef Amine Maria Hisham Adil and Esdine. Every member of staff worked very hard to make you welcome and looked after.  2. The Lobby Bar is lovely for pre-dinner drinks and the staff work very hard to serve you quickly.  3. The animation team were all wonderful. We didn‚Äôt partake in the pool activities but they are very happy and enthusiastic. They also made a great effort for the Halloween celebrations dressing up to great effect and putting on a Halloween disco.  4. The pool area is lovely. We preferred the quiet pool with the swim up bar but used both pools.  5. The gardens and grounds are lovely and the staff are constantly working to make the area look so wonderful.  6. The food in the restaurant at breakfast lunch and dinner was lovely. There is a pasta station where the lovely lady (I didn‚Äôt get her name) would make the most delicious meals as per my preference.  7. The wine was delicious as was the cold local beer at lunch times.  8. The rooms are lovely and spacious perfectly appointed with comfy beds and pillows.  9. The cleaning staff work so hard to keep the rooms and the hotel very clean.  10. A selfish person kept walking around her room in high heels every morning in the room above us which kept waking us up. With hindsight we should have gone to the room and asked her not to do it. We didn‚Äôt contact the reception either instead deciding to just deal with it but bear this in mind if you get a ground floor room and please respect your neighbours below if you are on the first floor.  11. We loved the bathroom with dual sinks and a separate shower and bath.  12. The communal seating areas were very well kept and comfortable.  13. The sports bar was great with lots of comfortable seating and a friendly happy bar tender.  14. The free shuttle into the town centre was very convenient and we used it a couple of times to explore Marrakech.  15. We didn‚Äôt dine at the snack bar or the menu that required a reservation so cannot comment.  16. Not really cons but I‚Äôd say the smell in the toilet can be unpleasant but it wasn‚Äôt all the time and we took some food freshener because we expected this from the reviews.  17. The water in the pools was freezing and I found it too cold to use especially the quiet pool with the swim up. This was a real shame as I would have loved to spend time in the water but I found it so cold my body just couldn‚Äôt get used to it. The animated pool was warmer but not peaceful because of the activities.  18. The music at the animated pool was repetitive and consisted of dodgy cover versions of famous songs played on a loop. There would also be some local music or Asian inspired music which I didn‚Äôt enjoy although the music used for yoga was lovely and relaxing.  19. The spa treatments were very expensive. You also had to pay separately for the indoor pool which I think is wrong for a 5 star hotel.  20. Our rooms were not equipped with robes despite our booking saying we would have them. This is a bit trivial but when we asked for them we were told they are only placed in the swim-up rooms but as I say or hotels.com confirmation said they were in all rooms and in any event they should be in a 5 star hotel. We were eventually given robes but had to ask about 3 times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Andy1978 wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Awesome trip with amazing staff and great food.... will definitely be returning next year ... karim is a great member of staff and should be valued ..... see you all next year for archery again .... cheers
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Karen A wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: I always try and keep an open mind when reading reviews and prefer to make my own mind up.    The hotel is lovely the reception bar and restaurant areas are kept very clean. We were asked for the local tax and deposit at reception as mentioned by other travellers.    The room was really nice and spacious. Loads of wardrobe space and nice toiletries in the bathroom. We also has slippers and robes.    I had read on here a few reports about the shower flooding and it did happen to us on the first night. What we did work out if you didn't put the water on full the drains coped well with it the problem seems to be if you use the full water pressure. You don't need to you can still have a great shower. There was also a great full size bath with a shower attachment. The hotel supplies a good range of quality toiletries.    The Food in the restaurant was varied and good if you are looking to eat burger and chips then you can get this from the snack bar during the day. I loved being able to try new foods. It was out of season and quite busy I could see that in busy periods you could possible have to wait as it isn't that big compared the the size of the hotel.    The all inclusive drinks taste okay (which is a bonus)and they do serve them in nice glasses in the bar. They are not very strong so you just have to drink a few more!    The staff work really hard and they could probably do with a few more on the bar and in the restaurant.    We used the Spa as the weather wasn't great while we were there. We found the guy on the reception a little condescending he didn't really listen to what we wanted was only interested in pushing the expensive full packages. We booked a massage and I would say it was pretty average. Even thought they said you could use the indoor pool facilities they didn't really make you feel welcome to use them. When we asked for a Robe we were told we couldn't have one and they gave us a towel so we left and didn't use the pool.    We used the shuttle into the Medina that was pretty good but you need to book the day before as the places get filled quickly as there isn't anywhere local you can walk to.    All i all an enjoyable experience (except for the Spa)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Michelle B wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Have had a lovely short break in this very clean & friendly hotel. Food was good but sometimes could have been a bit hotter. We were very fortunate with the weather as it can be cloudy this time of year. Simo & the rest of the entertainment team around the pool were extremely friendly & helpful. Would definitely stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: joanne s wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: This is a very nice hotel with lovely rooms and very clean in all areas however there is nothing round it at all so everytime you go out it's a 25 minute taxi into the centre. The food was ok but very repetative and only luke warm and the snack bar food was poor quality and cold. The weather was very cold mid November and although not the hotels fault I do think there should have been some heating on and not air con blowing cool air out I couldn't wait to get home to get warm. I wouldn't return for this reason unless it was summer. Also very understaffed with very slow service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: DB4423 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: I thought this was a nice hotel me and my partner stopped in May this year and had a great experience.    My only criticism would be that the reception staff had a poor understanding of english making it difficult to communicate and came across rude.    Also the sports bar was advertised as being open until 1 and closed at 12. Other then that great food and great drinks. For a new hotel was great ! Would definitely stop again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: jacky wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Food choices in my opinion were limited as I don't eat fish. Most of the dishes were prepared in tag Ines morroccan style which did not always look appealing. Food was sometime cold. Cutlery was limited at times and you had to ask a member of staff for them once they had run out. Hotel was located away from the main city there was courtesy buses from the hotel to marrakech centre. Nothing else surrounding the hotel so be prepared.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: dave4747 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Ill be honest this wasn‚Äôt the most expensive option and I knew 5* in Morocco wouldn‚Äôt be at the same standard as a 5* in other countries but here are my constructive thoughts around a hotel that does have potential to be excellent.    Rooms and beds are great although we had smelly drains towards the end of the stay (ground floor).  Lobby bar entertainment was poor and had an ‚Äòairport lounge‚Äô feel to it. Sports bar was ok.  Drinks were very good wine beer and spirits.  Main gripe was the food quality given there is nowhere else to go locally quality of the meat were cheap cuts. Fish tasted muddy and chicken thighs in tagine very dry. The food was often cold and had no flavour in the sauces. Everything was badly labelled so you didn‚Äôt know what you were eating. The serving tongues were shared amongst multiple dishes so unless you got there early the dishes were contaminated with other food.  A la carte restaurant food was limited to 2 menus and didn‚Äôt cater for vegetarians. The food served is traditional Moroccan. I wasn‚Äôt a fan I‚Äôm afraid. The snack bar food was probably the best option.  Some of the staff are excellent but some very slow and don‚Äôt seem to be great at multitasking and as a result service was generally slow throughout despite the hotel not being at full capacity.    Spa manager awful pushy sales technique and only interested on selling his most expensive product. Incredibly reluctant to even sell us two massages. Despite not explicitly stating it was cash only he wouldn‚Äôt even take card and insistent to a point of rudeness that we payed cash. We cancelled the treatment and took a day trip to Hotel la Mamounia in the centre and used their spa instead this included lunch massage and use of facilities all day for ¬£160. It was pricey but worth it and the best food we ate all week and genuinely has 5 stars.    Rooms were noisy due to the design of the hotel could hear the bloke upstairs all night wondering around drunk and people outside i.e Thin walls.    PS. Completely agree with the other reviewer regarding the puppies that the hotel management decided to abandon along with their mother in the middle of the desert 3 miles away at 6-8 weeks of age. I know there is an issue with rabies and dogs are not for everyone but this seemed very cruel. Thankfully you will be pleased to hear some other guests (Belgian i believe) teamed up and went to find the abandoned puppies they were successful and delivered them to a charity called ‚ÄúSPANA‚Äù to be cared for. We got news of this through the guys on the front gate.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: _dancingpenny63 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Wonderful hotel with fabulous big comfy beds great bathroom with super sized shower and bath. Fabulous staff always polite and smiling special mention to Omar Karim and Simo what wonderful examples you are to the young generation. Cleaning staff do a wonderful job bar etc cannot fault them.  Weather wasn‚Äôt great but still had a lovely time. Hope the man from Germany who had a heart attack in the bar makes a full recovery. He was enjoying himself after the entertaining belly dancing show dancing away!  Moans well ... the spa although nice is over priced. Although the buffet try to cater for all tastes it could have more variety.  Biggest moan which spoiled my holiday and spoiled others was the puppies! 5 beautiful friendly cuddly puppies and their mother by the hotel gates. Many of us were gutted when they were taken away and dumped in the desert! Please sterilize vaccinate and look after the animals born there including the gorgeous kittens. Bring the puppies back to their home sterilize them give them collars and dog houses at the side of the hotel away from possible moaning guests ( everyone loved them). Feed them there are enough left overs on plates. Set a precedent so animal lovers aren‚Äôt upset like many of us were. BRING BACK THE PUPPIES. (This is the reason for 4 stars and not 5).  Thank you Tui ( Dani) you were great. Queues at the airport far too long!!!! Hope to return.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: tripper51 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: This review is for a stay in November. The hotel was nowhere near full and it was chilly most days. We normally go to the Riu Palmeraie next door but that was closed for a refurb.  My wife and I treat this 10 day trip not as a holiday but as a cheap getaway. We're not expecting 35c temperatures and so with 20c most days and a little rain it was as expected.  So the hotel. Staff were brilliant. Bar staff in the sports bar and lobby bar were great and despite being busy would ensure our glasses were filled constantly. That said the quality was a bit low.  Buffet was boring. Same food every day and nothing exciting. Omelette for breakfast burger or pizza for lunch and pasta for dinner was the best I could put together. The restaurant itself was too small and there were never enough tables. Dread to think how they manage when it's busy. Staff again worked very hard but struggled to keep up with cleaning tables and getting drinks.  Rooms were spotless with the best bed I think I've ever slept in. Lenny Henry should check these out! How a 5* hotel gets away with no kettle and coffee I don't understand but as long as you are aware you can take your own. Also pack toilet rolls. Two supplied are not enough.  Two pools and the party pool was heated and getting in was OK. But getting out meant freezing so we'll skip that.  As the hotel was empty the entertainment was in the lobby bar every night. Live music or a DJ got many up and dancing but it was loud very loud VERY VERY LOUD. Blimey turn it down a bit please. Talking was just impossible.  During our stay a guest had what I understand was a heart attack in the lobby bar. Whilst the staff did deal with it in a calm manner there seemed to be no first aid trained member of staff on duty. I'm glad to report that from what I was told the gentleman made a full recovery. We wish him well.  Free coach to the town centre. Why oh why does it drop off in a different place to every other coach? Neither the front desk nor the Tui rep were helpful either. Hop on Hop off bus the Tui rep didn't even know there was one! I've put a post on Q&A to help as a reference.  To sum up it is a cheap get-away and as such I have little to moan about. The queues for the buffet and no room in the lobby at night would put me off returning. It's back to the Riu next door for us.  Nothing to do with the hotel but the airport. Oh my God get it sorted. 80 minutes to get in to the country nearly two hours to get out. We arrived at the airport on our return at 9:45 for a 12:05 flight. We got through security checkin security another check more security and then passport control at 11:35. This meant a dash through duty free and on to the plane with minutes to spare. Many people begging to jump the passport queue through no fault of their own but their plane was leaving shortly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Chris P wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Great Hotel, Great Service, Perfect vacation
Review_Text: We spent one week in this lovely hotel. I would like to bring up the great service of the staff. Especially our waiter Ousama who could remember the favorite drink from every guests and served it with a smile and great attitude.    The rooms were always cleaned and we got new towels everyday.  In the Hotel Restaurant we could find traditional food and other delicious meals.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Mandy C wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Just recently returned from a lovely weeks stay at this hotel. Room we stayed in was very nice and was cleaned to a high standard every day.    Food in the hotel was buffet style and is what you would expect at an all inclusive resort.    Staff at the hotel are very nice pleasant and very helpful and do everything they can to help.    Had two lots of treatments in the hotel Spa which were exceptional and would highly recommend.    A shuttle bus takes you into Marrakech and picks you up again if you want to explore the Souks beware of fake guides who take you all over the Souks and into shops that are owned by friends etc!    All in all a lovely hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Fran H wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Welcoming staff in a new resort
Review_Text: Spent a week in this resort in November. It‚Äôs a lovely new resort that has only been open a few months. Booked through Tui it‚Äôs a adults only resort but many young people here from all over Europe for a girls weekend or a long weekend in Marrakesh.    Decent quality food though it was quite repetitive. Hotel is clean and well presented with a really good atmosphere. WiFi throughout the hotel and shuttle bus into Marrakesh.    The staff are all pleasant and willing to help. Lovely entertainment staff to keep you entertained during the day even on bad weather days special shout out to Simo and Karim for keeping us entertained during our trip and also Reba the pool playing bar man.    Overall a very good holiday and would recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: yvonne f wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is out of the way nothing to do near the hotel. The hotel is nice clean great staff. There was a great variety of food it looks great but not hot which is a shame. This we did mention to the staff. Hope they can get this sorted.  The pudding were lovely a great pastry chef they look stunning.  Plenty to choose from I liked to try different food.  The swim up pools were lovely to look at but freezing as was the other large pool in the quiet areaif these pools were heated and the food hot it would be perfect.  The gardens are beautiful.  A trip to the Atlas mountains and the souks is a must take a guide.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Richard G wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Staff amazing. High standards of food and rooms. nothing not to like!    Hotel has a free shuttle to town. grrat restaurant and the staff are so friendly and cant do enough for you.    Special mention for Abdemassad. best waiter in the world!    Richard and Megan
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lorraine C wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: I just returned from a great few days at this lovely new hotel. The staff were fantastic couldn't do enough for us. Food was great a wide choice every day and a feast for the eyes. I loved the nightly entertainment the bar staff were so friendly. Even eating at the poolside bar was a treat. Rooms were lovely spacious and so clean. The room keys frequently didn't work but was easily fixed at reception. All in all this was a really great choice for us and we will definitely return.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: michellebG3774AN wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Hotel Amenities Great - Shame about the after service
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel in September 2018 and really enjoyed my stay. The amenities room food and bar/restaurant staff were superb.    However the after service given by the hotel is non-existent. Despite confirming at check out that the room and towel deposit we were required to pay at the start of our stay had been returned months on the hotel are still actually yet to return this. I have sent multiple emails to hotel directly and to the main chain's customer service team but I haven't received any replies. I've also rang my bank to see if there is an issue on their side however they have confirmed the money was taken as an actual payment (rather than a holding deposit) and no refunds are stuck in a process (which is another excuse the hotel has given to other customers on this website).    The lack of response by the hotel on this issue is extremely disappointing and it is wholly unacceptable for the hotel to hold money that is not rightly theirs.    Hopefully if this message is read the hotel will provide me contact details of someone who will actually respond to me and refund my payment accordingly!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Khush's Travels wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Airport:  We flew with BA to marrakesh Menara airport and this was a pleasant flight. I had read previous reviews around the heavy queuing system at Menara airport and the previous reviews were 100% correct. Once we landed we had to complete a form and wait in a que for approx 1 hour. My advice would be to carry pens with you jump in the que and then complete your form.    Once past security there was another que to put all luggage through security this also took an hour. Be prepared!!    Our transfer was ready and waiting for us and the journey to the hotel was short approx 25minutes - this was hassle free.    Hotel  Once at the Hotel the check in process was fairly straight forward. We were expected to pay tax and give a card for holding purposes.    We were given our room keys and made our way to our Suite on the first floor.    Our Suite was absolutely wonderful. We were a group of 3 and the cleaner had kindly set up a single bed for the third person.    The suite was spotlessly clean it consisted of two rooms (one living space area and one bedroom). The bedroom contained a double bed and tv and the living space consisted of a toilet sofas dining table single bed table with coffee mugs and a coffee machine (but not kettle or milk! which was a pain and pretty pointless). Complimentary water was provided in the fridge.    Overall the living space was really lovely the beds were super comfortable and the hotel offered heating and AC which was perfect this time of year. The evenings were slightly cold and the afternoons were warm.    Food  Being vegetarians (who do not eat egg) we really struggled with food at lunch and dinner time. During the snack times the hotel offered Margarita pizzas club sandwiches and chips - this was sufficient for us however by day 3 we really struggled!    During dinner and lunch times we mainly ate bread and pasta which was made by the lovely lady chef. However the pasta didn't taste the best and we put this down to the really strong herbs!    Souks  We booked onto the free bus service to the Souk Market in the old town. The bus service was in fact a really comfortable coach.    Once at the old town we were approach by a man with a Bike who told us he was a chef from the BE LIVE COLLECTION hotel and that he recognised us. We assumed that he was! He then said he could recommend a nice restaurant in the old town with good hygiene and perfect for us. He also repeatedly mentioned seeing the fresh argan oil shop! he was quite pushy and insisted we followed him.    After 10minutes of walking with him we decided something wasn't right and we decided to divert back to the Souk market.    When we returned back to the hotel another traveller also mentioned that this had also happened to her! The man was NOT a chef at the BE LIVE!    Souk  The Souk market was insanely busy in the evening on a saturday and we felt uncomfortable walking around. There were lots of men staring and generally not a nice atmosphere. The roads to the Souks were busy and it was extremely difficult to cross the road. We didn't stay long we headed straight back to the hotel where we felt safe.    Airport Return  Our transfer collected us at 1pm for a 4.20 flight.  We qued for over 2 and a half hours.. all flights were then delayed and we just about made our flight!    The staff at Marrakesh airport were rude and there was only one man managing the queing system of over 1000 people. ridiculous. It was actually quite scary as people were angry in the ques people had missed their flights and wanted to jump the ques which made other people late!    We had to run to catch our flight! Ridiculous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lucy J wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Excellent new hotel with good food and drinks!
Review_Text: We stayed for 5 nights in October.    The weather was still lovely and warm so we were able to make full use of the pool. The pool bar was our favourite and we grew very attached to the local stork beer they were providing us with. The white wine was also quite nice.    We had a swim up pool room which doesn‚Äôt connect to the pool unfortunately but is still really nice to have a little dip in outside the room.    The food is mostly buffet but it has a large selection of choice. For breakfast they can cook fresh omelettes and dinner they have a different meat dish. If you stay for more than 4 nights you can reserve a table in the a la cart restaurant which is a traditional Moroccan restaurant. The food is really good.    The room was modern and comfortable. Spent time in the relaxing when the sun was really hot.    The evening entertainment was pretty good but sometimes went on quite late some nights but it is adult only so to be expected.    I really liked this hotel. Would recommend for a few days but longer than a week you could get bored.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Getaway422156 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Wonderful holiday in the winter sun
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel on an all inclusive holiday arranged with TUI. The hotel is newly built and is lovely. The rooms were fantastic and the bed was huge and so very comfortable. I had the best sleep I have had for ages. Everywhere around the hotel was spotless and we were very well looked after. The TUI rep Danielle was brilliant and went out of her way to help us with appropriate excursion selection and local advice and even sourced some large plasters to help cover a wound incurred at the airport.    The food was just lovely. We can be a bit a bit difficult as we are both vegetarians but there were plenty of options for us at each meal and the catering staff were there to answer questions to help us select the meat free dishes. The food was very varied with plenty of Morrocan dishes to choose from (why come all the way to Morroco to eat international food) and joy of joys there were no chips available in the buffet restaurant although these were available from the pool snack bar. The waiting staff were very attentive topping up drinks and removing plates promptly. Abde Samad in particular needs a special mention for the warm smile and welcome he gave us at breakfast and lunch every day his attention to detail was excellent. Hassan was excellent in the evening too. The Morrocan wine was lovely too and the French pastries were to die for.    Bar staff were generally very attentive but more variable. We preferred to drink at the lobby bar as drinks were served in glasses rather than plastic as at the pool bar. Local spirits were not as good as the wine but then we were in Morroco wehre spirits are not drunk locally so this was no surprise    Marrakech was fabulous full of colour and life. The shuttle bus was excellent and we used it most days except when on a TUI excursion.    The only downside was the relentless queuing at the airport inbound and outbound. But we had a wonderful holiday and have lots of photos and memories. Thank you to the hotel staff and to TUI.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ciara wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: I stayed here with two friends for 5 nights and was very pleasantly surprised especially after reading some of the negative reviews before going. We were very happy with the hotel and happy to recommend to other travellers.  The hotel & grounds are all spotlessly clean the rooms extremely modern and comfortable. We had a swim up room which was nice for the view/ambience but it didn't get the sun until later in afternoon so we never actually used the sun loungers. There is a window between the room and the bathroom so it is a bit awkward as one can see into the shower. We had to use the pool towels to create a bit of privacy!  We enjoyed the food for the most part there was a huge range at breakfast lunch and dinner. They struggled to keep the food warm but we just made sure to get the food as it came hot off the grill or else we had the pasta which they would make on the spot.  The pizzas were lovely too. We had lunch in the snack bar two days but in the end preferred the buffet as you could make up your own salads.  The restaurant staff are amazing work so hard and always pleasant and helpful.  The animation team were great really enjoyed the aqua aerobics yoga and stretching classes. They do work hard to keep everyone entertained.  The one issue we had a problem with was the Spa. The facilities are really lovely and the treatments great however there was a hassle trying to get the 10% discount we were entitled to for booking direct with hotel. They would not accept the booking proof on the phone and instead we had to pay the full amount then go back to reception wait in queue then ask them to print out our booking & go back to Spa to get the 10% refund which would only be issued by the manager so we had to return a couple of times before we got him. Surely it would be simpler for the hotel to issue a voucher upon check-in or else the Spa accept the online reservation. It was an annoying hassle that should be easily avoided.  The other annoying thing was the Spa insisted on cash payment upfront however we heard from other guests that they took credit card if pushed. Deliberately lying to guests about the possible payment methods is a bizarre customer service strategy and not one that fits in with a 5 star hotel (although I agree hotel is more 4 star)  The music in the bar was very good lots of people up dancing but loud on some nights. However there was the option of the sports bar if the party music is not your thing.  I thought the reception staff were friendly and helpful although it did take us by surprise that we had to pay the full amount upon checkin and not checkout which would be more normal practice.  Overall I would recommend this hotel especially if you are looking for a reasonably priced 4 star adults only hotel .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Moj C wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: This hotel is great but the staff are Phenomenal
Review_Text: We were a couple staying for 7 nights.    I want to start this off with something about me. I'm an anxious and slightly paranoid individual. New places tend to frighten me and I take a while to get used to it.    So when I say how unbelievably comfortable and welcome I felt when staying at this hotel you'll know the level I'm talking about.    Hotel Grounds: Always kept to a high standard. Clean well kept and stunning.    Reception: Always on hand to help you. I've read many reviews that say they are rude and I've got to disagree. They are very friendly and helpful but from what I've seen they simply do not take anyones sh*t. Which I personally applaud as some people can be very entitled.    Rooms: THE BEDS ARE SO COMFY. Rooms are a great size lots of wardrobe space and a safe that's free to use. Ours came with a bath and a shower which was great the bath was so deep that my 6ft 8 partner could even fit in it! Only thing is the window between the bathroom and the bedroom. Toilet has its own little room so that's fine but if the blinds are shut you can still see into the bathroom when the lights on so for example if it isn't a couple staying together it may get a tad awkward. Housekeeping kept the rooms so fresh throughout our stay and even tidied up after my messy self.    Buffet Restaurant: Food was fantastic and always made to a great standard great choice throughout the day. The deserts were the real winner though so yummy. Staff incredibly attentive and friendly. I would recommend going to dinner earlier rather than later as it can get quite busy later on and on occasion you need to queue for a table but never for longer than 5 minutes.    Lobby Bar: We stopped by every day for coffee and drinks. Really comfortable and the staff again were very attentive and super friendly. Cocktails were great I would recommend the Marrakech Flower and the Atlas Lion. They often had a band or a singer and guitarist at night and they were always wonderful.    Snack Bar: First and foremost you should go here for lunch ALWAYS. Best burger I've ever had and we had a late breakfast here a couple of times and my partner says it's the best cheese omelet he's ever eaten. I've seen a couple of reviews on here that say the staff are rude. This is untrue they are still very friendly and if they aren't smiling it's because they are the most consistently busy serving staff throughout the day and surrounded by wasps as it's outside so I cannot blame them. They were still lovely and I think anyone who thinks they are rude just need to get over themselves.    Spa: I went for a californian massage which was super relaxing. The whole Spa area is incredibly chilled and calming and the ladies I spoke to were very helpful and friendly.    Pools: Honestly we didn't spend any time at the quiet pool. We tried once but it had no atmosphere and the pool is not heated. The activity pool however always had music playing and activities going on and the pool is heated (you could even see the steam coming off it on the cold mornings!) We took part in the archery a couple of times which was very fun. Got to hand it to the activity team they were all so bubbly and always encouraged everyone to get involved but never pushy. We never took part in the aqua aerobics but it looked great and a lot of fun.    Another note is that the TUI rep on hand was fantastic. She was very friendly and incredibly helpful.    There's a lot more I could say on this hotel but this is already quite an essay. If we ever return to Morocco we will without a doubt return to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Radu N wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: We stayed 7 nights here.  The hotel was far from anything and we had to book a taxi to get to the centre.  We also booked a transfer from hotel to the markets and it was all ok.  People in the market are very pushy.  Also the guy from spa is pushy to sell you some treatments and when you come to the spa he is not that nice anymore.  Reception girls were quite rude  there was just 1 pleasant receptionist.  Cocktails in the place didnt taste amazing.  I really enjoyed the white wine they had.  Pool was too cold for me so i could not swim.  Food was lovely and there is a pool bar too which offers burgers and different food to the main bar.  Would prefer to visit another hotel if i would come again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ryan O wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: helpful friendly staff (simo salim fati karim ibrahim titif)  very good selection of foods nice facilitiesand superb rooms very comfy beds rooms always kept tidy and clean. We used the spa and had 2 massages which were very relaxing  The weather wasn‚Äôt amazing all the time the sun came out in the afternoon ..    Highly recommend üëç
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: xxelainejxx wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a lovely relaxing break the entertainment team worked so hard to make sure everyone had a good time and if you didn‚Äôt want to join in you wasn‚Äôt pressured into it! Though I did enjoy watching aqua gym lol ...  I would specifically like to mention these people: Simosalim fati karim ibrahim titif they worked so hard every day! I enjoyed the yoga üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è in the evening!  The rooms were spotless and the beds really comfortable ... the food was really good there was always lots of choice.  We done a spa package which was lovely this included a hamman and a hot stone massage it was really relaxing .. the spa is brand new.  The shuttle bus has regular trips into Marrakesh and only takes 20 mins or so ..  I would definetly come back here üòÑ
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jessica T wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Amazing hotel - ignore all the bad reviews!
Review_Text: I was really wary about coming to this hotel after reading all the negative reviews but coming from a very fussy person who is a bit of a clean freak i was very pleasantly surprised - it was amazing!!! I'm going to give a detailed review to hopefully help others with the bits i was a bit anxious about before travelling!    We changed a bit of our money at Gatwick airport into Moroccan dirham so we had some for the taxi (really bad exchange rate!!) then changed most of our money at the hotel which was a much better rate. Not that we needed much as after food drink and shuttle bus are free we didn't feel the need to spend much more!    We got a taxi from the airport (there are loads waiting right outside the airport) they will try and charge around 400 dirham but try and haggle them down a bit. It took around 20 mins to get to the hotel. For the way back the hotel offer a taxi service which is 250 dirham we booked this through reception and they turned up on time and a bit less stressful than trying to haggle your own taxi!    We had a swim up superior double room which i would definitely recommend as its so nice being able to sunbathe on your own balcony if you don't fancy going to the busier pools. The room was amazing really big clean and comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. (If there is a slight smell it was only in the toilet section which is separate from the bath/shower anyway so really not a big deal!!)    The whole hotel is beautiful the grounds and gardens are lovely and the staff are working so hard 24/7 to make sure its always clean. All of the staff are really friendly and go out of their way to help you in any way they can.    The food in the main buffet was amazing different stuff out for breakfast lunch and dinner and different dishes every day. Lots of Moroccan food and all sorts of other food pizza pasta salads so there will be something for everyone. The desserts are the best part amazing pastries and cakes every day! You can also get food most of the day at the pool bar which is also really good food. The drinks were all really nice all sorts of cocktails on offer and they would pretty much make you anything you fancied!    The free shuttle bus from the hotel into the town was really helpful. They drop you off and pick you up near the Koutoubia mosque which is good because you can see that from all over town as its the tallest building. They always turned up on time just book it through reception the day before so you can guarantee a place on it.    Overall an amazing new clean and stylish hotel away from the craziness of the main town centre! Would 100% return to this hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: thispoint wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Nice and with a few extras could be excellent
Review_Text: The hotel has been built in a way that makes it feel very comfortable with lovely landscaping. There are two pools one of which is a quiet pool. The downside is that they are not heated and are freezing cold. They both have bars but the one by the quiet pool was closed for the days when the day started off a little cloudy.  The staff in the restaurant are excellent. There is a wide selection on food which was high quality.  The drinks were ok. Nice touch to have Morrocan wine sparking would be nice as well.  The hotel was really clean and the rooms were comfortable it would be nice to be able to make tea and coffee in the room.  The front desk staff were always polite.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Carol2000 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: We were not sure what to expect as some of the reviews were negative and pointing out it is not 5 * hotel.  It is not.  It is All Inclusive holiday hotel with a solid 4 *.  Positives - lovely gardens great hotel's interiors large rooms and bathrooms overall v. clean good pools nice people. Food was good. Could be better as the meats were mainly overcooked and dry the same about fish. Lots of fruits good selection of veg and Moroccan dishes FABULOUS desserts and a good selection of bread. Omelettes pancakes and eggs cooked for you. The same about pasta dishes.Wine good Cocktails weak but hey you want to enjoy yourself not drop dead. Shuttle bus to the city - convenient. Quiet cold ( I call it refreshing ) pool with a bar. More entertainment at the larger heated up pool. A nice atmosphere. Felt safe and relaxed. Staff working hard in the restaurant. Anyone complaining it is not 5* - just remind yourself how much did you pay and reflect on that.  Note to the management -  why you check the booking documents from travel companies if clearly you have the details of the guests and you just need a passport to check them in. It creates time-consuming unnecessary wait at the check-in after spending HOURS at the immigration at the airport. Plus - no one has them printed out anyway.  Extremely rude and unpleasant man at the Snack Bar - He turned to me after serving someone else and shaking his chin to me said - yyyh - I understand he just said in his own language - Hello what would you like ?. Then just made coffee and whacked it on the front of me without saying anything turned his back.  Maids ( early morning ) throwing buckets of soapy water on the corridor's floor to clean it. Guests slipping all over it - an accident waiting to happen.  Entertainment -  Monday (12 Nov ) night band was excellent put them upstairs in the main hall and call it Disco night.  White Night - was good - take the DJ upstairs and call it Dancing Night.  The lowest point was Latino Night. I'm sorry to say that it was absolutely embarrassing and painful to watch. So we left.    Overall - GOOD. There is a potential to be Very Good but you need a strong management and staff training. Service is more important than endless floor polishing. Then you can charge more and employ more staff.  Good luck!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Matthew F wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: A diamond that needs a tiny bit of polishing
Review_Text: After reading some negative reviews before arriving we was slightly apprehensive about arriving. However once we arrived we was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is itself is beautiful from the lobby to the rooms it‚Äôs all perfectly designed and extremely clean. There is always someone cleaning. The rooms are luxurious and spacious the beds are wonderfully big and they ensure a good nights sleep (This was a comment I heard many guests say during our trip). The staff are extremely friendly and helpful I must mention the entertainment team of SimoTitif and the gang (I forgot all the other names) they had a great attitude and done a great job of keeping everyone entertained during the stay. There‚Äôs much to do around the pool including aqua aerobics and table tennis. The only real negative thing to mention would be the poor quality of food served in the buffet restaurant. Most items are rarely hot and there is not much variety across the week. This is again something that many people mentioned hopefully they are able to sort this issue out in time for next summer. However the food served at the pool bar during the day is much nicer it offers burgers and chips panini‚Äôs and sandwiches. Overall this hotel is a great stay and one I will recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Trek45949975092 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: We had an enjoyable time despite these problemsWeather could have been betterA mini pitch and putt would have been nice or bowls.The quieter outside pool was not heated. Very wet slippery steps outside our room in the morning.Our key card was forever not working
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Aries C wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Really enjoyed our stay. Could not fault the service provided. Airport transport 250-300 dirham. High end hotel with gorgeous landscaped gardens. Food to a good standard. Range of local spirits wine and beer on offer. Cocktails included (obviously I‚Äôve had better and stronger but i was impressed with the range for an all inclusive none the less). Hotel was spotless. Staff very attentive. Lively and engaging animation team who put on a range of activities and fitness classes. There is something to eat and drink for everyone with lots of healthy choices too. I was very impressed with the quality of desserts fantastic pastry chefs! Free shuttle to city several times a day approximately 30 mins by comfortable coach. We checked out at 12 noon and had 5 hours to kill before our airport transport. We were allowed to continue to use the facilities until then. Thank you very much luxury on a budget we will recommend you to our friends!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: DrWhoBirmingham wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Just returned from a week at this hotel with my husband and friends. Very plush newly opened hotel beautiful rooms and excellent maid service. Food good and plenty of choice dining room not large enough and at busy times people were having to queue. Not enough staff in the dining room and usually only one bar man on which caused long queues at the bar. Attitude of staff mixed bit upset that on arrival at an all inclusive hotel we were asked for our credit card so they could take ¬£90.00 returnable deposit in case of damage to hotel or loss of towels! Staff on snack bar not the friendliest with no customer service more training needed.  To sum up nice clean hotel with a few teething problems which if sorted would make this an excellent hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: North East Star wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Stayed for 10 days at this hotel and can highly recommend it. Everything is immaculate and cared for. The grounds and gardens are amazing and the rooms cannot be faulted any small issues were sorted promptly. The beds and pillows are very comfy and it was very quiet where we stayed although the view wasn't great.  The food in the main restaurant was great and lots of choice and the snack bar was decent too. The decor in the restaurant was lovely but and although this is no fault of the staff who work tirelessly when the hotel was full you could wait a while for service. The hotel has 2 very different pools areas one quiet with a swim-up bar and the other lively with lots of activities. Entertainment is hit and miss but everything can't be to everyone's taste so at least it was varied. Drinks and cocktails were fine.  The hotel has a free shuttle bus which runs about 4 times per day into the centre of Marrakesh which takes about 25 mins. Best time to go is late afternoon and enjoy the street food at the Jemaa-El-Fnaa square and stay until it gets dark and watch the entertainers etc. Must add that it is very very busy there but well worth it.  Staff at the hotel are all very helpful and shout-outs to Mohammed and Mouhrad in the main restaurant and Hafid who never stops with the drinks in the Lobby Bar.  Very enjoyable holiday all round.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sarah H wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Stayed for 1 week  Food was lovely lots of choice.  Drink wasn‚Äôt branded but for small drinkers this is not a problem.  Hotel was lovely and clean.  Staff very helpful would like to thank Simu Titif and Karmin for a warm welcome they are very chatty they get you involved with all the activities and are very helpful with local knowledge would recommend this hotel .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: stewpotUk wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: 4 friends came to celebrate our birthdays for 4 nights. When we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff. We were given 2 rooms which looked beautiful and how we expected although one smelt like drains regularly. The quality of fittings etc was good and the bed was so comfortable. Wifi was great in our rooms.  I think the restaurant and bar were our biggest let down as they are quite small for a hotel of this size. The first night we had to wait over 40 minutes and past the 10 o‚Äôclock closing time to be seated to eat. The food was nice but nothing spectacular.  The pool and grounds are stunning and we enjoyed lounging by the quiet pool or swimming up to the bar.  The bar which serves food needs more staff. Two of us waited an hour for 2 pizzas.  Entertainment at night is quiet. The lobby bar doesn‚Äôt have a lot of seating but the staff were friendly. The main evening entertainment sounded great but it‚Äôs on the 1st floor so out of the way. when we looked in each night there was less than 10 people in there and no bar.  like someone else said it wouldn‚Äôt take a lot to make it a great hotel but it‚Äôs just not there yet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Wanderer32307205588 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: My mum and I booked ourselves a little relaxation break here on the recommendation of a prior guest and I am so glad we did we could not have been happier with the venue. The hotel itself is beautifully designed with fabulous gardens all around a couple of pools with plenty of sun lounges several bars serving drinks and food throughout the day a spa gym and a variety of both daytime activities and night time entertainment if you fancy it.The staff are wonderfully attentive and friendly all the way through from reception to the maids and gardeners. The place is absolutely spotless there are people cleaning and tending to the grounds constantly and all are so welcoming and helpful.The hotel itself is quite isolated but there is a shop on site and you could quite easily never leave the complex if you didn't want to. If you do want to explore there is a free bus into the city which you can book at reception which will take you to the famous markets of Marrakech - you will almost certainly get lost in the souks but this is half the fun and the Moroccan people are very friendly and will point you in the right direction.We had a hammam and massage treatment in the hotel spa which was wonderful. The ladies in the spa really seemed to care about making your experience enjoyable. I would say - don't be put off by the spa manager he was quite pushy in trying to get us to go for a much larger spa package which was simply out of our budget and time constraints. Our treatment lasted an hour and a half and included a steam in the steam room a scrub with traditional black soap - made during the process of extracting the locally made argan oil a full body mud mask and a wonderful massage. This cost 600 dirhams each which is around 60gbp and well worth it. Try to book with one of the ladies in the spa rather than the manager as he wouldn't even discuss with us the simpler treatments which was a bit off-putting.We booked with Thomas Cook who also provided a variety of excursions which were excellent. We visited the Majorelle gardens and did a full day excursion to the Atlas mountains and would recommend both. Our guide for the Atlas mountain trip Haseem made the day a delight. He was very informative and friendly and really showcased the Moroccan people's friendliness and sense of humour.Overall I would highly recommend the Be Live Collection we had a wonderfully relaxing stay with just the right amount of adventure!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: cawest1 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: I am writing this review a bit late! We visited in June and had a lovely 5 days so much so we have re booked to come back in June!    The Hotel is beautiful and lovely grounds. We did miss not having tea and coffee facilities in our room and the bar wasn't quite 5* - definitely missing tomato juice for the bloody mary's and some branded selections. The cocktails are from a machine but mixed by bar staff - Hafid was amazing - very friendly and we chatted to him daily.    Hafsa in guest services was very good too along with Rachid and Tariq!  If you are looking to just unwind swim eat drink and be merry with great bedrooms and very comfy beds - this is the place for you!  We look forward to returning in June! :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sejal S wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Its good but could be better
Review_Text: This is our first visit to Be live hotels.    I would return just for the entertainment team! They were amazing! All the guys Simo Salim fati TitifKarim and Ibrahim. All of them really made the day and nights enjoyable. I would definitely give them 5 stars!!    Regarding food. I am vegetarian so this is a little biased. They didn't really have much options besides pizza pasta salads and maybe a few vegetables. I am quite easy going but if you are a pure vegetarian I would be careful as they double dip from meat dishes to vegetarian.    The al a carte restaurant we went to didn't have any vegetarian option and they couldn't make me one either. I would have thought being a five star hotel they would definitely have this option its not anything new that some people are vegetarian.    Im just being a little picky now but poolside bar service would be a good touch as most five star hotels I have been to have poolside bar staff.    The one suggestion I would really hope they take on board is to hire more staff. They are definitely short staffed and just for us to get our drinks during any meal has been about 8-10Mins sometimes and its not due to staff being lax its due to there not being enough staff. The staff in the dining area really do work hard and at times I did feel bad for them. Also at the bar we would have to wait in queue as there was only one staff serving at the bar.    The rooms are super clean and lovely. They are big and spacious.    Overall its a lovely hotel and staff are amazing but they just need to hire more staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Travel53768522116 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel very plush and clean. Rooms very good all you need in a hotel room very comfy bed excellent maid service. Food very good and plenty of it and a good choice. Downside to hotel some staff especially at the snack bar a little rude with no idea of customer service. Not enough bar staff usually only one even at busy times hence a queue at the bar. One evening they ran out of white wine at 10.00 pm! To sum up nice hotel but has a few teathing problems which they need to sort out in order for them to give a five star service.
