Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Dollydollop wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: An honest review of the hotel - Please read- It may take you a while!!!
Review_Text: I've just returned after a week at this hotel with my daughter. Oh my what a catalogue of disasters! Firstly let's start with the positives - and there are a lot. The staff are all extremely courteous helpful friendly willing and happy but there just aren't enough of them. They are run off their feet and therefore when you request a drink or coffee or a pot of tea they forget and you have to ask again and sometimes again. The main pool is superb - freezing but superb. Plenty of sunbeds plenty of parasols for shade and a very attentive poolman/lifeguard who appears magically to move your parasol the minute you lay a finger on it to do so yourself. The activities pool is great but noisy. Every half hour there is something going on and it's accompanied by loud music!! The rooms are a good size clean well fitted and have the most comfortable beds I've ever experienced in a hotel. The curtains are black out and the rooms are generally quiet so you are not disturbed. We were unfortunate enough to have an elephant in hobnail boots in the room above ours and he also loved moving the furniture around at 1am 3am and 5am as well as at various times throughout the day - I will be intrigued until the end of my days by what he/she/they were actually doing in that room!!! But I spent a day in bed when I was ill and the noise drove me mad.  And then we come to the restaurant....... the food has to have been the most mediocre food ever served up in a 5 star hotel. Yes I know it's an all inclusive and you can't expect gourmet cooking but I can expect food to be properly cooked and free of bacteria that resulted in my spending a day in bed so poorly that my daughter got the doctor out and he diagnosed gastro enteritis. The incubation for this is maximum of 48 hours and I got it after we'd been in the hotel for longer than that so the hotel had to be the source. Also one of the main causes is people not washing their hands after visiting the loo and then touching food. I didn't see anyone leaving the toilets with unwashed hands but I did witness one chef serving at one of the stations turn and sneeze all over the countertop behind him then turn back and carry on serving!!! (No one came and cleaned the countertop - the area that they serve to the stations from.) Every meal there was an identical menu - lunch and dinner were indiscernable from each other. The meat was tough and over cooked in some cases or as in the case of the veal liver raw and bloody. I had prawns that were either dried up and shrivelled or decidedly undercooked and with the vein (or poo pipe!) still intact and a whole salmon put out for one of the meals (could have been lunch or dinner - see comment above) was decidedly underdone. Therefore I am confident that the restaurant was the source of my illness. But if they didn't get you with food poisoning they got you in other ways. My daughter bit into a pastry and something sharp cut her gum. On examination she found a shard of metal in her mouth that had come from the pastry!  So by now we were getting pretty fed up. We had asked the Reception to investigate the elephants in the room above on three occasions but nothing had been done. They promised to send the doctor within the hour but forgot to ring him so it was two hours before he arrived. The final straw or so we thought at the time was the metal in the pastry. I was still confined to bed so my daughter went and saw the restaurant manager (we nicknamed him Mr Bean as he had a definite air of that character about him) and the other hotel manager (or so we thought). He said he was very sorry about our issues but it was above his pay grade to deal with it (or words to that effect) and that we would speak to the General Manager but he mentioned that he would look into getting us upgraded to a suite when I was able to move. Again nothing happened. Then the best bit of all! We went on our 5th night to the hotels' special restaurant - you are only allowed to dine their once for free during your stay. We were really looking forward to a decent meal at last and dressed up for the occasion. We each chose - one of us Menu 1 and the other Menu 2 - and sat back in anticipation (next to a guy wearing flipflops and cut off denim shorts (he'd REALLY made an effort to look good!!!!). They brought our first courses - mine a mussel soup and my daughter's a vegetable soup. My soup was tepid hers was hotter. It was quite tasty though so I forgave them the temperature. Then my daughter picked up the sweet sticky pastry that they served with her soup (?). Well we both nearly collapsed in hysterics when she discovered the black bee that had been baked into it! I mean if it were a book people would say it was too far fetched. No two people could have that many calamities on one holiday. I promise you reader we did!. We discreetly put the offending pastry in a serviette and into our bag and didn't make a scene in the restaurant. The rest of the meal came but it was grim. My beef tagine was just that - beef. Nothing else just beef. No onions no potatoes no vegetables.....just beef! The dessert was a selection of pastries - without bees as far as we could see but by then we were so fed up with the food we left - not the only people to leave early I might add.  We went and found the manager (not Mr Bean but the hotel manager (who told us that he was actually the manager of the other Be Live hotel in Marrakech the 4 star one!). He looked appropriately sheepish said how embarrassed he was and admitted that there was a lot of room for improvement. He promised faithfully to speak to the General Manager the next morning and report back to us. They had already promised us a room upgrade which failed to materialise so we didn't really hold out a lot of hope but HE PROMISED!!! The next morning he was conspicuously absent from the hotel as indeed he was for the rest of the day. We caught up with Mr Bean and my daughter  who is five months pregnant was by now so totally frustrated with the whole charade that she burst into tears and ran off back to our room (the one that hadn't been upgraded). I told Mr Bean I would speak to him tomorrow. Tomorrow came and we were going home. Mr Bean studiously avoided us in the restaurant that morning as we had our last and routinely boring breakfast. However I went and tracked him down hiding out in the poolside bar. He started telling me that he had tried to speak to the General Manager and that it was all out of his hands etc etc but I just told him to shut up! I told him that I knew very well as did he that they had never had any intention at all of offering us any form of compensation for the events that befell us. He started huffing and puffing and I told him again that all they had done was stall us with worthless promises until it was too late for them to do anything about it. I suggested to him that they would maybe like to allow us to keep our room for the day rather than checking out at 12 noon as our fight was a late evening one and we didn't have to leave the hotel until 6pm. I also suggested that they might like to provide us with a free shuttle service to the airport rather than charging us the 35 Euros they normally charged. Again he had to talk to "De Management" and sat me down at the PR desk. 5 minutes later a delightful and highly embarrassed young lady came and sat down and apologised profusely for the problems we had had and said that they would comply with my request.......as long as I signed an affidavit saying I wouldn't seek further compensation from them!!!! I wrote and signed a letter saying that I accepted the offer of the room extension and free taxi as 'a gesture of good faith' but did not comment on not seeking further compensation.  I will write to Be Live but hold out absolutely no hope at all of getting a reply let alone any compensation (it would be nice if they would at least offer to pay my ¬£70 doctor's bill as with a ¬£50 excess it's not worth my while claiming off my insurance.  So to sum up the Be Live Marrakech Adults Only All inclusive has the potential to be a fabulous hotel but until it meets that potential be prepared to be disappointed. If you go along expecting to be ill and willing to eat the same mediocre food every morning noon and night you will have a great holiday. If however you are looking something that lives up to it's 5 tar rating and ¬£1000+ per couple price tag (plus flights) I would strongly advise you to look elsewhere. Italy is always nice!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: naracoyle wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Nice hotel but don't expect you deposit back
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel in June this year and i have been chasing my deposit for the Towels for 4 months now. The hotel has advised that this has been paid when it has not no receipt has been given and no response on emails.    The hotel was nice but food not great
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Adriana B wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: An amazing place to relax and a great animation team
Review_Text: Be Live Collection has just opened up and the quality of the infrastructure and food is great!  It is not a huge resort so it still personalized and children free :) The animation team has also a very personalized way to help and entertain- they know every guest by name and are extremely friendly. You can travel here even alone - you won‚Äôt feel alone. Thank you - (Ibrahim )Simo titif Karim - you have made from our stay a great stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Courtneymessenger wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Hotel is really lovely and we would definitely come back.  Experience on the whole was great;  - Cleaning staff do a good job  - Day time Entertainment was really good even when the weather weren‚Äôt great and overcast they still continued.  - Evening entertainment was good and the staff were really friendly and certainly kept us entertained! - Karim and Titif were our favourite staff members and did an amazing job.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Vicki M wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: My friend and I have had the best time here in Marrakech and especially at Be Live Collection.  The hotel is like something out of a movie the staff and locals are so friendly.  The entertainment team during the day are the best so much fun and provide great activities for all ages. Simo Titif Karim and Ibrahim are fantastic and hope that when we return they will be here!!  We love you guys. Best regards. Victoria
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: T0G0Away wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Can't be above a 3 star hotel
Review_Text: Disappointed really isn't the word I'm going to try and summarise this nicely for you...    THE HOTEL  - really isn't to the standards of a 5 star I don't care what country it's in. They really are conning people with that.  The shower in our room had 4 points from which it was leaking throughout our whole stay. Whenever the room above us would use water it would start leaking & the sound would echo through the bathroom. Even closing the door didn't help with the noise! After it would leak there was a horrible horrible smell that would fill the whole room. We complained to staff twice & the solution was to repair it. Which they didn't do because it carried on!  Also I can't believe how thin the walls are every morning we could hear upstairs and what sounded like an elephant stomping about! Notto mention the noise from construction no more than 20 metres away from the room.  Rooms are adequate no tea or coffee making facilities & the fridge in the room hardly works. I'm also abit confused why they would have 2 double beds in the room when it's an adults only & we booked a room with 1 bed.  Pool area is nice as is the buffet & bar everything is kept very clean and tidy.  Personally I loved the food it was the one thing that they got right! However in the onsite restaurant the food was shockingggggg!! & when I asked for a vegetarian menu the solution was to bringme food from the buffet...If I wanted that I Would've gone myself.  Drinks are absolute garbage!! I know most all inclusive places have cheap alcohol but when somewhere is advertised as a 5 star you expect more than petrol vodka!  Don't even bother with the 'entertainment' It's actually laughable how shocking it is!    THE STAFF  Pretty much if you don't speak French...or aren't a single woman...you won't have much luck from the staff here. The reception staff are unbelievably rude & I would go as far to say even stuck up. The lad that works during the night is lovely! He checked us in promptly and professiaonlly & the others could learn a thing or 2 from him.  As for the restaurant & bar staff I'd say 50/50. Some went above and beyond helpful & some were awful. The lad that makes the shisha& the main bar man in the evening were class. So helpful and polite we were so happy to give them a little something extra to say thank you.    Overall...never again. Even the couple in the room next to us said the 4 star Be Live was so much better than this one & they regret booking it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Di W wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Food choice & quality excellent. Every kind of food imaginable on offer & different every lunch & evening. I don't normally eat desserts .... but these were so superb that I could not resist them!!    Food in the main restaurant was much better than the special restaurant you could book to eat in once if you're staying for more than 4 nights. We were NOT impressed with the food there. The beef was gristly with a lot of fat on it . The "cockerel" was a poussin & the chicken was tough & difficult to cut off the bones. I gave up in the end with that! You could always go into the main restaurant afterwards to have some good food!! We thought the wine offered was very drinkable & always topped up when needed! Choice of red rose or white. I normally do not have any ice in countries like Morocco to avoid tummy troubles. I had ice all the time & no problems. If you go to the same table or area in the restaurant every day you get to know the waiters & waitresses really well & they are very attentive!!    We had to eat inside as there were so many smokers at the hotel & they had to eat outside. It is a pity a non smoking area outside could not be allocated???    Room excellent. We had the cheapest room - garden view. Would not want a pool view room as we go to bed early & the entertainments may be a little noisy that side. Our room had two double beds. Free safe - easy to use. The bathroom was very spacious with two basins shower & bath gel body lotion & shampoo. There was a large bath & a large shower with a glass door. Our shower door let water leak into the bathroom so we angled the shower heads towards the wall & no leakage. However when we mentioned it at reception a man came & installed a tiled ledge the same day so no water could escape through the gap at the bottom of the shower door. All you have to do is mention a problem you may have & it will be dealt with!!    The animation team boys worked hard all day. Not quite sure why the girl was employed - the animation manager did not appear to give her much to do apart from chatting to her favourite guests most of the day!!    Two large pools & loads of sun loungers & shades. No need to get up at dawn to reserve your place!!!    At check in you have to give them your credit card details to take a refundable deposit of 1000 DAM for your room & 2 pool towels. You also have to pay the local tax when you check in. No problems with all of that. Credit card slip just returned to you unused when you leave.    If you have a late flight home they will give you a room to use to shower & change before leaving the hotel.    Can't wait to back again next year!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Claire10996 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We enjoyed our holiday in the Be Live hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful the rooms are clean and very good and the food was versatile and delicious! Especially the desserts were so so good. Special thanks to Karim and Simo for making our stay so great with their animation! It was a pleasure to participate we were never boter. And thanks to Fati for the great dance and Pilatus! Thanks a lot!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jonas W wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Very pleasant stay. Everything in the hotel was always arranged fine and you have plenty activities during the day. The staff was always very helpful special thanks to our waiter Oussama who did a very good job to provide everything we needed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sophia A wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: I was apprehensive about visiting this hotel due to the bad reviews even though the good outweighed  However i was pleasantly surprised.    Food was good...good variety every day with different options available.    Rooms were clean and spacious. However as other people have said the shower is badly designed and does flood the whole bathroom! No ameinities as standard like kettle iron etc. As you would expect in any standard of 5* room.    Reception staff were pleasant but not very attentive of you waiting.    Snack bar a good option out of main meal time. However on the last day the burger was verryy rare so specify how you your food.    Overall a good mini break. Would stay again however not 5*. 4* at most    Overall it was a good mini
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: UncletravellingMac wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: After reading some of the negative reviews I really didn't know what to expect. Now after our stay I really can't understand what some people are moaning about.  The hotel staff were absolutely fantastic. Reception staff were smiling helpful and could understand enough English to assist us with any of our queries.  Food was great. We only stayed 3 days so it was not long enough to become repetitive however I did notice many people piling their plates with small portions of everything so no wonder you would get bored of the food if your there for 2 weeks. Just have one dish at a time if that worries you.....who eats lasagnewith chips cous cous salad and fish normally at home??  Desserts were great. I've stayed at a few all inclusives in Eqypt/ Turkey and desserts always look better than they taste however at this hotel they were delicious. Always managed to get our drinks topped up during meals and never had to wait too long for a drink but I don't think waiting 10 mins for a drink too much of a hardship anyway.  Room was fine. Comfortable quiet and clean. There was a slight smell in the bathroom when we first arrived but it disappeared after a few hours. We had stayed somewhere else in Marrekech before coming here with the same issue so I think it's a bit of a widespread problem but had it persisted I have no doubt the problem would have been resolved.  Entertainment was good. Had we stayed longer we would have used the free transfer bus into the main square at night to break up the evenings as its only about 20 mins away and a great experience. On that note the transfer bus runs throughout the day in and out of the main centre of Marrekech which is a great bonus.  The best bit in my opinion are the animation team especially Simo and Karim. Great fun and make everyone of all ages feel welcome to join in the activities without making you feel pressured. There is a fitness programme of aqua aerobics ( my favourite)  pilates yoga zumba and spinning aswell as game competitions such ping pong and darts.  If music and fun isn't your thing there is a quiet pool on the other side which is well....very quiet! There is a pool bar there aswell which is great for a cold beer.  Tbh we were happy with the local beer which was good so can't really comment on cocktails.  The only rudeness we came across was from the guests which unfortunately I'm embarrassed to say were from the U.K each time. Rude to staff and unrealistic expectations. One couple had a moan about arriving at 10am in the morning but not being able to check in till after 3pm. Erm...that's when check in is so really no reason to moan is there!  Anyway in conclusion my friend and I had a fantastic time and would not hesitate going back again which I'm sure we will be doing next year. The hard working staff are a credit to the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: nichollc wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: I am going to give the most honest review i can.    Firstly we had a great holiday met some nice people and really enjoyed our stay.    I would guess the hotel had 100 rooms taken    The Good    The Grounds and gardens are amazing.    Our room a suite fantastic like a apartment really    Pools clean and good but cold on first entry    Beds are fantastic    Pool beds loads available    Breakfast was good i generally only had fruit and fried eggs toast or freshly made omelettes    Food was ok apart from the french patisserie desserts which were amazing also bread was really good. The meats was repeated the day after in some guise or other think the turkey made 4 appearances!!    Hafid at the lobby bar was fantastic really great service made cocktails that was not on the menu. Other staff was mix and match i really think its an general education thing.    Entertainment was decent  i do think the disco 'down with the kids' was a little aimed at a lot younger generation ie 20's thought and sounded like i was in the middle of Ibiza at some points    The Bad    No iron in room If its five star this should be standard however laundry is cheap and good service.    Just a point on the iron when we arrived we asked for an iron in our room which was delivered promptly. We came back to the room and both me and my wife fell asleep due to the early morning flight. Staff entered the room and took the iron while we was sleeping!!!! when we both awoke i when down to the desk and complained only to be told we should have put do not disturb sign on I am not the best when first woke i requested iron again and they never took it back.    Minibar in room should be full in five star all inclusive with beer and wine at least. We stockpiled San Miguel beer from pool bar and kept some in room.    No bar service around the pool area not major problem but again i would expect for five star.    A la carte restaurant was terrible. we had menu 2 we hardly ate anything we spoke to alot of people who felt the same    Ran out of wine on 3 nights both white and rose also pool bar not stocked for opening and then when was 1hr later everything was warm.    Reception staff it was a pain to organise anything even booking the bus could take 15 mins for what is a simple task. I asked them to book me a dinner reservation in marrakech's most famous hotel and he asked me for the number! which i did have because of my guide book. He then rang it and passed the phone to me to speak to them i said you speak french can you do it please. He looked at me perplexed.    Again all in all we had a good time one week is certainly enough    The hotel could be great just needs the finishing touches i do think you have to remember where in the world you are.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ricky M wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: All show but zero substance. Appalling customer service!!!! Will Never stay again!!!!!
Review_Text: I never write reviews on anything however I feel strongly about how bad the service was at this hotel. Except for a few majority of the staff are very unwelcoming rude and make you feel like you are a bid inconveinece to them. We were ignored every morning at breakfast and couldnt even get a bottle of water or pot of coffee for our table despite asking at least 4 or 5 times. Lunch was the exact same things as well as dinner. Beware of the hidden charges at check in which go by tbe exchange rate on the day and not what you are quoted when you book also a ¬£100 deposit is asked which includes a towel deposit however you do get this back when you check out. The poor service is such as shame as this really has a lot of potential as a hotel. This is mainly due to the beautiful green gardens and idilic grounds with a lovely pool area and no shortage of sun beds. We loved the room which was very clean spacious and modern and had a great nights sleep. The food however was very basic and repetituve and by the end we were very fed up of the lack of choice. There was a lot of cold leftover food with flies swarming around very off putting. We asked for a plug adapter at the check in desk which they said was no problem(of course when they were taking or money however it never arrived and when we asked again we were bluntly told we dont have any!!! This was so we had to buy one from their shop next door. We asked for a iron 4 times and it never arrived and they again were very rude to us eventually it came but very late at night when we wanted to iron things to go out to dinner.We are really dissapointed in how we were made to feel at this hotel and will never come back to stay here or recomend it to our friends. It's definitely not 5* and the other guests we spoke to said the same things as us so we can't all be wrong!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Frosty32 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: This is NOT a 5 Star Hotel
Review_Text: Unfortunately this Hotel is 4 star at best.  First the good points.  The actual Hotel is quite nice kept very clean and most of the staff are friendly. Having 2 pools is a good idea 1 is noisy where all the entertainment happens like aqua aerobics dancing etc and the other has a swim up bar but is much quieter. There are plenty of sunbeds at both and there didn't seem to be much saving beds early in the morning which was nice for a change.  Second the points that make this not a 5 star.  When we arrived which was about midnight we were told our room wasn't ready not a good start but were told we would be moved in the morning. The room we were given was ok apart from the fact that you could see into the bathroom from the bedroom toilet and all. Then as other people have commented when we had our showers in the morning the water was everywhere and coming out of the bathroom into the bedroom. We hoped our new room was going to be better. It was better as the toilet was a room on it's own with a door. However the shower was slightly better as long as you only turned it on half way otherwise it flooded the bathroom again.  The food for a 5 star was not up to the standard of other 5 stars we have stayed in. There wasn't much choice and it was always luke warm. The dishes didn't vary much each day so we were glad that we were only staying for 1 week as you would get really fed up of the lack of choice.  The separate Moroccan restaurant was nice but they bring the courses too quickly after each other.    The drinks were of a poor standard apart from the beer which was fine. When staying at other 5 star hotels there is always Prosecco and Baileys (or Baileys substitute) not at this hotel.    This is probably the only hotel I have ever stayed in where you have bottle beer around the pool. Now whilst we were there I didn't see anyone drop a bottle but it is a disaster waiting to happen.    Lastly we enquired on our day of departure if there would be a courtesy room to use as we were not leaving until 8.00 pm. We were told by reception to come back and they would give us a courtesy room just to get showered and changed. Unfortunately when we went back the staff member had finished for the day and we were then told there was no room available. However we could use the SPA area which was ok but they don't have any hairdryers. I have never know a SPA NOT have hairdryers. Anyway once we got to the SPA we were told that they had not towels and we would have to go back to reception to get some. Starting to get a bit annoyed I went back to reception for towels who said they don't have towels. I can honestly say that the reception staff at this hotel are useless and fortunately the staff at the SPA sorted things out for us. Never once did we get an apology for not having our room ready and we had no apology for not getting the courtesy room that we were promised.    It is all the little things that make this Not a 5 star and I am surprised that Tui sell this hotel as a 5 star having stayed in some of their 4 plus hotels which are much better.    We will not be going back and I would not look at Be Live Collection if this is their standard.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: JulieFlanagan wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Lovely hotel and very impressed by our suite which was more like a small apartment minus a kitchen of course!  Not normally a fan of buffets but it had a wide range of tasty food and desserts were so gorgeous you had to have at least a few. The only disappointment was the A La Carte restaurant which has limited choice and quite frankly wasn‚Äôt particularly good so stick with the buffet. Two lovely pools one quiet and the other with music and daytime entertainment provided by a good fun loving team who weren‚Äôt over the top and didn‚Äôt hassle you to join in if you didn‚Äôt want to. Staff generally very attentive so overall a wonderful holiday.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Damien L wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Really good hotel would 100 percent come back  staff are really helpful especially the guys and girl who mange the pool  getting you involved in pool aerobics  archery  yoga etc big hi five to Simo .titiff karim
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Faysiemaisie wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: I was prepared to overlook the negative reviews and make up my own mind but I‚Äôm afraid I was bitterly disappointed. Overall the staff were polite helpful and eager to please apart from one waiter in the dining room who wouldn‚Äôt bring us a glass of wine because we weren‚Äôt at one of his tables !! The morning after our arrival my husband went for a shower and the water literally flooded the entire bedroom floor. The ENTIRE floor !!! The hotel has been open for over six months and this problem should have been fixed by now. The bedside lights in our room didn‚Äôt work and the main light switch crackled loudly when switched on or off. Even though it‚Äôs an adult only hotel it is definitely mostly geared towards young couples which disappointed me a little. We didn‚Äôt feel as though we could join in any activities with all the youngsters taking part... need to have something more for the oldies. Most of the food in the buffet restaurant was indeed cold. And even though I stuck to rice and vegetables (barely warm)  and my husband ate the fish but not the meat we both managed to have horrendous stomach upsets after only two or three days. This lasted for at least a week after our return home. While most of the hotel seemed to be clean there was a round dirty mark about four inches in diameter on our bathroom floor when we arrived and it was still there when we left. Can‚Äôt recommend I‚Äôm afraid. Very disappointed in what claims to be five star hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sixtoe wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: A far better experience than I expected!
Review_Text: We arrived at the hotel (located on the very outskirts of marrakech in the middle of nowhere) and it looked lovely (be warned if you arrive before 3 your room will not be ready).  Whilst waiting for our room to be prepared we were sent to the main buffet restaurant which is fantastic (I‚Äôve read people complain the only time I felt I‚Äôll is when I ate far too much of the food!) a great selection of food which changes every day with great staff (and both the food and service is much better than the on site ‚Äúspecial‚Äù restaurant which I really wouldn‚Äôt bother with).  The first room we had smelled really awful and flooded after my first shower I think the drain had broken they tried fixing it once and when they couldn‚Äôt they moved us to another room which was lovely so not knocking a mark off for that as the entire place is *constantly* being cleaned.  The entire staff was very good and friendly particularly the younger ones. Titef Miso and especially Simo from the pool area were great Simo was constantly smiling and engaging with everyone trying to get them to join in with everything (and even taught me some Arabic!) and made the holiday much more fun than I expected and young youssini from the restaurant always had a smile and remembered what we had to drink each night.  The drinks were plentiful apart from the few nights we stayed up late where they actually seemed to run out of certain alcohol they could do with more than one person at each bar at busy times as well although you never had to wait for more than a couple of minutes.  The on site gym and sports facilities are all good and there‚Äôs also superb WiFi throughout the entire resort including all rooms and outside.  All in all a great trip came for the sun but ended up enjoying the experience more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Becky B wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Absolutely amazing loved every part of it very clean friendly staff good choice of food and drinks.  No pressure to buy day trips etc.  Day time leisure staff amazing always around to chat with and activity‚Äôs for all.  Titif and Simo were so friendly always stopped to chat making sure everyone was ok and enjoying themselves a credit to your team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rhian S wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Awful Experience due to stomach bug
Review_Text: Myself and my partner decided to come to be live Marrakech for a relaxing romantic holiday. After saving up quite a lot of money for us to come here  we were happy to find that upon entering the hotel staff were generally pleasant the hotel was spotless and despite a foul smell coming up from the shower and toilet most days in our room it was kept immaculate by the cleaners.    Upon first impressions despite the smell we were content...Then about halfway into day two I was hit with the worst tummy bug I‚Äôve had in a long time and going by the food in the buffet restaurant I am honestly not surprised. Some of the meat is pink and undercooked or if it‚Äôs not it‚Äôs dry and over cooked. There‚Äôs flies and wasps crawling all over the soft drink machines and on the buffet food and it‚Äôs just not up to scratch for a five star hotel. We are about to have our last day and evening at the resort tomorrow and I am still so ill and have been since Monday so haven‚Äôt been able to relax by the pool or have the holiday with my partner that we have been waiting for all year. I am so upset and disappointed and I would not recommend this hotel if you have a sensitive stomach.    It is such a shame because the hotel could be fantastic if they just work harder to make sure their guests don‚Äôt get ill with the food they prepare in this place. Overall great hotel...if you don‚Äôt get ill.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: huntsi09 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Tariq and Morad who are both based in the Ksar sni restaurant have just given us the best customer service we've ever experienced.  Keep up the great work guys.  And great surprises for special occasions.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: sandyinelgin wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: V relaxing and interesting holiday in a v lovely resort
Review_Text: This is a v lovely hotel to choose with v nice spacious clean rooms high standard food in buffet and friendly staff. They did seem short staffed in dining area and pool bar which meant they didn‚Äôt have time to speak or acknowledge guests but otherwise they were always v helpful . We didn‚Äôt find the Moroccan restaurant much different than the buffet and the service wasn‚Äôt particularly memorable either. The courtesy bus is great for trips to the centre. There are lots interesting things to see in the centre and lots shopping in the soux so worth a trip. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: danieljowen wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: First the good points:    The buildings grounds and rooms are lovely. I found my room spacious attractive and comfortable. There were some quirks - the window between the bedroom and bathroom is just weird and the shower tray is almost flat so it didn't take much to flood the bathroom - but overall the room was a pleasant place to be particularly as it was air conditioned. It would have been nice to have a kettle and the ability to make a cup of coffee.    The all-inclusive package worked well. There were no hidden surprises or charges for things snuck in. The local beer was fine; the Moroccan wine actually very nice particularly the red.    Some staff - particularly in the restaurant and lobby bar and housekeeping staff - were very friendly welcoming and helpful.    Now the bad stuff:    First impressions are made at check-in and check-in here was officious and unwelcoming. No smile no friendliness no conversation just 'fill in this form'. It wasn't until dinner 5 hours later that someone (restaurant staff) actually said "welcome". You're given a wristband that you have to wear during your entire stay so you feel like an inmate in an institution. They also take a ¬£60 damage deposit plus ¬£20 for the pool towels (which are ordinary brown towels not worth stealing and not worth ¬£20). While these deposits were refunded to me at the end of my stay I will have paid two lots of foreign currency transaction fees for this pointless exercise.    I have never had worse food than here without being actually poisoned. I dreaded each meal. It was supposedly an 'international buffet' but it looked like some kind of 70s recipe book horror show. Much of the food was heavily processed and heated up from a tin or packet - and was vile. Sauces tasted mostly of raw flour if you were lucky - I tried the lasagne one evening and it tasted like it had been made with custard powder. Everything absolutely everything was massively overcooked. Meat was dry and leathery vegetables soft and tasteless. The Moroccan food was a particular disappointment; it should have been full of spice and fruit but instead was bland and flavourless - and massively overcooked like everything else. Breakfasts were no better. Limp pink strips of bacon - that had been nowhere near a grill or frying pan - sat and steamed on their hotplate next to (powdered) scrambled eggs that sat in a grey puddle. Shakshuka involved eggs that had been overcooked so they had turned to plastic in a sauce that lacked any flavour. It was all hideous. Nothing was labelled properly so you had no idea what anything was. A dish might be labelled "beef" but you had no idea what it was beyond that (other than it would be overcooked and have no flavour). A counter with six dishes on it might have three labels next to them but you didn't know which dishes the labels applied to so they all remained a mystery. I'm not a vegetarian but I noticed that there was little for vegetarians to eat other than salads or side dishes. Even these were problematic - a mixed salad of tomato cucumber and red onion for example turned out on closer inspection to have shrimp mixed in with it. Again lack of labelling doesn't help. On my last evening I considered just going hungry rather than having to face another disgusting meal.    You have little choice but to eat here three meals a day. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere on a piece of scrub land miles from anything. You can't just walk out to the local village and hope to find a decent meal there.    I had been hoping for a peaceful relaxing week but this place is anything but peaceful. Around the larger of the two pools they play (modern Western pop) music all day which they then crank up to obnoxious levels two or three times a day for 'pool aerobics'. All you could hear anywhere in the hotel grounds was the thudding of this music. While this clearly appealed to some people the majority huddled around the other smaller pool to avoid it - so this pool was often overcrowded (and this was not high season and the hotel was not full). At weekends the place fills out with a party crowd who drink a lot and make a lot of noise. Lots of people like this and if you're one of them you'll enjoy this place. But if you're looking for peace and quiet stay somewhere else.    Finally a note of caution for Brits or other English-speaking visitors: Morocco is a French-speaking country and this hotel is very much geared up for French travellers. You may find (as I did) that your booking has been made via a French tour operator meaning that the local rep speaks no English. The English language ability of hotel staff ranged from moderate to non-existent. You may find some difficulty communicating any slightly unusual request or getting a problem resolved. (I had a blocked shower drain and the first time I reported it the response was to send someone round with more toiletries!) If you go on an excursion you may find you are the only English speaker in the group and the guide's English may be limited. This isn't a complaint - just something to be aware of if your French isn't great and you're used to being able to be understood in English wherever you go.    Overall my sense of this hotel is that they want to give you the impression of abundance and luxury but actually no one really cares about any of it. What you get is quantity rather than quality. If you're a fan of noise and indigestion this would be an ideal hotel for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Heather E wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Wouldn‚Äôt recommend this hotel. Waiter service does not exist until the last night. Reception staff are very unhelpful and make you feel like your wasting their time. The bars close at midnight and the only thing you can do then is return to your room. There is a sports bar which is only open from 10pm to 1am and the point of that is unknown. Not the most welcoming of bars one pool table and a tv and not particularly comfy. Terrible sewerage smell in the room most mornings talking to other holidaymakers they had the same problem. Went to use the toilets one evening to find that they were locked!!! The quality of the drinks both alcohol and soft was very poor and basically warm at all times  ice was put in but that didn‚Äôt help. Bar service order 2 at a time as you‚Äôll have to wait anything between 20 and 30 minutes to be served. There is so much more but my advice would be to give this hotel a miss.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Gustavo S wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Service worse than a 3 star in Benidorm on a school trip
Review_Text: Food was aweful at best. Rooms sub-standard for a 5 star. Reception not helpful. All inclusive offer is just horrible. Bad food that compels you to just pay for going to another restaurant even if you have an all inclusive. However you have no options near the resort...just bad! The worse vacations on any recent years.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: JohnandTricia wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Just had a week at this hotel and had an enjoyable and relaxing time. It is fairly new and so generally very fresh and kept extremely clean. We were in a double room facing out to front of the hotel so view not very interesting but that did not bother us these rooms get morning sun and garden facing rooms get it in evening. Room was a good size and well equipped very comfortable bed and good wifi reception nice bathroom effective and controllable AC.  Being adults only means the atmosphere is much quieter than similar resorts and you have the choice of a quiet pool and the one where the low key activities take place. Plenty sun beds at both. Swim up bar at quiet pool and snack bar at other pool.  Sports Bar was shut for works but between the main bar pool bar and other seating areas you can always find somewhere to sit comfortably. Entertainment every night of the usual variety some of it quite good.  Food in the buffet was of a good standard we could always find something to suit us. We did try the Moroccan restaurant and it was ok but not better than the main one.  Have seen some critical comments about staff but we found most of them friendly and helpful particularly if you engage be respectful and the odd tip always helps - the way some guests treat staff is horrible.  The shuttle bus to the city is valuable as there is nothing around the hotel itself.  Only criticisms would be that when groups arrive together as seems to be popular with those from southern Europe the buffet struggles to cope - not enough staff. Also we arrived at 3am (see below) and there was not even a cup of tea or coffee available - not a good welcome all it takes is a machine in a corner somewhere!  Beware regarding passport control at Menara we joined a massive queue at 23.45hrs and finally got through at 02.00hrs disgraceful way to treat arrivals.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: abbylaurencooper wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I visited the Be Live Hotel at the end of September for a week and had a lovely time! After an evening flight we were both very tired and quick to get into the hotel room. The concierge and reception team were quick to check us in after checking in a pair of slightly unhappy couples that arrived before us. Reading reviews prior to our trip we were aware of the room/towel deposits before we arrived so planned in advance by taking out ¬£100 before leaving the UK and bringing our own towels - which was no problem to us!We loved how quiet and relaxed the hotel was with the option of spending time around the entertainment pool when we wanted to do AquaGym! The entertainment team are a credit to the hotel especially Simo - made our trip very fun! Around both pools there are ample sun loungers so there is no rush to reserve them in the morning which means you can totally relax and even get one of the comfy bed loungers in the afternoon!The decor of both the restaurant and buffet restaurant are lovely and Oussama gave us incredible service during our stay (should be definitely promoted!!) Yes sometimes you have to wait for a table to be cleared because the buffet is busy but this didn't bother either of us - we were looking for a relaxing holiday not to complain all the time!! Only advice or criticism I would give is that maybe the senior restaurant team members could put more of an effort in to help the tireless waiters who were rushing around so less complaints were made?!Although we didn't have a pool view our room was lovely with a nice shower and the most comfortable bed! The maids cleaned the room everyday to a high standard which was lovely to come back to after a day in the sun or the medinas.The shuttle bus into the medina is a nice idea Overall it was a really lovely trip and we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Trish H wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: So my experience at Be Live Collection...  I arrived in early hours of the morning it was a mini bus that took myself and a couple to the hotel.. on arrival we headed to reception I had to pay a deposit for the room and a deposit for a towel.. I was aware of this due to the reviews I had read. A member of staff took me to my room showed me around even opening the patio doors switched on the light and there was the pool. Although by this point I was shattered it did make me feel quite excited about this holiday.  Within my room there was a massive bed huge tv that played english movies the bathroom was beautiful had a bath separate walk in shower with a rain fall shower head plus a smaller one... I do recommend that when using the shower turn the head towards the wall a bit otherwise you will end up with a flood in your room!  The restaurant for breakfast had plenty of options... cooked...cold meats... cereal... fruit... pancakes you can sit inside or outside a waiter/waitress will offer you tea and coffee you sometimes have to remind them you need a teaspoon!  My first morning I went to the pool outside my room.. I presumed it would be the quiet pool as the towel hut was there also the swim up bar is at the other pool which usually means it is the louder pool... I was wrong this one was the lively one which wasn't a problem as a range of music is played from acoustic soft to dance music... there is a range of activities that happen around the pool.  It is also very quiet and plenty of sunbeds to choose from I am a creature of habit and like the same space every day... I found a nice little spot collected my towel from the animation team who were friendly...  The animation team come round to introduce themselves and let you know what is happening that day... this is where the trouble started... I am a solo traveller and quite confident travelling alone... sometimes as a solo traveller you get a bit of unwanted attention mainly because people from other countries don't really understand that you want to chill out...  The first guy introduced himself as Simeo he asked if I wanted to go out to town with him one evening being polite I said "maybe" his response was "tell me now I am a busy man!" then the implication came with women tend to sleep with him. After that I said no thanks... he was quite abrupt and it was made very clear he was off to try his luck with the next woman! Later on another animation team member came introduced himself as Titif came along for a chat he knew about me from Simeo I got the charm... your very beautiful I like you... blah blah I was just polite said my thank yous and went back to my kindle... I was pretty much offered sex by 2 reps... I got chatting to others round the pool and it turns out that they were receiving this unwanted chats as well! I didn't go on holiday to be hinted at how poor they are paid or that I need to sleep with a animation team! I am aware pay is low but if want a tip... don't be putting it my face!!!  There was one animation team Karim who I made friends with and would go for lunch with him... I didn't think he was like the others however I got the same stories however I made it clear friends only and wasn't interested in anything else I would say he was far more respectable than the others he got the hint from me that it was friends only and i wouldn't exchange numbers and I was happy to be friends in all honesty he prob was the nicest one out of the lot!  (ladies be aware they all have the same story!! oh they all like to tell you how well they are hung!!!)  In the evenings I didn't come away to be approached by Titif all the time being told he wanted to kiss me wanted to be with me...(he was spinning the exact same thing to ladies I had made friends with)  I feel very sorry for any of the ladies that fell for it and thought they were special as sadly they had us all lined up!  My biggest warning is to the ladies travelling together or solo just be very aware of the animation team they are very arrogant and mouthy.  Yes there is a language barrier and what we would find funny they don't get! But also they think they are irresistible and we won't be able to not sleep with them!!!  The waiters at the snack pool are ok one waiter decided to tell me I was fat and could wait for my food as I didn't look like i was hungry. When I asked him to explain he called me big! I lost my temper with him and he didn't understand what he had said was wrong!  Although there are sleazy staff at this hotel I actually had a great holiday made a lot of friends the weather was amazing I loved my room and food is samey but hey I didn't have to cook for a week...  Seating outside is limited so if you wanted to watch entertainment you needed to eat your dinner on a table by the stage or you are left in the lobby bar...  If you are a couple and want a chill out week yeah def have a fab time! I'd go back if I was with a guy but if your girls on a holiday together just be careful... But if your after a holiday romance then go fill your boots but just remember they have numerous women on the go at the same time.... at least you will get the same story from all of them!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: EmmaCalver29 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: The Be Live Collection Hotel was great the staff go out of their way for you. The facilities and decor are fab. There are two pools one with music and activities and the other a quiet pool loved them both. Also loved the fact that there were no kids! So relaxing and well needed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Amy R wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.  All staff were amazing and attentive the hotel was spotless.  All the staff work so hard yet are always smiling and friendly and welcoming.  Food was amazing with great variety. Cocktails were spot on.  Very comfy bed and pillows.  Shuttle bus service to take you into the main square and bring you back again.  WiFi worked all over the hotel.    Great experience would Definitely stay at believe collection again if I was to come to marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Thomas d wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Nice and new hotel. The swim up is to small. The food is nice and the service is realy good. Realy friendly... in the restaurant oussama is very polite and a good waitor. Credits also for the staff of the loby bar
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Keely M wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We stayed here for a week my partner and parents and absolutely loved this hotel the food is amazing always a different variety with good quality food. The animation team are brilliant always friendly. Loved the daily aqua gym! We was always served at our seat never had to go to the bar for a drink and bought us wine to our table in a ice bucket which was a nice touch. Waiters and cleaners work so hard. Wifi was good although better in the main areas rather than the bedrooms. The shuttle bus is good however we got dropped of on a back road so be aware this is not where the souks club med is where the horse carriages are you have to walk through the garden past the mosque and cross the road and there is the main markets. We was on block 3000 with garden view the room was lovely very clean the only thing we can say was would of preferred our room cleaned in the morning rather than 4pm as we returned to our room sometimes but think there was only one cleaner on that block. Will definitely recommend to our friends and looking forward to coming back next year. Really can't understand why people complain about this hotel people say it's not 5* because there's no room service which i wouldn't want why would I want to be stuck eating in my room I'm on holiday and because you can't get wifi all the time why would I want to be on my phone 24/7 I go on holiday to get away from it. Averall loved it !!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Meryem B wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We've been friends with all the team honestly they are such great people so kind profecional and they have sense of service i wanna thank them for making our week the best one this year thanks to you guys ( chef ziko hafid azzedine abdeljalil mohcine ayoub mohamed ...)  By the way the rooms are very clean the food and drinks all perfect.  If someone needed to relax just come to the be live collection or experience you're not gonna regret it at all !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: JMH2103 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Summary - had our money stolen from the ATM in the lobby majority of staff were ridiculously rude and unhelpful food was not nice and had flies landing all over it bar service was very slow sports bar floor looks as if the titanic has hit it and is extremely dangerous the spa staff were very pushy near death incident with an oil spill on the floor    Myself and three friends stayed at this hotel from the 20th-27th of September 2018. We were a little apprehensive about staying in this hotel due to the number of bad reviews however we decided the good reviews outweighed the bad. Unfortunately we could not have been more wrong.  One of my friends had been liaising with the hotel to arrange a taxi to take us from the airport to the hotel. She had sent our flight number and received email confirmation that a taxi had been booked. Upon leaving the airport there was no taxi to be found. We called the front desk to find out where to meet the taxi driver and they were extremely unhelpful and provided no solution to the issue. We ended up having to get a taxi from outside the airport and pay a higher price than agreed with the hotel. This was only the beginning of the awful service and terrible holiday.  We arrived before check in time and were told to make ourselves comfortable and go and get lunch. We looked around the hotel and the spa. We were interested in booking spa treatments and were told we could only pay for these in cash. We were encouraged to withdraw cash from the ATM in the hotel lobby.  Upon returning to the front desk to check in as stated in other reviews we were hit with tourist tax room deposits and towel deposits which we were not made aware of prior to booking. We tried to tell Mohamed that we wanted to pay for both rooms in one card transaction however he ignored this request and took the payments separately thus incurring two currency exchange charges.  Following checking in we tried to withdraw 1300 dirhams to pay for the spa treatments as advised however the ATM processed the transaction and failed to dispense any cash and printed out a blank receipt. Naturally we were very concerned about this as it isn't a common occurrence in the UK. We approached members of staff from the front desk who were extremely unhelpful Loubna even laughed at me while I cried over the lost money. We were eventually directed to Mounia Ouarhzif PR Manager who was insistent that the ATM machine was not the hotels responsibility and there was nothing she could do. I spent a long time trying to explain to her she does have some responsibility as the service is within her hotel. She then became adamant that we should wait 48 hours for the money to be returned to my account. I requested she put this in writing to guarantee liability for the lost money. All she could tell me was that her word was enough and we should take her word. I explained multiple times this was not enough for me and I needed further action to be taken. After wasting time calling multiple people and getting no response Mounia decided to send myself and my friend to a bank in the hotel taxi with a rep who was responsible for booking excursions and did not know a thing about the situation. When arriving at the bank the Rep did not know what to say and we were dismissed within a minute of entering the building and sent back to the hotel. Upon returning to the hotel Mounia was extremely unhelpful again and decided to send an email to a representative at the bank instead. Mounia asked what time our spa treatments were arranged for to which we replied 10 & 11 and she so kindly offered to allow us to pay for these treatments on card instead. She did not ever come close to offering us any compensation for the stress caused by this situation.  The email chain between myself Mounia and Houda went back and forth over the next day with no outcome. Over the next four days we received no update from Mounia or the bank and it was as if the whole problem was forgotten. We went to Mounia on Monday who informed me she would send another email however she did not bother to do this until I approached her again hours later. Whenever I went to reception to ask to speak to her I was informed she was not there or she was busy although I could see her sitting in her office picking out underneath her nails. We returned to the bank on the following Tuesday with Sarah PR due to the lack of update and spoke to Houda (Bank Populaire) who then told us it would take over a month to receive our money back. This naturally was very upsetting as we had already spent the majority of our holiday with no money and now knew we wouldn't have any money before we left.  My friend developed an allergic reaction during our stay and needed antihistamines and suffered irritation around her eyes and face. As we had no money we were unable to get to a pharmacy and purchase any medication. My friend was reviewed by the hotel nurse who offered to leave an eye wash at reception to help with the symptoms. When we collected the eye wash we googled the eye wash instructions as it was all in French and then realised the eye wash was three months out of date which is completely unacceptable for any star hotel let alone a 5 star.  We had two double rooms which both had continual issues with leaking showers which we reported however no one ever arrived to fix. The rooms were acceptable however the house keepers never replaced our water until the last night of our stay meaning we were always thirsty and having to go to the bar to get water which was an inconvenience.  We booked the a la carte restaurant for our last evening to round the holiday off nicely. Myself and my friend are both vegetarian and upon arriving in the restaurant we informed the waiter about this. We were told flatly there is no vegetarian option available and offered no alternative food. We were repeatedly told beef or fish and also were only offered beer or wine despite the bar being connected to the restaurant. My friend and I decided to speak to the front desk and public relations about the issue. Mohamed from the front desk informed us he did not know anything about the a la carte restaurant which is ridiculous. The lady from PR appeared to begin helping us only to put her palm up to my friend and say "wait" and chase after a couple of guests to talk to them for a while. Eventually she called the chef over and informed us we should have notified them of our dietary requirement to which we informed them it is completely unacceptable to not serve a vegetarian option at a five star hotel with regular visits from various nationalities. The chef informed us we could select items from the buffet to take into the a la carte restaurant and led us into the buffet (that we had eaten for the previous six days - morning noon and night - as we couldn't leave the hotel due to lack of money. We asked the chef which items were vegetarian and were told a rice dish contained no meat. We began putting this on our plate and then realised it actually had meat in. We then walked off in disgust (to the desserts which were the only nice option) and my friend began to slide across the floor due to an oil spillage which had not been dealt with. My friend nearly broke a bone from this and no apology was offered from the staff in the buffet.  The staff at the bar were extremely slow and there were only ever two people serving drinks which lead to large queues regularly. One of the bar staff Hafid actually called two other people forward instead of serving me and my friend when we had been waiting patiently for around 15 minutes. We can only assume this is because they were young and very pretty.  The buffet restaurant has very minimal labelling which lead to multiple near misses of meat consumption. The waiters were also very slow and one day we waited half an hour for a glass of Pepsi that we had to ask for four times that was flat on arrival. Often the tables were not cleared up from previous guests and there was regularly a lack of available tables at dinner. There were flies all over the food in the buffet.    Positives of the holiday would be the pool with the swim up bar Reda was friendly and helpful and the weather which is out of the hotels control.    I would not recommend this hotel to anyone please do not waste your money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: david g wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: My advice would be to treat this as a 3.5 star hotel if you are looking for a holiday. We were very disappointed. When a member of staff reduces your wife to tears because he shouts at here because she didn't understand him speaking in French (she is English) it's not great. Food was also not brilliant. Could be lovely but lots of in house training needed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: j0esf0 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: This all inclusive fell short on many levels . Very much a disappointment. Please upgrade your food drink and staff. Getting a driink at an all inclusive should not be a task. Beverages were all weird market brands Food was tasteless. Hard to believe in a country with so much spice that the food was so bland. Alternative venue was also a miss. Don‚Äôt think Be Live is a viable product .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Danny P wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: 5 Star Hotel, Your having a Laugh!!!
Review_Text: Its a lovely hotel with so much potential but it needs someone to sort it out as it‚Äôs no where near 5*.    Some of the Bad -    1. Food - it‚Äôs the same food everyday for lunch and dinner. They don‚Äôt have enough staff especially in the morning and you have to wait while the chef that is responsible for poached eggs runs around refilling the water bread yoghurt and everything else that he is responsible for while the 2-3 management stand at the door watching.  2. Night time - There is not enough seating at night and usually there is only one/two bar men so getting a drink is slow. The hotel was not even that busy so can‚Äôt imagine when it‚Äôs like in August! You only have one bar to sit in at night so minimal choice and limited seats.  3. How can you have a sports bar that opens at 10pm but most sport starts at 7.30pm- 8pm start in the uk? The time we got in there sport was finished and everyone was ready for bed. It‚Äôs really dangerous in there too as all the floor boards are broken and uneven.  4. Ala Carte restaurant - we visited the restaurant at 7pm we left with many others from other tables at 8pm as there is minimal staff they are rude and don‚Äôt top your drinks up. There were two staff in the whole restaurant so they never stood a chance with a fully booked rooster. The lady next to us asked for the door to be open as it was so hot (air Con not working) and the waiter was so rude to her. Not sure if that‚Äôs because she was a female but caused 4 other tables to leave the restaurant In disgust.  5. Drinks/glasses - Every time I got a drink at the snack or pool bar the glasses are dirty.  6. Minimal Toilets - There is a swim up bar that gets really busy but no thought was obviously put into the planning when the hotel was built as there is no toilets nearby. You need to have a 5 min walk back to main reception or the other pool to use the toilet  7. Showers - First few days our shower was cold. Luckily a fellow guest told us that the hot was cold and cold was hot no idea why they have built it that way plus the showers leak and flood the bathroom as the flooring is not designed right  8. Flies!!! - The hotel is covered in them especially around the snack bar buffet restaurant and bars which also had lots of wasps!  9. WiFi or lack of it! - The Internet connection is poor it goes down all the time and is inconsistent all day.  10. Shower facilities - we were not getting picked up until 9pm so asked if there were any shower facilities to use to get ready for our flight back home. Was told would need to use the outside cold shower by the pool or pay to use the spa so I could use their showers in the indoor pool. Never had a 5* hotel not offer these facilities  11. THE WORSE THING (Not hotels fault) was the 2 hour queue getting in and out of the country through passport control. üò¢    The Good - Animation team- Especially Simo Karim Titif and Ibrahim. They work hard all day talking and helping guests whilst putting on a packed entertainment program    Got some lovely staff that work in this hotel but it needs better management in order for it to be anywhere near a 5* hotel. I would not recommend this as a hotel to go to for my friends or family
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Melg2006 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Just recently back from 10 nights at this hotel. We read a lot of the reviews before going so we were aware of some of the potential issues. I have to say I agree with some of the previous reviewers on issues such as waiting times at lobby bar and pool bar occasionally. We also had a nasty smell in the room which after reporting was dealt with.  We had no issues with checking in or out and all the times we approached them the reception staff were friendly and helpful.    The hotel itself is lovely and the rooms are clean and spacious with massive bathrooms. There seemed to be someone cleaning everywhere we went in the hotel it was spotless!  The pools are good. We preferred the quieter pool with the swim up bar. There were plenty of sunbeds available throughout our stay no matter what time we decided to get some sun.  There seemed to be plenty activities on offer if you wanted to take part.    The restaurants are mostly good not the best we've had on an all inclusive holiday but could always find something to eat. The desserts were fantastic in the buffet restaurant. The drinks at the bars (when you can get served!) were ok but clearly watered down. Staff are hardworking but there aren't enough of them in the bars or restaurants. If this was resolved I'm sure the complaints about waiting times would be greatly reduced.    The hotel provides a free shuttle bus to the main centre of Marrakech which is a bonus and saves having to get a taxi.  We used the Spa whilst there and was impressed by the facilities and treatments available. Definitely recommend a Hammam as a lovely relaxing start to the holiday.    A couple of improvements could make this good hotel much better. Tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. An early breakfast or at least a takeaway breakfast for those going on early trips/departures would be a good addition. The motion sensor lights in the evening walking back to the rooms didn't always work and flicked on and off which was a bit annoying.    Overall we enjoyed our stay here hopefully the hotel will continue to act on feedback and make improvements to make this a great hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ambassador775930 wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Fabulous staff - polite friendly and helpful at all times. Rooms were great - clean spacious.  Food - a good variety at all meal times.  Work your way through the cocktail list they are all delicious.  Pool areas clean and comfortable always found plenty of sun beds.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sonia892015 wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Lovely Hotel, Not yet a 5 Star
Review_Text: We were here for 10 days Overall we were pleased with the hotel which was very clean and also the variety of food the hotel had to offer was delicious.    On arrival the check in staff were not very welcoming or helpful. In fact there was a guest throwing up and none of them took any notice of this poor man. It took a cleaner to alert the staff management for anything to be done even though the reception staff had clearly seen the guest. We arrived early but was told our room would be ready in an hour we came back after 2 hours and still had to wait a while longer however once we finally were able to check in our room was wonderful very spacious and had a lovely big bathroom.    I have to state again that the reception staff were pretty much useless during our stay. We twice rang from our hotel room to re-arrange bookings but was quite abruptly told to just go to the reception. What's the point of having a phone in the room if you can't sort things out without trekking into the reception every time? I also wanted to change up some Moroccan Dhirams to smaller denominations. However I was told that the hotel didn't have any Dhirams left which was a complete lie as straight after I someone requested to change up some Euros to local currency.    The hotel was away from the main city which was fine for us as as we just wanted to relax in the hotel. The hotel do offer a free shuttle bus which is useful as you don't have to pay for a taxi. However it states that you will be dropped by the main market but you are actually dropped around a 5min walk away.    The gym is small and if you are planning todo some weight lifting there is only one bench and the weights only go up to 25kg. They are missing some of the most essential equipment in there such as a cable machine.    The bar staff were very friendly and were great at mixing drinks the only downfall was they supplied cheap alcohol which was very watered down. The pool bar and snack bar was infested with wasps and put us off ordering drinks from there we felt sorry for the staff who had to wok there all day.    The animation staff were very friendly and provided good entertainment the archery and gym aerobics was a hit. The entertainment in the evening was good especially the live music.    We would especially like thank Ayoub and Hafid from the bar staff. Also we would like to thank Sarah from the PR team who helped us greatly during our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sunaina N wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: For the past two years i have done a trip to Marrakech with my girl friends. I have always stayed 4* all inclusive so i didnt mind paying extra for a 5* all inclusive adult only hotel.  To be honest i expected more from a 5* hotel considering its only been opened 6 months. The only best thing about the hotel was the bed and the animation team. The food was ok repetitive and seafood galore...even the pizza was seafood or margarita. The food is very bland even at the pool snack bar. We ordered a chiken and a meat panini...the chicken was boiled and the red meat was pink...that put us off from eating there.  The bedroom was nice but had a drain stench  The drinks choice was great but the wait at the bar was too long 20min.  So we got there on the 20.9 a thursday on saturday night we were going out...we had too much change approx 75-85 durham approx¬£8.00 we didnt think twice and left it on the table amongst other clutter...the money was not visible...on sunday night wen we going out again i thought ill add loose change to tge rest...well we couldnt find the change...spoke to reception and they advised to speak to public relation in the morning...but they did say that housekeeping might have taken it assuming we had left them a tip...i imagined the same...but didnt expect them to take money as its not the norm. So monday i spoke to the public relation Sara on monday explained money had gone missing and i wasnt impressed...especially from a 5*hotel. She advised that she will investigate and will let me know. So i thought it could have been honest mistake when she comes back to me ill let it be. So monday evening we are getting ready and noticed that my foundation NARS-longwear which took me 8months to get hold of the shade had been tampered with...it was a full bottle and there was no foundation in der it had not leaked into my makeup bag...no reason it should have done and it had finger prints all over the foundation. At this point i realised it had been done maliciously...no attempt was made to clean the bottle. I was soo angry and upset...why would some one want to do that...i took the bottle to sara and asked her to explain how this could have been done...i was shaking with anger and naturally wanted an explanation of WHY? She just looked at me blank...i had to ask her couple of times...do u understand what i am saying and all she could say is i am sorry for inconvenience and i will look into the matter. Any body can see this is the repercussions of making a complaint re money being taken...she said to give her time to investigate...i asked to speak to the manager she went in to see him 15min later he was unavailable...clearly he didnt think it was important to speak me...this definitely ruined my holiday!!
