I thought give her time to investigate...tuesday went by...she hadn't got back to me re the missing money or the foundation as wednesday was my last day at the hotel i went to see her and asked why she hadn't made contact...her answer was that she didnt see me...considering i spend all day at the pool side and she knew my room number...but hey ho...the best is yet to come...so i asked what did she find out...she said she rang the head of housekeeping and they concluded it wasnt housekeeping...apparently they never touched the money...oh yeah i also forgot to mention i left a ¬£1 at the same place and that also went Missin on tuesday! This took her 2 days to find out and expected me to chase her.i said i wasnt happy with the answer and wanted to speak to the manager...well the manager was not in that day it was his day off and der was no cover...so she said you can speak to her manager!! So the manager never showed 3 hours later...but the manager will be available next day thursday wen i fly out...how convenient....at this point i was not going to listen to her excuses...she was abrupt wasnt interested...i felt as though i was off the street asking her for a favour. I did say i will be taking this complaint further and i will putting a negative review on trip advisor and guess what her response was...sorry for the inconvenience...    Sorry for the long rant but i am soo disappointed that i paid a lot of money to be treated like this as though i made it all up!!! It is definitely not 5* i have been to better 4*  I also forgot to mention that the hotel takes ¬£80 deposit for damages and pool towels...like... are they for real..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: 2111sh wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Perfect holiday in a pefect hotel
Review_Text: Thank you for the great time at Be Live Collection Hotel! Simo Titif and Kareem were excellent! Great service all the time and really appreciated the activities at the pool including aqua gym darts as well as archery and football! 5star rating for them all! Definitely recommend the place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ginta V wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: The Holidays were amazing! We enjoyed all the stay here. You can see where 5 stars came from. The food were amizing the entertainment team were always on their feet making all the stay much nicer! Big thanks to Simo and Titif for making us happy all the time! üëç
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: mcstickle wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: After reading some reviews online we were slightly concerned that this was not going to be a great experience but we were very pleasantly surprised.    The hotel looks great it is very new but there are some minor niggles that I‚Äôm sure will be addressed the towel rails in the bathroom seem to come loose easily along with the towel hook and it‚Äôs very difficult to have a shower without getting the bathroom floor wet. But overall things look great the pool and gardens are beautiful and everything is clean and well maintained. In the rooms there are big TVs that show Hollywood movies in English 24 hours a day which is nice if you want something to watch or listen to. The beds are very large and very comfortable and the robes slippers and washing equipment are all nice touches. The cleaning team are very nice and tidy the rooms to a good standard. We chose a ‚Äòswim up room‚Äô which was lovely and fairly private for when you want to cool down away from the main pool but if I have one criticism it is that ‚Äòswim up‚Äô made us expect to be able to swim to the room from the main pool and this is not the case more of a small private pool.    The food in the buffet restaurant is plentiful and there is a wide range of cuisine. Not the most amazing food I ever tasted but very good for an all inclusive at this price point especially in a developing country! We found the service in the buffet restaurant to be fast and polite especially from Oussama he went out of his way to please every time and it was a real pleasure to meet him thanks Oussama! We booked a meal in the restaurant for our final evening which was a very impressive four course dinner with wine. We were also impressed with the service from Tarik.    The swim up pool bar is wonderful with efficient friendly service and a good range of drinks including cocktails beer wine spirits. The other pool looked great too but we used the pool with the bar every day. Around the pool are some four-poster loungers with covers ideal if you want to get out of the midday sun.    The evening entertainment is varied and enjoyable with some talented musicians. The main bar staff are very polite and attentive sometimes the service is a little slow here but the staff do offer table service where possible to speed things up. In busy periods we would order two drinks each to make bar visits less frequent and we never became frustrated with the service again just a small niggle.    There is a spa and a gym which we didn‚Äôt make use off but worth mentioning at no gym listed on TripAdvisor.    A few tips for future holiday makers: take a pen to the airport as you have to fill in a form both ways at Marrakech airport. Also on the homeward journey you need to visit the check in desk even if you only have hand luggage.    Overall a very good holiday none of these criticisms tarnished our experience we came back to the UK feeling very happy and relaxed but we wanted to mention them so that the creases can be ironed out and our next visit can be followed by a 5 star review.    Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Katja S wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Ok for the price but it's already falling apart
Review_Text: The Good:    Overall we had an enjoyable stay. The hotel is stylish the gardens beautiful the beds comfortable the pools quiet and the food good. It's nice you get bottles of water for meals instead of them refilling your glass constantly. The wine they serve is good too. The meal in the Ksar restaurant was the best we had in months.  The beds are large and extremely comfortable  We got a discount because we booked before they even opened so I think we got a value for money but if you pay full price now ....    The Bad:    First of all I think people who a book a 5 star hotel in a developing country and expect it to be the same as a 5 star hotel in europe/US are insane. It's just not the same.  But as other people have said there's a lot of small things that add up  - Service in general is quite slow! It's ok in the buffet restaurant. You get your own food and we didn't mind waiting a few minutes for drinks. Similarly the pool bar was pretty good too. You'd just go up and order and your drink was ready soon after. But in the Snack and Lobby bar it would easily take 20 minutes to just get the menu and then at least another 30 min to get a drink and your food. We actually waited an hour after ordering for a fruit platter once. During busy times they are just understaffed but in general a good waiter could handle the amount of people. It just seems staff was not trained properly  - It gets crowded. During our first few days the hotel seemed quite busy and it was impossible get a lounge chair at the pool people were pushing around in the buffet service was slow ....  - Hotel seems unorganized sometimes. We were there 10 min before check in so she told us to wait in the lobby bar for 30 min until 15:20 which was fine  After that we went to to reception and checked in. They gave us a room and a guy carried our stuff there. He opens the door and the room is a mess.  So we go back to reception. They suggest we wait for another 30 min until after 16:00. We decline and ask them to just give us another room and she just looks at the computer for 5 min without saying anything and then agrees begrudgingly. No apology    The Ugly:    - Rooms look nice but are falling apart and staff is very unapologetic about issues. Several things malfunctioned in our room. On the first day we hang a towel from the towel rail and a few min later the rail just fell off.  The next day we couldn't get into our room. First someone came and reset the card reader. It worked for about 5 min. Then he came again this time changed the battery and that seemed to fix it. It about 2 hours to figure out tho and no apologies whatsoever. No "sorry for the inconvenience" or anything.  Then a few days later we came back to our room after lunch and the small mirror was lying on our bathroom sink. Obviously it fell off when housekeeping was cleaning it and they just left it there.  On some days we got an unpleasant smell from the drains. It was not too bad and not constant but we heard other people had it worse and had to change rooms  Since they take a deposit for the room we were quire worried they would charges us for this but thankfully they didn't.  - In general the hotel is falling apart/badly maintained. The floor in the sports bar is ridiculously uneven tiles in the pools are already chipped/falling off. And that's just after being a few months old.  Also they have these great coveredpillowed lounge chairs which would be great. But they never actually put the cover on them. And when they do they are quite dirty and with holes    Overall we had a good holiday but we would not return and not recommend you pay full price
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: korynferdinand wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Where to start?!  1. There is only 1 person at a bar at anyone time so you will be waiting in a que for a least 10 mins before getting your all inclusive drinks  2. Food is tasteless with minimal option. My friend was violently sick for the last day of our trip.  3. The staff have no customer service skills what so ever and make you feel like you are not a valued customer. If you ask for a drink at any meal they will tell you someone else will get it but the drink will never come. Better to get it yourself.  4. While the bartender was making my drink a fly went in it and died. She picked it out and handed me the drink.  5. The rooms smell like drains. The AC makes the stench unbearable.  6. There is a ¬£60 room deposit fee that they fail to mention so make sure you bring enough money for that. There is also a deposit payable for pool towels.  7. The cleaners do not actually do as thier job title suggests but rather just tidy the room.  8. The manager is just as rude as the staff so to complain is pointless.  9. Black women are not welcome at this hotel you will be stared at no matter what you do.  10. The beds are the only 5 star thing about the complex.    To summarise. I do not know who gave this hotel 5 stars but they should take them back. The service is outrageous. Wouldn't recommend it to my worse enemy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Francesca wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: I‚Äôm sorry - did someone say 5 stars?...
Review_Text: I don‚Äôt know about anybody else but when I book a 5* hotel I expect to have a 5* experience. Not only do I expect the decor to be up to date and everything to be clean but I also expect the staff to be polished professional and helpful. I expect the food and beverages to be delicious and well prepared my requests to be granted reasonably quickly and when I pick up the phone to ask for something such as room service or extra pillows - I expect them to call me by my name. Is this too much to ask?... Well the Be Live Collection Adults Only Hotel certainly think so!!    On arrival I got a very warm welcome from Rashid the concierge. It‚Äôs a shame that his professionalism and integrity is overshadowed by the disservice of this hotel because he really did go above and beyond to make you feel special. Check in didn‚Äôt go as smoothly as it could have. When paying for our room I was faced with hidden fees such as a fee to rent towels for the sunbeds (even though I had my own beach towel) Tourist Tax and an incidental deposit. I was told I had to make three different transactions on my card rather than one transaction which incurred three foreign usage charges from my bank.    I was all inclusive but I wish I hadn‚Äôt bothered as the AI drinks menu was quite limited and the cocktails were undrinkable. Even a simple vodka and lemonade was approaching impotable! The food was very bland which was extremely disappointing as I love Moroccan food and the menu was repetitive (to be expected if staying for a week or two weeks but not for a four day stay like mine).    I was with four other young ladies and we were all ostracised. We were not greeted when we entered the restaurant like the French were and we noticed that whilst everyone else (French couples) were given a bottle of water on their table we were not. When we asked for a bottle of water anyone would have thought we had asked them to canoe all the way to Fiji climb the volcanic mountains and collect the tropical rainfall in a rain gauge!! We had to ask for a drink numerous times before receiving one and by the time we received any drink on our table I had nearly finished my plate of food. Not wanting to wait another 25 mins for another drink we would order another round of drinks (coke and sparkling water - not alcohol) but were told we had to finish our current drinks on the table first. At one point we had no cutlery on our table and I was made to wait 20 mins before they were brought. On our third day we had reached the end of our tether and demanded to speak to a manager expressing how very unhappy we were with the service and wanted to make a formal complaint. We were told the manager was not in and that there was no duty manager on the premises. The next day which was our last day was the only day we were even acknowledged. Greeted as I entered the restaurant asked if there was anything I needed my drinks brought promptly but it was a little too late to be honest.    My room was quite decent - I had the superior deluxe double room. However the telephone could not ring out which meant that I had to text my friends to call reception and ask them to ring my room. I never met the housekeeping team however I loved how they folded our bed linen and bedsheets into different patterns. Also the night staff on reception were very helpful especially when I needed someone to attend my room to save me from a spider.    This was my first ever visit to Marrakech and I would definitely return however I would NEVER STAY IN THIS HOTEL AGAIN! After returning to the UK I had a look at the reviews and can see that we were not the only people who experienced such rudeness from staff. I find it concerning that the hotel has reassured a customer who left a bad review in June 2018 that the hotel has now made an improvement and that ‚Äúthey care passionately about their guests feedback and remarks in order to improve the quality of their service‚Äù. This is not the case so don‚Äôt fall for it! It is simply the bog standard message they post to give the illusive impression that they are working to improve. It shouldn‚Äôt take more than three months to improve staff attitude and customer service. If you want to pay 5* prices and receive 2* service - then this is definitely the hotel for you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: CheGordon wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: A major gamble of a hotel
Review_Text: The service here is poor and disrespectful and i dont know where to start. In the restaurant if you want any form of drink with your food i suggest ordering it 15mins before your meal or you might have to ask 3/4 times and then get attitude in return because youve had to repeatedly remind them. Most staff are rude and can be unjustly argumentative making you feel like you are an inconvenience. Every time I requested something it felt like it was a problem and thats if i was acknowledged. The cocktails are lucky to be called cocktails so don't have any expectations you will be disappointed. The food...ive been ill for 2 days now and friends were ill too. Because i was still ill i paid for late checkout only for someone to come knocking on the door asking when am i leaving and not believing i had late checkout. Instead of going to reception to check their mistake it was a confrontation. Every day my room was tidied but not cleaned but by this point i didn't even want to mention it.  This establishment has an extremely long road ahead of them for someone to understand why it's a 5 star. It is unfair to other hotels who work hard for that 5 star status to be put in the same bracket as this hotel. I would definitely visit morrocco again but will book with a more well known chain of 5 star hotels so that I can at least feel wanted at the hotel I have paid for. Unfortunately the VERY FEW staff who were polite are completely overshadowed by the disappointment of everything else. There are so many poor examples I could give but I would be writing forever. I feel they pick and choose who to treat well and make it obvious and if you stay here the majority of you will experience the same thing so book here if you want to truly gamble with your holiday.  I dont like to be negative but in this circumstance it's just completely unavoidable and true.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sarah D wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Me and my partner had booked here for our first holiday together. After hearing a few mixed reviews about morocco we were a little bit apprehensive of what to expect.    I can honestly say this place is unreal. The hotel the people the city the culture..    Firstly the hotel is absolutely immaculate. There are members of staff all over the building continously working hard to make the place look good. Whether its somebody buffing the marble floor Trimming the bushes washing the windows or watering the grass. I have never seen anything like it.    Our bedroom was beautiful. We had booked a superior room. The beds were huge and super comfy. We had the option of a bath as well as a shower room. The housekeeping team were superb and kept the room spotless. We were very impressed.    The grounds are beautiful and very well looked after. In the evening the place is lit up with lots of colourful lights. Great for photos!  There is a smaller quieter pool with a pool bar and a larger pool where they do activities during the day. Always sun beds free at both without having to reserve early on.    The hotel is located around 15 minutes from the city and there is a shuttle bus that runs from the hotel which is very sufficent. We took a trip to the markets and I would highly reccomend this. It was a real eye opener for us. Although we had people coming up to us every 2 seconds trying to sell something it was all part of the experience. My partner felt a little on edge but this was because he was more worried on my behalf being a white british female but honestly there is absolutely nothing to worry about.The men may stare a little but it's expected.  Everyone we had contact with was super friendly and can say they are the nicest people we have encountered with in a foreign country. Every single person welcomed us. I was a little apprehensive of what I could wear but most tourists wear what they usually would on holiday as did I and I was absolutely fine wherever I went so please don't worry about that!    There are plenty of trips and excursions to go on which you can book with the hotel. I would highly recommend the Ouzoud Waterfall- the most breathtaking views and place. Also the quad biking if you're a little bit of a thrill seeker!    The all inclusive buffet was great! Lots of different foods to try from. Some days were a bit samey but this is what you expect from an all inclusive. The cocktails are lovely. Plenty to choose from.  We ate out one evening at the Buddha Bar in the city beautiful restaurant!!!!    What really made our trip was 2 particular members of staff. Ayoub( lobby bar) and Ayoub ( snack bar). These 2 gentleman looked after us from the moment we arrived. These people are what make the hotel and they are an absolute credit to the place. We have made friends for life and I cannot wait to come back and see them. Both have a heart of gold. Great banter too! There was also another young gentleman whos name I cannot remember but also looked after us very well ( his parents lived in Manchester uk).    Also take my hat off to Simo this man was part of the animation team and would be in high spirits from 9am right up until midnight. His energy and happiness was so infectious. I don't know how he does it but what a star!    Like I said previously everyone we came in contact with was extremely kind and it's quite overwhelming really. What a beautiful country!  Please everyone ignore the bad reviews.    Thank you kindly to all members of staff it was an amazing trip.    Sarah & Cameron. x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Tom F wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We are currently staying at the resort (19th Sept) and are disappointed overall.    The service in general is not up to scratch very long wait‚Äôs to get your drinks table service is even worse with most orders being forgotten about.    For so called 5 star there is a lot of things missing no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms no room service and a warm empty mini bar fridge. The rooms are clean but lack amenities.    Upon check in they make you pay the local taxes followed by a large deposit. Not sure why they need the deposit as there is no mini bar or room service!    Went to the spa to look at what was on offer. Walked out after seeing them trying to charge 5 star prices. After the rest of the service we had encountered so far we thought it would be best to go back to our room and burn our money then give it to them.    The food is not 5 star standard and again the service just makes you not want to not bother going for food. It is very poor. You are better going to the local supermarket and making your own food. To be fair though the desserts are nice.    If you try and ring reception or need to speak to someone anywhere prepare for a long wait. It seems this is the case for everything we are British and used to queuing and waiting but this place is on another level.    Also on another note. Not that I like playing this card but feel I need to mention for other same sex couples wanting to stay here. We were defiantly made to feel different and very uncomfortable. I hate saying this type of thing but it needs to be said. We felt more comfortable and at ease in Dubai and Egypt. Looking at the service compared to other couples we got sub standard service.    Overall I would say this hotel is 3 star not 5. If they invested in staff training and better amenities it would defiantly be 5 star but at present it has a lot to learn. We have stayed in a number of 5 star hotels and this is by far the worst.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rebecca N wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We stayed for 10 nights in a swim up room for our Honeymoon in July.  Check in - swift quick and friendly. Helpful staff. We booked through On the Beach and had the rep greet us.  Room - we had a complimentary honeymoon cake and the room was decorated beautifully a lovely touch. The room was decorated with rose petals most days.  Pools - both pools are great you have the relaxed one for some quiet time the bar does get busy as its swim up but the staff work their hardest all day - getting one day off so please be respectful! The other pool has activities happening all day -the reps are fantastic so much fun and energy!!  Snack bar - the food from here is soooooooo nice be sure to have lunch here a couple of times! A suggestion - this should turn into a cocktail bar in the evening and cut queue time at the lobby bar.  Buffet restaurant and Moroccan - Such a wide range of food to eat at the buffet for all breakfast lunch and dinner - we didn't get bored of eating there at all. The food is at a high standard. The Moroccan restaurant has a choice of 2 set menus. We did book this for one night but it was closed (no one let us know) it wasn't an issue though as we were happy to re book and get at the buffet restaurant  Entertainment - WOW WOW WOW what amazing nights!!!!! from the belly dancers to the African performance - outstanding. The band were out of the world and the DJ could get work in top England clubs he is THAT good!!    Overall hotel smells lovely and is very very clean. The staff work extremely hard to please you.  The photographer Raid what a great guy - really happy and chatty always saying hi and offering recommendations for if venturing out.    Book a guided tour around the Marina with the on the beach rep at the hotel entrance - he's there from 3-6 the tour was excellent.    You can not fault the bar and waiting staff - TIP THEM THEY WORK SO HARD!!!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lynsey B wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We visited the hotel at the end of August for a weeks holiday well what can I say the hotel was amazing the staff and service was impeccable especially a big thankyou to Azzdine Naimi who made our holiday extra special all the staff went to extra lengths to make sure we had a lovely chilled time.  We stayed in one of the pool rooms which was a big wow absolutely loved it was lovely and modern the rooms were cleaned every day fresh towels gowns etc provided every day would highly recommend one of these rooms for the finishing touch.  The hotel itself was beautiful and spotlessly clean the staff are cleaning all day the reception staff couldn‚Äôt do enough to help with anything you needed.  Breakfast was delicious the food in all areas of the hotel was lovely all freshly made and with every choice you could think of and the Asian restaurant was lovely again can‚Äôt fault anything about the food and service. Drinks provided were excellent a brilliant choice of cocktails and lovely wine also lovely mocktails too.  The pools were excellent one near the sports bar had music all day and the animation team were so friendly fab aqua aerobics and games in the pool the other pool was a quiet pool but great if you just wanted to relax in peace this had the swim up bar which was lush.  The entertainment in the evening was brilliant overall me and my partner had an amazing week the weather was very hot but not once did we get bored and we both highly recommend this hotel for a chilled week away the hotel offer many excursions out of the hotel which were reasonably priced there is plenty to do if your not a sun worshipper too.  An overall 10/10 love marrakech we will definitely be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: chelseamade wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: This was the most relaxing holiday we have experienced.  A new beautiful hotel with a warm welcome for all.  The adults only formula is fantastic and relaxing.  The facilities bars  restaurants and entertainment are of a very high standard and the staff greet you with a welcoming smile.  I would like to give a special mention to Ossama in the restaurant - excellent at his job -  Another extremely big mention to the entertainment team especially Karim Simo and Titif the life guard who SHOULD be part of the entertainment team .  As a new hotel there are a few little teething problems but nothing that we‚Äôre not dealt with efficiently.  I would highly recommend this hotel and looking forward to going back in the near future üëç
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lisamarielea wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Best visit so far to marrakesh
Review_Text: We have just come back from our second visit to marrakesh . We decided that we wanted to do all inclusive and a swim up room and were not dissapointed one bit .  The hotel itself was very clean  food was lovely  the only thing is that the food was sometimes cold .. staff were great but at some points during the day some were very slow in serving us . The entertainment at the hotel was amazing and the fitness staff really made an effort to get you involved .  Never wanted to come home and will defiantly visit again ..  also the airport in Marrakesh is a night mare to get through customs so we did VIP marrakesh and got fast tracked in .. took 10 minutes instead of 2.5 hours last time ..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: oxbury78 wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: When we arrived at the hotel we had a long wait with check in to when we finally got seen was told we could not check into our room for another 4 hrs But they would try their best to get us in as soon as they could 3 hrs later. Once we got into our room it was very clean and spacious We had a swim up room with sun loungers outside which was great Only problem with the room was it the drainage in the shower It flooded our room when the shower was on. The hotel drainage is poor And i heard alot of other people complain about this. There are some improvements that's desperately need sorting at the hotel.  - The bad smell of sewage drainage around the pool  - Wash the glasses at the swim up pool bar rather than just rinse them under a tap was remainders of last drink inside glass  - Excessive amount of flies around pool bars  - More staff needed at the buffet very understaffed  Apart from the above the hotel is clean pretty relaxing spacious and a good selection of food for buffet style and a good selection of drinks And free wifi around the hotel complex. The staff are very helpful and im sure if they addressed these issues it would make a much better stay !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nikki D wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: The only good thing about this hotel is the staff and sunshine. The staff are amazing. We checked in at 2 am. Our room had a disabled wet room. There is a huge window into the bedroom and no door on the toilet which Is not ideal if your a new couple or friends away. I had a shower in the morning which resulted in the bathroom flooding and the water going under the door and into the bedroom! We had to change rooms . Everyone we spoke to had upset tummy‚Äôs so I advise you take plenty of Imodium and buscopan. The only way I managed to settle my stomach was to avoid ice in my drinks and not eat lettuce. My husband and several others we spoke to had sickness and diarrhoea. Resulting in them loosing a day or 2 of their holiday. There is clearly something wrong with hygiene or food here to cause this to so many people. The staff are over worked and can‚Äôt cope with the amount of guest's. Some nights people were queuing out the door at the bar so I suggest u get 2 drinks at a time. They do do table service outside but it can take ages to get your drink and most times a drink would be forgotten. All they need to do is provide the staff with a note pad! Keep your phone well away from room key.. most days ours deactivated. Be careful what time u book your flights. We were flying at 11.30 pm and were they don‚Äôt provide a courtesy room for u to shower in! But u could use the shower around the pool!! This is the service of 5 star hotel ???!!!on the morning we checked out they said to come back at 12 to see if there was a room we could use. This is how they operate their courtesy room .... but we were told the hotel was full so there was nothing they could do !! After asking to speak to the manager they found a room we could use! Another we a disabled wet room which flooded again!! This hotel has so much potential but it‚Äôs definitely not a 5 star! The activities and entertainment is good but I do not appreciate being hassled by a male member of the animation team to leave a trip advisor review and give him 5 stars!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: kaylgriff2018 wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: From booking to arriving at the hotel we had a lovely experience. We had drinks brought to us on check in a lovely touch and the hotel checked us into our room early which was much appreciated.  The hotel itself is beautiful a real peice of paradise but unfortunately not without a few teething problems (hotel is new). We had a swim up room which smelt disgusting it was soon clear the drainage was the cause of the smell our room flooded when the shower was on and the smell got worse. We moved rooms and the smell remained we figured this was a problem we'd have to deal with and didn't want to move again.  The design of the hotel and drainage is poor when it rained the corridors flooded and became lethal to walk on.  Aside from the drainage issues the hotel is beautiful.  A major improvement that's desperately needed is staffing at the bar areas. You will wait half an hour at least for your drink to arrive on table service. If you go to the bar you have to queue not what you want to be doing on holiday. More staff would sort this issue immediately.  Apart from the above the hotel is clean pretty relaxing spacious and the food is delicious. The staff are helpful but slow.  Management seem to be around alot the last few days so hopefully these problems will be addressed. If they are addressed then this hotel will really be something!  Make sure to visit the atlas mountains which you can book through the hotel breathetaking experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: kateO6452TF wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We had an nice relaxing break at this hotel. There were aspects of our stay that we found disappointing but there were also many positives so we have endeavoured to give a fair and balance review.    We opted for a swim up room which we were very pleased with. We liked the outdoor seating area which had two sun loungers resting on a platform in the water. The room was spacious and airy and the bed was very comfortable. The rooms were cleaned daily to a very high standard. We did notice that the shower leaked quite significantly on to the bathroom floor but this was solved by adjusting the shower head so it pointed more in the direction of the shower wall.    The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and well maintained. We found all of the staff to be very pleasant and helpful throughout the hotel.    The main problem that we and many other guests experienced was that there were not enough staff in many of the areas in the hotel. In the buffet restaurant there were two mornings where we had breakfast without being offered tea or coffee and we had dinner once without being offered a drink either which was disappointing. There was also a time at lunchtime in the pool snack bar where we felt like we were being ignored as the one member of staff they had waiting tables was so busy serving other guests which was an impossible job for just one person during a busy service. At the lobby bar it took so long for our drinks to be served that we had to go and get them ourselves. These kind of issues are just not acceptable in what is supposedly a five star resort.    We dined in the a la carte restaurant once in our stay and we loved it by far the best meal we ate during our stay. (you can make a reservation in this restaurant once during your stay). The staff were very helpful and attentive and the food was delicious. You have an option of two set menus but they were flexible about substituting items from one menu with another which was good.    In terms of the buffet restaurant we enjoyed the Moroccan section. We did however find the choice of food on offer for each meal very repetitive and by the end of the stay we were quite bored of it all. We would also recommend that the hotel label all of the food as it really wasn‚Äôt clear what a lot of items were.    In terms of the entertainment we felt that this could do with some improvement. The singers were good but they did seem to sing the same songs each night. We would have liked to have had a bit more variety.    In summary this is a nice hotel but the issues I mentioned above really need to be resolved. We have stayed in many similarly priced all inclusive resorts and haven‚Äôt experienced any of these sorts of problems before it‚Äôs a real shame as these issues really let the hotel down.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Dziree wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: I arrived at the hotel with zero expectations after booking a holiday for a 40th birthday celebration. The main selling point for me was that it was adult only and after 6 weeks of my kids i needed a break without having to deal with other people's whilst on holiday.    From the moment we stepped into the hotel the service was amazing and consistent till we left. The staff were attentive polite courteous and the service provided with what i can only describe as genuine passion. We arrived earlier than the 3pm check in time and although our rooms weren't ready we were allowed to start enjoying the facilities. Naturally we started at the bar where we met Yassine who makes the most amazing cocktails and these were unlimited. Not as strong as what i'm used to but fantastic all the same.    Lunchtime and dinner time staff deserve some accolade ... Hamza Oussama Mohammed Amin and the Adil the manager. These guys gave 5*plus service. The entertainment guys also Karim and Simo kept things exciting from disco night to aqua zuma to Karaoke night... there was no dull moment at Be Live. Plus i got a cake and had the whole restaurant staff sing me a happy birthday song. Perfect ending to our holiday. Will definitely be visiting again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rue H wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: The process of booking was very good However I did have a few issues logging into my flight info and to check in and was annoyed about having to pay extra for seats when I believed I had already paid a significant amount as part of the complete package so that was disappointing.  In respect of the pick up the driver was polite and friendly however we did almost end up in an accident while being taken to our hotel!  The hotel itself was lovely. Great food and cocktails and the facilities were great. The room choice was exceptional and the cleaning service was top notch can‚Äôt fault it in any way.  However I do recommend that visitors make full use of the safe! We had an unexpected visitor late one night when it was believed we were at dinner. The gentleman attempted to enter our room and when he realized we were inside as we had not answered the knock he ran off mumbling about towels. We reported this to the reception who to us to the PR person who in my opinion was absolutely useless! She tried to make up excuses and then said we must use our date and said she would check it out and come back to us which she never did! I find that disgusting and unprofessional. My daughter and I were there as two females alone and it left us feeling very unsafe upset and shaken! This was two days before we left so it tainted our experience and we were pleased to be heading home at that point. There is not enough staff so if you go down to dinner late as it‚Äôs open from 6 to 10 and we ate at around 8.30 a few times expect to not have clean tables particularly on a Sunday or Monday and we ended up having to clean off tables ourselves to sit and eat at!  Finally the cocktail bar is always packed and you have to wait for a significant amount of time to get a drink as there is normally only one person working. Overall I am disappointed in this holiday as it was expensive and I don‚Äôt feel the service we received matched the star rating of this hotel considering we have stated in 5 and 4 start rated hotels before in the Caribbean and had far better quality of service and felt safe.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Abi M wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: On arrival everything seemed lovely nice clean hotel with quick service for drinks etc.    However this first impression did not last very long which was very disappointing!    The reception staff were very unhelpful and rude! Ayoub made us feel very unwelcome and clearly did not have any respect for the guest as the manner in which he spoke to guest I found disgusting! This really lets the hotel down!    At first we thought the food was lovely but wasn‚Äôt long until we were being sick along with most other guests that we spoke to! The staff were aware of this and some even said it was because of the sun!  We had to spend a couple of days of our holiday in the room due to being so ill again this was the same for lots of other guests!    Some of the bar staff are friendly but others were very rude and service was very slow a few days in to our holiday.    The room was kept very clean by the house keeping staff they were probably the friendliest staff in the hotel maybe they could teach the reception staff some basic manners!    The hotel could be really amazing it‚Äôs such a shame to see it being wasted with so many unhappy guests!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ian R wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel(and are still here!) For our wedding anniversary staying in room 6003and I must say that this hotel is fantastic.first of all a big Thank you for Mohammed and Rashid on reception for making our time here very special with always a very warm welcoming smile and very helpful and Ali the restaurant manager who is so attentive to every detail in his work and staff.  9All the staff in the hotel are great with a good sense of humour and with a little friendly greeting from yourself will open them up to big smiles and a warm greetingwhich the manager should be very proud of.  They all work so hard always cleaningattending the gardens which are beautifully kept with sented flowers and plants.  The rooms are cleaned everyday up to a high standard.  The food is fresh delious and well presented with a good selection.  we didn't use the spa which i thought was a little pricybut the gym was adequately equipped for our stay.  The entertainment was hit n miss which was a little bit loud but didn't go on too late.  All in all I would defiantly recommend this hotel on which we had a wonderful time.thank you Belive hotel!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Man-from-CFL wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here three nights for a conference. The hotel is quite a distance from the centre of Marrakech in a rural setting. Check in was quick once we'd found the correct hotel (the taxi took us to another be live hotel nearby!). I gather that the hotel only opened this year and initially had some issues but these seem to have been solved now.    The room was large clean and well decorated with a comfortable bed good shower etc. WiFi not the best but did work. For an all inclusive hotel the food was generally very good quality with plenty of choice (meat fish salad Moroccan International etc) although the same choice most days.    Two good outdoor pools (one for proper swimming one with non-operational pool bar) plus an indoor (for an extra fee as its part of the spa). Annoyingly for an all inclusive hotel there was an extra deposit for the pool towels although luckily this could be done on a credit card. Watched the world cup in the sports bar on the first night and the bar ran out of alcohol by half time meaning a walk to the main bar and back but other than this no issues (local brands as usual for all-inclusive). Good conference facilities upstairs with plenty of space.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Beverley L wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Nice, clean hotel complex. Just a few niggles....
Review_Text: Just returned from a week at belive collection. Very nice clean hotel with lovely gardens. Cleaning and maintenance staff obviously work very hard to maintain such high standards. Room was spacious and comfortable. Would have liked to have had tea/ coffee making facilities in our room but Maybe that's just me. Breakfast buffer opens at 7.00am anyway. Shower was a bit of an issue as water tended to spill out onto main floor area of bathroom so had to put towels down. Rooms cleaned every day and clean towels bathrobes and slippers provided. Pools nice. Lively one at one side with snack bar and various activities and quiet one at the other side with swim up bar.  Nice range of cocktails and outdoor entertainment every evening although this was a bit repetitive at times. Food was ok but nothing to tell you what it was so tended to play safe and stick to pasta and pizza more. Snack bar food nice and simple and morroccon restruaunt worth booking.  Enjoyable stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: travellingcockney wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Sat enjoying my last day in the sun and thought to write a review for our stay. I think one of the first things worth pointing out is that the hotel is practically brand new so there is still going to be a few teething issues. Having said that on a whole I‚Äôve had a lovely time the staff can be a little mixed drinks service could be slow but you could see every member of the bar team working their socks off to accommodate quite a fussy bunch (my partner and I made a few friends and all enjoyed a drink a touch stronger than they were used to making) but a couple of the waiters in the snack bar could be a touch aloof at times. All of the staff were always working extremely hard but as it got busier it was clear that there needed to be more of them.    The food was pretty good I think with all all inclusive hotels you need to learn to choose well and be a bit picky heard and seen a few complaints that food wasn‚Äôt hot enough but in fairness I‚Äôve never been to an all inclusive hotel where the food is absolutely piping but there is a couple of stations on the buffet where pasta dishes and meat and fish are being cooked to order at lunch and dinner. The snack bar food is pretty good for burgers/panninis/ pizzas etc but service can be slow. The desserts are a highlight every evening there was an amazing selection.    The evening entertainment was a little lacking but during the day the entertainment team worked their socks off to help people have a little more fun laughing and joking with guests and encouraging them to get involved with games and activities even offering to help run drinks over from the bar if you had a few for the group. Karim Simo and Titif you guys were great thank you so much.    All in all we had a great time the hotel is beautiful and absolutely spotless and you can see all of the staff work incredibly hard but with all new openings there‚Äôs going to be teething issues.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: Just spent a week in marrakech only day out we had was the quad biking & it was fantastic! had a wonderful time definitley recommend. The Animation team (Simo Karim & Titif) fantastic help & great fun. The pool snack bar was the best bit for food at lunch & buffet where you can opt for freshly cooked pasta in the evening which i tend to have. Rooms were lovely & cant fault the maids!! The staff are always cleaning! The barmen try there best but honestly dont think they have enough staff as it can be slow at times but if you get multiple drinks its less trips to the bar !! All round fantastic holiday with people i have met who will be friends for life.    Thanks for a lovely week Lauren x

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Oliver S wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Swim up room all the way to your bed!
Review_Text: Food:    Before arriving I had read a number of    After a week in various parts of Morroco staying in a combo of tents in the Sahara to stunning riads in the centre of the medina we decided we would indulge in a bit of a treat and stay in a luxury all inclusive five star hotel. Having not stayed in a all inclusive hotel before I was unsure what to expect. Myself and my partner had joked that it would be like a upmarket version of the Tv show Benidorm.... Safe to say we were not disappointed.    Food:    After reading positive reviews on the food. When arriving I was pleased to see there was a fairly wide choice of food however it was all clearly frozen bland and tasteless. For the cost it was pretty poor. In addition to that my partner spent the majority of our stay on the toilet.    Entertainment:    The entertainment was not something we had necessarily thought about when booking however on arrival we watched  in pool dancing and Evening ‚Äúwhite party‚Äù disco . It was unentertaining and felt like something from the TV series Benidorm.    Service:    Bar service was not to bad  staff quite friendly happy to help. Restaurant staff also fine. Reception disorganised and really unhelpful.    Room:    The room is nice however it could be anywhere has about as much charm as a damp rag. Clearly poorly designed as when my partner had a shower the bathroom and then the room instantly flooded. The water was flowing out at such a rate there was waves being created. When we reported it the response was poor. After calling three times eventually a cleaner was sent. He was overwhelmed by the biblical flood that  the shower had created. Sadly the flood also soaked a lot of our clothes and equipment !    The room was soaked and the stone floors presented a dangerous slip hazard. Despite this we were told we would have to stay in that room  and they might be able to do something in the morning.    In conclusion it is a bit of a farce to call this  hotel as five star. Zero character school dinner food and terrible service.Five star price 2 star quality!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Andrew D wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Hi just come back from this hotel .  Am not one who normally put reviews on here as i always try to be positive about everything  But sorry i would say this hotel doesn't really have any entertainment as such .  It was my 4 th visit to morroco so i knew what to expect but 2 guys every night singing the same songs does wear you down .  We did have the odd shows ie brazilafrica etc but again same 3 girls dancing to more or less the same act says it all when you see mist folk playing cards !!  The hotel it self is lovely very very clean and very helpful staff but you do get bored at night.  Food wise mmm again ive been quite a few different countrys and i would say 75% off the food is catering towards Moroccans and hardly any of the food is labeled.  As i said lovely hotel but plz sort out labels on food ( very easy to do)  And invest in decent acts at night not 2 guys and then a dj who plays the french version of the birdy song all night

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Mrshiggs wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We booked this resort taking a bit of a gamble as it hadn‚Äôt opened so there were no reviews. As we were travelling in August we‚Äôd hoped any teething problems would be resolved.  We were on honeymoon and the staff set up the room nicely for us we upon arrival having notified them of this. We had a swim up room although it must be noted it can‚Äôt be swam up it is a small channel outside a few rooms bit colder than other pools but very nice to have.  The food is good and there‚Äôs always a wide selection to choose from except breakfast is a bit stark in comparison. What I really missed was a kettle in the room as you could only get a cup of tea at the restaurant & bars often in a cardboard cup! The a la carte restaurant was a bit of a let down as you just get a choice of 2 set menus which is not a la carte.  We booked through on the beach and paid less than ¬£100 pp pn so I think it was good value as some all inclusives don‚Äôt have as much included. Room was bright well air conditioned and cleaned nicely everyday.  I‚Äôm not sure why but the staff at the snack bar just aren‚Äôt as good as the ones at the restaurant & pool bar and are a bit ignorant/rude.  Considering it‚Äôs almost brand new the hotel is showing signs of wear already. Our drawers were dodgy and throughout there is at times a drain smell. There was always enough loungers by the pool but the lovely sashes and umbrellas are already stained & ripped.  The website says the location has ‚Äòkept all its local essence‚Äô this means the hotel is in the middle of a building/dump site. Free shuttle to town though so use that to get out.  There was a healthy mix of older couples younger couples and mothers/daughters & friend groups. Nice entertainment every evening. Overall a good stay but some way off a 5 star resort

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: julietwheresromeo wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: We have just returned from a two week holiday 12th August-26th August and had the most relaxing amazing holiday at this resort.  We opted for an adult only holiday this year for the first time and it was the best decision ever  no screaming children or shouting parents it was absolute bliss.  The staff at this resort are absolutely wonderful and make this hotel what it is and the management should be proud of them all.  I want to mention some by name as they were amazing  the animation team Karin Titif & Simo who were just incredible ( Titif is a Lifeguard but should most definitely be in the animation team) amazing job these boys are doing.  Tariq in the a la carte restaurant was amazing & the restaurant & bar staff were excellent Oussama was the kindest most hardworking waiter I‚Äôve ever met & only wished I could bring him back to England to work in my hospitality business.  The hotel rooms are beautifully decorated and kept pristine clean by the housekeeping team.  The whole decor of the hotel is lovely and very inviting with a warm welcome daily.  The food offering was brilliant and lots of choice for everyone & the snack bar served a good variety of food & drink.  If I had to say anything negative it would be queuing for drinks was sometimes a problem with not enough staff for the volume of guests and the reception staff mainly one man in particular not very helpful but overall a 5 * from me for a most enjoyable holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Zineb G wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: My holidays at Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only are sadly over üòî I wish I could stay longer in this amazing place. I enjoyed being there. Everything starts from the reception you will notice that the staff is lovely from day 1. Thank you Adnane and the others (they were available 24hours a day).  The idea of offering one night at the Restaurant Ksar Asni is well-thought even though I would have preferred to eat it at lunch rather than dinner to value it more. The food of Chef Ilham is delicious and the waiter Tariq is to the small care. There are many activities; night shows make you feel the exotism of Marrakech. I enjoyed particularly the Arabian show and Moroccan night (for the Eid). Honestly the staff is lovely and doing its best. For the buffet what can I say?! I loved the variety proposed. We feasted on three meals the teams are doing everything to please you whether it is to cook you a colorful omelet in the morning or whether it is to grill some tender skewers they are trying to welcome you and to give you the best attention they can. The chief Adil is always checking if everything is okay. I attached some photos of the buffet to let you see by yourself.  The Lifeguards are doing very good job Titif went to the other pool in 41¬∞C to bring us deck chairs and umbrella because the pool was already packed when we arrived. Reda and Abdeljalil are doing tasty mojitos and pi√±a coladas.  Thanks to Leila as well that was making our room clean everyday.  The garden/pool/fountains are beautiful it makes you relax and the equipments are to the top despite the fact that it lacks irons in rooms (as in other 5 star hotels).    I also did not like that some customers were rude to some employees just because they wanted to criticize and they wanted more than it is already given but this has nothing to do with the hotel itself it is about the mindsets of people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: Went on holiday here for just 4 days with my boyfriend. Service and staff are amazing - especially the photographer guy and the men working behind the lobby bar in the evenings - they couldn‚Äôt do enough for you  the rooms are very clean and the bathrooms are lovely and spacious (no trouble with the shower as other people have noted).  The food is a bit repetitive but this is expected on an all inclusive holiday I had no problems with it and there are a massive range of cocktails to choose from at the swim up bar and lobby bar which do not cost extra.  No trouble getting a sun lounger even in August so there is no waking up early to bagsy one - perfect hotel for a relaxing and romantic holiday.    I would definitely recommend this hotel :)

Review_Text: Fantastic room exactly as in the photos. Food was fantastic loads of variety and all meat cooked to perfection. Drinks great. All staff friendly and welcoming. Only thing we found annoying is that it is so far away from anywhere so couldn‚Äôt really go for a walk or anything but the courtesy bus to Marrakech was great.  I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever stayed anywhere where the staff work so hard ALL DAY. Staff are constantly cleaning and waiting staff don‚Äôt stand still in the buffet restaurant always ready to clear your table and replenish your drinks. Oh and when you are there treat yourself to a trip to the Ozoud mountains. It‚Äôs a bit a trek (2/3 hours) but breathtakingly worth it.  Best holiday to date!!!!!!!!!!

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Amrik B wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Me and my partner went to this hotel 6th August 2018 till 11th August 2018 as we wanted a quick cheap get away with a lot of sun and that's exactly what we got. Great experience going to Marrakech ridiculously hot and the hotel was wonderful. I've read reviews about people being rude food being samey etc but as for us we didn't experience any rudeness and the food can be samey but that is lile every all inclusive hotel. I've read the snack bar being slow but they wasn't for us. 15 minutes burgers chips and pizzas were out and were delicious. The hotel do a really good thing in which if you stay more than 4 nights you get a free Al A Carte meal and that was gorgeous. The entertainment staff very friendly and keep you entertained so thank you Simo Titif Salim Karim Fati.  A huge thank you too both Azddine amd Ayoub who treated us like royalty. There service was exceptional and always had a smile on there faces.    The only thing I would say that could do improving is the air con in the room. I'm someone who likes arctic condition when it comes to air con but it was good enough. All in all a very pleasant stay and I would reccomend to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lizzie M wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: A hotel built on its people!
Review_Text: 5 stars given for the staff! It‚Äôs very rare that you meet such genuine friendly people in the service industry but this hotel shines through their employees- A special mention to ‚ÄòTiftif‚Äô who made us feel like family from the moment we arrived he brightened our day whenever we saw him! ‚ÄòOussama‚Äô who waited on us most nights in the restaurant was simple amazing at his job. Me and my partner work in hospitality and would of bought them both back to London if we could! The whole animation team were great fun and full of energy- loved to see they were able to dine with the hotel guests at lunch...    Great room always sparkly clean. Buffet food great- really fresh and lots of choice even as a veggie.    Al a carte restaurant TERRIBLE don‚Äôt bother going! Both food and service let the whole place down. Shut it please!    Cocktail‚Äôs weren‚Äôt great but wine and beer were fine for us- would of been nice to have the option to pay for higher quality spirts and better wine rather than have to stick with the ‚Äòall inclusive‚Äô offer.    Hotel not yet a 5* but go for the people- you can‚Äôt pay for that experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: ewhittingham2017 wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: This Hotel has only be opened a few months so was experiencing a few teething problems. However it was a beautiful hotel. the bedrooms were spacious the beds very comfortable storage was good and the bathrooms had two sinks and a great shower.  There were two pool areas a quite pool with swim up bar or the pool where music played a stretch class in the morning two classes of aqua gym and even a lesson on belly dancing. They also had a Yoga class held in the spa by a professional coach. All these were carried out by the amazing pool side staff with passion and fun.Plus they were very friendly and helpful.The entertainment in the evening was also good.  We arrived very late in the evening and we requested if we could chang our double room to a twin. The reception staff could not have more accomodating and when we asked the next morning if we change the room( one of the teething problems) again the staff were helpful and did not hesitate to make sure we liked the new room and we were happy. The two reception staff I dealt with were Maria Admane and Rachid who took our cases and made sure we were settled.  Our waitress in the dining room was Rajaa once served she always remembered our preferance on beverages and was so friendly pleasant and helpful. The buffet food on offer was very good with an excellent choice which we never tired of.  The couple of issues I had the Customer Services ManagerHafsa was very proffessional listened and noted my comments. They went the extra mile to ensure we enjoyed our stay. My daughter and I had a fabulous holiday because of the wonderful friendly staff. we would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Rojaho94 wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: Is a good hotel but could be great...
Review_Text: We have travelled widely and stayed in a number of all inclusive hotels abroad so feel well-placed to give an honest opinion.  Pros:  1. Cleanliness - the whole hotel is spotless and is constantly being maintained - around the pool the gardens the rooms etc.  2. The food is better than your standard all inclusive fare- in fact it is excellent. Plenty of choice cooking stations replenished regularly lots of fresh veg salad fish fruit meat choices etc. Love the little pastries!! The staff in the kitchen wear gloves too.  3. The staff- almost without exception the staff are helpful polite hard-working and they smile a lot (not easy when they are being over worked - see cons)  4. Two pools are large and never got crowded. Plenty of space for sun beds and lying in the pool  5. The entertainment is average and starts about 10pm- good fun.  6. The weather here cannot be faulted!!! Hot hot hot!  7. Large spacious room with well equipped bathroom and plenty of storage space. Everything is new and works as it should! No problems with the shower like previous reviewers.  8. Excellent WiFi all over hotel  Cons-  The Achilles heel for this hotel is the lack of staff who are manning the bars- most nights we have had to wait 45 mins for a drink while in the lobby bar and often had to wait more than 20 mins at the pool bar for a bottle of water during the day. In the evenings there is one poor waiter who is trying his best to serve all the hotel guests while one more is behind the bar making drinks. One reason the queue at the lobby bar is so long is that people are ordering two or three drinks per person at a time (including cocktails which take time to mix) as they know how long they will have to wait for a drink. Ridiculous! One simple solution would be to open the snack bar at night for drinks only and employ more staff (there are plenty in the restaurant where service is excellent).  Unfortunately this would stop us returning as we do not want to spend our holiday in a queue every night! And we are not big drinkers but enjoy a couple of post-dinner cocktails.  Basically the management are letting down their hard working staff in this one aspect. Please fix!  This is the main reason we are not giving this hotel 5 stars.

Simo Titif Karim and Ibrahim you all are doing a great job. You all work so hard to make everyone happy! We miss all of you and definitely we will come back! Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Anthony N wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Lovely and relaxing holiday in a beautiful hotel with very friendly staff
Review_Text: Myself and my fianc√© booked a 7 day holiday to Be Live Collection Marrakech and we were not disappointed. The hotel is adults only which as a teacher was a lovely reprieve from having children around however this did not put a dampener on the activities and everything that the hotel had to offer.  We arrived at around 10.30am well before the check-in time however the reception staff were so helpful and managed to get us in our room really quickly. They made sure to give us our wristbands so that we could access the food and drink straight away which was really helpful.  The facilities at the hotel are incredible. The pools are absolutely lovely and cater for every need. The quiet pool has a swim up bar which is a lovely touch and the other pool has activities throughout the day. The entertainment staff are incredible! They are so attentive and they get everyone involved. They did not stop from their start time until they finished. The lifeguard Titif was particularly lovely. He included myself and my fianc√© right from the moment we got there and made us feel so incredibly welcome.  The bedrooms are exquisite. They are spacious and roomy and they are so well kept and clean. The bathroom was so lovely it had a huge shower with a lovely shower head that my 6 foot 5 fianc√© could easily stand under properly. The only thing I would suggest is to bring your own hairdryer as the one in the bathroom is not very powerful and you have to hold the button down which is quite laborious when you have long hair.  The restaurant staff were incredible! I can honestly say that I have never seen people work as hard as they did. If they were not setting the tables up they were clearing them getting drinks refilling wine etc. They are an absolute asset to the hotel and each and every one of the staff were friendly and helpful.  The restaurant itself was lovely. The food was so fresh and delicious and there was a good variety of different foods to cater for every taste bud. The desserts were a particular favourite for me as I do not eat chocolate and there were so many options for me that I do not get in every restaurant.  The Moroccan wine was lovely - I had the rose and thoroughly enjoyed it - it was sweet and smooth.  Overall I cannot speak more highly of the hotel and the staff - they could not have been more attentive and honestly could not have worked harder than they did.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nicholas K wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Need a drink (this is a live post)
Review_Text: Sat outside desperately waiting for a drink queue out the door at the bar not enough waiters not enough bar staff. This is a common theme daily at the hotel whether this is the pool bar or the lobby bar in the evening One bar staff isnt enough for the size of the hotel and amount of guests. Its a very common complaint amongst most guest. Please sort it before my holiday ends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: isimace98 wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Very enjoyable resort, unfair remarks in previously written reviews...
Review_Text: My partner and I arrived at the hotel around 4 before usual check in time however the staff were very friendly and helpful throughout the procedure whilst being efficient with preparing our room. Good start. From this we experienced very welcoming hospitality from all staff members throughout the hotel during the whole week we were there. Every enquiry and question we had was dealt with effectively from the people on reception. In addition to this the daytime entertainers were brilliant. I would especially like to thank ‚ÄòSimo‚Äô (in pink top) and ‚ÄòTitif‚Äô (red top) for their wonderful effort for making our holiday so enjoyable. They regularly checked on us and made good convocation. Their English was very good considering it was their third language the activities they provided were all for good causes and enjoyable as everyone who participated seemed very happy in doing so. Both swimming pools were cleaned daily and perfect temperature for hot weather. Only advisory comment i would make on this is that the quiet pool with the swim up bar may be better set at the entertainment pool however this is a very minor criticism. In terms of food and service it was noticeable that during the day from the snack bar the shot of alcohol into cocktails varied drastically in amount however this I think this was due to maintaining control of people‚Äôs condition during the day as evening cocktail were noticeabley stronger. In contrast I believe the curfew for alcohol should be later than 12 however it is understandle and respected due to religious and cultural differences. Quality of the food was very good and tasted great however variation of food was limited. Other than this the food drinks and service delivered as expected.  All in all I think for a hotel which is only 4-5months old and developing its target audience and clientele it deserves much more credit than what I read prior to our trip. This hotel will go on to great things the way it is going and for its very reasonable price would recommend it to anyone I know. Would also revisit myself. Thank you ever so much for the hospitality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Martin L wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Management Sirs You let your staff Down
Review_Text: I wish to clarify that back home I am a General Manager and am often told that my staff let myself and the Company down. Retrain and hopefully improve. However the opposite is true with this Hotel.    This is our 3rd day of 7 in the Hotel. The Staff are amazing. The Dining Room Staff create and serve an excellent combination of different Meals and desserts all to a high standard.  The Bar staff always with a smile and friendliness serve a large number of delicious Cocktails.  The Animation team are so much fun in 2 days I have tried both Yoga and Archery for the 1st time. Friendly and always with a smile on their faces.  Again the Room Service and Reception always friendly and doing an excellent job.    Now all these things are extras and great. But the basic function of any Hotel is a Room to be fit for function. The room we were allocated was Room 2016 the Room itself spacious and beautiful. I have attached photo to see. However on the first night the room was like a Sauna. I had seen in 2 previous reviews people with issues with air conditioning not working. I went to Reception as always friendly and sent maintenance to our Room at 10.30pm. He vould not get working and would take time for him to get into ceiling to try fix we agreed he would return the next day and repair and I slept badly in a warm room. The next day true to his word he got working. These issues can occur but they seem to be an ongoing issue at this Hotel.  That evening I had a shower while having I noticed the Bathroom had become flooded. The water does not go down the drain again I have seen this in numerous complaints on Tripadvisor from other past Hotel guests. This is a complete Health and Safety violation that any Hotel guest should have to worry about slipping on a flooded Bathroom Floor while leaving Shower. These Rooms should not be in use until this problem is solved. But I am guessing Management sirs are trying to maximise number of guests for extra profits. Shame on you Sirs. Customer safety should always be priority and these Rooms taken out of use till problem fixed. We were moved by Reception as they obviously could not fix the issue in this Room. Our new Room is the same quality and beautiful with working air con and Non flooding Shower.    But Management Should take a lead on this occassion. Their Staff put their Hotel Guests first can never do enough and are 5 star in everyway. The Hotel itself is beautiful and in general perfect. But the management who allow these issues which are obvious on Tripadvisor reviews for months now and continue to allow these Rooms be in used with disregard for Guests you truly do let your Staff down having to continuously deal with Guests for these problems reoccurring.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: baz1969 wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Recent back from a fabulous 11 night stay at this hotel. The staff were absolutely fantastic and friendly the rooms were amazing and the hotel was spotlessly clean.    The food was good always a variety and freshly cooked. There was a queue sometimes at the lobby bar but not much of a wait usually due to someone ordering multiple cocktails. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: sharnna92 wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: From the moment we checked in the hotel was incredible as soon as you walk through the door there is the warmest welcome as the staff take your bags and begin your check in. Reception team are friendly helpful and extremely informative.    The rooms are absolutely fabulous modern and spotless cleaned to an extremely high standard each day by the wonderful housekeeping team. The beds are very comfy and big. The only thing I would advise is if you have thick hair bring your own hairdryer it can take a while using the one provided.    There is a wide range of food available at all times of the day lots of Moroccan food and also other choices of pizza etc if you‚Äôre a little fussy (like me). The snack bar also has a good menu great food and service with a smile. The bar is open until midnight I believe so stock up on drinks before this time.    The pool grounds and facilities are beautiful and constantly being looked after by numerous members of the team who always give you a smile as you pass. There has been some serious thought that has gone into every detail of this hotel and it really does add the wow factor.    The main thing about this hotel is that staff though each and every single one is a credit to your team. I have never been made to feel more welcome and more at home than I did here. Thank you to your entertainment team especially Simo and Titif! The other guys too I‚Äôm sorry I can‚Äôt remember all the names but were all great. Thank you to all the restaurant bar reception housekeeping staff and everyone behind the scenes I cannot explain how wonderful everyone is!    Please everyone ignore the negative reviews about this hotel I have worked in a hotel for a number of years now and can tell you 100% this is worthy of its 5 stars. I cannot wait to come back again - the management team should be super proud of everything they and their staff are achieving daily!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends
