He is a young and professional ober that made our vacation even more pleasant!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Niamh J wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Please ignore any bad reviews on this hotel. We have just returned last night from a holiday we will always remember. We travel 5 times a year and have never experienced a holiday as good as the past two weeks have been. From the minute we arrived everything was 100% perfect. The reception staff were very accomadating on arrival. The rooms are beautiful and absolutely spotless. They are cleaned every day to perfection. The grounds of the hotel are spectacular and even more beautiful at night. The restaurant was very good. Always something different to eat and it was nice to try different morroco foods. The staff were fantastic. They were always smiling and very happy to assist you. The snack bar is also available for lovely food and the staff there are great fun and always serve with a smile. There are two pools which are both beautiful. We preferred the pool.with activities. We would go to the quiet pool for a drink in the evening and relax in the water sitting at the bar. I don't know where to start with the animation team. They were just amazing. There was aqua aerobics Stretch archery darts water polo dance belly dancing Arabic lessons yoga football and other fun games daily. There was a mojito party and the team entertained us with a show which i thoroughly enjoyed. They were like a family that worked so well together managed by a brilliant manager who also organised the night entertainment. Titif is one of the lifeguards whom I think should be part if the animation team. He has great English and a great entertainer. The other two lifeguards were also gentlemen. I learned Archery for the first time and Karim who is a star was a brilliant teacher. The bar staff at both bars were fantastic. They waited on you hand on foot when it wasn't too busy. Mohamed was great in the bar. Nothing bothered him and was always smiling even under pressure. The entertainment was brilliant. There was something different every night and we really enjoyed them all. We have been to Marrakech 5 times and this has been the best. We will never forget the amazing experience you have us and hope to return in October. So please ignore any bad reviews as I could not say one bad comment on out two week stay. Every member of staff is very professional and management asked occasionally if things were ok. Thanks again to Be live collection for a fantastic holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jack_Hardy123 wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: A good hotel in need of refinement
Review_Text: My girlfriend and I have just returned from seven nights at Be Live Collection where we stayed in a superior room with a pool view.    On the whole our trip was lovely and we enjoyed the hotel a great deal but there were some undeniable problems which makes it hard to give it a glowing appraisal.    Positives first. The room was brilliant. Spacious clean and with a comfortable bed. The pools were both nice with an ample supply of sun-loungers including - mercifully for my girlfriend who burns easily - several with drapes around the frame. One pool has very loud music pumping virtually all day so if you are after a quiet holiday it is worth bearing this in mind as Be Live attracts quite a young crowd. Music did not play at the other pool.    Food was consistently good at the buffet with a wide range of choice. My girlfriend is a vegetarian and never struggled to fill a plate. Tagine dishes unsurprisingly were the nicest.    The drinks on the whole were good. Admittedly there was a limited selection of wines and beers but I found both the house versions to be perfectly adequate. The cocktails however were not very nice and below the quality of pretty much everything else the hotel offered. Cheap mixers made them taste sugary and a bit unpleasant - the mojitos perhaps being the one exception. This needs more investment as it is a painfully obvious shortcoming.    The location was good close enough to both the city centre and the airport. Free shuttle buses can take you into the heart of Marrakech from reception. It is undeniably remote though so walking anywhere is neither advisable nor particularly scenic as you‚Äôre effectively in a barren field.    Activities were also very impressive. Everything ranging from archery to yoga was offered led by the always-energetic animation team. A gym was available to use for free.    Our room was opposite a slightly perplexing venue known as the ‚Äúsports bar‚Äù. I say perplexing because it sits locked until 10pm every evening which always seemed ludicrously late considering the lobby bar quickly fills up as guests look for a pre-dinner drink. Many can be seen standing while others dragged over chairs from elsewhere. The sports bar only swings open its doors when most are ready to go to bed which seems a big waste as we would have visited more often otherwise.    Our main issues centred on the staff. Or more specifically about half of them.    Firstly it is important to say that the waiters and bartenders in the lobby bar and in the buffet restaurant were exceptional - among the best I‚Äôve had the pleasure to be served by. Mohammad really stood out in the bar working quickly and skillfully while managing somehow to remember my drinks order every time. There was a rhythm and organisation to both venues that made them work effectively coupled with the staff‚Äôs unwavering courtesy.    However the gulf in quality between those two places and other areas was big. The snack bar staff were consistently bad. Surly in manner and slow in delivery. It took a ridiculous amount of time to get served a drink sometimes despite employees often loitering at the end of the bar. I could sense they had their own responsibilities but they needed to be willing to jump in when they were not busy and there was a growing queue. The one person serving would often bustle off for five minutes and then return without any apology or explanation. We liked the food served there but it was often so torturous trying to get the waiter‚Äôs attention to order (and then for the food/drink to arrive) that we stopped bothering. The efficiency and organisation of the lobby bar/restaurant really needs to be imposed on the outside snack bar.    Similarly reception staff proved tricky to deal with at times. We were told when we arrived that there was no record of our new booking (we changed the dates within about an hour of first reserving our room online). To be fair we were given wristbands and let into the room but the rigmarole that followed was needless. We were made to feel like it was our fault this had happened and our responsibility to get the third-party booking platform to provide confirmation. It was not particularly as we‚Äôd provided them with printed confirmation documents. Guess what? It turned out the hotel had lost the updated booking dates. Our booking agent confirmed it had been sent to them the first time. Did they apologise? No.    It also took needless effort to get the hot water in our shower fixed as it was cold at first. Not just hours - days. It was eventually sorted but this is a basic requirement and shouldn‚Äôt need us to repeatedly visit the front desk to pester them about fixing it. Our key cards also stopped working for reasons that were never clear (we weren't keeping it near our phones as they kept suggesting) and again we were not offered apologies for the inconvenience it caused us traipsing back and forth.    These might be minor enough issues but the reception staff are your first point of contact in the hotel. It left us feeling a bit unnerved and uncomfortable which is not the dream start to your holiday.    Overall however this was good value for money. It is a very nice hotel with great grounds and facilities. We had a fantastic trip. These problems - which I see have been raised already - can and should be addressed to bring the hotel up to the standard it deserves. They weren‚Äôt just one-off dealings but a consistent attitude we encountered. A re-evaluation is needed to make this place top notch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Hannah wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Arrived for the start of our week at be live collection myself and my partner are not difficult people and are always very polite and respectful. The black guy with glasses (did not catch his name) on reception was the very first person we came into contact with. He was very abrupt unwelcoming and quite frankly very rude to us for no reason at all. We couldn't for the life of us understand what was his problem. We were told to wait 10 minutes for our room which was absolutely fine no issues in waiting but when we came back we were told "I asked you to wait 10 minutes you have another 3 to wait" ? We shrugged it off as a bad sense of humour but were slightly appalled at his treatment towards us. We were shown to our room by a great bell boy stopping to show us a few things on route we tipped him for going the extra miles for us. The maid had done a wonderful job at tidying the room the whole stay which we also tipped to show our appreciation. The room was very spacious great queen bed lovely bath robes provided and powerful shower but yes quite leaky. Resturaunt staff were smooth and efficient and Special thanks to Yassin in the lobby bar what a charming man fantastic fluent English held a good conversation and very nice man to talk to. May I suggest a promotion to reception for him. Pool bars were naff. Quite difficult to get even remotely tipsy in the end we gave up and stuck to mint tea water and fresh orange juice that was avaliable at breakfast only. Snack bar forgot our food order after we sat patiently for a good hour waiting one lunch time. Food was luke warm pretty bog standard but liked the modern decor and service was good. Swim up room was the highlight of the holiday and the lively band that played on the Saturday at the pool party and the belly dancers were very good. Big deposit for towels and made to pay local taxes but didn't bother us too much. I recommend popping into the shop on site to pick up some natural skin products and spices. Be live has a far way to come but it will get there with a little more willingness of going the extra mile.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: MDigby wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Came out to the Be Live Collection for one week for my birthday. We was a bit sceptical after seeing some of the reviews but thought we will make of it what we think. The good. The food is amazing the buffet food was top notch and the desserts were amazing. The drinks were weaker than I would've liked but just had to ask for it stronger and they would. The room we had was a swim up room and that was the highlight of the hotel. Was like having our own little villa in the hotel the room was big and immaculate and the maids always cleaned it to perfection. Lovely big shower and bath and balcony. Was peaceful compared to sitting round by the looks would recommend having a swim up room.  Yassine at the lobby Bar was fantastic spoke perfect English and was the most polite person that worked at the resort. Very attentive and made excellent drinks. Made my partner feel very welcome and I agree. The gardens were beautiful and well kept and the whole hotel in general was very clean! defiantly a 5 star in that respect.  On arrival to the hotel the reception staff shouldn't be on reception rudest people I've come across working at a hotel. A certain black receptionist with glasses was very rude to me. be warned they'll charge you a deposit of ¬£100 for your pool towels and the sneaky part of it is. they only give you one pool card. So when I got to the room realising this and returned to the lobby he laughed at me and said 'ha you've lost it already' assuring him I couldn't have I've just walked from the lobby to my room. he gave me another one and muttered 'this is yours try not losing this one'. One several occasions at the restaurant it would take ages to get served for a drink and given cutlery we was sitting for about 20 minutes and asked 4 people for drinks and cutlery and wasn't seen to to which I then stood up walked over to a member of staff and demanded to be seen to was extremely angry with this and this happened a few times as the staff were more interested and attentive to the French guests and not the English. This has been seen very much throughout our stay.  We booked a night to go to the hotel a la carte restaurant. my advice don't go there. it's not all that. When making the booking my wife was given a slip of paper for the booking we went to the restaurant and they asked for the slip I knew it was in the room but went to the reception as the room was on the other side of the hotel to ask for another slip. Maria the receptionist then said to me 'i can't print out another slip you get one if you lose it you can't go'. I laughed and said it's in the room on the otherwise of the hotel can't you just print another for me. no was the answer so I went to the room got the slip and we was seated. but as said. We preferred the buffet.  The entertainment of an evening is poor. It starts around 10 / 1030 and by that point you can't get a seat and you've eaten your dinner ages before that so you are sitting around waiting for something to happen and when it does. it's the same dreary music every night. We go to bed straight after eating as there is no point staying up for it.  We didn't go into Marrakech but did do some excursions. 4 of which only 1 lived up to expectations. This is not the hotels fault granted but the rep at the hotel provided us with the trips and we was very disappointed. Don't do the quads or the horse riding. We did the Hamman twice as the first time was pure bliss but the second time was such a let down it ruined the first experience for us. It was called Lotus Priviledge. I also wrote a review on there page too.  All in all I would not go back here again. 5 stars it is not. Only good things the food and the room. Very upset and disappointing week away.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Its serves only 2 set menus which is ok it you are not fussy. Both restaurants are very poor when it comes to allergy advice. Half the time in the buffet there were no cards to tell you what the food was either. The swim up bar was great hafid was the bar tender there for the time we were there. He was very friendly and chatty. A font of knowledge and very informative. All in all a great time was had. Would go back to Morocco but probably visit Casablanca next time.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: 2Scotsontour wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: The amazing staff make this beautiful hotel a holiday to remember! We'll be back next year!
Review_Text: As our first holiday together as a young couple we have created memories that will last a lifetime and this is largely due to the fantastic staff!    We stayed in a "Swim up" pool room which was spotlessly cleaned by the cleaners each day who were always so cheery and respectful if we needed a little five minutes longer to get out the room for them. We were made to feel super safe with the lovely security guards who kept watch over the rooms and the whole hotel is guarded with a wall with secure gates and some more lovely security guards at the entrance.    I would like to point out one waiter who I am sorry to say we never got his name but one night after staying at the Sahara dessert my boyfriend had a ticky tummy. The waiter kindly made him up a special Moroccan cumin powder and gave us a few large bottles of water to take back to the room. After consuming this my boyfriend woke up the next day feeling back to his usual self! So if the waiter gets to read this please accept our thanks once again; it was so kind of you.    As a vegetarian I was also extremely well catered for by the chefs and one even remembered each night and was keeping stuff separate and recommending dishes to me! For non-vegetarians the food was also fantastic. You had so much choice from sushi to Italian to Morroccan... you name it! So if you're a "fussy eater" there's no need to worry! You'll also find yummy pizzas paninis etc at the pool bar for during the day.    The manager and a gentleman who I believe to be the owner of the hotel were also wonderful. You could tell that they would have sorted any concerns immediately if you had any.    Our overall thanks however must go to three staff of whom we now consider our Morroccan friends and have kept in touch with and who are more than welcome to visit us in Scotland! Rida Mohammed and Titif we owe all our happy memories to you three. You are an absolute CREDIT to the hotel and we had such great laughs with you and you looked after us so well and we thank you SO much. Thank you also for accepting us at your time of Ramadan and for teaching us some Arabic which the other staff were impressed with (perhaps not at Gareth's pronounciations!) They were so attentive kind and as a young woman made me feel very safe in Morocco. Half the time we spent at the pool we'd be laughing and joking with them. We would go back to this hotel simply for the staff who were truly wonderful.    My boyfriend also booked me a surprise spa which was wonderful. I had all the treatments available and I would recommend it as it's really reasonably priced. Again the staff there were just so lovely! I even had a whole pool to myself during the treatments and a lovely Morroccan tea!    My boyfriend participated in the archery which he loved trying out we played basketball and there's tennis pool activities football crazy games board games etc so you'll never get bored! Towels are also available with a deposit. There's also a sport's bar which opens until 2am. All the activities occur in the "louder" pool (still chilled enough to lounge around at with some nice music) and then there's an amazing quiet pool with a pool bar in the water. Please be respectful in that pool which is all about chilling out. There's evening entertainment upstairs every night if that's your thing and there's also some in the trendy bar downstairs.    Please remember that Morocco is a Muslim country and it is therefore disrespectful to be very loud and drunk. This is not a hotel for people who like to get super drunk and get loud. This is an elegant sophisticated hotel and of course it's fine to have a nice modest time and cocktails (which are fantastic by the way) but being outrageously drunk is a sign of disrespect. It is illegal in Morocco to serve alcohol after 12. So if you're looking for a party holiday book Ibiza! Please also be aware that this is a five star hotel so don't go walking through reception or sit at lunch in your bikini/tops off/swimming trunks- you'll be turned away (pool bar is fine for swimwear of course)!    The hotel offers a shuttle bus into the Medina for free at scheduled times throughout the day and will collect you free of charge too! You'll find out this information at reception and you'll also be able to book other excursions like we did such as the Sahara dessert camping experience Atlas mountains and beach Essaouira.    The only recommendations (not criticisms by the way) are as follows:  1. A few more labels on the foods would be helpful (although there is some)  2. The actual shower block is higher than the floor level so the water can get on to the floor.  3. An ironing board and kettle would be nice extras to the room (but we did actually ask for an iron and we were given it).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Andrew M wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: me and my girlfriend stayed here from the 16th till the 30th the hotel is spotless cleners are everywhere the rooms are lovely massive comfy bed we had 1002 which was a swim up room which was well worth the money but didn't get the sun till about 1 as its set back near the buffet restaurant the only 2 things we had a problem with is the food is repetitive but always had fresh fruit and mixed veg and no 2 is wasps at the snack bar and lots of them going for the drinks dispenser apart from that we can't fault the place couldn't do enough for you we had a massage from the spa which was nice it was 50mins for 1400dh which in English is about ¬£120 which is a little over priced to be honest but wanted to see what it was like apart from that amazing holiday can't fault any staff as where perfect to us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: 674victoriab77 wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Small beautiful hotel, just a few minor issues....
Review_Text: Good points....  ‚Ä¢ Fantastically clean  ‚Ä¢ Lots of sun beds all day  ‚Ä¢ Staff very friendly & helpful  ‚Ä¢ Safe & secure grounds  ‚Ä¢ Free shuttle bus  ‚Ä¢ Beautiful bedroom swim up pool was lovely.  ‚Ä¢ Bed & pillows very comfortable  ‚Ä¢ Beautiful gardens  ‚Ä¢ A la carte restaurant was very nice & service fantastic    Bad points......  ‚Ä¢ Food repetitive! Ok for the first couple of days but not enough choice towards the end of our 7 day stay.  ‚Ä¢ Very little alcohol in the cocktails  ‚Ä¢ Only 1 restaurant other than the buffet & not easy to get a booking  ‚Ä¢ No choice of wine (house red white or rose) by the glass  ‚Ä¢ Reception very busy most of the time lots of queues.  ‚Ä¢ No shade in the afternoon for swim up rooms too hot to sit out there.  ‚Ä¢ Loud disco goes on outside until 00:00 most nights!! Bring ear plugs if you want an early night.    Overall we had a lovely stay it was our first adults only hotel we‚Äôve visited & it was lovely & peaceful. We found all the staff friendly & helpful. Unfortunately the food did let it down a bit same food brought out night after night. Snack bar at lunch time made a nice change.  Due to the value for money this hotel offers it attracts a much younger crowd. Therefore at times we did feel we were on an club 18-30‚Äôs holiday! The quite pool offers a bit of sanctuary most of time.  We didn‚Äôt use the spa so I can‚Äôt comment on how that was. The shower is not a problem if you simply position it away from the shower entrance!!  They opened up the sports bar especially for the football games which pleases the boys.  We were pleased with the value for money & would come back to this hotel if they improved the food choices.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: SAM wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Where to start. Just got back from Be Live Collection and I cannot praise this hotel enough. Just like other reviews the staff were absolute 5star.... It was my birthday whilst I was there and the staff were absolutely brilliant with me making me a delicious cake and making me feel special... ( Mohamed at reception Mr Adil Manager Hafsa Mourad and Abdesalim and all the other restaurant staff including the chefs) the master minds for my birthday couldn‚Äôt thank them enough.... Absolutely amazing how Mourad and Abdesalim (night restaurant staff) and Laila In the breakfast and lunch restaurant remember exactly what we like to drink even without mentioning it. Special shoutout to Samir the housekeeper assigned to our area kept our room immaculate. And the girls at the photograph area absolute amazing always took time to chat to us. Also the security guy Amiine was lovely chatting to us. Manager Hafsa is an absolute Asset to this hotel couldn‚Äôt do enough for us. Can‚Äôt praise them all enough Be live is absolutely amazing. And please don‚Äôt be mindful of the negative reviews. I can‚Äôt wait to be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: MasonBristol wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Just returned from a fantastic week stay here the earlier reviews issues must have been resolved as we had a fantastic time with no issue the staff were superb we spent half of our time at one pool then the other half at the other. Breakfast lunch and dinner had plenty of choice. But the staff are the ones that make this place the rooms were superb. The sports bar was a great touch. One of the 2 people I have to mention is the photographer guy I think he needs to be head of guest relations and just continue doing what he does (not the photography part) speak with people having a life and just being a generally good person. The second is abdessamad in the restaurant always smiling and keeping us well stocked with drinks. Can‚Äôt see how people can make fault of this now we will be returning thanks from Paul and Michele Mason (room3101)

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: GlenAshley wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We have just returned from a one week stay at the Be live hotel in Marrakesh (the adults only resort) I would like to start by saying that the bad reviews really should be ignored as we had a really great time!! The hotel is lovely there‚Äôs seems to be a mix of mainly French and English guests. I didn‚Äôt see or experience any favouritism as I had read in other reviews. The facilities and food are really great (especially the deserts). The only thing I would mention is that the slow draining shower is a bit of a pain as it does start to over flow after a while. Most of the staff at the hotel are really great and can‚Äôt do enough for you. We have visited North African countries before and have never received such good service. They honestly can‚Äôt do enough! Oussama our waiter at dinner was absolutely excellent. He remembered our drink orders and where we liked to sit. He made us feel so welcome and always had a smile on his face and should be commended for his high level of service. Abdellah and the other gentlemen on the front desk were extremely helpful and courteous. Also Tarik in the Moroccan restaurant was great. We did find some of the female staff on the reception desk quite rude and really not helpful I‚Äôm not sure if this was down to the language barrier but we were left feeling quite awkward and embarrassed by the way we were spoken to. However this is the only minor complaint as we really loved our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: lucyrichardson1 wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: The hotel is amazing it is clean the food is really nice Karim from the animation team is amazing and so friendly! The rest of the staff especially in the restaurant and animation team (Karim Fati and Salim) are so friendly as well! There is a free shuttle bus from the hotel to the main town which is also really helpful and the tour guide Abdul was so helpful and friendly!    Would definately recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Kayleigh P wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Lovely hotel.. but lots of cons!
Review_Text: We have just returned from 5nights at this hotel. The hotel grounds and rooms are absolutely lovely. We paid to upgrade to a swim up room before travelling and unfortunately were left extremely disappointed. When we arrived the pool was green and stunk like pond water!! Despite asking several members of staff we weren‚Äôt allowed to change rooms. Eventually on our last full day the water was changed completely in the pool and it was lovely.. however this meant we only got to use our upgraded room for a day!    The staff were all friendly apart from a couple who just didn‚Äôt seem to want to be there there or help.    On our last day we were due to checkout at normal time but had to pay 1200 Dirhams to keep our room as our flight home wasn‚Äôt until late that night. If we hadn‚Äôt paid we would of been left with no food or drink for over 10 hours...    Overall the rest of the stay was pleasant but these two things really let the hotel down.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Thehappygoluckys wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Just returned from a very relaxing holiday with extended family ranging from 18yrs to 75yrs.  I was not aware before travelling that other reviewers assumed this hotel was 5 star if I could give it a rating I would say 3-4 star with luxury touches and my reasons for this being is I see a 5 star hotel as a place where room service is standard long trousers if not black tie for dinner and al a cart menu is the norm this hotel is an All inclusive all you can eat and drink buffet type wear what you like for dining so consider that before you assume a 5 star service!! None of this affected our thoughts on the overall experience as I say because I have different expectations of what I consider 5 star to be and how much it generally costs in a major city around the world.    pros -    most staff extremely welcoming and willing to go that extra mile to make you time at this hotel more memorable these people were Hasfa (customer relations)KarimAmine Fati Salim (animation) and our waiter most evenings Mourad the service provided by the bar manager was also exceptional as was the other main restaurant waiters and waitresses unable to name mention them all.    Most comfortable Bed and pillows ever experienced away from home.    No problem finding a sun lounger or even a cabana (if your lucky) at any time of day at the quiet or activity pool    Delicious desserts    Gardens - the pools and restaurant are surrounded by the most beautiful landscapes gardens and the gardeners take pride in the enjoyment they give.    Cons-    If you do your research you will find that the hotel is a courtesy bus ride out of the main hub or the Mediana it takes approximately 25 or so minutes but other than that or trips to be booked if you go with a travel company there is absolutely nothing else to see or go to around the hotel this is by no way a criticism of what the hotel has to offer but should be considered if you suffer from cabin fever!!.    Additional info -    Hairdryers slippers a fridge with water and a free safe deposit box are provided.    There is a small gift shop selling essentials like suncream a few toiletries crisps and sweets alongside reasonably priced gifts if a trip out is not up your street however as we found out in the departure lounge At Marrakesh airport there is a traditional craft shop selling most of the items to be bought in the souks at labelled and you can pay in either Diahram or euros also a small leather shop selling bags purses shoes etc.    The patio door in your room opens at both ends something we only discovered after a week of our stay as part of our party were at the very far end of the hotel on the ground floor this was quite concerning as we found that one of them had been unlocked he whole time.    There is a cash point machine in the reception area however if you wanted to change money at reception we found that you need to do This first thing on the morning as some days they were unable me to change even small amounts by lunchtime.    If you consider the souks to be too much for you consider a visit to the artisan ensemble which is the other side of the gardens surrounding the mosque where the curtesy bus drops and picks you up here you will find all the crafts to be found in the souks like the basket maker Weaver leather goods jewellery etc all situated in a cool courtyard environment with a cafe in the middle no hustle or bustle and the prices quoted are the prices you will have to pay there is no bartarring here but we found the prices to be less that we had paid during our first visit to the madina earlier in the day.    I cannot express how much a visit to jardine Marjolle is a must in the Geliz area slightly north west of the Madina the gardens in Rue Yves Saint Lerant are beautiful we were there for about an hour and it was a lovely break from the mid afternoon heat in the canopy of the amazing garden and colours of the pots and museum this area also hosts some lovely boutiques selling tasteful traditional Moroccan goods at a more premium price however if you like a home from home it‚Äôs also where you will find shops like monsoon Zara H and m etc if your after a change of scenery than pool drink cake sleep and repeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Christon P wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: the overall place is very chic newcalmrelaxprivateadult only which is new concept in Marrakech --Bravo Be Live management Morocco    The service - unprofessional reception team- very panic all time  Customer service - need longe time to answer you  Restaurant - Staff not smilling at all - specialy pool bar and service is very slow  Rooms- to much dust inside room if you call houskeppling for any help need at least 1 hour to come if you dont keep your expensive things inside thye safe box definitly you will not find it    Be live Hotels create a good concept in Marrakech  you need to have professional team to drive the Hotel as 5 star atmosphere
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Bradley S wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Spent 5 nights here at BeLive Collection luckily we booked the Adults only!    Positives:  Really nice hotel very clean and modern.  Restaurant and bar was great. - steak and lamb was so tasty!  Pool areas 5* - no fighting over sunbeds one pool had music the other was quiet.  Pool bar was amazing and the barman here was very good!  Room was clean nicely furnished huge bed.  Spa was nice offered discount for an hours massage.  Gym was good for a quick work out.  Weather - 30 degrees+ everyday not a cloud in the sky (end of May)  shuttle into town worked fine and is free.    Negatives:  Front desk staff not that helpful could have been a bit more friendly. However they did let us leave bags for 3hrs after midday checkout and let us eat and drink until transfer arrived. We used the pool shower and changed in the toilets near reception as had no use of a room.    Snack bar staff pretty lazy - doing the minimum etc.  Slow service in the Moroccan restaurant seemed slightly under staffed.    All in all very good! - just a few things to work on...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Libertybrooke19 wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We went for three nights.  The weather was beautiful but the hotel was pretty basic.  Room was ok....shower flooded everytime you used it.  Mini bar was completely empty.If you wanted anything in it then you had to pay a ridiculous price.  Food was okay but not a lot of choice.  Drinks were not branded spirits.  We had a late flightbeing picked up at 6pm. Check out was at 12pm. They charged us ¬£60 to keep our room on for three hours and then at 3pm promptly cut our all inclusive wristband off so we couldnt get a drink for three hours. They also do not provide a shower room or any facilities if you have given up your room and need a shower before you leave.  For a three night cheap break it was okay but do not expevt 5 star because you will be very disappointed.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Veness_family wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: I have just returned from a very short 2 night last minute break away as a surprise trip for my husbands birthday.    I paid ¬£360 for 2 nights swim up room. (I paid a premium as I booked the night before arrival).    We took early flight from lgw (‚Ä™6.20am‚Ä¨) so arrived in Marrakech ‚Ä™at 9am‚Ä¨ local time. The queue through immigration took an hour! Tip: go to Marrakech airport website and you can pay to bypass all this vip fast track. unfortunately we needed at least 24hrs to book so was too late but in future wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to book.    We got a taxi from airport which took aprox 25-30mins (about ¬£11-¬£12).    When we went to reception desk to check in they told us our room wasn‚Äôt ready (‚Ä™11am‚Ä¨) and to come back ‚Ä™1.30pm‚Ä¨. They did however put our bags to the side and gave us wrist bands so we could get food and drinks. I informed the lady on the desk it was my husbands birthday that day and she just smiled blankly. I thought that was a little disappointing as previously 5* hotels would normally be interested to know that so they can put a card in the room or some choc on the bed or decorate a dinner table or something but oddly nothing! They also took an unexpected 1000dirums (approx ¬£83) as a deposit for towels and robes refundable when you check out.    Anyways we thought we‚Äôd make the most of the time and headed straight to the spa. Staff were really friendly and helpful. We booked 4 hours of treatments each. (2 hours over 2 days pp). The spa wasn‚Äôt cheap ..that cost about ¬£320. However the treatments were lovely. Staff were very pleasant. Spa needs some TLC considering hotel is only 4 months old but none the less we enjoyed it.    Walking around the grounds/pools etc it seemed smaller than anticipated. Very calm and quiet.    When we got to our room it was very clean and well furnished. They had nice little touches like a plate with a few little morrocan sweets the usual toiletries a razor toothbrush slippers robe. All looked promising. The robe was a little worn. My main concern however was the sewage smell coming from the bathroom. I‚Äôm not one to normally complain but I didn‚Äôt want to smell that for our entire stay.    Reception sent a maintenance guy who came and did get rid of the smell. Well until you flushed the toilet and then smell came straight back. Or if you turned the shower on.    We spoke to reception again and then got free shuttle bus to souks. Bus was supposed to collect us and 10 others at 11pm to return back to hotel however did not turn up! We tried calling but no one was getting back to us. We waited until midnight then decided to get a taxi back as was so late.    When we got to hotel we asked them to pay for the taxis which they refused. There was no apology.    In the morning we asked  If we could have late check out due to room issues and shuttle bus incident and again they refused. Unless we wanted to pay ¬£60pp. In fact when we did check out they wanted to cut off our wristbands so we could have no food and drink. (Check out is at 12 and our transfer was collecting us at 6pm). When I said we can‚Äôt be expected to not eat or drink till then the words I got in return were ‚Äúwell did you have lunch on the day you arrived?‚Äù.    I would definitely return to Marrakech. I would however NOT recommend this hotel as I would not return there myself. I would look at finding somewhere closer to the souks and better customer relations.    In my opinion and in agreements with majority of other guests staying there this is not a 5* hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: marieconnor1958 wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel which had only been open for three weeks. The rooms were beautiful and the hotel was amazing. The weather was very good also very hot. The food was excellent with a very wide selection the cakes were beautiful. All the staff were really friendly and they went out of their way to make you happy very attentive and very proud always smiling which made it more special. Will be going back next year cannot wait. I would like to thank them all for such an amazing holiday and look forward to seeing them soon special thanks to Salim Imad Sara Nissam Hassan Farooch Zachariah Mohamed Abdul Morad and Laila and all the managers too !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: lulewis2018 wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Not sure where to start with this review as there were so many excellent aspects to this resort. I have just got back (Friday 15th June) and I am already looking to book next years trip as I just had the most relaxing 10 day break ever.  The rooms are well appointed and as it‚Äôs not an enormous property fairly close to all the great faculties. The bed is huge there‚Äôs a large flat screen tv a cute garden area and space enough for 2 people to move around freely. Some reviewers have moaned about not having tea making facilities in the room. Really? Anyone with any sense would have researched where they were going to stay and therefore known this was not provided. Also you are in a foreign country do as they do or don‚Äôt go there!  The staff were nothing short of amazing! I had stayed at the Kenzi resort at the same time last year and a lot of the dining room staff remembered me from there and treated me like royalty for my entire stay...special thanks to Anil and Hassan (evening shift) and all the others that made my holiday so memorable. All the staff in the dining rooms were friendly and attentive without giving the impression they were hustling you...they remembered little things such as I like ice with my water and ensured it was on the table without me asking for it.  The entire property was kept spotless at all times and the room cleaners did a fantastic job cleaning our room and changing our towels every day. The pools (one quiet and one more lively) were super clean and for those that like activity there were fun games to play throughout the day. The more lively pool bar did sometimes have slow service but that was more to do with a lot of people ordering cocktails which take time to prepare so perhaps one more staff would alleviate this. To be honest the weather and environment were so gorgeous waiting wasn‚Äôt really an issue...and yes there are wasps around the bar but that‚Äôs to be expected there were virtually none around the pool which I was very pleased about.  The food was lovely...there was a carvery most evenings (lamb chicken turkey and beef) along with various tagines (fish meat and veggie options) sushi lamb chops salmon pizza a pasta station numerous salads...the list goes on! Breakfast was what you would expect in a buffet style and there were always something to choose lunch was the same and I enjoyed something every day.  The bar although small served fairly decent beers and wine and service was good...the guys there just didn‚Äôt stop working...also as it was just across from the dining hall if you wanted a beer or spirit with dinner (which I saw some people have) you could get that yourself and bring it in with you...not a hardship in my opinion.  The staff at the front desk were ok not over friendly but efficient. We arrived approximately 12pm and were shown straight to our room which was great as it‚Äôs an early flight and it meant we were able to unpack and head out to lunch and then the pool.  One thing to look out for is the shower will flood the bathroom but we also had a bath with shower attachment so it didn‚Äôt impact us too much however had we had a room with just a shower it would have been unacceptable.  WiFi is available throughout the resort and although patchy at times was adequate for our needs.  A safe is provided free of charge and there is a fridge in the room for water (which is placed in rooms everyday)  The a la carte restaurant was a disappointment. It‚Äôs nice inside but the food was grim! The bread roll was like a rock and the tagine was served with just stringy meat and nothing else. This was the only negative aspect of this trip and I honestly can‚Äôt wait to go back!  The staff are a fantastic asset to this resort and should be commended for their professionalism and courtesy to their guests.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Kate B wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Ok, lots to improve on but nice short break
Review_Text: My husband and I booked for a short break to celebrate our 22nd wedding anniversary we booked a swim up room; room was lovely lots of storage the private space outside was really fab but not being able to grab a couple of glasses and a bottle of wine to sip on while using the swim up lounge area was an unnecessary inconvenience.    The quality of the furniture around the hotel was really great and if they sort out the lack of staff this hotel could be a little gem.    The food wasn‚Äôt great you so t go hungry but it was not very varied and was lent great quality.    The special restaurant was really poor service was shocking we got up and left after sitting for over 30 minutes without even a glass of water.    A few things that was a real disappointment was the personal touches we have always received when traveling for our wedding anniversary not even a congratulations this was not just lacking for us we met a couple on their honeymoon and they didn‚Äôt even get an acknowledgment of their milestone!    Don‚Äôt book a late flight the cost of a late check out is not worth it your wristband is cut off at checkout ( not even permitted to retain as a keepsake) and you are unable to even get a drink!!    The was clear favouritism of French guests I‚Äôve not ever encountered that before and it was really evident.    We had a lovely time because it was a special occasion and we weren‚Äôt going to let the flaws ruin that; until they bring in more trained staff and improve the quality and choice of food I think the reviews will not gain this hotel a 5/5
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Hardon66 wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Having read the reviews which was quite mixed. I personally wanted to go to this particular hotel? Even though it look really nice in the pictures.  I was disappointed with the service of some of the staff. The receptionist had no manners always talking in their own language (quite rude)  The food as mentioned by another reviewer was bland and same ole thing each day. One of the bars you could not take the food away from.that area whilst the burgers n buns too hard and processed food. NOT good  Hotel was located in am area where nothing is there so u can't even venture out for a walk as there is nothing to see.  Rooms decorated on.. . But not the finishing touch n it great.  Overall it just ok... Not as what it makes out.  That's such a shame  The shuttle bus which operates from the hotel to Marrekesh central broke down one evening so we were expected to push it. And another evening it just did not turn up at all. The last journey at 11.00pm. we were stranded for over an hour. We got taxis the 12 of us who were stranded and once we got back to the hotel advised them of what had happened... the night receptionist refused to pay the taxis and was so rude too. Poor taxi man. They finally got their money
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: megan121290 wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for a week at the beginning of June. We requested a room upgrade to a swim-up room and were so glad This hotel is spotless and the room cleaners do a great job every day.    The food in the buffet was a bit same-y but fresh fish and meat and salads nonetheless. As a coeliac I did not have much choice when it came to the a la carte restaurant but I also did not request it beforehand.    Oussama waited on us in the buffet for most of the week and he was fantastic. Speaking to him in a mix of French and English was a pleasure as we both helped each other and he never let your glass of ros√© go empty. He is a gem for this hotel and will go far in the hospitality sector!    We usually sat at the relaxing pool in the mornings and in the afternoon moved to the beds outside our room as they got the lovely evening sun.    The free shuttle into Marrakech was a great extra and is definitely worth exploring the souks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Alain B wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: It s a basic hotel and not a five stars the service is very bad and if you attend to be pampered forget it . The pool and te room is ok but nothing more there is no room service if you want too eat something after 10 pm it s impossible you re far of the city 20 mn in car  The staff at the pool is very low you have to wait 10 mn to have a drink  So for me it s a bad experience  For young people is ok they can handle all this little thing and if you re searching for a five stars hotel don t come on this one
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Paul J wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Nice enough place not 5 stars though
Review_Text: Having read many of the reviews we took note of the fact that the showers would flood the room [and they do] and acted accordingly IE we placed towels on the edge of the shower base to stop water overflow. The room was very nice however the view over barren land and building sites was far from 5 star so we never used the balcony. The building seems to have used nice materials however the workforce used to put it together seem to have done an incomplete job lots of finishing touches required.  Staff mixed behaviour some are very polite and friendly others don't seem to have the time of day for anyone this could be a language barrier or a cultural difference but if they want to be 5 star they need to be more international. The entertainment staff seem faultless though and both my wife and I had lots of fun at the pool. She has since booked belly dancing lessons and in fact was belly dancing in the living room today with her daughter.  Previous comments about the food we feel were over critical and we both enjoyed all our meals. We were surprised how much the flies and the sparrows enjoyed the food too. The sparrows could be seen making happy faces on the food counters every meal apart from late evenings this obviously as they had their fill and it was bedtime.  We had an early arrival with another family - Lance and family who we loved - but the desk staff made us feel more like a hindrance to the hotel rather than guests arriving. We had to fill in forms as with the airport and then wait 5 hours before we were given rooms. This was not discussed by travel agents we were not given a guided tour we were not told what was happening we were merely told the rooms would not be ready for half an hour repeatedly. We were aware that another couple were expected to stay at the hotel for 6 hours without food after checking out so these kind of issues are not 5 star treatment.  We had fun there irrespective of all this as we have a good sense of humour.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: goa_ele_love wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Nice Stay. But NOT 5 stars.. yet!
Review_Text: I just returned from this hotel after a 4 night break with 3 of my girlfriends. I had some concerns after reading reviews from past guests but as we were already booked it was a ‚Äòwait and see‚Äô!  I‚Äôll start with the negatives:-  It‚Äôs a lot further from ‚Äòanything‚Äô than expected so pretty much nothing to do outside of the hotel. The hotel bus shuttle is handy and definitely needed unless you want to pay for taxis. You MUST book your seats prior to getting in.    The food is oh so boring limited and tasteless. Apart from the salad bar and sweets the mains are dreadful. The same unseasoned food served up day and night. Same tagines every night or weird dishes that consist of breakfast or lunch leftovers.. you either exists on salads or end up with a plate of strange food items that don‚Äôt really consist of a ‚Äòmeal‚Äô. It wasn‚Äôt even ‚Äòmezze‚Äô or ‚Äòtapas‚Äô which would‚Äôve been somewhat acceptable. When they did serve up anything half way exciting there‚Äôd be a long queue for it and a measly portion given so wasn‚Äôt worth the wait.  Drinks in the restaurant were limited. House red white or rose which were all like vinegar. You could have soft drinks or water but don‚Äôt dare ask for a hot drink as these were not available other than at breakfast. If you wanted one you had to go get it yourself from another area of the hotel and bring it back...... which leads me into the main gripe!  You were severely restricted to where you could get refreshments. For example you could only get a hot drink from a certain bar at a certain time. When you managed to get one it wasn‚Äôt nice anyway.  Alcohol was cheap and nasty. Cocktails were horrible (came from a dispensary machine with a little shake here and there to make it look like it‚Äôs being mixed professionally and unlike any cocktail I‚Äôve ever tasted in other words best to avoid. I did. I ended up sticking to water. Hardly all inclusive.  You‚Äôre not allowed to eat by the pools. Annoying as it‚Äôs an adult only hotel so I‚Äôm sure we know how to behave with food. This was a shame as it meant you couldn‚Äôt enjoy the full poolside experience. Staff never come and ask if you‚Äôd like anything it‚Äôs all self service. The hotel is very strict on having ‚Äòreserved areas‚Äô for eating and drinking which made no sense. One night the lobby bar ran out of tonic water despite having some in the pool bar but refused to get it... pool shuts early so too does the pool bar and (snack bar 6pm).  Which means that this hotel really only provides a ‚Äòfull board‚Äô experience and is not ‚Äòfully inclusive‚Äô. If you miss strict timings you go without. I tried to order a salad at the snack bar but I was refused as salads are not served after 4pm but I could order a pizza or burger until 6pm)??????    No afternoon tea type option no all day ice cream no bar snacks crisps/nuts...no tea/coffee making in rooms and mini bar is charged and very expensive!!!!  An early flight home meant we would miss breakfast but there‚Äôs no ‚Äòpack lunch‚Äô option available. We were told we could take stuff from the buffet if it were open but they would not provide a bag to put it in so pointless. They didn‚Äôt offer foil wrap or anything as an alternative which is a bit mean.    Entertainment is awful! Butlins style with not very good dancers/singers. Apart from a guy who sung for a while before ‚Äòmain act‚Äô came on who was good and should stay on. It was same old thing night after night. You‚Äôre better off going to bed early.  The bar was lacking seating that we had to sit in the lobby every night but one on our last night as the hotel was empty of guests. Luckily they just had pre downloaded tunes instead of an act. On Friday night couples were playing cards in the bar. Get the picture?    Spa really pricey! It seemed to be empty with few guests so they‚Äôd be better to reduce prices and actually do some work. My friend tried to book and each time it was closed when it was advertised as open. When she mentioned this to one of the spa staff he was really rude to her.    Finally on to the positives!!!  - it is a beautiful hotel well kept and smells amazing in the lobby!  - has security which was reassuring  - staff are a great asset. Very friendly and helpful (apart from the previously mentioned restrictions imposed on them). Although one or two of the snack bar staff let everyone else down as less friendly and less helpful.  - Rooms are lovely with the most comfortable beds ever!!! Although bathrooms have a large window into the bedroom with a transparent blind so no privacy from fellow room guest or anyone outside if room curtains are open whilst using the bathroom. Looks great but a questionable choice. A proper blind would make all the difference.  - everywhere is spotlessly clean.  - lovely manicured gardens  - has two pools one with music and activities and a quiet one if you want to relax quietly. This too is spotlessly clean.  - Plentiful sun loungers and parasols with a few curtained cabanas dotted here and there. (Grab early as these are popular).    All in all we enjoyed our stay. Weather was great had time to relax in the sun which was what we wanted. Rooms lovely and comfy. It was good for 4 days but definitely no longer with these current problems.    I‚Äôd say that with some easy and obvious changes this will be a wonderful hotel and could honesty claim 5 stars/ all inclusive but not yet.  This is an honest and I hope constructive review so I hope it helps you to make a decision and the hotel to take on board and improve in areas required.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: ExplorateurParis7 wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Disastrous and scandalous experience at the reception
Review_Text: We arrived to spend a weekend in this hotel to have some rest a family time and enjoy the hotel because we have been satisfied by the comments on TripAdvisor.    Everything was perfect rooms and pool. But when we had to check in they said that we have to wait until they receive ¬´ the reservation ¬ª from Spain. The receptionnist Loubna was really really cold and unwelcoming. It‚Äôs a shame for a 5* hotel to welcome people like this. She asked to pay additionnal fees for bracelets and towels and we accepted. We asked questions and she was unhelpful. For example we asked about restaurant opening hours and she replied that all the answers are on a paper in the room. The reception manager Abderrahmane came and asked her if there was a problem I told him ¬´ yes we booked a pool view ¬ª (we have paid more on purpose for that). He replied ¬´ it‚Äôs between me and her ¬ª. I was astonished by the unprofessionalism of the answer and the best is yet to come.    My father asked for more kindness and better service the receptionnist manager spoke louder and told my father that he doesn‚Äôt have the right to raise his voice and then the nightmare begins.    I told him that we have the right to speak freely and everyone on their site was complaining about the reception service it‚Äôs not normal to welcome clients this way as if the receptionnists were the clients. He started getting nervous came out from the reception and told me ¬´ If we were outside I would have broken your face. ¬ª The CCTV of the hotel and my phone recording can attest about that as his colleagues came around to avoid him punching me.    I was astonished : It‚Äôs the first time in my life that a 5star hotel ¬´ manager ¬ª speak to me as if I have met a drug dealer in the street. He called the security who told us ¬´ please forgive him ¬ª. Consequently we took our luggages back and we chose another hotel. We are wondering whether going to the police station to report a threatening behavior from a ¬´ professional ¬ª. I hope that the directors of Be Live hotels can read this and recruit in the future better skilled and polite employees on competencies and not only on CVs. Abderrahmane and Loubna had a lack of experience and professionalism.    What a pity the hotel seemed very good but the experience lived was traumatic. We don‚Äôt welcome clients like that sorry.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Dean S wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Me and my fiance went as a couple from 11th June till 15th.. 4night break ))  Overall we had a great stay but for people who have never been Marrakech before or even to this hotel I'll give you some info from our experience...    On arrival to Marrakech airport it is so laid back it's unreal.. we wasn't aware on arrival you must fill out a small form about you personal idendifcation..    Do not forget to fill 1 out otherwise you will have to go back and start again.))  after this we was stood in line overall 1 hour 20 mins to get through security!!    TAXIS AT AIRPORT- if you haven't booked transfers to hotel and just want to get to your hotel quickly like us... always haggle with the drivers. They will normally ask you you for about 400 Dirham roughly 25 English pounds. Don't be scared to to haggle on price that's what morrocois all about..  REGARDS    BE LIVE COLLECTION HOTEL- on arrival taxi pulled up to gates and checked taxi with metal detector security let him through big gates overall security all round fantastic..    Hotel pros and cons..    Hotel pros    - lovely and clean all the time. Cleansers work so hard all day.  - beds are big and really comfortable.  - staff are always trying to help.  - both pools are great and clean .  -food is good but subject to your preference and choice.    HOTEL con's-  there is a problem with walk in showers they flood if have it on powerful.. had to turn it towards wall and put towel down to slow water escaping.    - entertainment doesn't really start till 10.30pm by then alot people heading back to room after long days by the pool.. atmosphere all around becomes low..    OVERALL EXPERIENCE ..    Me and my fiance are 30years old from United kingdom. All we wanted was a nice relaxing short break to kick back and unwind.. we do love a good laugh and a few drinks along the way so if I'm truthful 4 nights here was perfect for us.. if I stayed any longer I do believe I would start to get bored.. Only so much you can do within hotel .( Don't take that as a negative )) defiently would recommend hotel but not for a long period of time..    Just a quick note for when you depart back to Marrakech airport you must fill in another identification form to get back through security.    Hope this helps and injoy your holiday!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Didier c wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We had an amazing weekend last week a Be live Adult  1. the customer service is very professional  2.Location is very quite far of the noise city  3.only the bartenders need to be more flexilble on last drink order  4.need more improvement for deep cleaning room sometimes the cleaning is not done on the day time  5. finalyy i want to thank Mr.Abdellah the director resident for his helpe last sunday night on lobby bar my wife lost her mobile and he found it in the terrace realy the Hotel has good system of security and trustable    looking forward to my next trip to Marrakech and Be Live Hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: M√•rvƒ´n M wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Hotel area is nice but the service is more than disappointing
Review_Text: We stayed here as couple in June 2018. The Hotel and the room are nice. The standard is the usual like the hotels in the neighborhood or the typical big hotel areas.  But the service was more than horrible while our whole stay. It starts with an unfriendly receptionist who didn‚Äôt help us with our wishes and problems around the hotel. The second is the stuff at the so called Snack Bar close to the Pool area. The whole stuff is chatting and ignore your wishes to order a drink. Sometimes you have luck and they hear to you but also in an unfriendly way cause of you they have to work. The third the service at the restaurant: you have to wait a long time until they service you with drinks. The same long time you have to wait until the waiter clear the table. Very often the garden and the pool area is full of empty bottles and glasses from the last day. That‚Äôs not the standard what I expect for a high class hotel. At least we had problems with our deposit what you have to pay at your first day and you normally get it back after your stay. There is a friendly manager we told our problems and he promised that he will fix it but without any results. Pity! That‚Äôs not a good start for a new opened Hotel.  There are a lot of beautiful hotels in Marrakech and same wise a lot of competitors so the next time we will book another hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Amy c wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: After reading some of the reviews i was terrified myself and my friend had made a terrible mistake....    I have just got back from the best holiday of my life! The hotel is stunning there are cleaners on site all day so the place is spotless.    The rooms are huge with the nicest beds i am no engineer but i worked out if you turn the shower head slightly away from the edge the leak on the floor doesn't happen!? we found the room was cleaned at least twice a day. The staff are great Amine in the swim up bar is the best he made the holiday for us. We spent the week at the quieter pool and had no complaints.    Our Aircon worked fine and we had no issues only downside is no tea/coffee facilities in the room but there is always a bar open to go get one - just make sure to clarify i you want English tea not Moroccan mint tea.    Reception staff where great we struggled to get our currency changed up as we arrived on the weekend and they had to wait till monday for it to arrive. Adnane on reception was so apologetic and checked on us every time we walked by.    The food was varied and a new dish was out every meal - steak lamb chops fish etc. The restaurant team where always friendly and had our drinks order memorised by day 2. Only used the snack bar twice but food was nice.    Evening entertainment was good something new each night and the cocktails are kept flowing. We did a day trip organised by our rep as two girls alone we were advised not to venture into the city centre alone the trip worked out about ¬£35.    We had a visit to the spa get a facial my skin has never been so clean highly recommend the package we had of a hammam massage and facial.    Overall we loved our stay and where so sad to leave. Will 100% go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Katie W wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Don't avoid it but maybe don't rush there.
Review_Text: We stayed at the be live collection adults only hotel for 10 days this June. Here is a comprehensive list I strongly suggest you read before making your decision.    Pros  The hotel is immaculately clean. The cleaners are easily the hotels hardest working staff.  Bed‚Äôs a very comfy  We had a Swim up room which meant we had a pool outside our room. This was the highlight and is very much worth the small extra cost.  Bar and Restaurant are nice looking.  Sports bar looked good but empty during our stay as hotel was quiet.  Quiet hotel but we did start to see an increase in guests during our stay which in turn made the negatives improve slightly.  There are two pools one for sport and another for relaxing. We stayed by the relaxed one which is great and you can sit at the bar in the pool which is really good.  Spa is really nice and reasonably priced.    Cons    Here is the problem...  Receptionists can be rude and poor at english.  We ordered a twin room but got a single double bed. So check before you go!  Had to wait for our room even when arriving at 7pm due to a broken door.  No staff really speak english  No food or drinks in room  BIGGEST THING IS THE FOOD IS COLD and bland. You will wait at the buffet for them to bring it out fresh but somehow it still comes out cold. In all fairness by our last day it became luke warm so maybe they are trying to improve as everyone has complained.  Flies an small issue cover your wine if sitting outside at night.  Snack bar okay for lunch but don‚Äôt get sandwiches as they wont have any filling. Also on two occasions we had taw pizza here.  The ‚Äòspecial‚Äô restaurant you can only visit once. Don‚Äôt even bother we had to go to the buffet after.  When we complained we didn‚Äôt get anything but a blank stare luckily another manager who was dealing with yet another complaining couple caved to our demand for a late check out due to our unwanted late check in.    Overall if you can put up with poor food then the hotel is actually good and well priced. And I do believe as they get busier and learn from complaints they will try and improve.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: porkpie28 wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We have just come back from a great holiday at Be Live Collection in Marrakech.    As soon as we had arrived the animation team welcomed us to the hotel and went through the entertainment programme for the day and the week that we were staying. All of them - Salim Karim Amine Fati Abdelatif and Mohemad - were fantastic and kept us entertained all day every day and also for the evening entertainment. They were full of energy and kept us laughing and busy all of the time with the different activities they were offering.    The reception staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us. The rooms were spacious very well equipped and kept very clean by the maids who visited daily. The food was lovely and plenty of it to go round.    The hotel grounds were lovely it was nice to walk round after our evening meal - very peaceful.    All the staff at the hotel were very polite friendly and helpful.    Fantastic holiday had by all and we will definitely be returning soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: alirobs wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Firstly this hotel IS NEW. Only been open since March but it is lovely! All inclusive; buffet breakfast lunch and dinner.  Poolside snack bar open 10am-6pm great  selection of drinks in all bars.  The rooms are immaculate the cleaning staff are great.Yes there is a problem with the showers flooding which does need rectifying but if you have the shower power on half it‚Äôs good.  The waiting staff are AMAZING! A big thank you to Hassan and Mourad and the PR Manager Mounia is a credit to the hotel. Get a pool facing room and the ‚Äúswim up‚Äù is definitely worth the extra cost.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: beadycharm wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Never written a review before so please bear with me...  Just come back from a weeks stay at this hotel and can confirm that although very nice it‚Äôs not quite up to 5 star standard.  As a solo traveller I had to say that I found the staff a little rude (not all of them) a lot of the time they would ignore you or forget that you even ordered anything - word to the wise scrub up on your French before you head here as they seem to respond more to anyone that speaks to them in French unfortunately mine is not great.  Rooms are nice was going to say very clean apart from the small blood stains I had on my bedding :-(  The air con in the room is beyond frustrating. On my first night I called reception to ask if they could send someone to look at it as the room was very warm. Admittedly within an hour they had sent someone and they got it to come out cool. Sadly it did not stay like this and every evening my room was at a constant 25 -26 degrees very uncomfortable and makes sleeping difficult.  Food overall is very good with wide selection in the buffet restaurant unfortunately none of it is very hot in temperature. My advice is to eat during the day at the snack bar by the pool as this food is freshly made and comes out hot!  Other than that everything was good - pool areas are very nice and the man that runs the little shop on site was really friendly. Hope this helps.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Yasemin C wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Lovely hotel  Staff all very friendly the cleaner in the room would design the bed in pretty patterners nice to see that extra bit of care really made us smile!  The entertainment team always happy to help and very friendly always things going on throughout the day but also another pool if you don‚Äôt like that sort of stuff! so maximum relaxation all throughout  The bar staff at night always so lovely and friendly always happy to conversate and always had a giggle  The food was amazing always a wide range I personally hate hotel food! But here the food was amazing always having a different selection and plenty for all tastes.  The morrocon restaurant is also worth a try really enoyed the experience.  Free bus that takes u in and out to the square day and night! Only taking 20 mins so you can go off and explore and also relax! Loved it here can‚Äôt wait to come back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: LadyKinz wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: The most friendliest accommodating staff. We were wrongly given a deluxe room with pool access which staff noticed on the second day. Although this room is a higher price the receptionist staff & admin allowed us to remain in this room for the rest of our stay at no extra cost. The hotel is exceptionally clean and well maintained. The restuarnt staff are very pleasant and attentive El Bachir and Chef Saad to name a few. The staff really did make our stay that much more enjoyable. There are also many activities to do during the day such as archery water aerobics & yoga. A genuinely great stay and I will definitely be looking out for Be Live Hotels in the future. 10/10
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: deknight75 wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: We"ve just got back from a great stay at this hotel - if coffee and tea making facilities in your room and a minibar are the most important aspects of your holiday then leave this place well alone    The hotel is great - its new its fresh and impeccably clean. You could drink your coffee off the floor its that good! The rooms are simple and as previously said in another review everything works which is great. If you want as we did your room will be cleaned everyday with fresh linen and towels. Yes the shower needs a door but a bit of care minimises flooding the bathroom. Most important is hot water and there's plenty of it!!    Hotel facilities are spot on - the restaurants provide a great selection of food morning lunch and evening and the quality is amazing (Make sure you get a freshly made omelette at breakfast!). We know our food and there is nothing wrong with what this hotel provides and theres plenty of choice which changes everyday - if you look carefully!    The spa (which we did find expensive) the gym the pools and the games are great. Entertainment in the evening hits the nail on the head too. Drinks are plentiful and nothing and I mean nothing is too much trouble for anyone who works at this place!    But what makes this place is the staff - they are friendly helpful and sincere. We made some great friends on this holiday who showed us how to dance do some archery keep us fit and do their daft hotel dance!!    Take some time and get to know Amine (an amazing guy who is a credit to the company and hotel). Get to know Imad (a great lad who will attempt to get you to do all the games by the pool!). Get to know Fati (loves her dancing but is an absolute nutter!! LOL). Everyone is great. Everyone who works there. They're all friendly and if you bother you'll get to know them and they'll educate you on their culture.    We loved it.    We'll see you again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Birmanhu wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: Never again no coffee in the room minibar extra charge max 3stars
Review_Text: We just arrived yesterday but everything was true unfortunately:(  Maximum 3starts hotel  Don‚Äôt go if you need all inclusive 5 stars hotel!!!  Extra charge for the minibar. No dressing grown:(  Poor foods and drinks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: SHOPPER1002014 wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: ADULTS ONLY-- NO-- 5 STAR FOOD --NO-- PROBLEM SOLVING--NO--
Review_Text: Late review as been waiting for hotel to respond to my e mails. No luck all IGNORED. No different to the majority of people expecting coffee facilities and mini bar.BUT NO must have all imagined it. Aren't we silly. all expecting the the same thing !. But according to hotel this was never the caseend of conversation. Food in restaurant looked OKon closer inspection actually very little choice. Not much to compliment salads and hot food luke warm. Choice at breakfast was also poor and god forbid you wanted something cooked fresh. Snack bar was very goodotherwise we would have probably gone a bit hungry. Roomsswimming pool area's pretty much as previous reviews. Staff some really goodsome not so. However if management treat them as they do gueststhat would explain a lot. This company is only interested in turn over and let no man stand in their way. Our last 2 days were spoilt by hotel being filled with families. Children everywhere running about in bar 11.00pm. Swimming pool with kids and inflatables. Exactly what you expect in Adults Only. I have not managed to get an explanation and dare I expect an apology. They just do not care. Just hope you do not have to rely on management for any problems. I never over expect and usually pretty satisfied. But next time in Morocco back to 4 star Riu Tikida Beach Adults only. It runs circles around this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: gtasee wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Firstly a massive thanks to the following amazing staff Fati Hafid Amine Hamza Mourad Facail Abdulla and Mohamed (Ronaldo) these guys have been nothing but welcoming and really make you feel like your at home.    Formalities complete let‚Äôs go into the hotel.    The rooms were spotless with all things working. I do agree the bathroom floor floods with the shower and this is something that should be looked into. Ok no mini bar being stocked but hey it‚Äôs all inclusive.    Facilities the pools are always clean and staff at hand if any issues. The various activities are great fun and the staff really do encourage you to enjoy them. You do need to pay for the spa however it‚Äôs not that pricey and all treatments are explained.    The restaurant is good. I think the food can get repetitive but quality is good. Desserts were amazing. I would suggest food is labled to avoid asking but they do tell you.    The bar well stocked and the cocktails are great.    Make use of the shuttle bus saves a lot of money and is only 20 minutes into the  centre.    Earlier issues mentioned in reviews about teething problems have been rectified.    Overall a great memorable stay one in which the staff shall never be forgotten.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends
