Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: deepikavadher wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Wow .... excellent place amazing staff  Special thanks to Fati Abdulla Hafid and Salim and all those who took such good care of us. Fair is my long lost sister xxx just a beautiful place great food and fab company xxx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ren√© T wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: Fantastic short stay at a superb hotel
Review_Text: My wife and I just returned from a 5 days trip to Marrakech and stayed at this fantastic hotel. The hotel has everything for a very relaxing stay not too far from the Medina. Food is very good and staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful: the receptionists the entertainment team the waiters/waitresses in the bar and restaurant the house keeping staff .... they all don't spare pains to provide excellent service and always with a smile. The hotel offers a gratis regular shuttle service to the city which is very convenient. Should we go back to Marrakech again we would definitely book this hotel again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Taz D wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Had a pleasant stay overall. At the time of booking an Adult Only hotel the day before the hotel was full of children and fully booked for a Jewish festival.    Although we are not anti children sometimes it‚Äôs nice just to have some quality time with my wife. Majority of the staff were fine to okay but not outstanding. The night of my check in we had missed the evening meal by 10 minutes and being a diabetic no effort was made to even supply me with a price of fruit. And on our last day no lunch as the hotel was booked for this festival who had brought in their own chefs so food was not available in the main restaurant but was offer a burger by the pool.    There was no iron or tea facilities in the rooms. But despite the negatives would be willing to try the adult only resort to base a true opinion and reflection.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: davecharles2018 wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: Excellent Hotel, Great Food and Lovely Staff, DO NOT take notice of the bad reviews.
Review_Text: After reading the reviews I nearly rang to see if I could change the hotel I am glad I didn't. We arrived at the hotel in April and they really couldn't do enough for us. The Hotel was exceptionally clean and the housekeeping was superb. The buffet restaurant and food was excellent and the pool area was lovely sunbeds were plentiful and always available. The entertainment staff worked really hard with a great shout out to Imad. They had a lovely sports bar and this was opened on request enabling me to watch several premiership games. Overall my wife and I loved the hotel and would highly recommend it.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: sls210 wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: we stayed for 4 nights as a couple in the swim up room. the room overall was lovely cleaned thoroughly 3 out of the 4 days we was there! the "swim up pool" is just an interconnecting strip of water between the rooms with a few steps down and a ledge to sit. the 'pool' is narrow but came up to nearly waist height.    we booked direct through the be live hotel website and paid on arrival. I recommend anyone to pay when booking or exchange money in the airport - after reading a review on here saying the hotel had a better exchange rate we waited and their rate was awful meaning we had to pay an extra ¬£70 GBP on top of the price we booked for to accommodate their poor rate! Also when booking through the direct site it states the benefit of the swim up room is robes (which were not provided and we had to ask several times for) and early check in. When we arrived we was told that because we was checking out early on the last day we could check in early on day of arrival. Told to come back in an hour then sent away because room was not ready. This happened 3 times with very rude service until 3pm when we could check in - so much for early check in?? We was given our wrist band though so we could use the restaurant.    Wasn't too impressed with restaurant same pizza pasta salad meat and veg every day and not too much variety. Desserts were nice though. Snack bar by the main pool had good drinks and food. We managed to book the Moroccan restaurant for one night was not impressed. Service slow and meat massively undercooked. We asked for water 3 times and was ignored each time.    Shuttle bus is provided to and from the town which we used. Arrived on time. Do not be late as the driver does not wait.    Entertainment staff were very helpful. Amine introduced himself to us on our first day and spoke to us every day was very helpful and friendly. Getting drinks or snacks do take a while so we ordered a few at a time. Activities on throughout the day at the bigger pool or quieter at the second pool.    Overall the hotel was lovely location was in the middle of nowhere reception staff very rude other staff helpful and friendly! Get a swim up room or pool view as the other rooms look at a car park.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Anne K wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: I travelled to the hotel expecting a luxury vacation for myself as a single female traveler.    The good:    Pool area is nice not to busy and quit if you‚Äôre at the pool without entertainment.    Housekeeping did an excellent job everyday.    The food in the buffet restaurant is good although the same pretty much every day. But good many options.    Rooms are nice I had a swim up room and stayed most of the afternoons there. Nice and clean good bed.    Good gym could use some barbells or kettle bells. Towel and water (some days) which was nice. Hard to find though.    The bad:    The reception staff is - to say the least - not motivated to do good service. They don‚Äôt seem to think service reaches beyond language. I don‚Äôt speak French but excellent English they did not. And didn‚Äôt make an effort. Most of the information I needed was given when I asked for it ie directions to the restaurant spa etc.    A la carte restaurant is not worth a visit. You have to choose between to set menues and it was pretty much the same food as in the buffet restaurant. Nice guys but the food was not worth a second look.    The bathroom - don‚Äôt expect to take a shower. I did that on the day of arrival and the room was flooding with water after 30 seconds. A technician came and had a look but said the same problem was in all rooms. And no help from reception either. Every day was a struggle to take a shower and avoid flooding the room. And the room had a constant noise from the piping sounded like water was running constantly. Smells bad from the drains too.    I asked for some sodas or maybe a bottle of ros√© for the mini bar but could only choose between champagne beer or spirits with soda. Had to settle for ‚Äòfour beers of my choosing‚Äô and was not able to make a choice of beer.    If the service level and piping gets fixed I‚Äôll come back. At least give me a smile when I arrive instead of looking like I‚Äôm intruding on a private conversation. And a shower a proper shower without having to shut the water of every 30 seconds to prevent a flooding.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Howeller76 wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Overall we had a really good break at this hotel......but there are a few niggles that really are easily fixed and would make it a great break. These may seem picky but they add up and left us scratching our heads in amazement.    Room - no robes in a superior room and a mini bar that you have to pay to fill (in an all inclusive resort)    Spa - list of services only in French and you have to pay to use the indoor pool sauna jacuzzi and steam room. Spa is also run by a separate company and you pay separately.    Front desk - tried to change sterling for local currency. They would only do cash for cash no cards and no ATM on site. Cards are ok to pay for room and spa though!    Restaurant - drinks brought to table is always a nice touch but you can‚Äôt order anything other than beer or wine - G&T is only available at the lobby bar and they won‚Äôt fetch you one (despite being 10 feet away door to door). Seems daft. Also some food signage would good - having been told that fish was chicken and chicken was beef I think this would be useful!    Like I said the place itself is generally really nice the touches listed above would make it the 5 star it advertises itself as.    Room was clean and bed comfy shower had good heat and pressure. Buffet food was excellent and as it had Moroccan dishes on each serving we didn‚Äôt go to the Moroccan restaurant. We had treatments at the Spa which were nice and pretty good value for money.    The only really sour note was the attitude of the 4 different front desk people we had. They truly acted as if they were doing you a favour with anything you asked. If these are the first and last experience you have of the hotel then surely they should be happy to see and sad to see you go?! Generally all other staff were really nice. French is the predominant language so worth brushing up before leaving.    We wouldn‚Äôt come back here. Not because it did anything significantly wrong more than it didn‚Äôt do anything significantly great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Jack H wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: The hotel and facilities were highly rated. Everything from the rooms to the pool to the restaurant and leisure activities were absolutely class.    The food was also very very good.    The staff were also very friendly and did their best to help were possible. Actually some of the staff were great. However the hotels service was lacking the quality that makes a 5* hotel in my opinion due to policy.    For example: the restaurant and the bar are less than 4 steps apart. However when I asked for certain drinks at dinner or lunch in the restaurant I was told ‚Äúthese are only available in the bar‚Äù.    Although I‚Äôm sure you could get up from the restaurant and order a drink in the bar and bring it over yourself... this is not 5* service.    We had a lovely break and a great experience visiting Marrakech and found the hotel beautiful. It‚Äôs a shame that the facilities have to be distinguished from the service.

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Pixelator100 wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Hotel and setting are perfectly nice. Lots of elements of the hotel are excellent but there are a few things lacking. Wife had her sunglasses stolen - not the hotels fault but the attitude of the staff and management about it was very poor. Service levels at reception are not at all good. You have to wait to enquire for anything and the speed of responding to requests is poor and you have to chase multiple times.  That said resort overall is good and the food is excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: MLBiscomb wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Be Live Adults Only has clearly come a long way in ironing out teething problems - we were apprehensive after reading reviews but had a fantastic time as a party of six. Firstly there were no building works happening whilst we were there and it seems all work has been completed.    We arrived earlier than check in but were provided with bands to enjoy the all inclusive and given a tour by one of the friendly pool entertainment guys whilst we waited for the rooms to be ready.    One our of party had a few issues with noise as their room was near the service area (particularly bad when they were clearing up after the launch party) but the reception staff were extremely helpful and switched rooms with no problem.    The buffet was fantastic with lots of choice (even for vegans!) - it would be better if the food was labelled but the choice and quality was excellent including freshly made pizza and pasta omelettes cooked to order and a fantastic salad bar and dessert selection. The snack bar outside was also great - as you would expect burgers chips sandwiches and pizza all tasty! We didn't try the other Moroccan restaurant on site (one visit complimentary for guests)  although we heard mixed reviews from other guests.    We also didn't attend any of the evening shows although there was something on every evening with an external events company instead we stayed mainly in the bar and sports bar that had DJ's karaoke and singers some nights - and pool table football table and comfy seating in the sports bar. Due to the great value and with birthdays to celebrate we also ate out a couple of times and can really recommend Comptoir Darna and Azar Restaurant for a glam experience (with belly dancers and delicious food) as well as Nomad and Des Espices in the Souks for more casual dining rooftop terraces and good vegetarian/vegan options.    In general we found the majority of staff to be extremely helpful and friendly particularly the pool entertainment team the PR/Guest Relations lady as well as all the waiters and bar staff. There were a few language barriers with the reception team which will no doubt ease over time but they were helpful in booking taxis helping us with dinner reservations and resolving any issues.    There is a free shuttle bus into the main square and souls that runs regularly it will also stop mid-way on request if you‚Äôre wanting to visit the YSL gardens. It was a good alternative to paying for taxis every time ‚Äì although taxis from the hotel to the souks costs around 200 durhams (¬£20ish). All our drivers were fab and in general we felt very safe in the town/square and really enjoyed the souks.    We also made use of the fantastic spa during our visit which we found to be fairly reasonably prices with lots of package options to suit your stay as well as complimentary gym.    The rooms were really nice spacious and clean ‚Äì the showers did flood a little but we just more towels down and got on with it. Safes available in room plenty of room on the terraces too. Housekeeping offered a great service.    During our time there were a few guests who seemed intent on complaining and stirring up other guests. Of course if you‚Äôre the type of person who loves to find problems and complain you will find them everywhere but any issues we had were resolved promptly and in general we had a fantastic time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Smeats wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Use the safe in your room
Review_Text: I want to start by saying that this hotel was actually better than we had anticipated. Given the mixed reviews we were apprehensive to say the least! It was very very clean the staff were generally good and the food was slightly better than an average all inclusive. 5* it is not however we didn‚Äôt expect it to be.    We were 4 hrs delayed due to a connecting flight from Casablanca being cancelled at the last minute. Thankful for the WiFi in the airport as we don‚Äôt speak French and ‚ÄòAnnul√©‚Äô appeared on the screens 5 mins before boarding! Have to say the staff in the airport from Royal Air Maroc were not great.    6 hours later and we arrived at the hotel tired and hungry. Check in was faultless and as requested the hotel had arranged for two plates of salad in our rooms which we were very grateful for at 4am. (If in the same situation ask for them to be placed in the fridge) All fine so far.    Day 3 and we return from the pool to find my necklace missing. I hadn‚Äôt used the safe and left it out on the desk in the room - alongside other less valuable items. This one item is nowhere to be found. We turned the room upside down just to make sure but I 100% know where I left it. The hotel investigated and the housekeeping said they had not seen it. Two people turned up later that day and went through both my luggage and my boyfriends to check it wasn‚Äôt there. Thought that was a bit strange. I could not gain a report to say it went missing on the premises from them either as I hadn‚Äôt used the safe. The customer service manager was as helpful as she could be but it really ruined the holiday to be honest. We tried to make the most of the rest of the holiday and pretend it hadn‚Äôt happened.    The evening entertainment was standard hotel entertainment and as it wasn‚Äôt very busy this took place in the lobby bar. I‚Äôm assuming when it‚Äôs fully occupied it would be upstairs in the conference-type room. There were session singers karaoke African dancers etc. Not really our thing but everyone else seemed to enjoy themselves.    2 pools in the hotel. 1 had the aerobics and activities happening with music playing and the other was quieter with no music and a swim up bar. The weather was changeable with it being April so the pools were a touch on the cold side! The swim up bar pool was quite cloudy which put me off getting in - not sure if seeing the gardener wading through it in his wellies the day before had any bearing on that!    The snack bar was open 10-6pm and served food to order. It was ok burgers paninnis pizzas etc. The service here was particularly relaxed as in it was table service but you could sit there for 20 mins before someone came over. We went up to the counter a few times to be told to sit down. Not a major issue but this could be improved.    Breakfast lunch and dinner in the buffet restaurant was nice. Lots of salad options and rice/bread etc. Nothing was labelled though so you were guessing what you were eating some of the time! Service was good in here.    We didn‚Äôt eat in the a la carte restaurant instead opting to head into the new town where we ate at Barrometer Marrakech on our last night. I‚Äôve reviewed this separately.    All in all this is a nice clean hotel with decent food and good service generally. Our stay was tainted by the necklace incident. This has been a learning experience - use the hotel safe!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: MarshallBuckley wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Clearly in the first couple of weeks the new hotel had issues to deal with. Most (not quite all) seem to have been resolved now.  We had a couple of small issues with our room - the balcony door would not lock and the quick flush on the toilet did not work. The door was fixed quickly the flush we did not bother to report.  Otherwise the room was fine - amazingly comfortable bed big pillows.  It seems odd that the mini-bar isn't stocked and that the option to have it stocked costs money but given that bottled water is left in the room and you can take drinks back it was never really an issue.  But these are small niggles and didn't detract from the holiday experience.  The hotel is sparkling clean everywhere the staff unfailingly friendly and polite and the buffet restaurant incredibly good - great variety beautifully presented. (The a la carte was less impressive but that's personal taste).  Plenty of choice of drinks from all the bars (cocktails are better at the lobby bar) - no issues with alcohol here.  The spa was good - though English is less widely spoken here but we managed to book treatments with no issues.  Overall a very relaxing week in a lovely hote.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Nav J wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: We stayed from 21st to 25th April and can honestly say it was amazing. I know there have been a few mixed reviews but when I spoke with reception they had only been open properly for 5 days so maybe the mixed reviews were while they were not fully open so some teething problems may of been expected.    The room was so nice and clean and of a good size. For breakfast/lunch/dinner the buffet restaurant served lovely food and it was a different menu every day. The service was always great and not once was any member of staff rude or not helpful.    The evening bar was really nice to chill in at the end of the day they had live bands every night and all the guests seemed to have a great time and getting involved/dancing too.    I didn‚Äôt expect too much when booking the hotel just a place to stay while in Marrakesh for me but I left thinking what a wonderful place it was. It has a good vibe about it everybody seems happy (including guests) Book it and you‚Äôll understand what I mean!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sharon M wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: We travelled as cousins for a girlie well earned relaxation break.    Fantastic animation team - Abdel Imad Fati & Salim kept us entertained all day with fun and frolics by the pool. They were very energetic and funny to say the least! We also got some free Arabic tuition which was a great laugh ;-). The lifeguards Karim & little Abdel looked after us extremely well by making sure that we had clean comfortable sunbeds to relax on while soaking up the Moroccan sun. Ahhhhh heaven!    By night in the Lobby bar Amine the main man went above and beyond first class service by keeping our drinks flowing along with a wonderful smile to top off a fantastic day / night before returning to our room and relaxing in the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in. Our room was well equipped and very clean with maid service daily.    Hotel is well maintained both day and night. The reception staff were very helpful along with the restaurant staff who couldn't do enough for you.The food was delicious and plenty of choice.    We are already planning our next visit and cant wait to return later in the year.    THANKS GUYS FOR AN AMAZING HOLIDAY!    SEE YOU AGAIN SOON!

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Chrisong1 wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Great value hotel and a fantastic holiday
Review_Text: We cannot fault this hotel. It was our first experience of Morraco and we would not hold back in recommending this hotel. The hotel itself is extremely clean and the food is fantastic this includes the buffet and Al A Carte restaurants as well as the snack bar the latter served great food which was always freshly cooked which is not our usual experience of snack bars. The staff were all so friendly at all the restaurants and bars and could not do more for us. Ignore the negative reviews this was a great holiday from our experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Maria M wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: This hotel is simply beyond amazing. From the moment we arrived on our girls holiday till the moment we left we received the warmest of welcomes including a personalized service from all the staff we encountered within every part of the hotel.Before I start a review of the hotel I would like to say a big thank you to the guest/public relations officer by the name of Hafza. She took great care of us from day one and ensured we had the most wonderful and relaxing stay. Her approach was very professional and also personal at the same time. we really took a liking to her throughout the trip. She made sure we got the best excursion deals educated us on Moroccan culture and much more. It was a shame we didn't get to say goodbye.  The amenities within the hotel are fabulously breathtaking. I would highly recommend the swim up rooms as they have the most outstanding view. The pool bar is a nice touch especially within the hot temperatures. The food was incredible!! Pure Moroccan cuisine. We were quite scpetical having read the reviews complaining about the food but I honestly give it all the praise and ratings. Breakfast was amazing and because its a buffet the variety was amazing. More food served at the snack bar included freshly made burgers and pizzas throughout the day which was a nice touch. Overall amazing 10/10 experience. The only things I would say were a downer were the views however for the location you wont get anything better unless youre in the mountains.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Leonie H wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: This hotel is amazing. It‚Äôs only been open a month and it‚Äôs faultless. The food is incredible all fresh and healthy. The rooms are out of this world all the detail that has gone into them are perfect for an adults only couple room. The staff are so friendly and attentive. The evening entertainment is great. They have singers and variety acts which get you involved and is a lot of fun. The hotel is incredibly clean. There is a free shuttle bus that takes you into the square for the markets. We will definitely coming back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Darryl B wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: What can I say about this hotel except it was fantastic and please ignore other reviews that are negative as I could not fault anything. Me and my grilfriend had an amazing time here and did not want to come back.    First and the best thing about this hotel are the staff. We had Hassan in the restaurant always catering for what we needed. Faical in the lobby bar making the new cocktail to soon be on the menu 'The 5 Star Faical'. Yassine and Abdul taking care of things in the swim up bar and of course all of this is overseen but the fantastic Mourad. All of these staff were gerneally interested in us and took care of us. Yes they don't all have the best English but you are in morocco so what do you expect. They try harder than us to speak the language.    Pool is was always fund and you couldn't beat the energy from Imad. From day one he introduced himself to us and even had breakfast with me one day.    The food was so good here don't expect English food you are in morrocco and you must dine in the a le carte restaurant tit was superb.    We wine it to town once and the place is crazy but good fun. It's worth checking out but if you don't want to leave the hotel you don't need to because it literally has everything you could need.    We will be back that's for sure thank you again to everyone at be live with special mention again to all of the staff above.    Darryl and Sibella
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Sarah M wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: I completely agree with the last positive review. We were 3 friends on a relaxing girls holiday and had the best time.    We had a suite facing the quiet pool and it was huge and lovely. The hotel was stunning food incredible (so much variety from fresh salads to amazing local dishes....for the complaining brits pizza and pasta was also on offer.    The staff really made it for us always smiling friendly and going out of their way to ensure you had a great stay. They even remembered our drinks orders. Such a huge variety of alcohol on offer including wine beer spirits and lovely cocktails.    This is a new hotel and staff are learning. Perhaps a little patience and a friendly smile would mean you have the same fantastic experience we had. They are clearly changing from the reviews they have had.    Thank you to you all for our lovely holiday we didn't want to leave and will most definitely stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Charlie M wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: My partner and I (25 & 29) just got back from a 4 night stay and we honestly had the best holiday ever. The hotel was beautiful the staff were incredibly attentive and the food was amazing.    If I am honest I think the things people are complaining about are just ridiculous. Who cares if there is no tea in the rooms- you should be outside exploring a beautiful country. Yes occasionally there are launguage barriers but all the staff have tried incredibly hard to learn new languages - we were polite and ended up making loads of new friends in all the staff. I think people are winding each other up and focusing on the nagatives rather than having a care free holiday.    There are cultural differences but that‚Äôs the beauty of it if you want exactly what you are used to then you might as well stay at home- Morocco is a beautiful country it has so much to offer you just have to step out of your comfort food and try new things. We would 100% return.    We can‚Äôt thank the staff enough for being friendly laughing with us chatting all day with us. Faisal always wanted to create new drinks with us he was brilliant.    A few tips - don‚Äôt bother exchanging money before you go the hotel has a better exchange rate. Book a room overlooking the quiet pool. Definitely go to the soukes (sky bar is a lovely rooftop bar for after). And make the most of your holiday rather than focusing on the negatives- get to know the culture and the people!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Michael B wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Brilliant holiday here last week.Everyone friendly and helpfull
Review_Text: THis hotel had everything. Good food good locationgood facilities and lovely helpful people  Have to thank everybody for making our holiday special  From Wisam at the pool barThe animation team Imad and AbdelThe waiters especially Hassan who helped my husband with his Moroccan languageThe reception team who answered all queries cheerfully.  Where do I stop.The chefsthe cleaners and everybody.  It was very clean and we loved the food.  Whilst there my husband had his birthday and it was so easy to arrange a birthday cake and the waiters brought it to our table singing Happy birthdayIt made his day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: 292James wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Plus Points:-    1) Hotel and room very clean  2) Excellent food  3) Friendly helpful staff. In particular I would like to thank Hasan and Oussama who made our dining experience a delight  4) Free shuttle bus  5) Good variety of alcoholic drinks including cocktails. Local beer was good too.  6) Bar service very good. Did not have to wait long for drinks  7) Excellent swimming pool. Great size and very clean.  8) The most comfortable bed and pillows ever !    Things that could be improved:-    1) Two members of staff cleaned the area around the swimming pool with strong bleach at 4pm on the 15/04 whilst guests where relaxing on their sun loungers. The fumes from the bleach were not very pleasant. Perhaps they should consider cleaning when the guests have gone ?  2) Shower design flawed as when the shower was on fully water seeped over the lip onto the bathroom floor. No drainage in bathroom floor so we had to mop up the water with towel.  3) Internet in room intermittent... better in reception  4) When Bath tap fully on water splashed backwards causing water to run along top of bath and onto floor  5) Need drainage holes along the first floor corridors. When it rained water had no where to go so large pools of water built up  6) Sensor light in pool toilet goes off after 10 seconds    Teething problems which I am sure will be rectified in due course. Overall we had a great holiday and had no regrets choosing this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Francesca M wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Relaxing with right amount of fun
Review_Text: Nice hotel amazing outdoor..but the very heart of the whole structure is the animation team..Salim Imad Abdel Karim Mohammed..and of course the lovely Fati! They‚Äôre always there to help and entertain u with the smile!  Only point to work on: a little bit more flexibility for check-in/check out..:)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: HOP130 wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Good overall experience but not quite 5-star yet
Review_Text: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this resort.    When you book to stay in a hotel that‚Äôs only been open for less than a month you must expect a few teething problems which is probably reflected in the price.    We arrived early evening to the hotel‚Äôs grand opening ceremony in full swing. In spite of this check in was quick and efficient and we were in the room within 15 minutes. We had a splendid dinner at the buffet restaurant and then got invited to the lavish opening ceremonies around the main pool.    The room itself was large and spacious with a comfortable bed. Yes there are no tea or coffee making facilities like some reviewers have said but you could get a cup of tea/coffee from 8am to 1pm.    The food on offer is of a good variety and quality and we certainly didn‚Äôt have much to complain about for breakfast lunch or dinner. Hafsa from guest relations organised a dinner booking at the Moroccan restaurant for my wife‚Äôs birthday with a cake and the staff singing which was all excellent.    Overall this is a European style all-inclusive resort and it might not be to everyone‚Äôs taste. We‚Äôve been to 5-star all inclusive resorts in Mexico Dominican Republic Cuba and the experience there is somewhat different.    We found the facilities to be of a good standard food was very good and staff helpful and enthusiastic. It isn‚Äôt yet the well-oiled machine that a place that has been going for a few seasons will be but that should come with time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: jloo21 wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: My husband and I had a cheeky get away with out kids and wanted a 5star experience. This was NOT 5 star.  The grounds are beautiful and the food was presented nicely though was often cold. The room are ok same sort of size as a Premier Inn but with out the tea and coffee. Some overlook piles of rubbish or are near the service entrance and are noisy. There were fag butts in the swim up room pools and they are not exactly swim up.    By far the worst part of our experience was the service shocking the front desk was a joke. Most of the time there was little bar or pool service for drinks.    I have stay in Marrakech before and had a brilliant experience in a 4star hotel. But the lack of customer care at this hotel made me cry one day and that is not an experience I would want again. Truly awful and not worth the money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Daniel O wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: It's just as people are saying. NOT 5 star    Their philosophy is flawed and the wrong way around. The hotel and its issues come first. The guests well being is a long way down their priority list    Good bits:  Hotel grounds nice food is nice and bar staff and restaurant staff were nice.    But other than this it's awful.  Basil fawlty would be proud of their front desk service.    Our first room smelt of sewage and had views of a big rubbish pile.    Took a day to get us a new room (even tough hotel was max 25% full) and we had to chase circa 8 times. It was our problem to manage.. at no point did they take ownership    New room didn't smell but had other problems. Again our problem to manage. They even wanted me to take time out of our holiday to wait in room for technician. At that's on top of wasting a whole load of time already. No apologies at all. How is that remotely 5star??    There were many other little issues.    Bottom line this level of front desk service is at best 3 star.    And reading the management's response to earlier travellers problems I can say that they just don't get it.    Over promise and under deliver. And just spin you a pack of waffle..hotel comes first then make life simpler for themselves then customer last    The hotel management is simply not fit for purpose. Miles and miles from 5star and we regret going.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: debratherese wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: After reading reviews was really aprehensive about going to this hotel but I can say honestly it‚Äôs a beautiful hotel the staff are really helpful and couldn‚Äôt do enough for us the room even though view not wonderful as it over looked the car park clean and the king size bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in admittedly there are no tea and coffee or drinks in the room but this is the only thing I can say needs improvement emad  Was particularly helpful and always happy to help us with anything that we need  The food is amazing and there‚Äôs plenty of everything  You would have to be very fussy not to find anything to eat deserts are out of this world  I understand that some people don‚Äôt rate it as 5 star  But I have travelled around the world and I think that standards vary from place to place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: lol051 wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: From our arrival at 12 midnight we had problems checking in  we where told by reception if we didn't have our printed off booking it was not possible to check in  i showed my conformation emails and booking details on my smart phone still made it difficult.  Checked in our room very clean large room with swim up pool which we paid an extra ¬£300 Fore 6 days  which is not swim up its more like a paddling pool not impressed at all such a waste of money.  Breakfast was limited for english guests good fruit selection and fresh omelet although the chef tries to insist you have the cold omelet already prepared.    Building work very noisey  most of the staff are very rude customer service none igsistant wouldn't change money for us at reception  refused to ring us a taxi point blank no walk its not far.    Regards the food in the restaurant it was cold not just warm but cold presentation is exceptional deserts are exceptional .  Food in the speciality restaurant was presented beautifully but yet again cold  walked out half way thru our evening after waiting 40 minutes for a glass of wine.    Too many managers standing around not setting a good example for the staff.  Spa experience was bad too  over priced impatient staff cold pool and after spending over ¬£120.00 on spa treatment i was given my closed and hushed out so i didn't use the spa facitities .    Couldn't get a late check out after being told this was possible the night before and told no where to get a shower as spa staff art happy people unsung the shower room .  The bar staff are not happy when you ask for a drink most of the time they pour the drink then go clean tables and bar leaving you standing there .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Skiffle2009 wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Had a poor experience at this hotel  The welcome when we arrived was we don‚Äôt do room service the mini bar is empty all the bars are shut there are no snacks available and your room is through them doors and down the corridor  Food was cold unless you asked for it to be cooked in front of you  Mainly French guests and very poor understanding of English language  I requested a salad and a club sandwich from the pool bar and a plate of chips arrived I looked at it and was asked was I still waiting for my burger  We had to pay ¬£20 each for pool towels and had problems getting our money back at the end of our stay  I tried to use the indoor pool as the outdoor was too cold and was told it was for spa clients only  I booked a spa session to find out the indoor pool was cold  This is a fabulous hotel and grounds but customer service is none existent  The night before we left I got a call asking about my experience when I explained about my problems I was told everyone is saying the same thing we are working on it  Definitely not for me sorry
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Suunyweather wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Having just returned from our stay here i feel compelled to write a review something that i have never done before .  The Hotel has opened before all the work has been finished so consequently the builders are finishing off putting up the roof by the main buffet dining roommaking it quite hazardous to walk around also not sweeping up the area around where they were working .  Also on the last day we were all sitting having a drink chatting enjoying our final sun when suddenly the builders appeared to put up a large sun blind and proceeded to DRILL INTO THE BRICKWORK really loud and ear shattering noise of course everyone moved !!!!!  When i asked why the hotel has been opened before completion i was told MONEY !!!!  The Management team were very dismissive of any concerns that we raised not sure if they have had any Customer Skills training Alex Polisti is needed here !!!!! The Food in the buffet was cold when i asked one of the Chefs for a hot fried egg that had just been cooked he said no and told me to take one that was on the tray i explained that they were cold and he argued with me !!!!! NOT GOOD CUSTOMER SKILLS.!!!!!  As everyone knows you come on holiday for rest and relaxationfrom hetic lives back home and thats why you may choose all inclusive and five star .  This is not the place for you if you need the above i am sorry to be so blunt but i feel that this is an honest review .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: peterZ3389KI wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: My wife and I stayed 5 nights from 16 to 20 March.
Review_Text: Our experience was mixed. Positives included great food very friendly and helpful staff (including good knowledge of my wife‚Äôs gluten free diet) and good sized bedroom with one of most comfortable beds we have slept in. Minus points include: teething problems with new building eg shower runs hot and cold and door keys often did not work; no tea/coffee making facility in room; English tea is a bit of a mystery to hotel and ran out of tea bags; poor reception when we arrived about 2 hours before our check in time and were expected to sit in reception for 2 hours unless we paid a supplement for early check in and a supplement for early use of dining room (after complaints by myself and others we were allowed to check in and use facilities but this was a poor way to greet customers who were tired from travelling from early hours).

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Lynn200248 wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here for 6 nights a week after it opened. Lovely grounds and pools nice rooms.Lots of problems during our stay. Leaking showers towel rails falling off no coffee maker no mini bar key cards frequently not working and no they were not next to the phone !!! continually cold food until Saturday when buffet restaurant overwhelmed with corporate guests and the food was steaming !! We had spoken to customer relations earlier in the week about issues but no apology for inconveniences. we were so looking forward to some peace and tranquillity from hectic life at home to be met with building works (outside veranda not finished) even sitting here writing this review there is drilling going on .We did not receive an apology at anytime and felt our concerns were dismissed  so disappointed that our week of rest has been so stressful.The web site information is misleading and did not explain works were incomplete. I have never written a review before but felt compelled to do so if you want a peaceful 5 star experience this is not the place for you .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Ian T wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: On arrival after initial welcome left sitting in reception for 2 hour before tui rep suggested we have lunch  Unlocked adjoining door meant guest from next room strolled in as I was getting changed 2 hours to sort  Offered complimentary kettle (none in rooms 5 star ?) but left no tea coffee !!!  Had to scrounge teabags Fromm lobby bar all week  No drinking water in room daily had to beg for this daily  Electric died couple of times  Management treated us really badly  Shower flooded room daily  Beer tastes like the tannery smelt  No breakfast offered for early start trips had to beg staff to let us in to grab something  Worst customer service ever
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Alma N wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Beautiful huge rooms , Huge beds, fantastic Shower, huge selection of food, wonderful staff.
Review_Text: The staff were so committed to making you comfortable.  Customer service fantastic. the hotel is modern Moroccan style luxury    The food was wonderful huge selection of food and drinks not the place to go if you are on a diet.  The entertainment was fabulous.  they teach you Arabic French by the pool if you require for free.  they give salsa and Zomba lessons.  I highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: perfectlyclaudia wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Beautiful but not quite there yet...
Review_Text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful with wonderful amenities. It‚Äôs beyond spotless (so much so that you slide across the marble floors). There are two pools - one more active and one more relaxed (with a bar pool) and in between the two is an outdoor bar/restaurant.    There is an indoor buffet restaurant and Moroccan restaurant (the Moroccan restaurant you need to book ahead - and sadly they had no room for us to book a table all week).    The hotel is brand new and there are definitely teething snags that drag the 5* rating down slightly. There was no welcome pack in the room so we had no idea about anything meal times spa times or costs etc. and a large amount of the staff don‚Äôt speak fluent English - so finding out info was a little challenging. The girls at reception however are the best to speak to. One chap didn‚Äôt even know where the spa was.    The showers in our room didn‚Äôt stay hot - and very quickly became ice cold. We did mention this to reception and eventually a chap turned up to fix our tv instead (very random?!) at 10.30pm. We weren‚Äôt too impressed here and our showers never did get fixed.    The food at the pool and in the buffet was absolutely amazing. Lots and lots of choice at the buffet and plenty of vegetarian choices.    There are a number of free shuttles to/from the souks throughout the day - and they are always on time.    We didn‚Äôt use the spa as we had mixed info from staff as to what was included in our all inclusive package - but it was beyond beautiful. There is also an indoor pool and a gym in the spa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
Review_Date: Smile D wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Be live Collection is a 5 star hotel not to be confused with Be Live Experience which is a 4 star hotel which is just round the corner.  This one is for adults only and opened on Thursday 15th March.    It is a beautiful hotel but there are many teething problems. First all we booked a pool view room and got a garden view.  There was no tea and coffee in the room no robes or slippers till the third day and an empty mini bar which had a lovely note to help yourself. When we asked for these things we got mixed answers even though they were advertised on the website. Please notes this has recently been changed.    We was also informed that we would have to pay a deposit for the room of 500 diram which is just under¬£50 and if you want to use the towels for the swimming pool you would have to pay a deposit of 200 diram per person per towel.    Never in my life have I heard of paying a deposit for a towel?! Make no mistakes here they aren‚Äôt no Egyptian 5000 thread count made by Cleopatra herself kind of towel.    All the drinks are included in the all inclusive deal all the alcoholic drinks are local. You get given a silver arm band to wear for the whole of your stay which entitles you to all the food and drink you could possibly eat.    The pool is lovely and they do have activities depending by on the weather. The aqua aerobics was really fun.    The buffet restaurant serves lovely food of mixed cultures like Italian and morrocan.    The sports bar opens at 10pm and closes at 1am. Glad to say me and my partner was the first to use it woohooüòÅ.    The snack bar serves breakfast until 12:30 ish and their chips taste like MacDonald‚Äôs fries. I highly rate the presentation of the food there.    There is another morrocan restaurant on site which is advised that you book in advance. While we did book we didn‚Äôt end up going as we were having too much fun trying out the cocktails are the bar next door.    The staff there are very friendly most are multi-lingual speaking Arabic English and French    I would recommend the spa but be warned the prices are steep and but are in their local currency. The price list is in French so it would be nice to a English version as well    The gym is included in the all inclusive deal but you can‚Äôt use the heated pool or sauna unless you pay.    Overall a good experience they were still doing some building works while we were there so perhaps in a couple of months they will really live up to their 5star rating but for now I would say they are more of a 4 star ‚≠êÔ∏è rating
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

Review_Text: Teething problems aplenty. Still some building work. No tea or coffee in rooms or mini bar unless u pay. Great rooms great food. Helpful friendly staff. Fantastic grounds. All drinks are local brands.
